VW-O9XTt9-2R9wFdv2ApoQ.text: I dinned at  this restaurant after looking it up on Google of one of the better dim sum eats in Las Vegas. About a 10 minute Lyft ride from the strip,  The place was nice and clean with an open area for the carts to be pushed around.  There were three people pushing carts around with variety of small plates steamed only however. With the exception of one person pushing a cart with an attitude,  the staff was friendly and accomadating. The food was good I would say a little above average versus most dim sum place. Most of the dishes tasted fresh and we even order some stuff off the menu which arrived fairly quickly. Lots of Asian patrons here that usually mean is a good place for Asian food. Price was very reasonable and I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

r6p6As1Xv1I2_bDe4mTG6Q.text: Tried 4 different Yum Cha places in Vegas so far in 3 days.  This is the best taste one ... geee ... It deserves 4 stars just making my previous eating places look bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damnnnnnnnnn goooooood！

-bBOwz2_CsVLzgHAXA0Tvg.text: I'm always a sucker for the cart being pushed so that you can see what your getting and get what your seeing right now!.        Stuffed 5 hungover revelers for 60 bucks.   Food was good enough that just thinking about it right now has me hungry for more.        clean bathroom,  friendly service, will come back next trip to check consistency.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. great for hang overs.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gimme my food!!  now get in my belly!! good dim sum.

1sn3QDZtLW83ryf78N9XIA.text: Friendly service 1 star Fried chive dumpling 1 star  Umm if you think this is the best then you need to eat at dim sum king to compare

bvdLiWmCRhEIER1aXMMSaQ.text: Yum Cha was great! We have been to Ping Pang Pong on previous visits and decided to look for another Dim Sum spot without such a long wait. Yum Cha was a 5-10 minute Uber from our hotel on the strip and it did not disappoint. No wait and prompt service. Highlights were the shrimp and chive dumpling, the radish cakes, and the shrimp with sugarcane. Wanted to try the custard buns but got too full!

QmOFZjbI6sYL1ZMbRxCMrg.text: Solid dim sum spot.  In fairness, this probably would have been a 4 but we went at night and I suspect the dim sum was not as fresh as it is during a busy lunch hour!  That said, the value is INCREDIBLE for what you get especially compared to the Strip! Highlights were the chive dumplings, shu mai, chicken feet (yes chicken feet!), and sticky rice.  Loved the curry noodle soup as well.  The soup dumplings were not as good.  Service was attentive and friendly!

QameTwDy39-m-eh7zG0UDw.text: My family and I have pretty much ravaged Vegas for the past 10 years in search of our favorite Asian restaurants there for specific cuisines so we were super surprised to find that we hadn't been to Yum Cha for dim sum before despite its stellar reviews and ratings. We were definitely not disappointed though and even came back here twice in one trip! The food and the service are both phenomenal so if you're looking for a dim sum spot in Vegas, this is it!   Despite its popularity, there was pretty much never a wait since they have an abundance of seating and the staff are incredibly efficient throughout the entire meal. Upon walking in, it looks like a take out type of place but they actually do seat you so don't be confused~! Here, they only cart around steamed items so everything else you order from the menu (but those items come out fairly quick as well). Their most well known item is definitely the baked custard bun (even one of the ladies who help to manage said someone once ordered 100 of these to go to take back to California) -- seriously melt in your mouth heaven!! Aside from that, all of the dim sum items were yummy and didn't disappoint; you'll get exactly what you want for dim sum.   The only thing that might be a little iffy for those coming from California is the slightly higher pricing for dim sum which ranges from like ~$4-$7 per item. One of the employees said this was their most common question/complaint was the pricing, but I honestly think it's understandable considering their popularity and lack of competition compared to California. Despite the higher pricing, I definitely still think it's worth it, especially since it's hard to come by an awesome dim sum place with even more excellent and friendlier staff in Vegas if you're visiting. Will most likely be coming back here whenever we're in Vegas again!! :)

eA2EIlOxJLyn6-SxNEDRXg.text: This place is right next to my apartment complex so I order from here or go here for Chinese or dim sum when I'm in the mood. Their dim sum is good here and they have many options as well. There's not a lot of dim sum in Vegas so I'm glad this place is open and food is good! I like their theme inside and the decorations. It seems really happy and vibrant inside. It's clean as well which is great because other dim sum places I been to, it's not that clean. Their service is really friendly here. I want to try their hot pot since it advertise that they have it here but I haven't got the chance. So far I had their dim sum and regular Chinese dishes here and all been good.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotta have these dishes

QlitRgn6d4Zt0SmTIwF4HQ.text: My bf and I come here all the time for dim sum! We are from Hawaii where the dim sum is top notch, and this is the place in Vegas that we think comes the closest. It's close to us (Spring Valley) and because it's not right on Spring Mountain it's never a long wait to be seated. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. Their shrimp dumplings, shrimp & pork shumai, and steamed bbq pork bun are our favorites. For dessert try the baked lava custard bun! So delicious. Their dim sum goes great with the hot tea they serve. They also have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options, which is rare at a lot of dim sum places! Lastly, the prices are very reasonable and you can get a lot of dim sum at an inexpensive price.

4UIdhF4knibRyq8f0DW0Bw.text: Disappointing.  Nowhere near what I can get in SoCal.  Ordered har gow, siu mai, chicken feet, shrimp & chive dumpling, shrimp rice rolls, sticky rice in lotus leaf.  Not coming back.

tDSZ_FnSEd2LulgGO1AkgQ.text: Been here many many times but just leaving a review. Reason being is they have been CONSISTENTLY good (food quality AND service) from the FIRST time to THIS time.  Cleanliness is also important to me too and they are clean here. Their tables are always wiped down, pre-bussed, and NEVER nasty or sticky!  Its a PERFECT place to get your general YumCha fix!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GNIP-WQpm7WQJZKolCIAMg.text: A friend and I ate here Sunday night and while the food was fine, it was not 4star worthy. My pal is allergic to shellfish and shrimp and I ordered shrimp shu mei for just me. He had one, unknown to me. He had no clue because usually the smell effects him before it gets to his lips.  No reaction at all.  It could be a substitute, red algae maybe?  He might have ordered it if he knew.  But I won't go back.

Q5Yv9rim-gS_dL174AMtsg.text: The dim sum was very mushy and not much flavor. The best thing they have is the short ribs that I couldnt find on the dim sum menu but they do have it on the main entrees list. You can ask for a dim sum portion.

i1Wcd0NTJktYPVWPpFpm-g.text: It is very clean and the service is all smiles.  It's an easy ride close to the strip. Food is great and priced very reasonably. I would happily go again.

8zDjEqaz9WkmLyigirehwA.text: Pleasantly surprised at this place, always like to seek out local fares. This is by far the best food since I've been to Vegas yesterday. Decor: bird cages, tv previewing salivating food.

evVYHJtRBGUyDqBAgar9JA.text: So every time we go to Vegas, we make it a point to come here. We live in LA and there is no shortage of dim sum spots and I think my family and I have been to most. We are huge foodies and dim sum is always a craving. If you're the same way - your dim sum eating life means nothing if you don't come here. Our dim sum worlds have been SHOOK. They have the freshest, tastiest dim sums ever. Everything is made fresh to order - not like some where you know it's been sitting in those carts since lunch time began. That's another thing, they don't do push carts - you simply order. They also have been attentive and friendly - each time we go we are met by the owners(?)/managers(?). We LOVE this place so much we plan a trip just to come here. It's really the best dim sum and they serve it all day! Not like most places that end at 3pm. If you're in town, make it a point to stop by!

-IFRzlPgzRODPKFF86kx5Q.text: Wanted to try dimsum and this one had good reviews on Yelp so here goes.  No comment on the restaurant decor itself. It's clean- (that's important!) Straight to the food:  -Salt and pepper shrimp was too salty. Had to scrape some off.  -pork belly: looked like a lot of pork in the picture but actually a small serving. We laughed about it. Taste was ok. I've had better fatty food. Yup, I said it.   -siomai- shrimp and pork/ mushrooms were very good. Added 1 more order, in fact. Hey, we were hungry.   -shrimp toast- Ha, good too. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Wait a minute, that's me!!   -sticky rice wrapped in leaf (you guys remember what it's called?)- good but small serving. I mean, tiny. But an order has 2 pieces. Maybe they should combine it and have 1 good sized serving. Not complaining... just a suggestion.   -egg tarts- I've had better. Wife said it wasn't fresh.  Yup, she can tell. Her taste buds don't lie. Mine do, darn it. I ate it all.   -Buchi rolls- those round things covered with sesame seeds and has red bean inside (its for those who don't know). Epic description? Thanks for going with it. I liked it.   So in a nutshell, 3.5 stars. Not 4. There's better. Might come back when they have carts going around. We ate about 5 pm. Came straight from the airport. Should have been in my intro.   Would recommend some because it's not bad at all. I might come back.

xLm0jCo4tgyrKFjv3D1GQA.text: The flavor of food was about average. The shrimp dumplings are not enjoyable. The other dishes I ordered were much better.   The wait time on food is very quick. The service is on point. Which was the reason I rated them 3 stars from 2.5.  The prices are slightly higher than places with comparable quality and flavor. The convenience of this place balances the price point.

GS-FrYCBq_szwiyYN8fAlg.text: Dim sum/food is good. Nothing that stands out, but decent. A little over priced for the quality of the dim sum @ $3.58 a piece, but you have the convenience of dim sum anytime.   Service was excellent and good served in a timely manner.

WaezTsY6FQP1G3HdqYKqZQ.text: The place to satisfy your Dim Sum craving when in Vegas. Pretty decent quality and variety. Most waiters and waitress speaks clear English which is super helpful. The best part is their top notch customer service we received. Their siomai was super salty and our group of 7 people had ordered three orders before trying it. We asked the waitress if we can trade out the two we didn't touch for something else. Without hesitation they said yes and which two dishes we would like to replace them with. One of the lady's there not sure if she's the manager, was constantly apologetic about the siomai and mentioned it usually doesn't taste salty like that and it is our fault because we had a really busy weekend due to the holidays. Most of our food was cooked fresh and most on the cart tasted fresh or not old like many Dim Sum's. Hargow, pork bun, chicken feet, meat rice cake, fried rice, spinach dumpling, and pork dumpling were all good. The only thing I would say, don't order the fried pork belly (super small and is not with the price). When I'm back in Vegas I will definitely be back, the food was pretty good, but it's the customer service that puts the cherry on top for me!

7EZFM4gKFGSu_XaWrpoxTw.text: This place is delicious! Didn't stop eating from the moment they brought us food. The staff is friendly and quick with service. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the mood for dim sum because I'm forsure coming back next time I'm in vegas!

TkSeqAuAKvEnlUyu6rn61g.text: Amazing food and GREAT SERVICE! Clean, very respectful, Kid friendly, great for big parties. Ask for Yao! He's AWESOME!

EgK9XzvFEQDYa20lPxPYtw.text: My husband and I were in LV from Chicago, and we checked out Yum Cha for dim sum with my in-laws.  We had tried some other places recommended by locals, but this place was by far the best.   We arrived early, and the selection was fresh and in abundance.   Not only can you pick from the carts but there's an entire hot station where you can get fresh buns, congee, veggies, and hot lo bak go.     I felt out of all the other places we tried this one had one of the better selections of items.  I've had A LOT of dim sum, and was very happy with this place.  The roasted pork buns were especially yummy- always hot, soft, with some sweetness.  If you enjoy traditional dim sum this is the place to go.  It's about 2 miles off The Strip, making it super convenient to get to.  (We stayed at Luxor and it literally was a 10 minute drive.). It's definitely worth the trip.

oSP0VLMLT8mNvVkHAwbYFw.text: best. baked. bbq. pork. buns. ever!  egg custard tarts are amazing.   i've lived in vegas for about 7 years, and was on a search for great Dim Sum, after years of trying several different places, i finally stumbled upon Yum Cha and now i don't go anywhere else!!  As a child, my Mom used to take me to Clement St. in San Francisco. this place brought that nostalgia right back to me. Highly Recommend for all your Dim Sum needs!

ji4c-jDSzJwuuv571ilwIA.text: Yum Cha was a fun experience. We decided to try several Dim Sum plus our favorite of the night the Won Ton soup. The Dim Sum we picked were the steamed pork buns also the chicken buns (both soft and delicious). The veggie noodles were really tasty and quite a large portion (so we couldn't even finish it). I enjoyed the curry turnovers, but my friend thought they were to strong in the curry flavor (kind of like an Indian Samosa). Dinner time they have you order what you want, but at lunch they have carts going around to try different things (sounds fun). All in all, I definitely recommend this tasty place!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard buns

J7S_ZylAnqofafHWFSmUvQ.text: Grade A Food Establishment   These people where very friendly. Even helped me with my order. I showed up with my daughter and were greeted with a friendly smile.   Stuff we ordered. Top being the most flavorful.   Chives Dumpling (Shrimp & Pork) Shumai (Shrimp & Pork) Steamed BBQ Pork Bun Shrimp Dumpling  Wish it was closer but will definitely be back. Smaller Sized Dumpling then what you get in San Franciscos China Town however still very tasty and probably cleaner place too.

bb9c9SpXN7Yy-0XDP9uHdQ.text: Siu mai was hot, savory and delicious, won ton noodle soup excellent broth with flavorful deep fried garlic and onion bits, spring rolls crispy and tasty, har gow delicate, moist and tender, scallion dumplings were fresh with a perfect crispy texture, but the real star is the ginger scallion flounder. I don't think I've ever had fish this tender, flaky and flavorful. Unbelievably good. I'm a huge fan of this place.

bnP6qY9KrapnuAUS5VUEiw.text: Host immediately catered to us upon walking in and explained the menu well.  Great service, people were nice, and provided dessert dim sum on the house!! Be careful, huge portions..  We had the Gen Tso Chicken, Chow Mein, and Sweet And Sour Pork along with complimentary egg tart pastries =]

e1XYSwJOknKI-zBvniou9A.text: Just went there because it has 4 stars.  The parking is big and the decoration is unique.  After we sat down, noticed there was a party and making a lot of loud noise.  It took us over 10 minutes to have the tea.  We told the first one that took us to the seat but he never returned.  We asked for tea again, and the request sunk into the ocean.  Until the third one, and then we got the tea.  Shrimp dumpling was fine but I don't consider others up to par at all.  We ordered the baked roast park buns and the inside don't taste like roast pork.  I also went up to the buffet setting to check out the food, and none seems to be appealing.  I would recommend dim sum cafe instead.

QP8PHuf_NgFA0gZpjgfGnA.text: Yum Cha is my new go-to dim sum spot.  I've been to several dim sum restaurants around Vegas inside and outside of Chinatown and this place has won me over.    I was greeted by the owner, and he took the time to explain to me that carts run from 10-3, but that I can also go to the food counter or order from the menu.  How outstanding that I can get my food 3 different ways (2 ways after 3PM when carts stop).  All the common dim sum goods can be gotten off carts, but those items are all also on the menu and most of the rest that my friends and I can think of is available on the menu or at the counter.    In addition to the owner, the service is attentive and friendly.  The cart runners made it to my table every few minutes and the waiter checked in regularly for drinks and other matters.  The food displayed at the counter is for show and what you ask for is made to order.    Dim Sum and tea is a staple in my circle of friends, and we have been to many establishments serving this type of cuisine in Las Vegas and other major cities.  Yum Cha is up there with any other place I've been to and will be our new cornerstone.

lOf8NOjTcZQFDG1lTo6TnQ.text: This place was clean, fast, food was delicious and the wait staff was nice and attentive!  We will always make a stop here when in Vegas!

bO3GIoY_wyExgiGiSp9MnQ.text: Honestly, the friendliest staff EVER in the Chinese food industry lol. Usually Chinese restaurants leave a sour taste in my mouth because I always feel like I am an annoyance to the server. However, at Yum Cha I literally look around once and someone immediately comes to me and asks me if I need anything and I immediately get whatever it is I needed (napkins, Coke, etc.). The food was good and, again, the service blows all other dim sum places out of the water. Highly recommend for a feel good place to go for brunch :).

SOtU5jyYK106PANQuKwbhg.text: Good dim sum! I was trying to find a good place being from Southern California and this place made me happy.

P8idM3gDNT0U9vm4OrIBqA.text: All the food was delicious the sesame chicken, shrimp wonton ,chive dumpling ,BBQ pork pastry ,the gyoza. The service was great. Great recommendations

U1lz7SZrAvjCfGQmLZkvtA.text: Not a bad place for congee, noodles, and dim sum.  Not exactly a destination spot or a place to bring your friends to entertain.  Just OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oNeOsHXunC9rpAbIFQEO_w.text: So me and my boyfriend have been craving a good dimsum restaurant. And we found this one that has 4 stars. We lived down in henderson so we drove 25 minutes to give this place a try.   So we got there, two other group were there but we all got seated right away. Then it took about 10 minutes before someone took our order. We had the feeling that they're going to take a long time. So we ordered a lot all at once. It took about 20 minutes to finally get our food. It felt longer because we're both starving.   While we're waiting for our food to come. Another couple came in. And literally they did not wait for long. And it seems like they were taking care of them more than anyone. They got their food first even though we were there 20 minutes before them. They were making sure their water get refilled while me and my boyfriend clearly have empty water glass but We have to ask to get our water refilled. They were asking if their okay or if they need anything else several times with that table while me and my boyfriend and the two other group that came in the same time we did, they didn't even ask if we need anything. We always have to call them. It's not like we're rude or we're asking for so much. We even cleaned out our own table and even gave them a good tip even though they didn't really took care of us. I'm a server so I know how it is to be a server.   But overall. The food is great. It tasted fresh. It was really good. But the service. Not so great. It's not that they were rude. It's just that they didn't take care of us but they took care of that other table well.   But I don't know if we would ever come back. I'm sorry.

PooGR-QTkc1V7qIrtUsgqA.text: I was craving hella dim sum on this random day. My whole family (party of 10) asked me what I wanted to eat and I told them Chinese food! At first, we were Yelping around and before we came here, we ended up in this random sketchy place with the sign all bust and said, we'll pass on this one. Yelping for other restaurants, we came across YumCha. Honestly, this is a really good Chinese restaurant and I enjoyed the variety of food they offered and how authentic it was. Lots of dim sum variety too.   Ps: Don't get freaked out by the the cages hanged on the ceiling. My baby cousin looked at it and thought there were birds inside.

yAn2OHI2GKVvcc3FWc00Kw.text: As a tourist coming in for EDC weekend we needed something wholesome the next day to speed up our recovery from a long night of dancing. Walking into Yum Cha, the staff is very prompt in greeting us quickly and the restaurant is very spacious and roomy.   We came in for the dim sum on a Sunday afternoon and there was no problem with getting seated. After 2:30pm dim sum items are not pushed around on a cart, rather they are made to order. From chicken feet, to shu mai, fried shrimp rolls, we piled up a total of about 20 dishes total costing us no more than about $80 in all. The portions were just perfect to share and all the dishes came out well presented and savory.   Would definitely recommend for the awesome staff that checked in on us often and I promise you won't come for dim sum and leave hungry!

LcTXNzZ37QLMJ_BAM0grkg.text: Solid 4/5 stars. It's good, but not the best I've ever had. The service was easy and fast, but it confused me at first. They have it set up looking like a food court, but there are actual servers that take your order and bring your food. It honestly looks like it used to be a Panda Express or something. Either way, it's a place you would go to for cheap and fast dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum!

D1scd0EBFTKEfnyxACWpwQ.text: In the search for great Dim Sum and good Chinese Food, one must journey and navigate an ocean of many Chinese places, and accept the fact that there is only an occasional "island" or "harbor" in this sea, that will be worth the journey.  Unfortunatley, Yum Cha is not worth the time or money on this journey.   The Dim Sum, though freshly steamed, for the most part lacks flavor and distinct spices that make for an epicurrian delight. If you have eaten Dim Sum at The Orchid Garden, Yum Cha will be a major disappointment.   Not able to find satisfaction with the Dim Sum, we ordered the "old standard" of Kung Pao Chicken. Though the pieces of chicken were of decent size and quality, the over meal had a sweet taste to it, and seriously lacked peppers and onions that give it a crunchy and distinctive flavor.  Good Chinese food in Las Vegas is very difficult to find. We owed it to our Yelp friends to try something new and hopefully found a tasty discovery to share with all.  Our disappointment is your gain. Strongly suggest you don't waste your time or dinning money on this place.  If you are a big fan of Dim Sum, put up with the crowds at Orchid Garden. Yum Cha wasn't crowded, Orchid Garden is almost always crowded. There's a reason for this contrast.  The taste of the Dim Sum.

ohB6t3JYv8LgbammGSpalg.text: Love that this place has dim sum at night! There are some things that don't taste quite as good as other places, like the sticky rice and egg custard, but they're still good! I've also tried some of their other food, like their beef noodle soup & crispy calamari and haven't been disappointed.

ohcr_jSnHJpEL9hedxA3Mw.text: Very delicious dim sum, we will be back! Staff are friendly and quick. Food was delicious, we enjoyed every thing we ordered.

S5PYcAntFKuwikPDGz8Feg.text: I went there on Saturday night based on yelp review. Place is awesome. Great customer service. Great dim sum especially the fried eggplant. Will definitely return.

7ra04mht6MO2lAywYvWoZg.text: Really great dim sum. The flavor is amazing, good amount of salt and clean flavor.   The restaurant is clean and comfortable. Service is fast, friendly and kind. I will be back

xsVQWw_g7PxQst06-64afQ.text: New restaurant. Staffs and the owner are very friendly. We try the curry noodle, not a traditional hongkong dish, but really delicious.

_VUzrz8bY-p0BM79NmVJNA.text: Super affordable, great food, great service! It's a restaurant, if you want to change up a menu item, like from shrimp, to pork, your server will take care of it.  Incredibly good prices.

36eXCxLKIDTpZlj-QCe7Nw.text: Food is too salty. Fried calamari got too much flour coated outside. Most of food doesn't have price tag and did not tell you there's surcharge if you add other ingredients which you should tell customer ahead of time before order. Service is good, but food came out slowly in very disorderly manner. Will not go back anymore.

TJRwZC9gp_KVYIYLesVbzQ.text: Visited on May 20 and have been lagging on the review. I am half Taiwanese and Caucasian raised in Northern California, so I am used to the typical customer service received at many Asian places. Not so here, they were actually very friendly and provided good service on top of reasonably priced, tasty Dim Sum. It is bright, airy, and open with plenty of seating which is a plus. They lost one star on this visit because the older gentleman who was asking "how many" looked me and my wife up and down making sure we weren't homeless. He was way too obvious in this and needs to work on being more discreet. We just needed to use the restroom before being seated. When mentioning it to a younger gentleman which I believe was the owner or manager, he informed us they had a real issue with homeless people using the restroom. We will definitely be back to give Yum Cha the opportunity to earn the fifth star because of our overall experience and our conversation on the way out with the man who's name eludes me. He gave us the impression they genuinely care about people's experiences.

LefpOPYYxcC548N6cMswnA.text: Amazing dim sum and on top of that it's super affordable. During lunch they bring the cart around to the table and you can choose off that or their full menu. A must eat in Vegas!!

stgUkaApZFUQULSn33MjWw.text: After orchid garden shutting down several times for health issues . We've found this place and it's been our GO-TO ever since . The food is really good , but the service is really what has us coming back . The owners treat us like family , they recommend different items and also give us samples for being loyal . BEST DIM SUM PLACE IN VEGAS HANDS DOWN . Don't let these other yelpers fool you .

9bvmpuBn3HnqIn1Jq8i46g.text: Place is very clean, hosts were friendly and attentive. Dimsum is definitely better than Orchids Garden or Changs.

4wu-T4PdYrmzOGHAqSm4Sw.text: First time here i was told the food is good.  I ordered food to go it's taken 45 min to get it if you don't have time to wait I don't recommend this place.  It seems busy which is a good sign but when ordering dim sum to go and it takes that long I have to give it a low rating.

CKkC18xS3z9BzMCFAO--NQ.text: Very good food. Love the ginger and scallions. Huge menu. Also have Dim Sum. Try it, you won't be sorry.

TehqHfmCE1jzxl5b7W598w.text: Me n my fried we wanna tried this place after a recommendation from one of our friend. And she was right. This place is the way to go!!! Awesome dimsum and they have it all day!!!!! Yuuum. Be back for sure.

RXe0FQs61S6Cx26LQOnPXw.text: First time coming here for Dim Sum.  The wait staff was very informative and attentive.  The potstickers and pork, shrimp and chive dumplings were wonderful.  Impressed by there service and food. I will definitely return.

kvWE3iebpSBkmUBQvv7NjQ.text: Warm and Friendly service. Clean. Great food. My favorite dim sum in Las Vegas. We came in Sunday at opening and were seated immediately.

3x6-U5NsU_57GxZ0m1iXRQ.text: This place has great authentic dim sum and amazing customer service. Wife and I had dinner tonight and the server showed us all of the dinner dim sum choices. We tried several of the more popular items and everything was full of flavor and generous portions. Will definitely come back with a bigger group as this place can accomodate a lot of people. I hope this place catches on and stays in this location for a long time.

hmzKX0pzIVy0ETqQ6XAmIg.text: service is excellent!! Good is good but could use less salt I was driving so much water after.

BGIk09WXDIhw83q-23ejDw.text: If you're looking for some incredible Dim Sum in Las Vegas, this is the place! Took the family here and was totally satisfied with the quality, price and service. The steamed bbq pork buns, spare ribs, shu mei, har gow, and shrimp noodle were incredible. Definitely a "can't miss" spot for our visits to Vegas.  The manager or owner (Sam) went out of his way to make sure we were totally satisfied. Waitresses were very friendly also.

-0Pov3nVRsitiBl7QGtOtA.text: the food was fresh and well prepared, a knowledgeable friend invited me and I thoroughly enjoyed. Restaurant is clean and the service is excellent.

lIjfgsXNfWXYuZAiy56rVQ.text: Ron is the best! The rest of the staff is also very nice. Food is quite authentic and tasty. :)

FruCEzyLE0Lf8geg-8hcOQ.text: You will be assisted when you get inside. Then a cart ladies will come and ask you to get the food they have in the cart. I said i want pork soimai. The lady said wait 5mins ok. Then we ordered a sautee brocoli vegetable. After 30mins of waiting we didn't get our food. So we decided to leave and eat somewhere else. For me i think what ever on that cart is the only thing they can have. Very dissapointed.

ZMYRf89e0BfZ2PNny2QhyA.text: This place is OK if you're on a budget and want dim sum. They still have the carts with food but it's limited in variety. This place wasn't packed so there's no telling how long the shrimp dumplings been under the steam warmer.  If anything wait until they bring the fresh one from the kitchen before picking it from the steam cart. Fortunately there is a menu that you can ask the waiter to order which I recommend.   I would stay away from their fried taro root or any of their food in their glass case. Although the lady said it was fresh and made this morning there's no guarantee she's telling the truth and when you bite into one it didn't taste like it was made that morning.   The restroom does have a couple of funny signs though.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pkg_2yK_b2PgCdTN0aPfUQ.text: I'm not sure what happened on the day we visited. The place was quite crowded but nothing we ordered was that good. The staff was friendly and the service was good but the food just wasn't worth coming back for. The chicken feet were over flavored and definitely had a lot of MSG in it. The taro cake (which they claimed was made in house, fresh) tasted like its previously frozen and thawed out then fried. The center wasn't even hot. It was slightly cold in the center The beef tendon I ordered turned out so mushy. It was so over cooked. I couldn't even eat it. The only decent items were the shrimp rice wrap (even though the  rice wrap was too thick) and the shirmp dumplings (the wrapper broke as I picked it up from the steamer). Even the tea was off. We ordered oolong and it tasted like pu-erh tea.  The bill was over $40 and I just didn't think it's worth it at all.

jxr8SBEo6Z8QdPC2uoZHTA.text: Our group was looking for a restaurant that offered dim sum on a Sunday with minimal to no wait and that was close to the Strip. We found Yum Cha on Yelp with promising ratings and reviews. I called them to inquire about the wait time for 6 and lucky for us there was one!  The restaurant has more of a "hole-in-the-wall" feel with typical Chinese diner style furnishings and metal dim sum carts. Complimentary iced water and hot jasmine tea are provided. Just like most dim sum restaurants, staff pushes around carts with very dim sum options.   Dishes that I enjoyed were: shrimp & pork shumais, shrimp dumplings, shrimp rice noodles, taro dumplings, and turnip cakes.  Dishes that I didn't enjoy very much were: baked BBQ pork buns, xiao long baos, and steamed BBQ pork buns.   The dim sum was a bit limited but they had a lot of solid choices and quick service. Good place to keep in mind if you're looking for a yummy dim sum restaurant in Vegas.

pYqvqGlh31KzOSp1W-UA5Q.text: The best thing about Vegas? LATE NIGHT DIM SUM.  My visit was later in the day, so there were no roaming carts delivering deliciousness to your table. That's fine. We ordered our dims sum off the menu. Har gow, shumai, and beef noodle. We also ordered chow mein and salt and pepper pork. I mean, if you're going to go get some late night eats you might as well go big and order all the food.  Everything was great and the prices were typical. The dim sum dishes ran from $3 a piece. Family style entrees were around $10. Our server was friendly and came back to check on us a few times and refilled drinks quickly. Which was surprising, since you know how most Chinese restaurants are.   Will come back again! I would suggest checking to see when they have special weekday pricing on dim sum. It's like happy hour for shumai, that's a win!

zIQsXrkV3t9mQXophzvVVQ.text: Customer service is good, fast. Raddish cake tasted burned, can't taste the radish taste. Golden Sand lava custard bun is too sweet, not much salty egg yolk, not hot enough. Shrimp rice noodle dish size is too small, noodle is not soft not silky. Shrimp pork chives dumpling is good. Pork veg tofu skin roll is good too, but size is quite small. Steam sweet rice cake is too sweet, but the size is good, 3 big pieces, not sure if it's worth $3.68 though.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xinLmkH7lGYQ6Q_ePANU-A.text: BEWARE.  They added 18% tip for a party of 5. Upon questioning, he justified it as a customary tip during the holiday season and also gave me some BS about travelers from China not tipping.  I requested it to be removed since there is no sign or any notices.  They did and I added my own tips.   The food was only fair.  The skin on the har game that we had was not completely cooked.  Overall small portions.  Only 2 egg tarts per order.    We look for Dim Sum everywhere we go.  We come to Vegas every new year and will not be visiting here again.    DISAPPOINTED.  I really dislike anyone when they try to be deceitful

G1Z6Co9CZR35qNtH-lzg2A.text: The dim sum was amazing!! They had the traditional carts, and the authenticity of food was A++++. Very clean, great ventilation, customer service was quick and efficient. All around must eat dim sum.

eqMBiXrc4OqULGo4iAXFZg.text: Wow! What a great find! So many choices in the area but this is definitely the diamond of the area. Friendly,smiling staff. Quick service. Extremely clean and of course great food! This will definitely be our go-to place next time we're in LV!!!!

WKIcEkGlmnmPLTxvv7SUjA.text: We decided to try this dim sum place after seeing so many reviews. You can get dim sum from carts as well as order from the picture menu. I must say that their picture menu is helpful especially if you're a first timer.   We walked in little before their opening time at 10:30am but one of the staff sat us right away. The staff are really nice. Our tea pot was checked few times so we enjoyed many cups of hot tea.   If you dine here, I would stick with steamed dim sum. One of our non-steamed dish that we ordered didn't seemed like it was made same day. That's why I could only give 3 stars.

hyBSKfhcgXW5yF1RhwC_fg.text: Great place for Chinese Dim Sum with affordable prices. Quick service. Best soya bean pudding in the city.

kLWv_Z-AZookmwemlpiC2A.text: Pretty good decent dim sum. They've got the staple items like chicken feet, pork siomai, shrimp dumplings har gow, pork buns.. the pork siomai was on the salty side and the waitress was kind enough to let us exchange it for something else. SUPERB customer service. That impressed me far more than anything else. I can't say I've been to a Chinese restaurant with such service as great as this place, especially dim sum where they can get pretty crazy busy and customers can get pretty demanding. Not here, they were busy but stayed professional, accommodating, and even apologetic for the siomai not being on point. They are a bit on the more expensive side for their dishes but you still get good food and good service. So all in all, it's a good dim sum place that hits the spot.

uBMgQDl6hC-lLWHJv2c8-w.text: Sooooo efficient and scratches that dim sum itch for a very reasonable price! I didn't want to make the drive down to Rio or Gold Coast and decided to try a more local restaurant for dim sum. Yum Cha has a very casual, cafeteria-like feel. They dangled birdcages from the ceiling which made me smile and remember when I used to go to dim sum as a child with my grandfather back in Hong Kong. The service was VERY quick. You want some egg tarts? They're at your table in 30 seconds. Tofu fa? 20 seconds. The service staff is on top of things for sure. The food was pretty good. I did not experience any problems with the taste or freshness of the dishes.  No wait times, quick service, decent food. Definitely an option for casual dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ye3V4Kme3MxfjMQdsW_5AQ.text: I enjoyed this place as it had many options for dishes to share.  It is a good place for groups as my group had 9 people in it and everyone left stuffed and content.  A server with a cart comes by with many of these small Chinese dishes and you pick and choose what you want.  Turnip cake, fried taro, bbq pork bun, shrimp dumpling, chicken feet . . . they seem to have it all.  However, there is menu with pictures to choose larger dishes like salt and pepper calamari or General Tso's chicken (both were delicious).  Wash it down with some jasmine tea and then food coma time.  The food quality and prices were good but I gave a 4 due to the service being slow.  If you haven't experienced dim sum or just new to this type of cuisine, this is a great place to start.  I would definitely come back here again.

nCQfmGdKjfVM4KPo8jA0Kg.text: Came with a huge group, they were able to accommodate us easily. Great spot for dim sum, and very close to the strip too. Would recommend and go again.

-0jidFlO-eKwjFtfFtrkLA.text: Yelped Dim Sum and this placed popped up! Visited in the afternoon so there was only one family dining in. Looks clean and spacious loved how they have a cafeteria style cook area. Big screen tv all around and AC was great! Menu had prices and pictures!! Shu Mai/Shrimp Dumpling/Shrimp rice rolls: 4/5 typical great taste can't complain here. We ordered the beef rice rolls as well but I recommend don't get it just an opinion. Steam spare ribs: 4/5 typical taste nothing good or bad here Pork Buns: 3/5 not sure but I didn't see any baked BBQ buns I was craving those... chicken feet: 4.5/5 okay so I DONT eat chicken feet but my family made me eat it! Lol on the real side I never eat this dish but they told me the flavors of this dish was off the hook so I tasted it. I gave it 4.5 so that tells you I really liked the flavors not the chicken feet of course lol Tendon: 5/5 FIRST time ever I've seen this dish on a dim sum menu!! Flavors were great and so soft and bomb.com!!! Out of my mind that it tasted so good! I don't think it's a item that gets ordered a lot so we order a few of these and the last one came out late which they didn't get steamed long enough and the tendon felt like it just came out of the fridge. Deep Fried Pork Belly: 0/5 do not get this dish! I know what Pork belly is and this shit ain't it! It was just a slab Of Pork floured and deep Fried! It as too salty and what a rip off! I was so mad bc I wanted PORK BELLY! Fried Pork Dumplings: 3/5 took them forever to bring this item out I thought they forgot till the end of our lunch. Very Small fillings and not that much flavor to them. Overall, not a bad experience the workers were great. Ohhhhhhh and their chili oil is a 5/5 can't have good dim sum without this side so yeayyyy!!!

fE49EiGeE2Q4G76QNjeNew.text: Extremely vegetarian-friendly! This place is great, friendly and had tons of veggie options, including fake meats. The menu has all the vegetarian options clearly marked. And they serve dim sum all day! Must try! And get the mung bean pancakes!

FqM7Xgb_EjO8d2enM3dXxg.text: The food and service overall were good but I took off 3 stars because in the spicy pork dumplings the meat was still raw, yes raw pinky chewy pork. I was terrified because I often have dimsum so I know how the dish is supposed to taste. In this case, my friend didn't know the meat inside (pork wrapped in dumpling skin) still raw until I tried and pointed it out. He thought the chewy texture is how it's normally like. We notified the server and he offered to take that dish off the bill but I had lost my appetite I couldn't eat much more. I was so psyched to find out this place but the raw pork really brought me down. I wish they could have been more careful about cooking the food bc until now I still can't forget the feeling of chewing the raw piece of PORK and worrying so bad of getting sick.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw pork (pink and very chewy) in spicy pork dumplings dish.

Vnl5Es4YnxqPuTvS4baG5Q.text: They served me bad smelling spare rib dimsum that's seem to be from last night  They did replaced it but they should NOT SERVE old food to customers

DEiYsiaMlKTCpTUx1YGaBA.text: Las Vegas has some of my favorite eats in the world but I stand by what I've said: They just can't do dim sum right!  But when comparing it to other dim sum places in Las Vegas, Yum Cha is okay. We ordered a variety of the typical standard fare. Most dishes are bland but still palatable. I like the squash/pumpkin found in the black bean spare ribs but I think they were using it as fillers to give less meat. Food was served hot from the steamers and didn't appear to be reheated leftovers from the day before so that's a big plus. Don't forget to look at the heated bar holding some more food like congee with Chinese doughnuts and liver and tripe with daikon.  The staff was very attentive and the place was clean. Yum Cha, cute name and all, is a decent place to get your dim sum eats if you're in town but don't go in with high expectations.

-JuRFQwU-FzRRjuKgjVlfg.text: This is my favorite spot for dim sum. They serve dim sum all day which is a plus. I usually come here in the night time & the food still look tasty. I recommend taro cake & custard lava bun. The bbq pork pastry is the must too. Good customer service & decent price!

CGoP1nXKEiSkSFVgu4R13Q.text: Honestly, dim sum places in Vegas are not that impressive.  Yum cha has become my first choice when the craving hits.  There's a lot of positives to this place and a few misses.  What is most noticeable about this place is the customer service.  The workers speak a fair amount of English, which helps because they are able to explain the food they are offering and answer questions appropriately.  You'll always spot the man in the orange, who I assume runs the place.  He's always got a smile on his face and is constantly interacting with customers.  He's been prompt and follows through with specific dim sum orders we had.  Most dim sum places in town do not even go the extra mile and many workers come off rude. Not here!  I am not that adventurous and stick with the basic fare like: hargow, shu mai, char siu bao, beef/shrimp noodle, sticky rice, pineapple buns, egg tart, and sesame balls.  I did enjoy the quality and freshness of the food.  The pork shu mai was my least favorite since it was on the bland side.  The sticky rice, pineapple buns, and sesame buns were my favorite here.  I also liked that they offer roti here!  Another major difference here is the large glass counter/open kitchen where you can walk up and order dim sum beyond what is offered on food carts.  This is where you can get congee, fried rice, desserts, and more!    The space is large, airy, and very clean.  Location is situated on Tropicana/Decatur in the shopping center with Walgreens. Be aware on holiday weekends, this place will charge more (like $3+ for basic dim sum).  I feel like I spent a lot more than I would on dim sum that I had in the past from other places.  *****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge***** 53/100

58UCqImIFleL8wGXscYBSw.text: Would totally recommend to get your dim sum fix. Staff is very attentive, friendly, and just overall great. The dim sum is reasonably priced. Will be coming here again. And dim sum wasn't too bad either.

STNgGzirlymNQTVeMmmldA.text: The place was recommended to us by local SE Asian student. I was there with Foodies so they knew what to order: I liked the sesame buns, but the egg tart was the bomb!!!! My friends had it at a Dim Sum in Chicago, and they convinced me to get the last one; it was very light and did not have that "eggy" smell or taste. I may revisit for these two items next time I am in Vegas!

GeP8vMtzWWNITYQN_M-BFA.text: I've never left a bad review for any restuarant. After our first dish was a complete disappointment and being told that's how they serve it, we should have left. Worst place I've ever eaten.

JxlBJKONJ9CX5EI-kzjebg.text: Made a yelp account just to post this review! We have been a regular customer for over a year now and our experience was always the same every single time! Nothing but good food and excellent service from all the staff!

14_6SGTvgOU2VSQBkxupwQ.text: I have to say this place is totally amazing! The food is great, the staff are super sweet, and it's probably the cleanest restaurant I've ever been too! If you're vegan this place is the one to go to! Also majority of the food is made to order in front of you!Sadly I didn't get photos of the food cause it was too good, but I did get some of dessert. All the vegan options are marked with a symbol and there is so many options! Please check it out!

HxcdAncVlPIsL0f3KfhU5A.text: All day dim sum! Many vegetarian options. Flavorful food and great bao texture.  Some different selections , with the iconic siu mais and gaos good texture, hot and steamy. Very friendly and helpful staff.

vrEOJw0kXIzAUlJD0as2hA.text: Or should it be called Yummy Cha? I've been to four dim sum restaurants in the Las Vegas area and I have to say that Yum Cha is the best.  My husband and I visited Yum Cha  this past Saturday. As always, my husband scored a parking space right in front of the restaurant. As we were walking to the door, the door opened up for us and stayed opened. When we got there, one of the employees of the restaurant was holding the door open for us. I don't remember any restaurant doing that for me as soon as I get out of the car. So I was wow'd.  We walk in and the restaurant is huge and CLEAN! Double WOW!. We are seated, are drink orders are taken, I turn around and there's the dim sum cart. Triple WOW!   And the one cart has variety of options that it took us, what seemed like, less than 30-seconds to grab six dishes and 5-seconds to stuff our mouths with har gow and shumai when we realized, we didn't take a foodie pic. So in other words, we were hungry.  About a minute later, a second cart pulled up where we grabbed two more dishes and I was like, we have to slow down. Thank goodness my husband ordered chrysanthemum tea. And wait there's more. Whatever dim sum dishes they don't have on the cart, but is on the menu and as long as it was not a seasonal dish, you can order it and it is still the same weekend price of $3.58/each dish, $2.98/each on weekdays. So we ordered 3 more dishes.  Now it seems like we ordered a lot of food, and yah, it was, but keep in mind, depending on the size of the dim sum, it comes in 2s to 5s. Only two of the dishes were really bready, so we weren't filled up until we had the baked baos.  I have a lot of family and friends that visit. Yum Cha is definitely on the list of family lunch or dinner.  Fantastic job Yum Cha!

-dQ-tc4e7tDO8VYtJy5SUQ.text: Favorite dim sum in Vegas!!! Anytime we're in Vegas this place is a MUST!! The service is wonderful and the food is amazing!

DnydMda2sdEvfdbdduUhYg.text: Dim sums are available all day log and are priced at either $3.58 or $4.28, a little more pricey compare to New York prices however the price was still reasonable and worth it. Some dishes are already made and available in carts but some have to be ordered, which just guarantee hotness! Food came quick and service was attentive. Food wasn't bad but it wasn't great, it would definitely satisfy your cravings though. I recommend the lotus leaf pork sticky rice, fried dough wrapped in rice noodle, beef tripe, and radish cake.

BLCp_6jKcXh57yN5S2yoKg.text: I was good luck for found this place.  I love Dim Sum. It place is Amazing. When I walk in they are welcome and smiles. The food 5 Star. Service 5 Star. I ask for a lot of sauce they give us try everything.  My friend ask Chinese owner ? Then the owner walk to us. He is The Who that walk around and take care very table like another staff.  This place will be my Best Dim sum restaurant in LV now. No more ping pung...pong

8FS_aaOswQSrv5OYzxbhhw.text: I've driven by many times, finally went in. It is no longer a buffet but offer Chinese food as Emil as dim sum. During "off" hours of dim sum, I appreciate that they make the items when you order them. I do find the prices a little high. I am here on a Monday night at 6:30p & there are only 2 tables beside mine. I had the Wonton Noodle Soup as well as Chive Dumplings. The soup was good. I do wish it had more vegetables in it. The Chive Dumplings (3 per order) ^small but tasty. They were a little on the greasy side. I might come back & try again.

jdWCaynjGdVqbZJhDVr3_w.text: Average dim sum in Las Vegas, but for the price you can't really complain. And what's nice about this place is that if you're craving dim sum, they serve it all day! That's a first, well, for me at least.   Nothing really stood out but they were all good enough to satisfy my hungry belly. They had all the typical dishes like har gow, chicken feet, and siu mai. Service is fine, nothing special. The restaurant is a asian looking for sure and very casual. No tablecloths, just a table, chairs, and a turn table. Pricing for the weekday and weekend different with the weekend prices being about $0.50 more for the dim sum. Cash only.  If you want some quality dim sum you're probably better off paying a little more to get that in the casinos. I prefer to go to the one in Rio. Though getting dim sum more off the strip is always easier.

K_sO-F3fhes68DQWuO9r-A.text: I'll start by saying that the service was great! Super friendly, attentive and kind which is rare at a Chinese restaurant. The dim sum in itself was okay.   I like the idea of walking up to the counter to order your dim sum. It's definitely different from the authentic cart service but it allows you see everything they have to offer and not have to wait for the cart to reach you. However, their selections were very limited when we went on a weekday. Only half the display station was filled with dim sum options. They had your typical hargow, Shumai, sticky rice and chashu bau but not much more. Wish they had more items to try didn't feel like I got a real dim sum experience. Maybe it's better on the weekend? I don't know but what I did try was just okay. Definitely not the best I've had and just okay. Would I come back? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Probably not.

yAaopqh3WrpBfYxeFGXuWQ.text: Went there this morning. This is definitely a great Dim Sum place to go. Food was fresh and tasty. Many interesting choices. The service was very nice! Those who said their food was not good, liar! Must go place in Vegas.

tfcPEjOf-Isb3-JHsNs1bg.text: I have eaten in this restaurant many times and It may be my favorite restaurant in town. The food is so authentic and my meals are always made with love I can tell. They really care about their business and it shows. The restaurant is always sparkling clean and the staff are friendly and efficient. Yao is my favorite server, so charming and friendly . My favorite dish is the Curry chicken noodles and I like the roti. If you go here try the traditional egg custards. They are made from scratch daily and often run out. Their lava custard buns are  the best I have ever tried. They are so big and delicious .Sesame balls are also a good choice for desert.

FgxegL2zmM8Mvm07Ky3xRQ.text: This place is soooooo good. Plenty of options and things to try, beware you might be here for while enjoying the yummy treats they have in the carts, so fresh and hot and full of flavor. A definite must try!  You have options of ordering dim sum from a steam cart or heading over to the counter and ordering other various items like egg flower soup and yummy pastries. Overall we were very happy with our lunch

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t be discourage by the way this looks! It was delicious and packing with flavor.

VdxWxt9h17XrJHKkePopxg.text: Very nice owners and staff!! Food was very good and a great variety. We will be back!

VVcXaUfyjYDFEDy1HlOdLg.text: I was craving some Dim Sum and I looked at all the Yelp reviews.  We were so glad we decided to give this place a try yesterday.  The place is nice and clean.  The staff was so helpful and nice and they came by to see if we needed anything.  Since I was there for Dim Sum, we picked delicacies from the cart and we went up to the window case and ordered some more food.  The food was tasty and fresh.  We particularly liked the pork rice porridge.  We are going to come back and try the dishes on the menu.  Their lunch menu looks like a real good deal.  The prices were really reasonable.  It is very close to Highway 215.  Give this place a try!

viOsj2xsbr7jU_UGajduzw.text: Great dimsum place plus the price is right ! The staff and servers are all nice , friendly and professional . The place is clean and service is outstanding. Will definitely come back .

yJianAfkrtxxfPtSELx9yg.text: Travelling all the way from Connecticut for a roadtrip and stopped by this dim sum place for lunch. We have been craving authentic chinese food for a long time and this place delivered!  We ordered chicken feet, pork ribs, custard buns, rice noodle, shrimp dumpling, sticky rice, and all were great. My favorite was the egg custard buns and chicken feet. Highly recommend!  Very friendly management and even gave us a free dim sum to go!

hcNBMAI7lvlM4yI_J4rR8g.text: I love this place!! The food is amazing and the staff is wonderful! They always fill up our hot tea. Everything taste really delicious

ZpTI1mbH2-EHEVtyzU4XMQ.text: I love how big the place is. I love that I can get Dim Sum at night. Usually Dim Sum is only serve in the morning but Yum Cha is different. The food here is super cheap. It taste super fresh and delicious. The server were really nice and kept asking me if I need any help. The custard bun is to die for. The filling inside the custard bun flows out once you bite into it which makes the bun taste absolutely delicious. I highly recommend this place for anyone who loves eating Dim Sum as much as I do and love all day Dim Sum.

_jXJbcCU7grL23IdfZ3hBw.text: The new Dom sum place introduced by my handyman. Foods are awesome. Usually dim sum can be a bit oversteamed and greasy but not the ones here.

LkCDqtkxfpfE1QKe9kO7Fg.text: Yum Cha has yummy variety, cleanliness, and friendly service.  What more could you ask for?  This is a new "must stop" each time we visit our son and mother in Vegas.  It will be yours once you try it!!!

HycFYr25KzAymnJd83d_mQ.text: This is absolutely my new favorite for dim sum! Excellent food and a great selection. They have carts and a buffet style counter. I always order too much because everything is so delicious! Great customer service, very nice employees.

ShapDDj1mMgBjbT6TPJHSg.text: Dim sum was very average nothing special! resturant is very unorganized.  Only 2 dim sum cart with the same exact things on it. Service was also average.  I don't know if I will make another visit here.

ZGbkXvY97hbXe-XukF4vug.text: Service was as wonderful as the delicious food. The dimsum was amazing. Very clean and everyone was very friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone that's trying dimsum for the first time. The employee thoroughly explains everything, so you don't need to be nervous about what you'll be trying. I also enjoyed the interior design with the bird cages.

FBoxe8KCs4Ia_wICOFVT9g.text: Decent place with great dim sum. Family and Baby friendly.  Decent place with great dim sum. Family and Baby friendly.  Will come again

3A1RTDouYd9Nv6nG0_kRUQ.text: Watching Bizarre Foods last night is the reason why my gf and I craved dim sum and chicken feet. We recently moved to Las Vegas so we were on the hunt for some great dim sum. We stumbled upon Yum Cha & I am so glad that we did. Every piece from the taro puff, to all of the various dumplings met our expectations and more! My personal favorite was the flat white steamed noodle with steamed shrimp. The sauce that was added to it before being served was absolutely delicious!  For desert, the custard buns had my name written all over it. First bite in and you're greeted with an explosive flavor of soft bun. Sweet and decadent custard filling and a bit of custard crunch on the top. All 3 mixed together tastes perfect! The staff was very friendly and we're always on top of things whenever we needed something. If you happen to be in he area and are craving great dim sum and Chinese food. Yum Cha is the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dim sum spread ^__^

z7ue4Hrxhhxz7WoJK0chVA.text: Great meal. Pleasant staff. We felt very welcomed. As soon as we were seated, the carts started coming. Cucumbers in chili oil, noodles and fried shrimp balls that looked like chrysanthemums were delicious. The best was the coconut buns for dessert. A short drive from the strip, easy to locate. Very reasonable.

Xx8nZHsgoQMCwDUj7Ek1DA.text: Very friendly staff, fast service and solidly authentic food. Curry fish ball is especially good. Great lunchtime place :)

gnES_dSRyIMeVWm4XhdhmA.text: We've lived in San Francisco, New York, Chicago and now, Las Vegas. We've tried Dim Sum here and now found Yum Cha. The Dim Sum is fresh, tasty, and there is a large variety to choose from. The food is very fresh and the restaurant is clean, inviting, and the owners welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable. The service is good, friendly and efficient. (My husband is Taiwanese) We Highly recommend!!

RlDRfzYtzAuWJl3jjEp4GA.text: Great place to eat. Food is always good and the service is great. They are always looking to improve. Food comes out quickly and is delicious every time.

MjiyfWRXqdutUN5K0Sy4ag.text: Good dim sum & I liked the line so you could look at the specialty dishes & order them. The place is super clean & staff is really friendly. I didn't like the cream buns as they were crunchy & had very little filling. Too bad because those are my favorite. Prices were higher than other places I e been but still good.

qyX0jCig7kvbtB2CKa59WA.text: My Girl and I gave this place a try being that we are Dim Sum aficionado's it was way better than we expected and reasonably priced too. They have all the same items from the other Dim Sum Spots so don't worry you'll be satisfied! Compared to the other places we've tried I would give this place a must try! Coming from me I wouldn't say that to waste your time because everyone's taste buds are different so just try it out. Not only Dim Sum but they have a Regular Menu with Chinese Dishes as well. Spoke with one of the workers that used to work at a Dim Sum spot I would always go to and told him we'd definetly be back! I Guarantee you'll never say Nah when it comes to Yum Cha!

-fAzaIDf9j9iwxTQvxyNTw.text: Food was overall good, but some of the dishes like Chicken feet was cold.  They should over all the dishes from the mobile steamer

9MsGe5l5ihR303ZBgfKKZg.text: The best Dim Sum in town, First time in find in vegas a rice noodle roll with bbq pork. Everything is super fresh and the staff is very nice . For sure try the Roti Canai, its like a naan but better . they have the best beef tripes in town .the chives dumpling are amazing .The crispy eggplants are very interesting. This place is my new dim sum place , I have been 3 times in a week,

srSeFy454-ueL_YXodwjmg.text: Staffs were nice. Food was good. Typical dimsum. Nothing wrong. Can't complain about anything tbh. Fairly cheap food. Porridge was good afffff. Would come again.

Z0PXDP3RxRCHfTUj_xFV6w.text: $25 lunch for two. Well worth the Uber over from the Strip. Typical dim sum fare. Clean restaurant. Quick service.

nSpf5q7K5jJezf3XbBJRLg.text: We just found a new favorite DimSum place. The reasons are as follow;  Pro: - Greeted immediately  - Great Service - Explained each item on DimSum menu. Once we mentioned we eat seafood only, they suggested great options.  - Food was freshly prepared.  - Food quality is so great. Very tasty & definitely not greasy.  - Good size on the Tofu Fa - Very clean & well managed restrooms - They have diaper changing table on both Ladies & Mens restrooms. - First restrooms in chinese & asian restaurants I know that use a touchless soap dispensers  Con: Other than too greasy on fried items, & some stained on the chair, we almost couldn't find any negative side of them.

lQ7l1PRtyYmkOGUSAnyrCA.text: Very polite staff! Dim sum is served fresh and fast! The baked BBQ pork bun was really great. Also loved the shrimp & pork Shumai! The egg tart, sweet tofu, and coconut bun are really great desserts! The entire restaurant is very open and not too loud. It was nice talking to the staff while enjoying the food. I'd recommend this place for lunch, dinner, or even a snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eUNNU-mAIniUg2Tc11WKpg.text: Great Vegas eatery with all day dim sum.  And it's good.  Loved the sticky rice, beef crepes, and salt and pepper squid.  Best squid I've had in the USA.  Good service.  Only knock would be the decor which looks more like a fast food or food court style.  Tasty food tho would certainly recommend.

xQg7HBl0jFicKDuHWOs_wg.text: OMG, this place is super delicious. I was in Vegas for a friend's birthday party but I also met with some family off the strip and they recommended this restaurant to us for some great dim sum.  My family is Chinese but I'm very much Americanized but still have nostalgia about eating dim sum. I got there and the staff was super nice. The food looked and tasted amazing.   You have to check it out for yourself but I enjoy all the favorites like hai gow, shu mai, turnip cakes, and roast pork buns. I can't wait to visit again when I head back to Vegas.

TSsJdwklikcdvwYFxpTMRQ.text: Everything we ordered are very flavorful. Everybody here were nice and tentative, not annoying or fake. They took their time to explain everything and how it works. I like it how they also have chicken siomay, we don't eat pork so its good to have other option.Their dimsum price are slightly higher on the weekend and holidays. They have a lady walking around pushing dimsum cart, she has all selections of steam ones but if you want any fried dimsum or veggie you can walk up to the counter to see their selections and order from there or order it from your server.  Good dimsum, clean. We'll be back!

7DlB-grZpVNqBYunu4Mojg.text: WOW! Their dumplings are on point! I was here last week with a few of my friends and we stuffed our faces with every dumpling dish they had to offer. All dishes are made fresh and they do not use frozen items. Also, their hospitality and customer service was fantastic. We felt like they were welcoming us into their home.  I will be going back here often because the food is delicious and my money is well-spent!

qR9T3a5J8CkbBsrf0Eo-Zg.text: Dim Sum with Malaysian flair! Even though it was very busy on a Sunday with lots of people, our party of 4 sat down immediately and began eating from the dim sum carts right away. One of the few dim sum places in Vegas that has xiaolongbao! And roti canai with curry! Their Singapore noodles have an authentic Malaysian/Singapore taste. The staff are very attentive, fast, and friendly! Huge selection! Something for everyone.

W9TVyANAMRHru9N19iqFcg.text: Yum cha is the place, you need to try! Friendly staff with delicious food. I'm giving this place a 5 stars for the following reason: 1. Great customer service 2. Tasty food 3. Food are not greasy 4. Reasonable price  5. Place is clean 6. You have a choice of dim sum or not 7. Love love love

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp... Wow
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum... Love it
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fishballs with curry.. Yummy

Me9YeMuiCgMDnNaX1WclsA.text: Really was hesitant at first on trying this place out but I was craving dim sum so I decided to give it a try. There's only a few dim sum places opened late in Las Vegas and this one was nearest to my house. So Let me start off by telling you the experience here is great. The service is perfect and even talked a few stories with our server she is a really nice lady. On top of that they make the dim sum fresh to order  and the portion sizes are great for there prices. Definitely gonna come back

WoqV7lenxtx_u1adOegwtA.text: Fantastic food off the strip! The staff is friendly and provide excellent service. Then there is the food. We were so impressed with the food that we ate there twice in the same trip. There is not a bad item in the house and with a selection from "American Chinese" food to more authentic selects it was all fantastic. We highly trying crispy eggplant.   Yum Cha will definitely be added to our Las Vegas routine.

LzYFOAlkfG17-es-fm9JUw.text: Had the same problem as Lily C. Restaurant refused to honor $25 certificate obtained just days ago, claiming they have not participated in the program for a while, yet it is still listed on the website today. Get it together or just honor the promotion as a courtesy. We splurged since there was a $50 minimum. Big mistake as our bill ended up over $70 for 2 adults/2 kids. A bit pricey for a 'casual' lunch.  Decent dim sum, was a bit cold as we dined later in the afternoon. The freshly steamed dishes were fine. Not the best dim sum but not the worst either. A bit pricey at $3.50-$4+ a dish  ($1+ for each morsel). At that price point Ping Pang Pong @ Gold Coast is better. Service was quick and attentive but it was not busy when we went.  And in case you noticed this place has large number of good reviews - they reward positive reviews by bribing reviewers with free dim sum - shady.

6No1vS7-oPwKqqBejixgBg.text: Below par.  Way better dim sum in Hawaii where I am from.  Everything just tasted a little off.

qeJIyCqyGhSrXU-dSufkKg.text: Salt and pepper shrimp was salty, service was bad, i called the hosts they just ignored me and kept on talking, i have to wave 4x. HK seafood garden is much better... dimsum? They really have not much of it, only siomai pr whatever...

WgZe9eFtN8MAPmt5lcb4TQ.text: I'm very pleased with this Dim Sum restaurant. After living in China for many years, I've become more critical of the lack of authenticity in the states. This place is the real deal. The food was excellent and the service attentive. This place will become one of my go to places for authentic Chinese food! The cleanliness stood out too.

d6uJbY7FAYjJBCdWDyq8Lg.text: We are on vacation and drove past Yum Cha this morning.   We thought it looked new and and we Yelp'd it.  Great reviews and they have Dim Sum! So after a day in Red Rock Canyon we came in for dinner.   Holy smokes this place is remarkable. The Dim Sum was fantastic.  We enjoyed the Tarro Root which looks like a birds nest. It was yummy.  We had shrimp and spinach dumpling, chive dumpling and some tofu dumpling.  The dessert Dim Sum was amazing. One had a coconut filling and the other was a sesame seed red bean ball.   Well we live in So Cal and are here on vacation.  This will be our first of many Dim Sum dinners at Yum Cha.    The staff was great! We were promptly greeted and though we love Dim Sum they explained everything and recommend some things too! Great service !  Ps looks like it's large enough for large party's and receptions.  Lastly this is the cleanest place I've ever seen. They have a lot of pride in their family run restaurant!

7XrdnE9XaC6xGZTp_Qxt8Q.text: Not bad...but not good either. Just your average Vegas dim sum joint.  After returning from delicious dim sum in LA; I was excited to go to Yum Cha. I expected an authentic experience followed by delicious food and great customer service. Unfortunately, I came out a little disappointed.  Although the food wasn't terrible - I wouldn't have considered it great either. The shumai & rice cake lacked a lot of flavor. On the flip side, however, the steamed char siu bun was delicious. That's the only dish we ordered multiple times.  The wait & cook staff were pre-occupied while 3 employees went on a dinner break at the same time. I could literally see them eating their In-N-Out burgers while the rest of us required assistance. I was left with an empty water cup for almost 30 minutes! (My biggest restaurant pet peeve). There were other people around us complaining as well.   Excellent customer service could have saved the rest of my issues with the restaurant. However, based off of this experience - I don't think I will be back anytime soon.

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friend Shrimp Ball
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Pork Shumai

RxvC8bfayt5lye5LaiyjoA.text: Great service   Friendly atmosphere ! dim sum was delicious with lots of selections, will be back again !

gn8Rqds8y-AjOA3YA2bJ5w.text: It was okay; I expected more from the authentic place. Prices are way higher for the quality and specifically I asked if meals come with rice.  I was told yes by not one but two people. But yeah it comes if you pay extra.    Then the dim sum comes out and the price is marked for for two but they charge you per piece.  Wtf is that? So a bowl coat 7 bucks vs the 3.50 on the menu.  All in all I would skip this place.  The only reason I am giving them three stars is because I left my glasses there and they where honest about having them.

_ValYIUdewCr9ME2lugH8A.text: I was hoping this place would be the type that a person would roll a cart around the restaurant and you picked whatever plates were on the cart (like any traditional dim sum restaurant), but this place is not like that. The restaurant is quite spacious, however, and the tables are not so close together like some other dim sum restaurants in town.  However, they have a wide variety of dim sum made on their menu. They have some common dim sum dishes/tapas and some really authentic dishes (the kind that you have to acquire a palate for). The owner of the restaurant stopped by our table multiple times to explain that the items were made daily and that some of the items we ordered take a while to heat up, but she assured us repeatedly that the dishes were delicious.  My favorite thing was the green tea mochi with coconut filling. I don't remember what else I ordered, but that was the most memorable thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi and Dim Sum

qWVRN_E-LVUOsotC5srWHA.text: Fantastic service and food! We have had dim sum at the Rio and Ping Pang Pong in the Gold Coast. But this place is awesome. Every time we touched the menu, someone was ready to take our order. Be prepared to wait a little if the dish you want isn't on the cart. But it will come out fresh and hot. The baked pork buns, shrimp stuffed Chinese doughnut, fried shrimp balls, and roasted duck were delicious. There are lunch rice and meat specials as well, if you are not in the mood for dim sum. All the staff we met was helpful. No horror story here yet, we hope to visit again.

4c8sE-FU6h4Jw5oJNJcu-A.text: Found my go-to place for my last meal when I leave Vegas to head for home now :)   This is a legit dim sum/Chinese eatery. Quality food and they make it fresh. Puts some distinctive dim sum place in Orange County back in Cali to shame.   Their sweet bbq pork bun (the one with the sweet, shiny, sticky coating on the brown bun - not the white soft steamed bun) is LEE-GIT. DENSE, HEAVY and FILLED with filling. Physically pick one up and you'll find that it's quite heavy in comparison to dinky other ones elsewhere. We ordered two more orders and took it with us in the car for the ride home.   If you order off their specialty item menu - they will make it in the kitchen and the preparer/cook will bring it to your table fresh as soon as they are done.

axJLxGIDWHFAgz8I_Usk3g.text: Yum Cha was a pleasant experience. Off the strip but definitely worth a trip to get affordable dim sum. If you are new to dim sum this is the place to go. A short cab or Uber ride will earn you a very approachable and enjoyable experience. The staff was very attentive and the menu had good pictures. They had a good selection of Dim Sum and the flavors were good.  I have had better in New York and Los Angeles, but I would still recommend this to anyone. I will definitely be back   The highlights were the Sesame Balls, a fried shrimp roll cut in pieces and the bbq pork pastries.

FI6WcIhlKwWeS2CyycIIXA.text: I must say that I've been to a lot of dim sum places in the san gabriel valley and some in it's motherland of Hong Kong as well and I really enjoyed myself here at this Vegas location.  I was overall surprised because I honestly didn't think you could get delicious dim sum in NV. The best part was the service was excellent along with the delicious food.  This location is a mixture of your cart dim sum where you pick your items from the carts that are pushed by your table and ordering from the menu to your table. I say this is a mixture because they usually only have 1-3 carts floating around and they have tons of wait staff to come and get your order, also some items are order only.   They make all their dim sum fresh to order and it taste that way! Another note, their baked BBQ Pork buns are jumbo size so be warned not to order too much!  Come early because they do get very busy and a wait does form.

bf28a0RxGNc49kbNIs0NyA.text: After a long night of drinking, we woke up Sunday morning craving one thing: dim sum. This place popped up on Yelp and we were off. We were a group of 5 and were sat right away. Dehydrated, we begged for tall glasses of ice water.   Service here was phenomenal. They took our order right away. They kept refilling our water and our tea. Bite by bite, we were slowly coming back to life. The dim sum was very fresh and piping hot. We were so so so content coming here. Will definitely be back if I'm craving dim sum next time I'm in Vegas.

IzpdkLAdRgHn380vvkYARw.text: Good dim sum variations. We ordered the chicken feet and is was the start of something new and wonderful. Hahaha

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

nSJHgFoARALYHi9eazsBFg.text: This place has all day dim sum. All the. On steamed items are great. The steamed items are not al dente which is why they lost a star. They are mushy.   Service is great. Pricing is decent and parking abundant

eh6GFDO7bVOGApAl-LzDzw.text: 1. Not lunch rush, but there is line, gat situated fast 5 2. Food fresh and Hot, and tasty, Recommend lava bun 5 3. Decor of the restaurant is nice with the bird cage on the ceiling and open kitchen bar. CLEARN 5 4. The service and the servers is not the top of the line , but is above average for sure 5 because of the  face.  Then why they only get 2 , because after all the satisfaction I have with them, I needed to go to the restroom to wash my hand, OMG that bathroom is so bad is like there is an ozone sphere inside, I don't think the exhaust fan is working or on. I can't help it I vomited on the sink. ( I clean up after myself and the sink)  If not for that, 5for sure.

5739lNEmBy2ogpU4si2Mhg.text: Legit dim sum. Great selection and reasonably priced. Service was A+. This place and Hong Kong seafood are now my go-to's for dim sum.

tc6-ip6Am3m2oAVMpxS96Q.text: Perfect place for dim sum. The place is cute and the service is amazing. They always make sure you have what you need. The dim sum is fresh! The Siu mai is so good. I only regret not being able to try the pineapple bun because I was so full. I will definitely be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bysBk7_Y7WSnYDZmE64ODA.text: When I was craving some decent dimsum in vegas, I had to ask around for some local places that people liked that are NOT located in buffets. Had to make it a point to come here with my mom, because you know, asian parents love dimsum. LOL  I have to say it was really nice to have a place that serves dimsum all day long, especially when most places stop at 2pm or 3pm.  Good selection of dimsum, most items are driven on a cart, some specialty items are kept closer to the counter and are made to order. Understandably, as you don't expect a full time dimsum chef back in the kitchen making dimsum all day, there are some items that are decent under heat lamps. I really cannot badmouth anything as they were just as good.  The lava custard buns were delicious, not too sweet; the meatballs weren't excessively greasy and did not taste like baking soda. (some places are notorious for marinating it with lots of soda to tenderize the meat) The beef rice crepes were also delicious, not too thick, and not too salty. It is worth the detour. The palace had a nice asian tea house feel with birdcages hung on top; really quaint and a relaxing atmosphere; good place to come and gossip like asian ladies and spill tea. The prices were really decent too! did not break the bank! stuffed ourselves with dimsum for 4 people and barely spent $75. Would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining hall
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

3yyPYQWWTisIOGqWI-KIpA.text: This dim sum was so fresh and delicious. The service was great as well! We ordered shrimp dumplings, fried taro, radish cake, chicken feet, shrimp rice noodle, shrimp and pork shumai. All of them were delicious! If I'm in Vegas again, I will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
