Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bun and fried taro

PWHfCHa2MDxsCu0cB8Hl3A.text: The food quality is alright and the service is just about as alright as any of the other (non-Strip) dim sum restaurants in town. The prices are nearly twice that of Orchids Garden whose food quality is very comparable.  Although some of the dishes we ordered were made to order and tasted better as a result, many of the dishes we had suffer from the same problem of just being a little old from sitting around. You can taste how old dim sum is even if it is reheated.  They do seem to have a bit more variety, but it doesn't seem very significant. Honestly, I didn't eat anything that I couldn't get at another lower priced restaurant.  So go here if you don't feel like driving a few more minutes and saving a few bucks for essentially the same experience. It'll probably be okay.

ZVaSBBTxnobZujAuejQfQQ.text: The dim sum was outstanding, all the shu mai, dumplings, sticky rice, were incredible! We also ordered lo mein (incredible), pork belly deep fried (outstanding and not greasy), egg foo yong, curry chicken, and a myriad of other dishes. Can't wait to return here soon!

g16Wz5nhaaGODNy5XD0AQg.text: Not that many selections and their prices are ridiculously expensive for what you get for.  Frozen dim sum tastes better than theirs. Not recommending to anyone.  I should have not given it a star. Very disappointed....

mffQTEvtuUcQZhbzvqgwRg.text: Stopped by here during Labor Day Weekend to grab some good bites with my girlfriend. The Shrimp & Pork Shumai was AMAZING as was the Fried Shrimp Balls. Definitely give those a try. The prices are very very reasonable as well. On top of great and polite customer service. Will definitely head back the next time I'm out in the Las Vegas area!

fkBtePtUxSbd6ZIxBnK2ow.text: I went with a friend after 3pm and just missed the dim sum cart, but we were still able to order dim sum via menu and it was made to order.   The dim sum was good, I've had dim sum other places before and can't say that it was extraordinary but tasted like dim sum anywhere else you go.   Deducted one star because it took a little while for us to get our bill to pay that we had to walk up to the cash register for someone to notice us. It was slow so they weren't busy with customers or anything. Guess they forgot about us!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hr0ZCWFH8Pwd0OdlKlzUTQ.text: This is the only place in vegas that I know of that serves dim sum all day and all night. If you want dim sum past 2pm, this is the place to go!  Even though it's available, the quality is not he best. The service is also not the best. This place does not have carts. You order from a menu and they bring the dim sum to you. Either the service is slow or the chefs are slow but only one dish comes out at a time. And after you finish one dish, the next comes out five mins later. I like my dim sum experience to be a spread... With all of it in front of me at once so I can pick and choose what I want to eat. This place serves it in courses. Nothing comes out together.   Also there were some mix ups with our ordering. A dish never came out and we had to ask them to check on stuff because food was slow to come. I thought the food tasted fine but my no means one of the best.  Also, this place has the basic types of dim sum but the menu is small compared to other restaurants. The variety was fine for me but you won't find any specialty dishes here.

iYaFEQoBUez0RIfQpZnGZg.text: Very disappointed, I drove for 45 minutes to try, the food was average, but they actually collected more money on the bill, need to be careful, please be careful dont pay more

5KryoZDPZEsCiEcMMdAuUw.text: Mediocre food. Wasn't bad. Wasn't good. Service is also mediocre. I prefer dim sum at ping pang pong compared to here, though this is easier to get in and out.

CngSA5Vx7YOIpB-m4WqqiQ.text: It's nice to get good Dim Sum. The reviews were pretty good so we were there right as they opened. The service was quick and continuous as the carts kept coming by. We had about 8 dishes from shumai to sticky rice and the egg custard tart was right out of the oven!  The tea was Jasmine and it was really tasted good. There were many big screen tv's located all around the dining room, plenty to watch.  Service was very good and the restaurant was very clean.  Parking is everywhere as they are located in a large shopping center.

Yu8il8vEraXGjkfx25OfWg.text: Best Dim Sum place in town! Food is fresh and my husband even said the steam pork rib is better than those we got in Irvine. Daughter loves the bbq pork bun and Xiao long bao. The bolo bun with gooey egg custard is a must! Egg tart is crispy and good. A big plus for me is Sam the owner is friendly and tries to connect and understand customers need. We will be back soon!

0excOTUBc-2wFWNxD6jxVA.text: Delicious dim sum, very authentic and clean. The shrimp dumpling and baled pork buns were my absolute favorite. My boyfriend loved the soup dumplings and Shumai. The chow mein with chicken was also delish! Will definitely be back again soon.

8a5s1aJ21F74oNda13ZWew.text: One of the best dim sum places and a MUST visit when in Vegas!  Very good quality and delicious dim sum.  Also, the service can't be beat here!!!  All the go-to steamed dishes and the veggies are yummy

oYNXWApYQ5oJ2cDx2IprWQ.text: First time here and it did not disappoint. The staff were so sweet to all of us, especially my 6-year-old son. The food was delicious and totally hit the spot. Loved how you can order from the menu as well as get items from the cart. Thanks, Yum Cha! We'll be back soon!

yvue6TCv1-1xQs2cVjAp_w.text: Easy parking. We were seated right away. Service was good and attentive. They charged each person $1 for tea. Food was not hot. Portions for the lunch special werd small. Dim sum was OK. My favorite was the chrysanthemum tea. Everything else was forgetful. I won't be back.

EEJgXyBHPrrlTIQCVUX3Xg.text: Get your yum cha on at Yum Cha! Came with a group for a daylight savings dim sum brunch. There are carts, hot pot items, a cafeteria-style counter, and a full menu for special orders and entrees. They seem to have a few more traditional items than the few other dim sum spots in town, but unfortunately even with the selection YC isn't about to compete with CA's shops so scale back your expectations.  Some favorite items were the radish cake (so crispy!), the chive pancakes (stuffed with filling!), the taro dumpling (crispy without being greasy), and the lava custard bun (a new item for me). We also got some of my go-to orders of hargow, shrimp and chive dumplings, shrimp rice noodle, and BBQ pork bun. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with some other items: salt and pepper calamari didn't have much salt or pepper seasoning and the Xiao Long Bao soup dumplings weren't soupy, for example.    Food quality was pretty decent for most items and the service was really a lot better than I've experienced elsewhere- cart ladies were helpful about showing and describing their items, constantly giving drink refills, clearing plates, and asking for additional orders. Pricing was pretty fair too, at about $20/person for our feast.

AufXs-DC3YFXxRdysJhH7w.text: Dim sum was a let down after seeing stellar reviews.  Prefer Ping Pang Pong, but wanted to try this new place.  Dim Sum was all average or below compared to California.  Pricing was so-so as well.  OK to try once but probably will not come back.

Hb-6IgxwyoGX9vpNKxgrHQ.text: GREAT PLACE FOR CHEAP AND DELICIOUS DIM SUM!!!  *review is only about the dim sum*  We came at 12; no wait, lots of seating and carts walking around.  Mon-Fri dim sum is only $2.88 and on weekends it's $3.28  Carts are only till 2:30pm  We ordered: Pork shu-mai, Chicken shu-mai, Lotus Leaf, Steam Pork Bun, Baked BBQ Bun, Shrimp dumpling = total $21.80  I love how fast the service is and how attentive they are! Very nice!   Food was pretty great for the price! Not too salty. Ok portion. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT! Worth it!!

SzfXf_5uQD-7P8FjPSnGcg.text: This place is a keeper. Great service. Good food. Reasonable price. It is not too far from the strip, you can easily drive or Uber over. Nice variety of dim sum and flavorful.

RTiltll4cr0WIn3QcSxeMg.text: The food is ok..basic Chinese restaurant. The reason for this yelp, food is over priced you pay for extra rice, low mein noodles $14.99  soft drinks comes in cans..no free refills. They charge for tea!! List goes on and on..go to dim sum in summerlin!!!

zk8a08egURzKpbtbHJ7JPA.text: I haven't had dim sum in a while, so I was hoping for good things out of this newer spot. I wasn't disappointed.  Yum Cha is a dim sum restaurant located in the Walgreens plaza at the southwest corner of Tropicana and Decatur. Its name is literally the term for eating dim sum, but they do have a menu of other items which my group (Stefany V., Bethany E., and other friends) ignored while we had our Sunday "brunch" (boozeless as it was).  There is also a picture menu of the various dim sum items, which is helpful not just to non-Chinese speakers, but also for just seeing the entire breadth of the selection that this place serves. Regular items are $2.88 on weekdays and $3.28 on weekend/holidays, and they appear to be available from carts that circle the spacious room. Other typical dim sum items are priced in the $3.98-$5.98 range, and these were actually cooked in the kitchen to-order.  Needless to say, I tried quite an array of items. My favorite were as follows:  Taro Dumpling ($3.98) - one of my favorites to order anywhere, a pork-filled taro treat with a crispy exterior that wasn't as greasy as expected.  Shrimp Rice Noodle ($3.98) - shrimp and rice wrapper both were cooked right, and it just hit the spot.  Chicken Feet ($3.28) - a fall-apart treat marinated in a nice sauce, not too try and with a gelatinous texture. As always, this is simply fun to eat, even with the multitude of bones.  Shrimp & Pork Shumai ($3.28) - ground meat in a wrapper, and one of the most flavorful renditions that I've had in a while.  Radish Cake ($3.98) - a surprisingly crispy version, perhaps because it was cooked fresh instead of being carted around in a container and losing the subtle crunch due to steam. Didn't even need soy sauce on this.  Bake Lava Custard Bun ($3.98) - they didn't have egg tarts available for some reason, but this was a great alternative. Another nice exterior, moist yet cooked sweet dough, and a sweet interior that's smooth but not silky - by that, I mean that there's a bit of texture, but nothing off-putting. It wasn't served hot though, so the interior didn't really flow.  -----  I was pretty happy with the other items too, including Har Gow ("Shrimp Dumpling"), Steam BBQ Pork Bun, Beef (meat)Ball, Steam Pork Ribs, Beef Tripe, Veggie Egg Noodle, and Salt & Pepper Calamari. I should note that the Xiao Long Bao was enjoyable, but it clearly does not meet the expectation of a soupy dumpling; I could tell despite not having much if any experience with this much sought-after speciality.  I will definitely return to Yum Cha some time to yum cha. The offerings here are reasonably priced, generally delicious and among the best that I've tried in this town's not-particularly-known-for-dim-sum scene. I wasn't completely blown away by most of the items, but I wasn't outright disappointed by anything as I have been at other places. I definitely missed out on trying some items, and I will have to rectify that issue in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Lava Custard Bun ($3.98). Really good dessert item.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt &amp; Pepper Calamari ($5.98). Pepper seasoning, pretty crunchy, not greasy.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Egg Noodle ($5.98). Not what I&#39;d usually order, but pretty good.

I9MvVvkEXjcbmYBYRx1jqw.text: What a great find that is chinatown-adjacent. The interior is not crowded and not overly fancy. It's very clean. Slightly strange quirk: the tv is playing videos of cooking demos of Indian street food.   The menu is divided into a dim sum menu and an entree menu. We only ordered the dim sum so I can't make any comments about the entrees. Each order came out relatively quickly. Pay attention to the pictures on the menu as the number of pieces shown is what you get per order.   The xiaolongbao were good. Slightly doughy but not too soupy. Great flavor. The steamed buns had a generous amount of filling compared to the dough. Great flavor in the pork buns. Our waitress also said there will be BBQ chicken buns after Lunar New Year.   The real standout was the curry and potato puff. It is similar to a samosa but different. Delicious though.   For dessert I always get an egg tart. It was quite good but not as good as you'd find in Hong Kong. The waitress says the custard buns are the specialty so I'll have to make a point to try those next time.   In all this was a great find for dim sum. We spent about $50 for two and had more than our fill. The only downside to the pricing is that there are only two price tiers (where most places have Four or five). This makes some items a steal and some kind of expensive.   The service was great. The waitress was really happy to talk about the menu and keep us engaged in the choices. Everyone was super friendly and I definitely didn't get the feeling that I was being a dumb white boy. Go check this place out and eat all the dumplings.

bgbGwNTQsGccF3NvuDlOig.text: Dim Sum was good.  Service was great.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Will definitely return.

7UgE8D3LcTl8wVk2MtZKfw.text: First of all, there's a hair in our dim sum and the manager came to our table and says "this is not the first time, sorry" like if it wasn't the first time why aren't you doing anything? You should tell your staff to wear hairnets when they're handling the food. Second of all they overcharge us. And lastly they are not they touch all kinds of stuff and their faces and touch the food. We sat down by the front kitchen so we saw everything.   The prices are reasonable and cheap but there's more restaurant that is more clean and cheap.

8KJEe8ZdR0kh-wOOxBdHxA.text: Las Vegas isn't really the place for good dim sum but this place is not a bad choice ! I like this place much more than the ones in Chinatown , but maybe not as much as the ones in the casinos.  We came here for lunch which is the proper time to eat dim sum anyways. What caught my attention is that this place is very clean plus the prices are not that bad (compared to other places like Chang's right down the street). They serve dim sum all day which is cool. You can order dim sum off the menu & you can walk up to the open food bar. It seemed like there were not that many carts were going around but we had no problem having our waiter take our orders. I just wish there were more carts going around for the dim sum experience.  They have typical dishes like congee , shumai , har gow , chicken feet , etc. All the food is served piping hot. It surprised me that they have roti w/ curry here. The roti was perfectly cooked but the curry was alright. It was a bit oily. For dessert , I usually get egg tarts or red bean sesame balls at dim sum but the custard bun was definitely my favorite here. I enjoyed breaking open the custard bun and dipping it in the custard filling. Tea is extra here which I found a bit odd since it's usually free at other places.  This place is pretty big so it's great for large groups and families. It's on Tropicana/Decatur located opposite of International Market. It's a decent place to get your dim sum eats but don't go in with super high expectations.

cQP4Ss63ed0uwid_EB3wXw.text: This is an update on my review from December. We went back to Las Vegas in May and visited Yum Cha again as promised in my last review. Again, we were not disappointed! We were able to try things we didn't get to try last time. It's absolutely the best restaurant and friendly staff I have been to in a very long time. And I go to many restaurants. If you want great authentic dim sum then you are in for a real treat. The prices are great, food is absolutely wonderful and staff is very friendly. I recommend this place to everyone. Thanks again. We will definitely be back on our next trip.

A6G3KtUaZqjYLOweROwuDQ.text: I have never seen such a bad service attitude. Inside the buns is still frozen. We ask to see the manager. But manager does not appear. Just told the waiter to ask what we want. Attitude is very bad. And his expression also felt that we deliberately find trouble. There is no apology. No change of food. I will never to come again. Horrible service

UDvDHvHZkEcI_7x15mQAMA.text: This place has potential. Customer service is very good compared to other Chinese places. Dimsum dishes were ok. My usual dish is Ha Cao but I had to throw out the shell because it's a little hard.  We ordered 2 tripe dishes, the second dish was too chewy.  The place seems clean and all the server wore mouth masks to avoid spitting on the foods whole serving?!? There was a gentleman opened the door and bow to us when we exited. WuYLw7stU9kbath7kPkfGw.text: This review is not based on the quality of the food, but the customer service. After finishing a really good meal, we ask for to-go boxes. I decide to take one more bite of the beef tripe before packing the food up and notice a long strand of hair in it. I quietly mention it to the guy (I don't know if he was the owner but he was older and rude af). He acts like he doesn't see it & asks me to hold it up to the light. He then proceeds to make jokes about how it's probably my hair before taking it back to the kitchen. Mind you, my hair is BLACK AND GREEN OMBRE and the hair in the food was a lightish brown, almost blonde. He returns with some oversized muffin looking things and says here I'll give you these free, even though it might be your hair. At this point I'm so annoyed, I push the muffins back at him & tell him I'm leaving, just give me the check. He insists on us taking the free pastries, when I literally just have to blurt out I don't want the shit and just give me my check. The dim sum & wait staff was solid, this guy was just a total dick with no customer service skills. I will NEVER be back. Ps: most of the food was good, their salt & pepper squid is salty to an EXTREME and the jellyfish salad had a whole cup of sesame seeds as a topping.

aPzESAJRE3pciWNLNoI2Jw.text: The dim sum is amazing - best in Las Vegas. The service is unique as there are push carts but for some items you can just go up to the counter and order. This makes a lot of sense as these items take longer to heat/crisp and you're left looking for them at other push cart places. Everything we tried tasted fresh and delicious. Parking and service were great, not always the case with Chinese establishments. The owner and several servers continually checked on us, made recommendations, and kept the tea pot full. Make sure to try the custard bun!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You must try.

dbhCR9soGA2wGbRHtZS8Kg.text: Best Dim Sum in Las Vegas! Good customer service :)  The lady was very nice! The shu mai and shrimp is very good. The egg drop soup with sweet corn and chicken is the best I've ever had. I'd return back here for sure!  Lunch is 10:30 to 2:00 so if you come later you have to look at the food through the glass, but don't worry they will steam it for you :)

2_r0c4AzicTf1hZ8HgqKRw.text: I am still not sure what people expect for dim sum. I have been to several dim sum restaurants in San Francisco and the Bay Area (Yank Sing is awesome, even if overpriced), and Yum Cha meets and in some cases exceeds those places. Flavor, choices, prices... All on point. Will be back and anyone in the Las Vegas area, support this local gem!!

Krc86bPCDmrnbIe0_l4pjQ.text: My Family and I live in Vegas for little over two years, from San Diego. Tried so many dim sum places and we have never pleased with the TASTE, FRESHNESS, AUTHENTICITY, CLEANLINESS, and ATTITUDE. Finally we have found a PERFECT THE BEST DIM SUM PLACE IN VEGAS - YUM CHA. My wife and I were so happy, even my 4 years old daughter love the food. At the end of the meal, Sam the owner stopped by at our table. We asked him what should we have for dessert, he recommended us to have their signature 'Lava Custard Bun' OMG  we were blown away, they were so awesome... Sweet, little salty on the Custard and perfect crust on top of the bun. Guys, you guys got to believe me... I'm really picky on the food, always want to make things right and perfect. I grew up in the Restaurant-Hospitality industry. I would like to take this opportunity to share my idea with Sam, I think would be better if they add another hot sauce on the table - their own SIGNATURE HOT SAUCE.  With their magic ingredients combination, will make them different than any other places just using chili oil and sambal oelek.  We will be back Sam, You and your Team are doing an excellent job! Thank you.

FLcn2r7gIirOAwuVmxmBTA.text: Every dish we order was good:  sticky chicken rice, cha Siu boa, lava bun, radish cake, hai gao, beef tripe, taro roll, chicken feet, beef rice noodle.  Great service.  Better than some top Dim Sum restaurants in LA

Dfm180xzjlTI4CiT3xWSFA.text: The Best Dim Sum in Vegas!  We passed on Lucky Dragon, and Jasime for a good Chinese food experience.  From the siu mai(both the chicken with mushrooms, and the traditional pork) to the crispy fried egg plant(a bit sweet, but the crunchy texture made it a bite of heaven) it was all excellent.  Friendly service, ask about the story for why all the bird cages for the decor, it is a cultural experience....awesome, and worth the wait!

vZWVBuBD8h6nUlifiRhvdg.text: Great new dim sum place. We love that they serve dim sum at night. We liked chow main, pork and chive dumplings, steamed shrimp dumplings, curry Malaysian pancakes, and egg custard. Its clean and service is good.

h-hwRxxzfsCZRGLtILtRjg.text: Went to Yum Cha for brunch and I was very pleased with everything! We were seated very fast and as they were taking the drink order the dim sum carts were already asking us about what kind of dim sum we wanted. The food was amazing! We ordered shumai, hargow,  pork buns (steamed and baked), shrimp and beef rice noodle, beef ball. All the food was on point! The service was great as well, I tend to drink my water really fast and I could honestly say that I did not have a empty glass the entire time. Everyone was really nice there so it felt like I've been going there for months even though it was only my first time. They serve dim sum all damn day too which is amazing!!!! If you like dim sum you gotta check this place out!!

AysPpX9Owh_Ob92BvxIPZw.text: When Yelp works, the reviews the restaurant has received matches the food quality when you get there and you're not caught off guard or surprised.  This is not one of those instances. Overall, I would say our experience at Yum Cha was disappointing. Not sure why it got so many stars. The biggest disappointment here was the beef (and shrimp version as well) wrapped in rice noodle dim sum, that was unfortunate as those are my kids favorite dim sum dish. I don't understand how they can mess this one up as it's probably the most common dim sum dish.  The sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf was also disappointing, no filling inside. I mean literally nothing inside!  The other dishes we had, such as the steamed tripe, fried taro, steamed roast pork buns, beef chow fun (ordered from kitchen), was good.  I'm comparing this to dim sum restaurants I've been to in the NY/NJ areas and having eaten dim sum for over 30 years. :)

SBu1v8KvEVPVeb_w9WPJkA.text: I was craving some legit dim sum at night and found Yum Cha. They are not far from the strip, all the staff speak Cantonese or Mandarin, and they have dim sum ALL DAY LONG! They have good selection and the dim sum is delicious! Also, listen to your waitress's suggestions...they know what they are talking about! The pineapple lava bun is the best I've had! Highly recommend!

KD8n6QE80m5xVNfOp339jg.text: I wanted to try a new dim sum place. Yum cha just was not very good. I had 8 dishes all were a little off with the taste factor. Also it does not taste very fresh and the food came out cold. Service was nice and friendly but still slow for how empty it was. I wouldn't come back. Safe to say ping pang pong is way better.

7RDZngWfdhLi56lh1lYXig.text: Very clean dim sum restaurant with good food and good service.   It wasn't that busy when we arrived but the servers seemed to be attentive and the food arrived quick.   Ask for the menu to see all of their food options because not everything they have is sitting out on display.   This is located close to home so we will be back!!

hIIK5BSjz1SJrlW4x0hDhA.text: Friendly and helpful staff! We came after 2, so there were no carts, but full menu available.  Liked it better since it wasn't packed- more attentive and able to walk up and look at the dim sum and order them.    Dim sum tasted great!

RjOzFQZxrOtdOQCuZ6b_7Q.text: Been to a lot of dim sum parlors across the country (L.A., S.F., N.Y., Boston, etc) and although this was our first time at Yum Cha in Vegas, I would rank it in my top 5 in the country, and from a quality to price ratio perspective, best in Las Vegas for sure. My wife and I came here 5 minutes after they opened on a Saturday morning and all the items we ordered (14 dishes) were excellent quality, texture and flavors, and even their presentation.   This is not a typical dim sum parlor where everything comes around in carts. Several items - probably their most popular ones - come around on the carts. But then you can also walk up to the "sample bar" where they prepare lots of pan fried dim sum dishes and order several other varieties of dim sum. You can also order from a server if you can flag one down. It's a creative approach and worked well for me.   The service was attentive as they did a great job of making sure we got everything we wanted, and always filled our tea pot and water glasses. We would highly recommend Yum Cha and we will definitely be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked BBQ pork buns are awesome!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s not often you find a dim sum restaurant (anywhere in the country) that has nice decor and a clean environment, but they do at Yum Cha.

aC0nsODVc1MtGBsoTHvuRQ.text: We were passing through Vegas on our way to Kingman, AZ and came across Yum Cha and were blown away from the service and the food. I've eaten at dim sum places in the Bay Area a lot and this place is just as good if not better. You won't be disappointed. I can't wait to come back here next time I am in town!

hxpqKOQA72xPkUAkNRuZjg.text: Visited this place on a recent Vegas trip and was pleasantly surprised. Prices for dimsum are $2.83 during weekdays for shumai, hargao, and other favorities. I highly recommend the fried stuffed pork balls for their different textures (soft and gooey on the inside and crisp and flaky on the outside).

HBPeRdx_8u3z5xzm0_kQ7g.text: it just seems cleaner and better made than other dim sum places in vegas. Definitely the go to as of today.

1yaXiWPv_otR6YGCxDJDiw.text: Really awesome staff who will give you the lo-down on all the good eats. The dim sum is great! Major highlights on the fried pork balls, chive fried dumplings, and shrimp dumplings. Probably the best shrimp dumpling and chive fried dumpling in any chinatown I've ever been to. Worth a look whether you're new to dim sum or have been eating it sonce you were a baby.

DMcwoVOVdjtUfSbUtcNPZg.text: If you are looking for a dining experience outside of the strip , consider a visit to Yum Cha. Sans flashy lights and boastful signage, this casual dim sum experience provides a friendly, fuss-free, and filling meal. Main highlights include late night dim sum, and friendly waitstaff. The whole-fried flounder and coconut tart pastries distinguished Yum Cha from the standard shu mai and potsticker offerings of many other competitors. Yum Cha is a great stop for any visitors seeking relief from the typical offerings on the strip.

S1ifefXcBXzKb-vj_g79lQ.text: What a disaster this place was! The wait time was about 15 mins at 12:30. When we were seated there was no available wait staff to take our order. We were lucky that a solitary cart with a few items came around after about 10 mins. The servers were walking by but no-one stopped and said anything. We finally had to ask someone for assistance or we would not have been served. The dim sum was okay, nothing special.. We had the usual sui mai, shrimp dumplings, pork ribs, pork buns..We will not be in a hurry to fo back.

Lmui4yGuTJuZplj_3y6B6g.text: Been there twice, love it. Very fresh and great variety. Friendly and efficient service too. Highly recommend!

fWvyKFEl5VgqS-pJKd6_sw.text: First time here today. One word...AWESOME! Food is delicious, price is reasonable, friendly staff, great service and mostly importantly, CLEAN! We'll be back for sure.

EDLL-p54rdjMoeELKqic-g.text: Seriously. This place is a joke. Maybe I caught it on a bad day but yea. I'm not coming back.

Their authentic Chinese food and Dim Sum that we tried were truly tasty!!! If you are unsure of what to order, ask! The people are super friendly! If you truly enjoy Chinese food you will enjoy Yum Cha. We will be back

yD-rSdWRz45JM31CKkMN_w.text: Authentic dim sum experience. Super tasty pork and shrimp shumai and shrimp dumplings. Extremely reasonable prices. Highly recommend.

PoPfgsLK_RI_Ffgmnmomdw.text: I had read about Yum Cha from an article on Las Vegas Eater on facebook so decided to look up Yelp reviews. I'm always on the look out for new dimsum restaurants to try that are comparable to Hong Kong style dim sum. Our usual spot is KJ Dim Sum but service can be hit or miss and we didn't feel like going to a casino. From the minute we walked in to the minute we left Yum Cha service was very inviting and friendly. Every worker smiled, they all spoke very well english, very friendly and just made our experience comfortable. We came in around 2:30pm for a late lunch and learned that carts stop coming around the tables after 2pm due to its generally their slow time. They move all the dim sum to behind the glass counter where you pick what you want or you can simply tell the server what dishes you want and they'll bring it to your table. Our tea and water was refilled constantly. My husband and I especially enjoyed the shrimp stuffed eggplant here! Shumai, har gau, char siu bao and lotus sticky rice were all tasty. We'll definitely be back. Would like to try some of their non-dim sum dishes.

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp stuffed eggplant- Soooo good!!!

w8Fnt2kXbG--fh-a5nb16g.text: This is my new favorite dim sum spot! Very clean and fresh food. Everything well made. Standard dim sum items and some special items. I really like that veggies and fried items are ordered from a menu and made fresh. The roti chickpea curry was amazing and I enjoyed the shrimp wontons. I can't go without coconut buns and their bread/pastries are really good.

27JdcBVJxW5BZ3vNjOnWcw.text: First stop for food once me and my girlfriend came in to town on a trip. Yum Cha has great Dim Sum but even better service. I would definitely come here again when I'm in town next time.

ex5aVSc9xx0-ULYw-7RP2w.text: wow! I absolutely fell in love with this place! the service is beyond exceptional and the food is so delicious! they have such a great variety and it was all sooooo good! on top of that I love how really clean and open it is! this will definitely be our new go to everytime were here!

mNV8nRpkH_lqNw36WCbcTQ.text: Was really excited to try a new dim sum place in Vegas.  Big space.. We went around 2pm and there were a few tables dining.  Whom I believe is the owner came over and made some suggestions. We tried our normal dim sum cravings and also what she had recommended.  I can't say that it's good but it also wasn't bad? Lol   I wouldn't mind coming here if someone had invited me but I probably wouldn't go back on my own.  Service was excellent though!

lblY9PiRdS0CzWuSic-cEQ.text: First time here and everything was good. I usually never eat eegplant but their's was really good. It kind of tasted like a donut. The prices are reasonable. It's a pretty big place but sadly not too many customers, at least around dinner time. Service was rather decent and the staff was nice.

oZjQLrvZVeRGCHG43GgYLw.text: Great new restaurant. I wanted to have some Chinese food and dim sum so I tried it out. They have a large selection to choose from. Everything was tasty with a nice presentation. So many items to try for next time. It's quite a spacious restaurant with a few large screen TVs, booths and accommodations for large parties. The owners take pride in their food and stop by to check on you. A must go.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_nH6sg2xGwUY0ni90IWcTg.text: I love Dim Sum, and really like finding it when I travel. Yum Cha is a nice place with great service and better than average Dim Sum For Las Vegas.  This is the 2nd place I've tried in Vegas and it's really worth hitting up.

PsbeFshuW4PMCrKtRYMVtA.text: Just opened 3 months ago.  Dim sum served all day!  Full and diverse menu. Good service.

ygPYFjruDYKkbqxmDCBPeg.text: Great service and good dim sum! A lot of the waiters don't speak English very well, but they're very nice and try to get you what you need. It helps if you find a picture of what you want on yelp and show it to them. Will come back. Boss man pretty cool too!

Jnx-0bsSExafFq1NPdFz1w.text: Our experience with the service at this joint was horrendous today. First the greeter attempted to seat us near the front door where the cold air was blowing in.  There were plenty of empty tables or booths further in.  Reluctantly the greeter seated us just a slight bit further from the front.  The place then started to pack and the chaos began.  Instead of waiting for the dim sum carts to come around, the other customers either redirected the carts to their table or went up to the carts to pick their food.  Some crowded at the counter and grabbing food from there.  There was no civility or order.  It was like a horde of starving people in a soup kitchen.  We managed to get some dishes off a near empty cart that came by.  I thought eating dim sum or yum cha is supposed to be a relaxing experience when friends can chat over the meal.  I tried to order food off the menu from a server,  he just walked away and never came back.    After 15 minutes with no carts coming to our area, I finally got the attention of another server.  I asked him why the carts are not coming over.  He didn't answer.  I told him to bring us the bill and we are leaving.  His response was "Good, leave". I take back my previous rating and changed it to one star because this type of service.  During our previous visit, Elaine who I believe to be the manager had asked us to each recommend 3 friends to patronize this joint.  If Elaine or staff member of this joint read this review update (which I doubt), we will tell our friends not to patronize this joint.  Today was within the winter holiday, it appears most of today's customers were from out-of-town.  This joint's owner or manager should realize it is the locals that support their business year round.  We are taking our business back to Chang's down the street.

pj7w7aCZSMgvYW6eVZ-1YQ.text: Service was so frustratingly bad here!  First of all, they were out of half the things we were trying to order. Then, they messed up our orders several times. They kept trying to give us other people's dishes and not bringing us ours. We also had to keep asking about our dishes because nothing was coming out.   When we asked about dishes that didn't come after over an hour, we were told that they ran out already.  No one communicated this to us. Then, we saw people coming out of the kitchen with the dishes that they allegedly ran out of! Unbelievable.  In all fairness, the food was quite good. However, the absolutely atrocious service made this experience intolerable.

JkcgEBF1BanUeyH6ZOX_oA.text: Decent dim sum place.  Half full Tuesday lunchtime.  Has all the popular varieties you expect.

ypLGqxSnxOE8HapAUj_28w.text: Delicious food and great service at 10pm. Beats any fast food option by a long shot! Everything we ordered tasted homemade with fresh and flavorful ingredients. We loved the hot and sour soup! They even made us fresh baby bok choy (not on the menu). We will be back!

RSPHyKgzHXI46MABgjB9PQ.text: This is the WORST Dim Sum I have EVER had!!! We waited over 20 minutes before our order was even taken. There were people who arrived after us who were tended to. When the waitress came back she stated ooooh, sorry. The Crab Rangoon was stale with curdled chucks of cream cheese inside. The hot and sour soup was average at BEST! Food tastes reheated in a microwave! Stay away! YUM NO!!!!!

0m81gYPW0zRZRgXZa8jAkg.text: Fresh food,Good taste and friendly staff.Owner is very nice guy. Not far away from Strip,you can enjoy one of the best Dim Sum in town.

Ms0_TH0P4LDTm07iAB_djg.text: Steamed Vegetables, traditional Chinese tea (No Bag, just rich tea leaves) and Dim Sum from 10:30am until closing at very reasonable prices!  E and all the rest of the staff get A+ for smiles and hospitality.just google Yum Cha, the building looks new and smells delicious and clean!

C7bhVuAfY8lkmOZPbseHHg.text: Been craving for authentic chinese food since i moved to the US. I could say that Yum Cha is a good find! Besides the great dimsum and chinese food they serve, they have the best employees. We met Elaine and she was nice enough to give us free mango pudding for my husband's birthday. It's our second time here and we'll definitely be back for a third time!

q7Qse1qbh04U7cRjcQnHyw.text: Discovered Yum Cha by accident when I drove by on the way to somewhere else. We had the dim sum, which was kept on the buffet instead of carts because it was after 2 PM. It was delicious! The steamed pork buns are savory with just the right amount of sweetness, and the various dim sum dishes are authentic and fresh. Their crispy pancake appetizer is delectable and reminds me a bit of Indian cuisine. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty. Yum Cha is kind of a hidden gem.

4o5iBUrpG3zFF9L-FYkQwg.text: Best dim sum I've had in Vegas, as we are from the SF Bay area. Glad I found it on YELP and we will come back. Highly recommend Yum Cha

5eFRwMIx625PutIUzia56A.text: Great dim sum place! Fast service, clean and new restaurant. Food was really good, loved the bao! The noodles were a big hit too. Close drive from the strip, and would recommend!!!

XLaglrQY_H0NoNuMJcD6Mw.text: Service very good.They take care customers.Food it's super delicious like I go back to Asia.Restaurant's clean.Everything Awesome

h7_jhNlIMBYNkLe2cWo2RA.text: The wife and I have always gone to the more known dimsum restaurant on Sahara but to our dismay, it was closed.  Searched on Yelp for an alternative and found Yum Cha.  It was not hard to find since we use to eat at the same establishment in the past when it used to be a buffet.  Yum Cha did not disappoint at all.  We came in on a slow time so service was very fast.  Menu is your typical dimsum menu; crab/shrimp balls, shumai, chickent feet, pork bun, short ribs, stir fried egg noodles, etc.  Servers were pretty good in recommending items in their menu.  They weren't even recommending anything on the high priced list.  Ended with a baked custard bun which was  the perfect finish to our meal.

pYyiqQgHBBd7T8khDPL6GQ.text: Good food, great service when the manager/owner is helping. Much better than other dimsum places we've been to.

0HfdE8wcfsAV4168VxBxqw.text: If you're looking for simply lunch with friends lots of good food and awesome service,check out this new Dim Sum!!!  Well differently will go back  for more:)

0qdE9rcBEwdOzD8tsQO3-w.text: So freaking good. They serve dim sum all day which is awesome. I had great service with a group and alone. They food is so fresh and flavorful. Everything is delicious and great prices.  I'm trying not to go every day.

BLyVkcyxfJ7_xAW3fhY1aA.text: Pretty clean and the people that work there are all really helpful and kind! Sometimes when you go to Asian places they seem like they don't want you there and they just want you in and out. But not here! Really nice people

qC9Iu3wWjZSbi0sksLKTaQ.text: The environment is clean. Service is good. Foods better than some dim sum restaurant . Haha..Good choice for short Lunch time~~!

7amj9uaYendRsnGYjqk9Hw.text: Scary trying something new but this place made you felt welcome. Nice service! Clean and pretty good dim sum. Ordered the Ginger Chicken fried rice and also mango pudding with coconut milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango pudding with coconut milk for dessert
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet!!

qdpCbJcIl0Oob_rOm9cmZQ.text: First of all, the service here was GREAT. My mom was craving dim sum so I looked on Yelp for some good places and this one had the best reviews and I definitely wasn't disappointed. The owner, Sam, was very welcoming. The food was very delicious, the dim sum didn't come out hot but it was still very good. I only gave it 4 stars because it kind of took a while for them to bring out the food with only a few tables being served.. also some of the dim sum dishes weren't hot. And they had a sign that said "free dim sum when you check in Yelp or google" so I asked if one of my dim sum was free but they just said they usually give a free steamed pork bun.. Maybe they should change that sign.   Overall, if you're craving dim sum.. This is a good place to go.

eiBccDG0L_Z99X3eWyMVtQ.text: If you want to have Dim Sum even after Dim Sum regular lunch hours, you should try Yum Cha Dim Sum. I tried their Beef Ball, Chicken feet. Fish stuffed tofu are so good.  Place is clean and the service is go!

pZzDFS8BEouEY8vPyM5xJA.text: I really wanted to like this place, but I couldn't. The Dim Sum definitely leaves something to be desired. I'm native to the Bay Area, so it's difficult to compare, but this was just an average place and there are plenty of better places to eat in LV.  The food doesn't come out hot (at least the time we went there). They told us, the  dim sum is cold because that's how white people like it. Example, friend shrimp wasn't hot when it came out.  The pieces are smaller than I am used to. That didn't matter because the dim sum didn't really taste that good. We ordered shrimp, pork, chicken feet, pig stomach, sticky rice (my wife said it was the worst she ever tasted). The pig stomach had good flavor and the best dish was the beef stew.  Also, the pricing isn't quite clear. We went to this place as a result of a newspaper ad and the prices looked pretty darn cheap $2.99. Note, not everything is that price and the tiers are a little different than I am used to. Some dishes that should be the A category aren't.  All in all, we were fed. I don't think anyone got sick in our party, but this place leaves something to be desired.

sQjTzfVHcyNeYEJRkOtVcA.text: Great dim sum place. Services are little slow but foods are very good!  Weekday price is very reasonable and they are all freshly made.  Their pan fried dumplings are so worth to try.

1RL5I1CQ_RFnJMPh6ZmfAg.text: This place is amazing!!  I have been looking for a great Dim Sum place in Las Vegas and I found it!!  My fiance got orange chicken in case he didn't like Dim Sum and the quality of the ingredients was delicious!!  I can not wait to come back and try everything on the menu.  The food and the quality of the food was well above average and the price was fantastic.  Everyone needs to try this place, even if you are not into Dim Sum

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CLzerOO6TWUBO8fl1ZVzKA.text: GD find ! REALLY like their authentic buns for dim sum. Fried SHRIMP wonton excellent! Everything really delicious and made fresh to order (slight wait but worth it). Mgr Sam even made special lap xuong  order for us which I really appreciate! Will definitely be back to try the lunch dim sum special. Dinner specials and will have liquor soon.  Love their decor and the cultural history behind it!

lKgVrNeOkqOo2GFms2leZw.text: Was in Vegas for vacation and found this spot on yelp. Definitely hit the spot! Great food and even better service. Our waiter Yao was very friendly and was very diligent in checking on us and making sure  our drinks were always filled!

UYxtMmUtI2oYl8ih_q4Tww.text: I think this is my new to go place for dim sum... Everything inside is updated. Modern decor, great service, good food.. I like the idea of them coming to your table and you just pin point what you want. Hahaha if there's a dish I wasn't familiar with; they fully inform me and best described the dish. The only thing I wasn't fan of was there's other dishes at the counter but you have to get up let them know and they bring it to your table. It would of been better if they had a small menu for that at the table for convenience... Otherwise, I will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Custard
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot what this was called but it taste so good with that curry sauce! :)

Fh8DssiekP5DYMlfa7CPcg.text: Dim sum was ok, not great.  Not steaming hot, even the bottom trays.  Also ordered a pan-fried noodle, but wasn't exactly what a pan-fried noodle typically looks like.  No gravy, noodles not crispy, and has onions (usually not in this dish).  Place is clean.

7qKNN4QKekdqlJcK8dwHog.text: Tried this place for the first time. The staff was extremely friendly, great service! The food was awesome, it totally hit the spot for some late night dim sum. The Shrimp Shumai, Shrimp Dumplings, and Lotus Leaf Pork Sticky Rice would be my favorites. We came in late, close to closing, and we were still treated very nicely. Salt and Pepper Shrimp was also delicious! :)

NOoAcqDFwUz79NLSFj8pyw.text: I was hesitant to eat here because I remember the last 2 Asian restaurants that were here before this, and it was scary to eat there. But I'm glad I tried it, and I'll definitely be coming back!  Dim sum is something that's not done very well in Vegas. So I was really surprised by how good this place is. The basics like Siu Mai, sesame balls, chicken feet were all good. Shrimp dumplings were amazing, they were so good we had to have more. I really wanted different varieties of the dumplings. But this isn't Din Tai Fung, but it's still pretty good.   I'll definitely be back, there's still a lot  I haven't tried and seen a lot so I can plan my next attack lol.

l2LIYYOYccCn6tl01G0MiQ.text: Damn, I had some high expectations based upon 534 reviews. I was sadly disappointed, came here on a Saturday night around 8:15 pm, and they were out of shrimp dim sum. What the heck kind of dim sum doesn't have shrimp?! Ordered pork Belly, it was pork katsu that came out. Tripe was ok, tasted like MSG. Beef noodle, did not have flavor. Calamari was salty, veggie noodles, bland. Save your money and go to Orchids Garden.

snBl-wwM6NnEWRTJCzg59g.text: This is the best dim sum place I've been to. It's not oily, and the service is extremely good. It doesn't seem overwhelming or unorganized like Orchard Garden or Hong Kong Garden. The food isn't oily, and has good flavors.

Yem8zUHsJYxHCakThtJ-_Q.text: Edible but definitely not authentic.  Tastes like frozen dim sum.  Very disappointed. Don't know why the high ratings. I guess we're spoiled with good authentic food in Vancouver BC.

gl7A0Q0tjeWkxRe2jT7APQ.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST DIM SUM IN VEGAS!!!!  My partner and I ate here last week while waiting for our son to finish rugby practice.  Out of all the dim sum restaurants we've dined at, this place is the best.  The service was great.  Our server made the best recommendations on the menu, and they really tasted good.  It was like talking to an auntie made something special in the kitchen for you.  Roti with curry soup, and the Bo Lo Bao are a must have if you go.

QoyTyBmTcaD0-GSuCvjcSA.text: First time visiting here, I like it. Good selections, and non steamed items are cooked to order. Very good sauces and pricing.

4tR8dVeaXi3PrSeNorH-5Q.text: Finally I found the real good food dim sum restaurant in Las Vegas with comparable price with Las Vegas.  It has really Cantonese style rice noodles with green onions and  cilantro

WQMdbBSRbeB6qyjAN1HNMg.text: I've had a few dim sum places here in Las Vegas and I really enjoyed Yum Cha's food, along with their fast service. They were able to accommodate for my group of seven and even gave us coconut buns and bbq pork buns as a first-timer gift. I really appreciate their hospitality and would definitely come back.

UXGn20cjfG-YH-qLd_BkoA.text: Very good food and service, especially Sam, the manager. Clean and spacious restaurant. My family and I love everything we ordered. We got beef lo mein, salt and pepper calamari, crispy pork belly, fried flounder, eggplant with tofu, short ribs, salt and pepper smelt. Everything was delicious, cooked with fresh and quality ingredients. The food already looks so yummy and even more when you taste it. Highly recommended!

annSvmx5PPjPFggSwtygng.text: This restaurant has original Asian food.  I got the General Taos chickens and it was very good.  My children ate the orange chickening loved it.  The atmosphere was cafeteria like, but the food was good and plentiful.

WKJyVj-K1_B5g9dFHj5lOw.text: Great dim sum! Love the shrimp dumplings and siu mai ! Everything is fresh and tasty. Only thing I didn't like was the sweet and sour seafood dim sum. Really superb service. I would come again and enjoy!!! Thanks Yum Cha.

rBj0BMJ7roWIiVwB_fq7cw.text: 5 stars for:   - Food(brings back memories of street food in Malaysia, Singapore, Macau)  - Service(quick, clean and chirpy)  - pricing: very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Newest addition: Chinese churro stuffed with prawn. Delish

8kMJrj64yga-KMJngnVgcg.text: Stopped by about 7 ish for a bite of dinner - place was empty/chairs on tables - I asked if they were closing-no they weren't but so UNIVITING that I thought to get it to go...General Tso with white rice - BLAHHHHHH so NOT worth it.

eCwov7jYrwbkKw5Xz3ef-w.text: Good food. Friendly staff. Tons of selections at decent prices. Will definitely come again next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NvgCEy20Wpdb6rOf_2PurQ.text: We were there during Christmas weekend. Place was super busy. Instead of a hostess handing out number tag for your party, the guest just write down their name and number of party on a notebook. I've witness a few mistakes with this system during the 30 min wait.  Dim sum selections on carts are limited, but you can order items from their menu. A very friendly lady came by with a giant bun. It looks good but we won't be able to eat anything else if we ordered it. The lady took her time explained what's in the bun and how it was made.  Taste of foods are a Ok. A good place to go if you wanna try something different from all those buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tHUsHZEcR82PWeCPyvjzlw.text: I been here multiple time, never actually checked in on yelp. But it's always great. Is the best dim sum place I found and stop trying once I found it.

DmP2EMVkopQy5hbFCCXSxg.text: What are people thinking in these reviews! Worst place ever!!!!! My kids hated the soup dumpling too which is usually their favorite! I feel crappy! The food was extremely salty!! And everything wasn't fresh.

NwNtki0qKHCnaCQluWLN6A.text: I came here with a friend for the lunch dinsum and I was pleasantly surprised. We picked this location because it was not on the busy spring mountains street and it had a higher rating on yelp compared to the other dim sum restaurant in the Las Vegas area.  They had everything fresh and the shrimp and pork dim sum are out of the world! Their soup dumplings is also great but we had to order it separately and it came towards the end of our meal. For two people who had about 10-12 dishes our meal ended up being 40$! If anyone else I know wants to eat dim sum I would definitely recommend coming back to this location.  The staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean. They also have cool birdcages on the ceiling which makes the interior very interesting. Got some TVs on so kids could have something to watch

AJCujXah_K_VzlAGbhweHw.text: Yum Cha is currently my favorite dimsum place!! It's the closest one to the SW area, which is a big plus. It's nice that it's away from the hustle and bustle of Chinatown (and not as far as Sahara for Lotus Garden). You never have to murder someone in the parking lot to find a space either LOL. Also, all the times i've been there, there is little to no wait time.   Since there is no cart service available, all the food tastes fresh and made to order. Their chive dumplings are bomb, and the baked BBQ buns make me drool every time! The buns are toasted perfectly with the right amount a sweet, and they're stuffed with a lot of meat. The xiaolongbao are also the best i've had in Vegas so far! They're filled with piping hot soup and the skins aren't too thick like other places.   The also have the rest of the dimsum standards (siomai, hargow, chicken feet, etc.) but the ones I mentioned earlier are the best. Service is friendly; they take the time offer suggestions, and the owners or managers stopped by to talk to us.   Issa must try for dimsum lovers!  TLDR; a rly chill place with fresh & tasty buns/dumplings!!

gUyWrYQyw3ftEs9PvQtsIQ.text: I didn't think the dim sum was going to be that good but pleasantly I was suprised. It's located off strip the area seems kind of random. We went on a Sunday and was seated right away no wait.  The service is really good here and the food is just as good. They have more variety compared to other dimsum places. The people are super attentive and it really helps that they speak English.  I love that they have the baked custard bun and steamed version. A definite must try!  The price is higher than other dimsum though.  I would definitely come back here when I'm in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pm89TawIYKOaR2Pd-wEZvA.text: Service was good and food was good and fresh. Only things I'd avoid are the egg custard and soup dumplings.  A little expensive for dim sum but overall I would come back.

u3xOAFpjVNoGTXW_OLHvtQ.text: I liked the peacefulness of this place as well as the food! The downside is there aren't many options for dim sum comparing to some other dim sum places I've been to. However, for what they do have, the food tasted pretty good and authentic. They have both food carts (the ones you can grab from the trucks) and order-from-the-menu items.

-lTOb3ZVX5z0-xRvYsvpcA.text: This new local gem has amazing dim sum  I'm from Orange County where dim sum is abundant.  I was really impressed with this place.  I came here on a Wednesday around 1pm with one other person.  Once we arrived we were seated immediately and carts were pushed to us.  They had everything a normal dim sum place would have but even more items.  Like a lot more!  I like that they had everything steaming hot and there were more items on their menu.  You are bound to find something you like.  Everything we tried was delicious and tasted like they had just made it.  I don't normally get desserts but we ended up even getting some goods for our hotel.  We got their sesame balls, egg tarts, and egg custard filled sweet rolls.  All were amazing and so amazing.  Our total for our food was only $19.  The desserts was an extra $10.  It was very worth it.    The owner was really nice to us.  The girls serving us and pushing the carts were also very friendly and sweet.  The inside is very large with plenty of chairs, tables, and booths.  It's super casual.  You can walk up to where they are preparing food and also order there.  I cannot wait to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ooey goodness
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gdxg93zrjnrJdoq-zY2N1Q.text: Good authentic Dim Sum. I cannot believe I didn't find this place sooner. The dim sum was fresh and very tasty.

H1i8JvfaO8VPAd0IDUHz5Q.text: Great price for Dimsum and they open for dimsum all day. their chicken feet is tendered and well marinated. Salted egg steam bun is excellent and has running fill. Great service also!

2q10KWoWT7QyF28nMX2WVw.text: Decent but nothing to get excited about. It's clean and fast but expensive and not all dishes are up to par.  I grew up going to some of the best dim sum restaurant in San Francisco's Chinatown so I admit I have high expectations. The highlights were the black mushroom suimai and the spareribs. The rest was passable but not worth what we paid. The ha gow and shrimp wrapped in batter was not good. Shrimp was rubbery and the batter was greasy. With so many other options in Vegas... I would skip this one.

z6R_6iIgVv5YXbBgK04QMA.text: Here on our 1st time and 1st vacation to LV. After a longs day of awesome sight seeing. Our sister-in-law & brother took us here for dinner and wow Onodeliciousnous!  Welcomed by the owner, she's so pleasantly friendly and made it feel so homey. Very clean, a little modern with a touch of decor and a lot of space!  We placed our order -Family Style- it was so Quick, Hot and Mmmyummy! We had 2 types of noodles, a couple different type of dim sum and 1 protein. We started off with Sis Fave an appetizer Deep Fried Eggplant and Man was it Choice!! Then the rest came out one by one and there was no pause in between and everything was Hot.  We had a good time, plenty of laughs during dinner, taken good care of.  To our family and friends when your here for vacay or live here, you gots to come here for sure! Aloha & Mahalo Yum Cha! Also, to our Braddah and Sistah for bring us here :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asst yum dim sum
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Sour Pork
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake noodle with chicken vegetables

TfSvDqGAzjqe8ClxdMZt0A.text: Oh happy day!!! I FINALLY found a delicious dim sum restaurant here in Las Vegas...where to begin on all this food happiness?  Located on South Decatur (South West part of Vegas) This place is easy to get to from I215 or Decatur.     Inside the place is huge, lots of seating including booths AND large round tables.   Side note***they're getting set up to have a Cafe which will soon be open for business (if you like bubble tea, boba tea etc.) additionally, they're waiting on a liquor license so stay tuned for being able to order wine, beer  and other adult beverages!!!  Ambiance: totally chill so no need to dress up, this place is casual all the way.   Service: EXCELLENT!!! Our order was taken promptly, our drinks were always full and any time we looked like we wanted to order more dim sum, our server was there. Very nice, professional and absolutely spot on with our orders.   Food: absolutely delicious! We ordered three kinds of dumplings, spiced sticky rice  wrapped in leaf , spare ribs, chicken feet, fried pork belly, bok choy, sesame and red bean rice balls. That's just 1/4 of what the menu has to offer.   Price: all that food ^---- was literally less than $40 and it fed two people. So yes, this place rocks my socks off...yes YOU should come here and try the dim sum (they have a Chinese food menu too if you want that) and yes you had better bring your appetite!!!     Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chicken feet and dumplings!

G3VllRhjQgr_FTpzmnLZIA.text: Stopped by to have lunch here because of the good ratings in Yelp. Service was good. Food was pretty good. Prices were higher than Los Angeles which is to be expected. I highly recommend the baked BBQ pork bun. We bought some for the road and they tasted very good even after refrigerated.

3KrxqK2mW7JO24Uc8NtVnA.text: Terrific service and good food with a great price, cannot go wrong. Off the strip, but within 15mins drive. So worth it for dim sum. Got everything we wanted and more. If the carts do not come as quickly as you want, flag a waiter and order all you want and it'll come in minutes to your table.  So many waiters come by to check on us while we are ok during our meal. As we left, so many greeted us on our way out. We will be back!

hblMvDGr-UHQx-uy2R4n9w.text: First the good, dumplings are fresh and taste great and the soups, too. Great service and very clean. Great parking in a big shopping center. Now the bad, ordered 2 Mongolian beef entrees and the portions was SUPER SMALL for than $17 each. What a rip off! If I ever make it to Vegas again, I'll just come here for the dumplings and soup.

DDk5ezWPQuouXXrkHEpjSg.text: Went here for a quick Tuesday lunch. Staff was friendly. Even though it was not busy to have many dim sum carts circulating, the staff was eager to take our orders directly.

GF03ZFj2WY5RHR2qOSlA4Q.text: Bad restaurant, Bad service, don't come here, order 3 but mark 4, be careful. Do not come to this restaurant, we ask for manager to come but some lady come out and said we had to remember who ever that serving us the food, because every body had different food cart. How in the world we can remember all there employees had the same uniform and we in there only 5min. Unbelievable, this is the way their customers service. I don't know how do they got 4 stars on the review.

z7MatVpbRGU_hscgdVZJ5g.text: Good food. Good price and good service. What more can I ask for?  This is the best meal I had in Las Vegas.

M8_1dfwvaiSIJgfFZOGQuQ.text: My cousin and I were visiting Las Vegas in February and were waiting for the rest of our cousins to fly in. One morning, we were craving dim sum and found Yum Cha. The name itself was catchy. In Cantonese phonetically 'Yum Cha' is translated to 'Drink Tea'. The dim sum here was good for what it was. My cousin and I were trying to fix a craving and we got that. The food seemed fresh since it was on the typical push cart. The best thing on the dim sum menu was the shrimp dim sim options, the shrimp rice noodle 'fun' was my favorite. The restaurant was quite large and the dining decor reminded me of a cafeteria.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried shrimp balls
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shrimp with fried wontons
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet, Steamed Shrimp dumpling (hai gau), pork &amp; shrimp dumpling (seew mai)

Q_u0WAyNzJOZHP9sa1OsdQ.text: Stopped at Yum Cha on the way to the Vegas airport,  it is in a shopping mall with ample parking space.  The host was cordial and seated us promptly. The ambiance is authentic and made me feel like I was traveling in Asia.  There is a dim sum menu and you can order from the menu or you can get plates from the dim sum cart that rolls around. We tried both approaches, but I have to say I preferred being able to look at the menu to know what I was getting.  While ordering from the cart we asked what things were and ordered some banana leaf pouches which we were told were 'sticky rice' just to open them and realize it was sticky rice with generous portions of pulled pork inside.. It was delicious but my non-pork eating boyfriend was not happy about having taken a bite..  Our other picks included shrimp dumplings, noodle soup and steamed chicken buns. Everything was delicious and at a great price.  I LOVED the chili oil that was on our table and it was the perfect accompaniment to the meal.  Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M_u-lFz0eIAXQcRpO1Ro5A.text: Having been to and reviewed many different Dim Sum restaurants across the country, I usually always start at the highest rated restaurant. According to the reviews, this was the place to start. Came on a weekday so it wasn't too busy, but still had a few tables with locals which is always a good sign. The food was good and had an authentic taste. Enjoyed the variety including beef tendon, which I haven't previously seen at most dim sum restaurants. Since they push carts, some of this dishes had been sitting out for a while, but you could also order specialty dim sum items from the back. Overall, would come back if I lived in the area, but as a tourist was not easily assessable from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eS60B-2_Q6gBPsUJeQ5z6g.text: Excellent service. Good Dim Sum. Definitely coming back. Affordable and delicious. My favorite was the shrimp&pork chives dumpling. They had this sweet called mango pudding, it resembled flan a lot and tasted like  real mango not artificial. Also had Thai tea it was a little sweet but nothing I couldn't tolerate

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not bad.

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left side is shrimp dumpling, middle is shrimp&amp;pork chives dumpling ,on the right  side shrimp&amp;pork shumai.

FPSOFZwcS_qPhIZT8mk9Cw.text: Good food, got open kitchen to see them doing their magic... TV's to show how there food is made from authentic cooks... tried this noodle dish that was to die for... gonna leave a pic

F8o5heC_dg7WvLksVQ6cUQ.text: My new dim sum place.  Vegas with the family always ends with dim sum. I was always loyal to Orchid but decided to give this place a try. I'm giving this place 5 stars because of the food quality and the attention given by the servers.   I suggest trying hot mustard mixed with regular hot sauce and soy sauce.

Pxb2hlswn46KoahA8qjvCQ.text: Ambiance: Open concept, clean, and welcoming  Service: Fast, friendly, and pleasant Food: Delicious! My family and I tried a variety of items from their dim sum menu and all were very delicious and flavorful: har gow, shu mai, chicken feet, pork ribs, bbq pork buns, Chinese broccoli, hot ginger tofu.  Conclusion: Will definitely be back and recommend! I love how you can get good dim sum without heading to crowded and chaotic Chinatown. Parking is also breeze.

u-MHp-ZLlJIY5pyqhxxb-w.text: My husband & I had been talking about trying Dim Sum for the first time and we turned to Yelp and came across Yum Cha. Since this was our first Dim Sum experience, we can't compare it to any other places and this review is solely on today's visit.   The restaurant is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. When we walked in we were immediately greeted and seated. The inside is pretty big. Besides us there were only 2 other people dining at the time. By the time we left there were only 2 other tables occupied. The service was excellent. There were 2 ladies & 1 gentleman who constantly came by to refill our water, clear our plates and take our orders.   We had the following based on our choices as well as our server's recommendations:  Shrimp & Pork Shumai Steamed BBQ Pork Bun Shrimp & Pork Chives Dumpling  Shrimp Rice Noodle BBQ Pork Puff Pastry Pan Fried Potstickers  Fried Shrimp Ball Xiao Long Bao  Red Bean Sesame Ball   The dishes come anywhere between 2-4 pieces and range in price from $3.68, $4.38 & $4.98 depending on which page you choose from.   Our favorites were the Steamed BBQ Pork Bun, Shrimp & Pork Chives Dumpling & the Fried Shrimp Ball. Our least favorite was the Shrimp Rice Noodle. Everything came out hot except for the Red Bean Sesame Ball which was disappointing because those are best nice and hot. Some of the dishes came with some dipping sauces and overall the flavors were good.   We quickly flipped through the menu and they also serve Chinese food as well as lunch specials. But today we stuck with the Dim Sum.   Would we come back again? Possibly. If you're like us and are first time Dim Sum-mers I would say Yum Cha is a good place to start!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

08X9kF-eGui_799zfVz7xg.text: omg this coconut flavor is everything,a great choice of veggies (eggplants and noodles) and the right amount spiciness. Loved this place

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious scrimp &amp; veggies curry spicy soup.

egyVOVnsvVYXlwUfGL__vQ.text: Staff was friendly except for a young lad who made a rude remark but nevertheless, the food was extremely delicious and would definitely come back!   This is not like a traditional dim sum place where they walk around with a cart and you pick what you want!   I never actually had egg tarts before and for the first time trying it, I was super impressed. It was super flakey that the dessert melted in your mouth. Definitely a more savory taste than I expected but super flavorful and very well made.   If you're not in the mood for some dim sum options, they do offer other appetizers and entrees to choose from!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jasmine tea

9MypoVwV6HeFVinxw3Jjpw.text: Hands down one of best (if not the best) dimsum experiences we've had....beats NYC, Hawaii, and Cali ones we've been to.  Service was phenomenal as well.  Funny cause we always expect very hurried  and not so friendly staff at dimsum (like we almost always come for the fun of "soup-Nazi" service) and this place is completely opposite.  Super nice and accommodating to a point we were waiting for someone to come up from behind and tell us we've been pranked.  Truly, come here for amazing dimsum served by the nicest smiling faces.

UOsfGpYGHqIfHJmyzVJzsg.text: The place was busy and very noisy.  The food was warm and took a fairly long time to arrive at our table.  Lastly the customer service needs more attention.

NfLwRkH_To2xOcHisjGqaw.text: Something refreshing while in Vegas.    The decor was decent, there was not wait to sit down, and the staff was great.  Plates are about $3 and some change each and it is filling.  The servers came in their carts and rolled around some food.  There is also an option to order food from the menu that is not dim sum.  I had some bao, chicken feet, shumai, and dumplings.  I enjoyed everything and I would love to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch!

RjImY01Ow2bvtZo4-DKABQ.text: This place gets such great reviews and I'm not exactly sure why. Maybe you should go for lunch instead of dinner like we did? Almost everything we had tasted like it had been frozen and heated up. The only thing we thought might have been homemade was the spicy shrimp wonton & the steamed bok choi (but dear lord how hard is that). The spicy shrimp wonton took much longer to come out, which I didn't mind, and actually had some flavor. On that note I will say they were fast at bringing out items, but I'd rather them take their time so we get better quality food. Maybe I've just had good dim sum and I'm too particular? .....I don't think that's the problem here ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Shrimp &amp; Pork Wonton that wasn&#39;t spicy and I&#39;m a wimp!

PU-4r7kk0Rfxqsl8rMX3AQ.text: When everyone wants dim sum in Vegas, they automatically always think to go Chinatown to get their fix. but this place is the ONE! don't miss out!

Npf-ZofpFReaKBv7bpYKbw.text: The Dim Sum was ok but the customer service was incredibly terrible. We believe they don't make EVERYTHING listed on the Dim Sum menu that was given to us because we never saw half of the things listed. Would I return? Probably not.

gHNNmXRoCzPLaQjEPg7APQ.text: Great service, good food. As a Chinesr Malaysian, I must say the taste is genuine and nostalgic. 2nd visit! Must try for dim sum and the curry noodles are amazing.

8koKmSJa2M_O8V9LDtjy8w.text: This place is the bomb!! I never had Dim sum before and this place was a real treat. I enjoyed the push kart that came by the table, I tried way too many dishes off of that thing, I guess I didn't feel guilty bc it came to the table instead of me making frequent trips to the counter. I had the salt and pepper pork chops as a main entree and it tasted amazing. The BBQ pork buns was worth the trip by themselves. Give this place a try if you love Dim sum or just great Chinese food.

Zj4Bt82iAkGtZJ2pEva6kA.text: Just an average dim sum place. The service was amazing, but the food was mediocre. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu and it was either too mushy or just meh. I would give the food about a 2, but the service was so awesome that I had to give it an extra star. The calamari was non-existent, so it felt like I was just eating batter and salt. Literally, fried batter with nothing in it. The tripe was decent and the lava custard was pretty good. Everything else was soggy. I'm not sure if I'll be back here, but I tried! My last round, I ordered the pork ribs, stuffed mushrooms, and pork and chive dumplings. For some reason, something smelled really off. It turned me Off and wasn't sure what dish it was. It was strong, like something went bad. My heart told me to stop eating, so I did. We ended our meal with the lava custard, which was delicious. TBH, I don't think I'll be coming back, now that I think about it....

j92x2k0cSRB7AY0lXTt8nw.text: The fresh roti with chickpea curry is hands down one of my favorite dishes here in Vegas. The flavor is incredible! And as a fan of the red bean sesame balls, they are huuuge here. Win and win! Sorry, no photos, I was too busy stuffing my face. It was THAT good. Maybe next time I'll be able to resist and take a photo first.....maybe. We need a Yelp Elite Event here!

duGfznFVGNVJNIbmBfFutw.text: My boyfriend an I found this place maybe a month after it opened last year, and hands down it is our top spots for yum cha in the southwest. The food is fresh, the noodles just melt in your mouth and they have the most delectable fish balls I've ever had. SUPER SUPER FRESH!! the owner is a sweetheart and the staff is very attentive and helpful. Location is great, close the the strip and there's plenty of room for large groups to enjoy this great food together. If in town definetly come through and give your taste buds a treat!

L7qHbP-mX2D2PfRunIJWLw.text: Great service, delicious food and friendly atmosphere!  Decided to try a new Dim Sum place today and glad I ran across Yum Cha. Food was delicious and restaurant was extremely clean.  Sam, the owner, came over and Introduced himself and was very pleasant to talk with. Staff was always around for anything we needed.  To all the Hawaiians in Las Vegas .... they have Rice Cake!

rkuNeZEJhi4Fp95hHSUegQ.text: Very roomy, well organized and clean were my first impressions of this place. There are several dim sum carts that keep coming around with many classic, basic dim sum choices. The dim sum "specialties" are served at the counter and you can walk up there to order or wait for a waitress to come around and order with her. The owner was very nice. He came over several times to check on us and made sure we were happy with the food as well as the service. He also asked for our suggestions and constructive comments. I have been to so many popular dim sum places in town and generally I never get good customer service. If they're not ignoring your request then they're basically throwing the food on your table and walking away. This place was an exception. I was very happy with the service I received today. Overall, I think the food was good in flavors, selections were various and customer service was outstanding. I will definitely come back.
