Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice rolls with ground beef filling

Cd7r0ESfDmKTgMcI1g9uGQ.text: First time here and very pleased. Food was very fresh. I've been to many dim sum restaurants in the area and this place has the best service! Will definitely be coming back for more dim sum.

-3I4W54_KRS7zl-hKar3Zw.text: Best dim sum in Las Vegas !!! My favorites are the Pineapple bun, lotus leaf rice wrap, bbq pork rice noodle, short ribs, pork rib, and my boyfriend love the chicken feet.. very family friendly ... and open on holidays !!!!

nWwpCVnVlqCNskNZYs-oIQ.text: Hands down, some the best dim sum I've ever had! The food was absolutely delicious, an amazing blend of fresh flavors that dazzled my taste buds. The restaurant has both traditional push carts and a counter where you can choose from an array of delicious made-to-order items. Customer service was great and the owners are super friendly. Too bad I don't live in Vegas, otherwise I'd be eating here regularly!

1Q8yVo8bdwlEPZPyZSd8IA.text: My fiance and I are visiting from CA and we love dim sum. We have a favorite place to go where we're from so I'm always apprehensive about trying new places because I don't want to be disappointed. We got a craving so I looked to Yelp.  I found and tried this place based on Yelp reviews and once again I'm pleased!   We ordered dim sum items and some wonton soup. We had shrimp, pork/shrimp, and shrimp/spinach dumplings. We also had the beef crepe that comes with this amazing sauce, a tofu item, pan-fried pork dumplings and some black bean spareribs.   Everything tasted amazing! It was delicious and fresh. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because we waited for the wonton soup and then got all the way home and realized it wasn't in the bag.   The food was so good that we weren't even mad. I will definitely be going back to this place before I go back to CA.

2aZaCTTLWa6x23kaz0m2mA.text: I really enjoyed this stop and look forward to more. There are dim sum carts that roll around, but they have a full menu, and a counter area where you can select more food (that will be brought to your table). We tried a bit of everything, from the chive dumplings at the counter service, roti and curry dipping sauce from the counter, and tons of dim sum from the cart. Everything was excellent!  I'm glad we found our new go-to for dim sum!

gSgy6TYc07J5EDQLh3EH3g.text: Being from the East coast and a Chinese food connoisseur I found this place to be phenomenal. The dumplings are some of the best I've ever eaten along with the riblets pork and beef. The staff is extremely friendly and it's set in a very casual diner like atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If my plate is empty means the food was spectacular!!!

WOPL-_qjJW7OfHZwwyeJHA.text: My parents and I went here for dinner. We've been here before when it was another dim sum place. I definitely like yum cha better!     What I love this place is that they serve dim sum for dinner.   They have a lot of different selections. It's a Chinese Malaysian fusion. They have an amazing Roti that comes with this amazing curry. I ordered three orders!  Another delicious find is their yam puff.    The manager Eileen is also very nice. She showed us different things we could try and always checked up on us.  I will definitely come back :)

5XhRrM8-_LO6aYEyIuSgcQ.text: We just returned from a trip to Las Vegas. While there, my husband and I made it a point to eat local and eat off the strip.   On our last day we tried Yum Cha, a dim sum and open stall Chinese restaurant.   We went for lunch. There is a dim sum chart that circulates among the tables. Additionally, the open food stall allows one to point other foods to have brought to your table. Dim sum prices range from $3 -$5 for lunch.  The dim sum features pork, shrimp, sweet and savory.   The service is excellent, the food is delicious. The staff will offer selections based on your preferences.   We highly recommend this place. We are only disappointed that we couldn't eat here again.

fcCw_RkojBj4gi_4exZlwg.text: The best dim sum place in Las Vegas. A little bit far but totally worth it. Service was great very friendly people. Food was reallyyyyyy gooooood!!! actually the best that we had in Vegas.

8i78ab-51BVGizGZNss1qQ.text: This place opened 6 weeks  ago. First time here, and will definitely come back. The cleanest by far among the many dim-sums in LV. Food's superb and the staff are very friendly.

J71toqbDgMF-j3Q7oUKbTA.text: Having visited before official grand opening, it's understood the place is not running at 100%. The food was very tasty. Management (?) was interested in knowing what we thought of the food, service, etc. Personally, I'm particularly interested in cleanliness especially the restroom. I give a thumbs up. Will be back!

-dkvBfyLjuUZI3LCMQkRDQ.text: Absolutely love this place.  The food is good, fresh,  and authentic. The employees are very welcoming and will come to check on you regularly.  They care about your experience and take time to explain things and make suggestions.  Cannot get enough!

kANnyMqdZyx7HsxA6uPQ_A.text: We've been to Vegas quite a few times, and we would always hit up our usual dim sum place.  This time we decided to try a new one.  We found this place on yelp and we're gald that we did.  The dishes were just as good and some even better than our usual dim sum place.  The open counter makes ordering certain dishes much easier,  especially if you don't speak Chinese (you can just point).  This will probably be our new dim sum place everytime we're in Vegas now.

AFsxLwv2xrjMpPM9n95Bww.text: Amazing food. Very nice staff, which is a rare find in Asian Resturants. They are attentive and accommodating. Dim Sum and menu prices are very reasonable. Will be returning on our next trip to Vegas.

wJlidOWDnBi481431e_zww.text: Decent place for dim sum. Stick with dim sum items. The noodles did not impress. Prices are reasonable.

8IgzMcBjRBsQNFFtr_pupQ.text: Pretty good I was visiting from Vancouver and this place still has cart service which is really rare now in Vancouver. Dim sum is still pretty cheap. $2.98 each for the basic steamed dishes and the veggies and other are a higher price. Would come again. The best places to eat in Vegas are the smaller shops. Everything on the strip is either too salty or too fatty or too sweet. While not a fancy decorated place it's good for a satisfying meal without blowing your budget. You will probably need a car to get here.

q1evuvTq7lxyLeM8NeVBnQ.text: This place is horribe. My husband and I go to Dim Su regularly, but this place's food and service is awful. The food is not comparable to any other Dim Sum, and quality is terrible and overpriced. Half way through eating, the server studpidly thought we left and dumped the subpar food...save your appetite andbmoney for other high quality Dim Sum! Super disappointed! Would have given a zero star.

SvXl4LOdGiMWfjIwmftIFg.text: Good dim sum! Very clean restaurant.  Staff is really nice & attentive. Food is fresh & hot. Prices are decent & portions are good. We would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

gvqO8y54ReWMHST7J97rhw.text: Excellent Love it good price good service nice and clean. if who love tofu must try sweet tofu it my favorite it come with ginger water but just tell server that sweet on the side if you don't like too much sweet.

kYHwaqNHLWHrjtubVJMCeg.text: Tried restaurant out at lunch on the way to Utah.  Food was average. The lotus wrap rice was bland.

Lc6KKovS2C6Q9tdc6_iu0Q.text: Ive only had dim sum twice and this place was the second place ive been to. Everything was perfect all of the dishes were as good as i expected or better. They have so much variety i cant wait to come back and try new things!! The service was some of the best ive ever had, besides being attentive the waiters would give recommendations and explain different foods to us and how they should be eaten. Couldnt have been better, i left very happy. The price was good too. For two people who took a bunch of food home and the bill was only $40 it seems kind of pricey at first but the experience was akin to high dining.

olMiRwL2X2oTSgHJuMboKA.text: Great food and great service. If you want great Dim Sum this is the place. They have a huge selection of items and everything is always hot and fresh.

yfa6Zop0-bAZR5815L2bHQ.text: We've eaten here many times over the last few months.  The dim sum is usually very good but today was a disappointment.  The steamed pork hash had chunks of hard pork in them.  Items that are usually portioned on the dim sum cart were not available so we had to order porridge and noodles alacarte.  We paid $6 extra for a small plate of dry fried noodles that had no flavor except for the round onions & bean sprouts.  Overall, the food was disappointing.  We also noticed the staff is all new...maybe change of owners?

XOYBBDKB_6nWtEpJnHpfYw.text: The best chinese restaurant here in Vegas, the food is really good and the cleanliness of the restaurant is impressive, prices are really good too especially if you come on days that they have the dim sum discount I think tues-fri!

7jni2-JOM594mcXSyC9rCQ.text: Was very impressed fast and very good dim sum,  many there were asian customers, so I knew it must be good!

gzvRMUhhBfLeF6sg3iNnWQ.text: This place has the best dim sum in Las Vegas and it is open until 10:30pm!  What more could you want?  The service is good and the price is very affordable.  Definitely get the baked lava custard bun.

Fi5WSwyMjxnnc6mWX5RdJQ.text: Went here for lunch and it was very disappointing. From the very moment we sat down we were ambushed my carts. We hadn't even ordered our drinks yet. Custard bun was undercooked. It was raw dough on the inside. The soup dumpling was also raw in the top. Pork dumpling was also raw on the inside and you could taste the oil it was fried in. They had the temperature wrong on the oil. They need to cook their food thoroughly!! Not coming back here.

6RqJ9sEEpBV2qcmFj4naug.text: Came here because of the great reviews, so I was a little disappointed when my experience wasn't the same.  Most, if not all, of our dishes were reheated and it tasted that way.  Not sure what the appeal is.

UGv3U1lvnBxXZiHJCfsnHA.text: Delicious food and fast courteous service. I especially liked the baked sticky pork buns and the fried shrimp balls. The restaurant and bathrooms were very clean. The owner came to our table and personally greeted us and treated us to a sweet custard puff pastry. I highly recommend trying this place when in Las Vegas. We will definitely return.

SUzyuyADo3DJdCgQogTtzA.text: I like this place. First time here and it's Thursday between Christmas and New Year's. Came at noon and was seated right away. All day dim sum with a pretty big normal order menu. Everyone was super friendly. They have carts that come around but also can order and they will bring it fresh to your table. Atmosphere is open and inviting and the dim sum is very good. I recommend the shrimp hargow (lots of shrimp) and the shrimp, pork, and chive dumplings.I would definitely come back again.

21s4BaFXKoePLWM6q9NuFw.text: Still my go to place when I miss home! Their menu has way more options now, making it so difficult to just pick my top 10. Best way is to bring your family and friends so you get to order and share all the good stuff! The servers still provide the most engaging services, always making sure if customers are satisfied with their food unless for the crazy busy weekends, well, can't blame the customers for keep coming back! ;)  It's almost winter now! My cravings for curry noodle and braised beef noodle soup are back! Some simple stir fry veg, steamed whole fish, oatmeal shrimp, yuuuumm! You're so missing out if you haven't give this place a try!

v6efQPfgOq4AD4bvGKzlQQ.text: Been searching for a good dim sum place and this is it. Came around 8pm and service was prompt and attentive. Got the shrimp dumpling, shrimp and pork shumai, bbq pork bun, custard bun, rice cake, and coconut bun. All price was adorable and reasonable. My new favorite in China town.

J0-l6UOXWSv3nfAD0U-3hg.text: my Only place to eat Dim Sum even on week day! place is modern, very clean. i love the little suspended bird cages. reminds me of Singapore. Dim Sum is Dim Sum right? the only difference between others is that the place is modern, spacious, clean (no stinky carpet). staff was very pleasant and friendly.  i like their little mango and coconut flan or gello in caramel sauce. very light so you can have both flavor

BpGhW5xy5rjMOYcoUMeo9w.text: Visiting Vegas and found this spot, so we had to check it out. Good Dim Sum at a good price. I'd definitely come back.

sGuvQGhMXGhvxkqmBERlzA.text: Prologue: One of our dining traditions when visiting Las Vegas is to try at least one new Asian restaurant. After perusing several reviews on Yelp we decided that this trip would include some dim sum at Yum Cha.  The Plot: My girlfriend and I shared a variety of traditional dim sum, including chicken feet, sticky rice with pork in lotus leaf, rice noodle with shrimp, beef short ribs, and beef tendon.  The Scene: My girlfriend, who is a native of mainland China, and I agreed that the chicken feet and sticky rice with pork were as good as we've had anywhere. The beef tendon, which was perfectly cooked to the optimal degree of tender, rich, gelatinous yummyness was quite satisfying.   The Rest of the Story: The service was intermittent and challenging at times. The rice noodle with shrimp was cold and the sauce was a little weak. The beef short ribs were tasty but not nearly tender enough.  Epilogue: The relatively limited dim sum menu was a somewhat unpleasant surprise considering how many good reviews this restaurant has received.  That fact alone dropped our review from 5 stars to 4. Combine the limited menu with the sketchy service and cold rice noodles and the best review we can legitimately give is 3 stars.  Photo design by Billie Z.

ulwCwZV7dRbtbFDy5SEcIg.text: This dim sum place is pretty substandard. Came on a Saturday and all three carts had the same 5-6 items. There's an odd menu system where if you don't see it on the cart you can order it, but what's the point of that with dim sum?!? Shu mai was pretty good, everything else was fair to poor. Greasy dumplings, heavy pork buns, just not a fan. If people truly think this is the best dim sum in Vegas they need to get to LA, SF, or Portland to try really good dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super heavy bao. Too much dough!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nasty greasy pork ball.

Q8VwVg8GfNN66RC0PqCS4A.text: For those of us who want dim sum but are not morning people - Yum Cha is here for you! All. Day. Dim. Sum! If you come late (past brunch time) the "cart" experience is not there, but you can still order the full menu and they make it to order.   This place is a little quirky, with fake bird cages all over the ceiling and TVs showing cooking videos from various Asian counties. The restaurant is also large with ample seating for small to big parties. Although, I'm not sure how busy this place gets on weekend mornings (as mentioned, not an early riser). The staff are bi-lingual and do a good job of explaining what each item is for those who are unfamiliar. They are quick to refill tea/water and are on top of their stuff!  Been here about 3-4 times mostly because the dim sum is all-day. But that's okay because the food is actually really good! Each plate comes out hot and fresh. They have everything from the typical har gow, and shumai to xiao long bao (soup dumplings) and curry fish balls, which aren't usual dim sum fare. However, I do think it's a little on the pricey side for some dishes like the beef tripe, entrails, & radish.   Yum Cha is great if you want that dim sum fix, and don't want to get up early. It's not the best I've ever had, but it's pretty darn good.

_g-L3vJGtPN9Xiy6XGPNYw.text: Oh man. We got like ten different dishes to split and all of them were good. Some were better than others, but the fried shrimp wonton, shumai, chicken wings, fried pork belly and pork dumplings were all excellent. If we had to rank things, the chicken wings were probably the best and the sticky rice was probably the least favorite, it wasn't bad, just OK. The lava bun the custard was really flavorful but a little grainy. Overall we were thrilled with the meal.

_pmm-sf58A9TTulv5mr1_w.text: This restaurant is authetic and traditional Hong Kong style Yum Cha! The flavor is just as Hong Kong local flavor, which is amazing!! People who love Dim Sum or Yum Cha must try this restaurant while visiting Vegas!!

vjuwmxn-bgWw5mTF3wzNmg.text: Yum Cha instantly became my new favorite dim sum restaurant in Vegas, which are hard to come by. The flavors were on point, and I stuffed my face to my heart's content without feeling super weighed down by the usual grease you get at other places. Ended the meal with the custard filled pineapple bun, definitely a highlight.   Would definitely come back here on the next visit to Vegas.   And now I've come back for a 3rd, maybe 4th time. I can't remember now, but it still hits the spot!

jwcAhXPw7jiIMqGPAQn5mQ.text: We enjoyed the spread here - from the dim sum to the ala carte noodles. And the baked lava custard buns were very good; likewise the "tau foo far" or bean curd pudding. The sugar syrup had hints of ginger and it lifted up the enjoyment of the light dessert.

HwpiWu22fbDEZ4YMvSP0RQ.text: I'm Malysian and I stumbled on this gem when I was in Vegas with my family. Holly cow it hit SO CLOSE to home; Owners Elaine and Sam provided us with amazing hospitality. A few things that is a must try- Hainanese Chicken Rice, Kuih Malayu, stuffed eggplant, braised beef tendon, lou sar pau (creamy custard bun)...honestly, try everything

8B6G6hAVjzsSEliA1k-7jA.text: Great place. Good food. Lots of seating. You should give it a try if you're craving dim sum

caX8S0oeLtDGM72W-TLKYw.text: Really good dim sum. They seem to have a big rivalry with East Ocean on Eastern in Henderson, but I like both places. I think they have an edge on service over East Ocean, though. Also, there's some food on display, which is a feature East Ocean does not have.

QBjeIjWbqOkJZhs4J0Hy2A.text: Great restaurant for Chinese food!! Found them on yelp and it didn't disappoint. 10+ dishes for under $35 and friendly servers and owners. Perfect option if you want Chinese and easy access off the strip. Big parking lot.

CcgdLpic6rOtXj7fAX0Dtw.text: Dim sum all day with good service. It's in the same plaza as my gym but I've never been. Went here because I was craving dim sum and it's 8pm. Good thing it's all day dim sum! The food was good just a little bland for my taste.

Fq9mzs0GQ-eM4E4VMtNA6w.text: We went to this restaurant, today, based on the reviews.  The only negative I had read was one that referred to the slow service.  I figured that was out weighed by the great reviews on the food.  The food was awful and the service was terrible.  The waitress, instead of believing the customer was right, argued with us and didn't give us our change.  We will never go back there again and I don't recommend it to anyone!

JjvIqSw3ukc0yQfI73Wv_A.text: Really nice food overall and short wait time, however by the time we arrived for dinner many of the food options were unavailable/sold out. The staff were friendly about it, but unfortunately we were unable to order what we wanted to. Perhaps they have more availability during lunch or breakfast.

d_SXqEbtFlsLIQuM13EW5w.text: yummy.. clean, and everybody is helpful.. good tasting food. We'll be back here for sure :)

g8ohBRcYLpIMhK0RaK64jg.text: Just had Dim Sum at Yum Cha. I live in Vancouver (Hongcouver) BC Canada, and visit my significant other every 3 weeks in Vegas. I'm Chinese so I wanted him to try Dim Sum since it's my go to comfort food. Him and I both Loved Yum Cha! The service was excellent and very personable and the food was Fresh and tasty. We ordered half the menu and plan to order the other half on my next trip to Vegas. Make sure you ask for the special sweet soy sauce when you go!

ngHHX1tBnp9xfl0NGoUmHA.text: Las Vegas, we have dim sum happiness! First time visit to Yum Cha today (Thursday, 4/27/17) with two friends.  The restaurant is spacious, clean and friendly staff.  It was not busy, there was only one couple sitting in one of the booths and the rest of the place was empty, but it was also a time of day when most are just leaving work (5:15pm). This did not worry me because I felt we would be given swift service and lots of attention to detail, which we did! From the Jasmine tea to the soup dumplings, everything was flavorful and fresh tasting!  I left very full, not heavy full but satisfying full.  The price was surprising (in a good way) the three of us had 10 dishes and it came to $42.00 and change, I was expecting almost double that, it helps the there is a lower price during the week (approximately $2.88 per dish vs. approximately $3.68 per dish weekends and holidays).  The staff was so helpful in making suggestions and keeping the tea and water full, and just friendly in general.  Our server was very honest about what she thought we would like and she never tried to "trick" us into ordering more dishes.  She was also very forthcoming about what the crowd and environment is like during the busier lunch time hour (they only do cart service during the early part of the day through lunch due to the volume of customers). Every dish we ordered tonight was freshly prepared and came to the table hot and delicious. I live 45 minutes away and used a 1/4 tank of gas and it was worth it!!! Thank you Yum Cha, you have a big fan in me and my two friends, we will be back with more newbies soon!!!!

G9dK8X902rzrDdZEcEkDZQ.text: New place ~6 months. First time here. AMAZING. Pretty good quality for dimsum by the strip. The service is phenomenal, they were very on top of everything. Would recommend and would come back.

Q_FbeMhxCjmVgf4VRgBx7A.text: Checked out this place after reviewing Yelp. Delicious and authentic Chinese food. Very kid friendly atmosphere. Loved the salt and pepper fish fillet and the thousand island shrimp. The beef noodles soup was great too. Customer service is friendly and very responsive. Will definitely visit again when Vegas bound. The kids loved the egg tarts too.

PkECzW-5UvT0KcRrh-v7RA.text: came here for lunch after searching for a dim sum place, and it wasnt that busy...good food & attentive service;  the staff were very nice and friendly... definitely worth tryin!

cfVep4Evuvg8EH8kWcb83w.text: Very good Dim Sum! Everything was delicious, the atmosphere was low key and everyone was friendly! My favorites were the noodles, the sticky rice with pork wrapped in leaves, and the curry fish balls. So good!

fIapy1-Och03dKd1LdFemA.text: Very good place. Delicious food and wonderful service. My sister visiting  from ukraine loved it and it was her first time having this type of food. It was also very close to our hotel Tahiti so it made it very convenient for us. We came and were served right away. Five thumbs up for this place and food.

DN63Ykh03kKKRlTNCxYp7w.text: What a great place to eat DimSum....found this place through Yelp and it truly lives up to its reviews.  Staff is beyond friendly and helpful.  A defiant must try.

T09D75WrCBjgBlgVnul7nQ.text: Great service. Food is fast and hot. I had to be adventurous but liked everything I tried.  My husband agrees all had good flavor,  even though he was looking for something super spicy. They have dim sum, kay not a cart.  You can view & order at the counter.

RU7d5qEvvPNuFv95tvwZ-w.text: We were driving around and seen this place online we thought it must be good since they have a lot of great reviews. The service was spot in everyone was friendly everytime we needed something they came up to the table. The food was okay I liked it taste like they don't put too much salt like other places. I think I will be back again

qax7nzZp2CtxVw2s6KRTBg.text: we have had dim sum at several places in Las Vegas, and this is, by far, the best place by far. great food great service and great environment.

jfk2QUgqs76EVy7iErTt4A.text: Based on the good ratings and reviews, I decided to try this place out for their dim sum. I honestly wasn't impressed. The service people were nice. Their English, however, was very poor. I had trouble communicating with the staff. They tried to do it a little different here. The standard dim sum dishes are in the carts being pushed around but their "special" dishes are behind a counter where you walk up and order. The order then gets brought to your table. I don't know if that's necessary but I guess you don't have to scour the carts looking for dishes. To me the flavors weren't good. I left feeling like I was missing something. My dim sum fix had not been satisfied.

BFd6Nj_p73VH3jovWqaiaQ.text: Food was great! A couple of things were a little cold but they replaced them as soon as we as we asked. Recommended for hangovers!!

W8Up5TtYlCTKUpVsaM_BZg.text: Wanted to try some Dim Sum off the strip. Went to Yum Cha....what a great find!  It was off peak hours but still lots to choose from. The place is super clean and very well lit. All the dim sum staples we tried were very good. Had some delicious sticky rice and a nice serving of crispy pork belly. Also had a good bowl of congee. The owner Sam came over to make sure everything was ok. We struck up a conversation about Malaysia and the great food you can find there. His staff's service was great and he personally asked what could be done better. Now that's customer service! The place is new so hopefully the locals will support it and make it thrive. I want to return next time I'm back in Vegas.

MXrNdkf7lJ3BVE9gBqlAOw.text: I've had dim sum in NY and LA and this place certainly contends with the coastal restaurants. The staff is quick and polite and everything is made fresh. Usually when i get shrimp dumplings or pork shumai i have to drown it in soy sauce...everything i got today was perfect on its own. For desert, treat yourself and get a "golden sand lava custard bun". This bun is the chocolate lava's glimmering sexy cousin.

BhrRMzMSpNH_flxRsEmehw.text: Its really hard to find dim sum served beyond weekend days but after doing a lot of research, i found this place and i loved it!  I cant believe they serve a full dim sum menu until 10:30pm!  Vegas eats late and we should be able to eat whatever we want late.  The dim sum is really good: the har cow (shrimp in rice dumpling) and shu mai (pork and shrimp wonton style dumpling are my favorite.  I also really liked the wonton soup.  The owner is really nice and makes people feel good around him.  Another plus is they have free wifi and electrical plugs at the booth tables so I can sit here and work while i eat or have business meetings here.  Five stars - try it!

Lv1JNgbF9NC9TQl8dqLJ4g.text: BEST DIM SUM IN LAS VEGAS! Everything was delicious. Some of the items did take a while to come to our table, however it was fresh and hot.

Gw_drd1JI_9lwyK5AvWdaw.text: A tad pricey for a dim sum place but plenty of great food options! I ordered around 10 dishes and my total came out to be around $50ish. Compared to NYC dimsum, this place isn't ... that great. What makes up for it though is the great service and quickness in which the food arrives! I highly recommend ordering the fried sticky rice. I never had sticky rice that was "fried" but now I'm on a search for that in NYC. I DO NOT recommend the xiao long bao because it was a measly portion of 3 mini bao's that had the flavor of cardboard. My boyfriend liked the egg plant stuffed with fish paste dish so I recommend that. Lastly, they charge $1.00 per person for tea (which surprised me because in NYC tea comes for free!) Nevertheless, they have many tea options (black, red, chrysanthemum etc.) They're open until about 10:30pm, so if you're craving late night dimsum this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

Oq2rxtqxwwEt5-K0wjXIVg.text: I was pleasantly surprised how good this place is. Friendly staff, they'll make you items on the menu, but not on the carts. Lunch for 2 was $20, so you can't go wrong with that.  I'm so used to Ping Pang Pong that I've neglected this place for years. I plan on going back again soon.

8HMAiXytJh-gF4pOaAkO_g.text: This is easily the best spot in town for dim-sum. All of the food is very fresh and always comes out piping hot.  My favorites are the shrimp dumplings, shrimp and pork shumai, and the bbq beef buns (steamed). My gf is a big fan of the fish-stuffed tofu and the stir fried noodles.   The service is not the best, but it's not terrible. The prices are also pretty good. Most items are $3-$5.   Overall a great casual spot for delicious dim sum.

2GC7pGGjtIhTNgPjVTvTTg.text: Wow! Thank you Yelp for another great find. This place is a pretty big restaurant, but the food is SO good. What I loved is everything is made to order. They have meat substitutes for vegetarians (easily labeled), seafood for pescatarians, and many meat options. We didn't have one bad dish. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back! Yum yum yum!

1Oj6BG4Evljj4xZbpWqRXQ.text: I was craving dim sum this morning and instead of driving to Chinatown I decided to check this place out...  The food was suuuuuuper good!!! As you can see in the photos I got 9 different plates and my total was just under 40 bucks!!!! That's fricken awesome!!! My fave was the spare ribs , the rice noodle thing with beef and some type of soy sauce, and the sticky rice...  I was super impressed on the customer service... for once I could actually communicate with the servers and they weren't pushy like other dim sum places... every single worker in there was extremely friendly and provided exceptional service.  I will def be back and I'll bring my whole tribe with me next time hehe...   GO CHECK THiS PLACE OUt!!!

-_a6JNNNUugNQRX3QVWROw.text: I've been craving dim sum for awhile and decided to give this place a try. We ordered the Shrimp and Beef Rice Noodles, Chicken Feet, Roti, Siu Mai, and Shrimp Balls. Everything was pretty good, but I've definitely had better shrimp and beef rice noodle. Those dishes came out a bit cold, the rice noodles were a little thicker than usual, and the shrimps were also smaller compared to other places.  However, the shrimp balls were better than other places. It was really big and crispy. They paired it with this spicy orange mayonnaise sauce instead of the tradition sweet and sour red sauce.  The service was pretty good and dim sum is available all day. However, they only roll around the hot carts in the morning, so don't come late if you want the full experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Beef Rice Noodles, Chicken Feet, Roti, Siu Mai, and Shrimp Balls

mLIk5ECSjmC1VxqsvNbMsg.text: Great staff and good food. We had some "miscommunication" with the waiter but that only speaks to the authenticity of the restraint. Great place to have dinner with friends or have a family gathering. They did forget some of the items we ordered and they were out of something but didn't tell us and we didn't find out until the bill was brought out to us.

lhhAX567gMGFRn9S2oueng.text: It's hard to find good authentic Chinese food in Las Vegas, let alone dim sum; however, Yum Cha was great! I wish I knew about this restaurant sooner.   The service was great. Everyone was very attentive. I literally looked up from the menu for one second and the waiter was over to ask if I wanted to put in an order. It's no secret that many Chinese restaurants usually don't have the best customer service sometimes but I really enjoyed my experience here. For being prime time for dim sum, it was fairly slow but it was a Tuesday morning.  The menu included several options and offered detailed photos of the food items. I was impressed that some classic dim sum entrees offered a chicken or pork option (siu mai). We ordered the chicken siu mai, har gao (shrimp dumplings), char siu bao (pork buns), har cheung (shrimp noodle rolls with sauce), and the egg custard buns (which were ginormous, the photo in the menu was not an exaggeration). I'm picky when it comes to dim sum, but everything was very fresh and delicious! My eyes were far hungrier than my stomach and I really wanted the egg tarts and mango pudding, but that's something I'll have to try next time.   The restaurant was very clean and you had a clear view of the kitchen area.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: Har gao - Top Middle: Har Cheung - Bottom Middle: Chicken Siu Mai - Right: Char Siu Bao

_XY9xmGhNo3r2lwM7Hen8w.text: This place has the BEST dim sum in town!! I have been here multiple times and I'm never disappointed. Everything is made fresh after ordering and it comes out steaming hot. The staff is always so kind an attentive. The third week of November 2018 they will be starting a new menu with more dim sum choices and vegetarian and vegan dim sum, with vegan entrees. We are so excited! If I could give 10 Stars, I would. UPDATE: The new menu is beautiful, we ordered some new items, and more of our favorite items. The owner gave us a delicious complimentary dessert. I couldn't be more impressed! Can't wait for next time.

BRoH8AVTPYRnzEWt2R6EzQ.text: Great Dim Sum. I went in the middle of then afternoon, when they weren't very busy, but everything was prepared fresh and service was fast. I can only imagine how popular this place is on weekend mornings.  The traditional dim sum dishes were excellent, and there were other Chinese dishes to order from the menu. Overall, probably the best I've had in Las Vegas, and very moderately priced.

PzqS9XPzj0CvVCS0w6W28A.text: 8/18/18 hmmm, this place is expensive. We wanted to try this place out because it was along the way to where our appt was at. Again, Yelp reviews rated 4 stars. We ordered shrimp/pork shumai x2, tendon x3, fried taro x2, crispy pork belly, tripe, and an order of rice cake. Almost $50. Tendons were awesome, fried taro was lacking flavor, and crispy pork wasn't crispy. I think I'll stick to Orchids...Dim sum all day! Happy eats!!

QrwKPPxf4CxLPBgP1Ioqew.text: Chicken feet were delicious, good seasoning and cooked for a long enough time so that the part that we eat falls off the bones. I was excited to try the baked lava buns as everyone was raving about it but tbh i was not impressed. It was too sweet and the lava was not as lava-y as i expected. Shrimp stuffed eggplants (not pictured) were quite yummy and unique

B4X-opWAnwUh4hPSgYGEVA.text: This place was an all day Dim Sum in Vegas. When we walked in, it was about 2-3pm on a Thursday. Only us and another table. You walk in and can see the kitchen right away. The staff was very friendly.  Place is huge w lots of space and TVs everywhere.  Menu was pretty decent so we ordered a few dishes to try out.  Dim sum wasn't bad, but don't order off the menu. I ordered the Hai NaN Chicken dish, which I've had very many times before. I was disappointed w this one. Rice had a really weird flavor, chicken was dry, and the two sauces were bland. This was a $10+ Dish too. I only ate the bok choy that was served w it and left the whole plate untouched. My hubby tired the chicken and agreed on how dry it was.  If you come here, stick w the dim sum. It was not bad, but since I've had PPP, I feel that this place is beneath them. One thing was kind of gross: one of the wait staff stood in the corner, scratched her scalp, picked her nose, and then went on to set out the plates, bowls and silverware for the tables.  :-/  Never saw her wash her hands.

XVCOKI-0obsDGP1eYZU6-A.text: I'm giving 2 stars due to their dim sum tasting pretty good. However, like the other people complaining our bill included tip already but it suggested to tip on top of that. Very confusing and we probably paid $20+ more every time until we noticed the last 2 times we went.  The price for the dim sum plates are pretty expensive as well. My family is used to paying close to half the price in SoCal.  We've gone here multiple times, but felt the bill was more expensive than what we're used to pay for dim sum.   Also, it feels like an old food court inside.  That being said, if you're craving for dim sum and in the neighborhood, you'll get tasty dim sum here!

2_zmoSRgipPqjO0HlecgCw.text: Came here expecting bustling action but maybe week day, only 4 tables. They do have carts being pushed around. The food quality was not so good. Chicken feet and Beef tendons were pretty oily. Too soft on texture. The larva pineapple bun was huge. Though maybe others like it but I find it too big because there is at least 1/2 cup of oily egg yolk ooozing out of it. Not a very healthy bun. Maybe smaller size better. The service was terrific though.

EzyntA0IjgpT_d7ifvQVCw.text: Food was pretty good and the price is reasonable for Dim Sum. Im a tuff critic on Dim Sum since I've eaten in so many restaurants. The wrapped stick rice did not have any taste. But the overall experience was very good. The food temp was on point and the staff was helpful.

FQQRgReBgI3F8G7YA4bP3Q.text: The food was very salty everything from the shumai to the spareribs was overly salted. Also pretty expensive... Not Asian approved

XKZg4iFYYe8vihF-1nBpXg.text: The food is both varied and delicious. The restaurant is spotless and the servers are friendly.   If you arrive after 230, there are no carts out but all that means is that you can order anything you want and it will be made fresh   Make sure you try the lava tart for dessert as it is delicious.

AbOo8rI848ZlPA5W2z37QQ.text: craving for some authentic Chinese food after days of buffet at the strips. This place is actually very nice, clean. The owners is super friendly. Good service :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K6mrjz2uBF7HT6PFCu-9Lg.text: Came in for lunch this time, so got to experience the carted service.  9 tables occupied and two server carts from Sam and Co (no Elaine present, sorry I missed you).  I was skeptical that the food quality might suffer for the sake of convenience vs coming at night where food is made to order, but at 11:45, everything was hot and delicious.  The dumplings were NOT sticking to the tins as I was fearing, and my sesame balls with mung bean were crisp on the outside, not too oily, and nice and gooey and chewy on the inside.  Regular Dim Sum items are reduced to $2.98/ea Tues-Fri, so that was a pleasant surprise!  Great experience all around once again!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu showing Tues-Fri special pricing on regular Dim Sum items.

nyrp9Xrjh757a9xmGHiT8g.text: Review as we eat! Basic dim sum! Nothing spectacular at all.. Not one item stood out from any other dim sum restaurant. I'll have to try other vegas spots to see how it compares but I'm definitely not fond of this place

XAxx8_g8-B9747yqPFmMCA.text: So disappointed. Food is not fresh even on made to order items. Don't waste your time. Decor isn't worth it either as it looks better in photos than in person. Service was worse than the bad food. 8 people and they charged me a $40 tip on a $250 bill for sole service. They charge per can of soda. Go to Chang's or Orchid Gardens. I'd give negative stars if it were possible.  I know good dim sum and this is not it!

yQZEESBZEqUoO_q4R57XBg.text: Service was fast and friendly, food price was reasonable, dim sum came out in a timely manner- and tastes great.

AD-0KqzWQWdKJHp9G3m4mA.text: Well, food was just ok, hit and miss dim sum. Slow traffic inside. Was glad they had dim sum in Vegas but we probably won't be back again. We also ordered fried tofu that took them a long time to prepare but it was a big disappointment. Whoever made the fried tofu didn't know how to cook. Even my husband, who never complains about most food, said that it was pretty bad. But the manager did take it off the bill.

332kS_dJkkximaNsTncyMg.text: good chicken feet and sticky rice wrap in lotus leaf. i ordered the eggplant but it was not seasoned really well, the shrimp paste inside the eggplant was good tho!

x_jMl9QuKiGUQnIjfA22xQ.text: Dim sim was not bad or great. It was just so so. There was no wow factor. I had the fish rice porridge, and it was bland. I gave it 2 stars instead of 3 because the service wasnt all that great.

9gXOEryLgQS2eP9WnPO3QQ.text: Place is great! The dim sum here is really good! Served really hot and fresh! I would prefer here than Orchids. Service is better and the  place seems more modern and spacious. The food off the dim sum menu was great too! Didnt take too long for us to get our food to arrive to the table.

k1JUuSLZBdY9qvQXfnY8Og.text: Have been looking for a dim sum place to eat in Vegas since we first tried one in Sedona.    Yum Cha was clean, the staff was attentive and answered all our questions, which were many and the food was so so good.  There were many items to pick from on the menu besides dim sum.  Some of our favorites we had were the fried eggplant with a sweet sesame seed sauce, chicken wings, egg tarts, bar-b-que pork steamed buns, and shrimp dumplings.  We will be back to try other items, especially the duck.

scBldZf-npqsX49ZnrM9PQ.text: Made to order dim sum, open till 10:30pm. Great authentic flavors. Great customer service not like other Chinese restaurants I've been to. Found this place on yelp, thanks yelp! Everything we ordered was on point! Will definitely be my new go to dim sum restaurant! So many other things to try, can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Course I had to order the sesame balls! Red bean custard inside, must try!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tendon, melts in your mouth.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet! Great flavors!

MIzODg4Nknetn14pEptQPg.text: When going to the office I stop here for a quick bite. Service is quick and the staff is friendly. Usually only one cart rolling around but you can order any type of dim sum and it comes out fast and hot. It's not the best but it's better than the most.

FyiZOIbZdP1khIWF_nR2RQ.text: This place is so nice and really good!! Food always fresh and hot! I love how the inside of the place and the stuff is so friendly and nice! My new favorite Dim Sum place.

UpdTpnjJhGBcqMCtGJRdsQ.text: This place is ok if you are in a budget and want to get the same amount. The place was beautiful and clean with an open area. The food was good, I would say, slightly above average compared to the majority. The price was very reasonable, and I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

AWoksxY1RPD0hn77sjbtKg.text: This is my new to go to for my dimsum  craving, chicken feet tender is very falling off the bone, clean place, staff are friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eIS_NcI8mPTezyDeSD_RTg.text: I was here one time after going to the gym... they have good food. It took a little while to get some of the fried dumpling tho so that sucked but for the most part it was a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry fish ball soup w egg noodles, and pot stickers

oy0iH6F9Zi786VoAQ5nZ1w.text: Dim sum prepared fresh (not on carts) during non lunch hours. Pretty good but I've had much better. Pork belly seemed like fried pork chop chunks, not really pork belly. Good, but I was craving pork belly. Ordered a side of white rice & asked for water, in addition to my hot tea. Neither showed up. Asked if I wanted anything else when the check was dropped. Ummmm... yes I would have liked water & rice with my meal. Food was ok but service not so good. Maybe an off day for them.

EWRlGun2AuJCy7-w9GZUrg.text: Came on Christmas Day hoping for good dim sum. This place didn't have much variety and it seems that they're not prepared for busy days. We asked for sprite and the guy didn't know what that was. We asked another person and she didn't know what we were asking for. We could see from our table the green can and tried to just say green can and they told us that was tea. Hummm... my husband walked up there to get it by pointing.  There was one nice guy working who helped us to get what we wanted food wise from what they did have available as the carts had only 2-3 items at a time and the same stuff kept passing. Food is better at dim sum cafe or orchid garden. Probably Will not return.

0Q4bcbx8HqCC6hIDfyDavQ.text: There was 5 of us, 3 adults and 2 kids. Wanted to give this place a try, and it was a regret.  Price: We ordered just about the normal amount we do for dim sum at any other dim sum restaurant. But our bill came out DOUBLE what we usually would pay, averaging $4.25 per item. That is expensive!  Taste: As mentioned earlier, we ordered the items we normally do from other places. Steam Pork Ribs () was tough and lack flavor. Fried Taro Dumpling ()didn't have flavor and was extremely greasy. Curry Fish ball () was frozen fish ball in curry paste soup, not chewy like it should be. Beef Stew () was flavorless as well. Ovetall, it was a great disappointment.  Atmosphere: The restaurant was a bit dim, but acceptable. Unfortunately, there is very little ventilation, the front door was kept open, no A/C which means summer will be horrible inside there. Lastly, many flies inside, a few kept going around our food.  Husband said, this will be out first and last time here.  Price for value was bad, price for quality was also bad.

2kr7pyqSPKnCfmQqRfE2Rg.text: This is the best Dim Sum we've had in the entire Las Vegas valley. We are from Orange County and have finally found a place to our liking. The food is flavorful, the staff is very attentive, and the restaurant is very clean.  The steamed items are served on the carts. The other items, such as shrimp balls, chow mein,  sweet buns, etc, are ordered from the kitchen. So, everything comes out fresh and hot. The strategy is to put in the order for those first, and then get the items from the cart. You have to try the egg tarts--tart shell is flaky and custard is nice and light. They are close to the strip, by the New Orleans hotel, and you don't have to deal with the crazy traffic in the Spring Mountain area. I wish you all happy stomachs.

iiwpu5zck4_XyZhsnojfOQ.text: All day dim sum! Customer service was great. The kitchen area is open so you can watch them steam your xiao long bao.

sogNf44P8kmZDdgCdST8gQ.text: Been here a few times, and never a disappointment. Every dish we have tried is fantastic.  Our regular Chinese spot closed down so we were on the hunt for a new one we liked as much as that last one. Finally, we have found it! Definitely recommend this place, you will leave satisfied!

dfkjIOh3RvvRrKDrdQEneQ.text: The owner was very accommodating for my party and the quality of food was exceptionally good for dim sum in Las Vegas! would definitely come back again!

nWyuXJEWa_h1KN_rGPiWhg.text: Super good! Delicious and fresh. Great service, the workers are fast and the facility is spacious. Would go again!

xsQTCcRHKTVucCWgwg5EfA.text: Once again this place doesn't disappoint! Every time we come from San Diego we always have to stop by here. This is my kids favorite place to eat and that's a big thing here in Vegas. They have a wide selection of dim sum and regular Chinese food as well. They have a new menu that includes vegan dim sum and vegetarian dishes that's made out of soy bean that are absolutely delicious! You have to try this place out! I would give it 10 stars if I could!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9E1jG2haPJ2HQ39BWc1ARw.text: Great Dim Sum place!   The staff is friendly, and their customer service is great!   All of the items we chose from the cart were fresh and delicious. We ordered some shrimp noodle and fried wonton shrimp, and they were freshly cooked.   We didn't order any specialty items this time around but we probably will next time we come to have dim sum.

wQmB0sUaUmDazitYKLGZwQ.text: Yummy yum!  There are many spicy Chinese restaurants are around this area, yet we wanted not spicy Chinese food.  And this was perfect. A little too sweet on everything. Sticky rice in lotus leaves was really good!

RTMyfFGnzaOKFcZbu5WHsA.text: Very yummy!! Very fresh and service is prompt and nice! Food is so delicious - taro dumplings!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kJj_6X9I5LerdzzchATSfA.text: At long last, I can have dim sum for dinner!   I can't always go when most dim sum is offered at restaurants and sometimes, I only crave it for dinner, so my family and I are so glad that we found Yum Cha.   The location is easily accessible (short drive from Henderson or the strip) and the restaurant is very clean. They have TVs all around showing food shows and the news but the sound is off so it's not distracting. The food shows are pretty interesting (showing different food from Asia).  The staff has been really friendly each time and very attentive.  During the day (lunch) their dim sum is available via push carts (steamed items) while other items are made fresh to order. At dinner time, everything is fresh to order! They also have a full Chinese menu for the non-dim sum fans. Once again, this is perfect for my picky family.  Our favorite dim sum items are: Siu mai (pork and shrimp) Pork ribs in black bean sauce Potstickers Pork buns Beef tripe  We have also tried their sweet and sour pork and fried rice from their regular menu and both were really good and better than other we have eaten elsewhere.  They also have noodle soups and duck on the menu.  I definitely recommend Yum Cha to anyone who loves dim sum (especially for dinner) and for anyone looking for Chinese food. It's worth the drive.

TVgY5TIs3iYAOZ3F8t2gVQ.text: Decided to eat out on New Years eve and was excited to find somewhere that was open with such great ratings. I took quite a few friends from the Philippines here and we enjoyed an array of delicious dim sum and other dishes. Among those was a house specialty steamed custard buns and steamed shrimp wontons. The staff was very friendly and took the time to explain the dishes that make their restaurant special, including how they make every curry dish from scratch. Next time I'm in vegas again I will definitely visit here again.

fG_iJmJUR2OyK9ntjoOlig.text: I've eaten a lot of dim sum in a lot of places, but this is the best I've ever had - a little unusual to have it made to order, but everything was fresh, hot, and perfect. Extremely impressive.

MzJxsyacwEl-00fmL418ZQ.text: A surprise in Vegas. We were in Vegas for a family vacation and wanted dim sum but didn't think I was going to find anything good. Looked on Yelp and found this place. It was such a great treat. The steamed dishes were bought over in a dim sum cart (right away) for your choosing and the baked dishes or entrees were bought over per order by a waiter. The food very good, the service was quick and friendly.  A definite find in Vegas!

67vTZuOCoP0cSvntTNTeUw.text: The service was good but the food was sub-par. As the first dim sum place I have had in Vegas, I wished the experience was much better. The place is itself is nothing to rave about. I only came here as for convenience in location.  The selection was sub par. The har gow and shu mai was not very fresh tasting. Few times in my life have I not finished a dish and their har gow was one. The skin was not chewy with a nice bite. It was thick and almost stale. I enjoyed their taro dumplings but it was filled grease (grease residue means it was not sat out to let it seep through before serving).  I really wish the dim sum was spectacular but unfortunately it was not.

qzraVdQqWJG_FXqN7EfxeQ.text: About a year ago, we came here for dim sum and all the staff were friendly especially Elaine. She was very nice and helpful. We ordered shrimp rice noodle and Elaine added some dried or crispy garlic on top for us. It was so good and it made us want to go back for that lol. Other than that, all of the other food were good.   Today, a year later, we came back again for shrimp rice noodle and for Elaine. Thanks Elaine for all the food recommendation

V_NW54v99VSPkuVooqB8ZA.text: Food was really good! I'm semi SLC and the prices here were a lot better! We got 8 dim sum dishes to share between the two of us and we were full. It cost us about $33. The shumai was the star of the show! Highly recommended that dish! The service was great as well. We were greeted and seated very quickly and had food in front of us within a minute! We were surprised and happy! This is now our go to spot in Vegas whenever we pass through!

zkHe6dwHr7Hb9rXW4VClBg.text: I like this place.  It's quick, efficient, and isn't crazy expensive.  I took my parents here and they liked it too.

c-W9GAuHO5_vM9mD5UVQhg.text: Wonderful dim sum place - probably my new favorite. There is plenty of parking and plenty of seating. They bring around carts just like any dim sum place but with the picture menu I now know the names of the things I'm pointing to! I also love that the fried food is made-to-order - it came out piping hot!

h_XoFe8Kj9Hy-3ZZ5oePRw.text: This restaurant is my weekend Dim Sum on the fly kind of place, they have fresh, variety and tasty Dim Sum. They also have regular Chinese food. Great service, moderately priced. They have ample parking, wheelchair access.  This is a good size restaurant and and nicely managed. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

lMCvRa86RezIvUTAqUrgTw.text: The food is absolutely gross, I'm from LA and I'm telling you this place not close to half freshness dimsum place. Lack of service, ordered 2 chicken feet but only got 1 order, no one ever came to check on us and we had to ask again. Also, 15% auto tipped on my card for 2 ppl, how dare you to do this when you have a sign that says 15% gratuity will be added for 4 ppl and more?!

ksxQnyVGZ3juUlO646MVqg.text: Food is very tasty. I really love their shu Mai, chicken feet, pork and veggies rolls, shrimp rice noodles and the sweet tofu dessert.   However, I think it's a little pricier than other dim sum places I've been to. One thing to note that I never get full with dim sum, it's just really a snack for me. Of course, chicken feet can't make a dent in your belly. It probably costs you more energy to work with all the bones. The main reason is that I get tired of chewing a lot, so I stop ordering more food. So if you are expecting to get full, you should order something with high carb.   Service is okay, or maybe we were a big group of 20, so the waitress was very confused. The restaurant itself is clean, looks like new. It doesn't really have smell of food all over the place. This is really good for an Asian brunch. I would want to come back.

2OnBwtes0SVlslkAnqWpzQ.text: Rude wait staff. Was going to Underdtand its busy long weekend. But first bite of hagaw.. was fronzen pieces of shrimp. Raw shrimp. Picture to follow

MOPsq7ymuf9OVwnm-50oKw.text: First timers here, and it was great!!! Customer service was good, we had our drunks refilled the whole time we were there. Dim Sum cart was always stocked with hot food. They also have a separate food counter that serves different foods aside from the Dim Sum. It was the first time trying Roti... 2  up.  I really hope this business stays open longer than the other businesses before them. Love the location, so close to home.

VX8MIc6x86IxqPCfS3xV-w.text: I've seen this dim sum restaurant plenty of times when I leave the International store because it's just across the street. I finally gave Yum Cha a try last Saturday because I felt like some dim sum for lunch. I arrived right when it opened so it wasn't at all busy.  I ordered some general tso's chicken,  shrimp dumplings,  and pork dumplings to go. I wasn't expecting it to cost a lot but it was around 18 dollars!   It was 18 bucks but I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of food you get. I got the normal 4 pieces each of the dim sum,  but the general tao's chicken was a large helping!  I think I had it for dinner in two or three nights. It was all delicious!

E4G_nD8Iz9cMeaT9z54TFA.text: We celebrated my sister's bday here yesterday. Although we were hoping for dim sum...it's only available during lunch. I wish I knew this ahead of time. We had dinner around 6:30. We ordered so many different dishes. The food quality was excellent. The flavor was great as well. But if they served dim sum from opening to close, it's a great possibility the restaurant would be pack with customers. The restaurant is still new and very clean. The ladies room was very clean as well.  The server explained to us that only a few of them can speak English, the rest spoke Chinese (Cantonese). So we sat in her station. She was very nice and attentive even though we were a group of eight. Next time we'll definitely be there during lunch hours for dim-sum.

x87jqoMVdP62fyiIHWnQdQ.text: Great selection of dim sum, very good service.  The lava buns were definitely better in the steamed version than the fried ones.  The dim sum offered from the carts were nice and hot, better than the dishes ordered directly from menu.

azAL9fIuFgVI6VqTw79U-w.text: Came here for dinner on a Friday night. This passed Friday night actually and upon getting there, there was probably two other tables with guests. By the end of dinner, it was a busier house. Employees were very kind and frequently checked on us. We came for the dim sum and it was our first visit there. We got many items from the dim sum menu... I believe a solid 8 items at the very least and had 2 items from the entree menu. I was glad they had a full menu of items outside of dim sums. I believe the price points were between $3.90 (sumtin) and $6 (sumtin) for the dim sums. The items were as fresh as you can get and it was helpful that you could view half of the kitchen area from the seating area. Overall, one of the better places to get dim sum in comparison to the other places in town.

iDjgk2zcZ5ND9tJO094Ysw.text: For what it is, it is great. Dim Sum is my comfort food. I come to Las Vegas 2-3 times a year. I always make this one of my stops. Coming from San Francisco, I've had a lot of Dim Sum. At Yum Cha we get fast, efficient and pretty good dim sum. I like it so I can get my fix quickly and inexpensively.

WbMl-YRHtD5hwwjsnCT6Aw.text: My new favorite dim sum place! They have all my favorites and would be a good place for the unacquainted (the special dim sum menu has pictures). Everyone was so nice, and the food was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q478TRyRDzNCAArDhkb4HA.text: For my first time here it was really good! Service was wonderful. No complaints what so ever. Dim sum was SO GOOD.

-Hq9ckVzJekTOTZzWynRlQ.text: Came for brunch with the girlfriend. Thanks to my traditional Chinese roots, I've had the pleasure of consuming egregious amounts of dim sum in my past. This is definitely one of the better places. Service was good and while most dishes were frozen, they were well steamed and had the correct sauces. The ones that were fresh made in house were great as well. Out of the 11 dishes we got, here are my three favorite and three least favorites.   Three favorites:  1) Beef tendon - Fresh and tender. Sauce was on point  2) Lotus Leaf Wrap: Savory & tasty. Good rice to meet ratio  3) Tea: We got chrysanthemum. Ask for rock sugar.   Three least favorite:  1) Shrimp dumpling: A little cold - nothing special. Tasted like the frozen ones you can get at an Asian super market.  2) Roti Canai: Bread not flakey, curry was average.  3) Fried Taro Buns: To fried. Taro inside was good but not a lot of filling.   Overall, while there were things I didn't as much, everything tasted good or great. Definitely come here if your craving some authentic dim sum.

o4xSoSp_U7EvaagNobCGQw.text: Yum cha? Yum-my! Yum cha means dim-sum in Chinese fyi.  Ever since this building was BJ's buffet, I never wanted to come near it again. But for Father's Day, my brother and I decided to go with Chinese food and suspected all the other places to be packed. Yum cha was not busy at all during lunch time on a holiday... which was cool with me 'cause the dim sum carts came rolling in real quick.  We had a bunch of different dishes- steamed pork ribs, two different shu Mai, bean curd, tofu, various dumplings, & rice paper rolls. Not bad, although I'd skip the pork next time. All of these dim sum options are $2.99. Not expensive either, compared to other dim sums near the area (I'm looking at you, Chang's!!).  Spacious and open dining area. You can walk right up to the open food bar. The owner walked me through it an pointed out each item and suggested the curry roti, which is picture-popular on Yelp. I regret not trying it now. I did try the fried shrimp balls (kinda too oily) and pork ears, which was the most flavorful dish we had. This one was seran-wrapped behind the glass display, and I think they just microwaved it before bringing it out. Wish it were fresher! They did charge for tea which I found surprising, as most Asian restaurants do not, but it wasn't much. Also about $2 for a tiny bowl of rice. My father liked it so much that he brought visiting family to try it a few days later, who all enjoyed it too.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean curd
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork- least fave of what we tried
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy shu Mai

ELWpn63JsiHk9_VzYAMBzQ.text: Great service with great food! My husband and I  actually went to the restaurant twice on our Las Vegas trip. We will definitely come back again when we visit Las Vegas again in the future. P/S the lava custard bun is so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xPt-hu1P6Wxf7T2x1FYgIQ.text: Cheap fast tasty dim sum, at a place that has outstanding customer service, which is really rare for an authentic Chinese place.  The people here are very nice and attentive, the dishes are $2.88 (mon-fri) $3.28 (sat-sun and holidays) same dishes $3.98, $4.98, $5.98 for other dishes depending on what it is.  Everything was fresh, I came in at 3pm on a Sunday, so the carts had stopped, but I could order anything from the counter  The food had a good balance, the flavors were well balanced.  Definitely worth your time to check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickens feet, pork dumpling, shrimp dumping, shrimp noodle, bbq bun, and fried shrimp...nom nom nom

R0jYsL7nO3_Lc23sZY8brw.text: This place is on point!!! We are from Hong Kong so naturally very critical of dim sum. We tried some other places in LV but this is the best. Superb service and the food taste like home... Location is great as well only a very short drive from the strip. We came around lunch hour and the food stays fresh on the carts. They also have a hot plate bar where they pan sear taro cakes as ordered so it was very fresh. My parents are elderly and they find the seasoning just right. Just the fact that we could communicate with the servers and owner/manager is simply like home. We are coming back for dinner service to get a better idea! Bring an empty tummy!  We went for dinner and it was amazing as well! The salt and chili pepper fried shrimp is perfect! And the  slow cooked pork belly is definitely well seasoned! The food here is not greasy or too heavy on salt so you won't need a nap afterwards! Two things are very impressive here if you're Cantonese: the steamed egg was exactly done right, smooth in texture and not tough,BB; the other was stir fried beef and rice noodles , ,!  traditional Chinese cooking!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed eggplant! Very clean flavor, you can tell the stuffing was homemade!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 干炒牛河，真係至愛...
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 牛雜超tender... 炆得夠！

3QMns-Ff_fIiuZlkedrmTg.text: Read abouth the good reviews about this new dimsum place in town. And they were right we like almost all weve ordered like chicken feet, fish ball, pork siomai, congee, hongkong style fried noodle, pork bun, sesame ball. Also they have new item in the menu pork sung bun which is good too. Roti and taro cake is fine but not a fan of it maybe because we are not used eating these. Good customer service, big space, parking lot is ok too. Will definitely be back!

MI4z_ypbP64LsR1ktxbzeA.text: Went here for my birthday (today) for lunch with my significant other and the space itself is very large and has a nice look to it on the inside.   Service is very friendly as compared to majority of Chinese restaurants.   Dim Sum Cart doesn't run after 2:30 which was a bummer but understandable.   When we walked in it smelt a bit like sewage which sucked but further in near the window the scent was gone.   Food was very good which definitely makes up for any of the drawbacks of this place. We order the chicken fried rice and many of the dim sum plates. BOMB SAUCE

yA2t1gIcEEaG6cuI3Pk0qw.text: Awesome Dim Sum and by far the friendliest staff I've ever encountered at a Dim Sum place. (Although I might miss the old ladies yelling at me).   Spotlessly clean, super good mustard, delicious dim sum cooked to order!  Will be back!

6dPaRYpJ8QWKlAAGvhw9LA.text: Great service and food! I love the chicken shumai and the soup dumplings. Comfortable seating and excellent dim sum experience.   I do wish they had more soup dumplings to choose from.  I will be back!

lZnumaAqy7OfzlUZXzZprw.text: Warning! This is not a real dim sum restaurant. I was fooled by the yelp ratings and pictures. I think they might pay some service to write fake reviews like amazon has fake reviews. Because by just looking at the pictures and reading the reviews I was expecting it to be at least decent but by the end of the meal I was feeling grossed out. The dim sum tasted old, like it was frozen packaged food from China. Everything was mushy and had an off flavor.  -pork spare ribs had mushy texture and a foul smell. -shrimp noodle sauce was totally off in flavor. -shumai was also mushy and tasted horrible.  -pork balls were super greasy and had a strange mushy filling.  -salt and pepper squid had a thick coating that seemed like it was packaged frozen food that they fried up and sprinkled lots of msg on. -Chinese broccoli- this was the only thing that was edible and seemed to be made fresh.   There was so much food leftover because we couldn't stomach eating anymore. I seriously think they steam and fry up frozen packaged dim sum. I've had dim sum at many places good and bad but I must say this was by far the worst.

9VgznXrGeK9myR9Aypeypg.text: We came here right when they open and there was no wait.    They offered many dim sum items just like any other dim sum restaurants.  You order from a slip and they will bring it out to your table.  Everything came out hot.  We enjoyed our breakfast and were not disappointed with our orders.    Service: good.   Parking: plenty at the plaza.  **come early to avoid the wait**

ApOTycOFeW0rbVB8HyzEFA.text: We were out and about exploring Vegas when we had a sudden craving for Dim Sum.  So I tell my son to Yelp the nearest one, and this place popped up. It's located in a strip mall at Decatur and Tropicana, next to a Walgreens. There is plenty of parking and you can't miss it from the street.   We went inside, it was around 1530 (that's 3:30 pm) LOL. The space was huge, with plenty of seating, but because of the time, there was hardly anyone there eating. We were greeted by a friendly face and seated right away. It's not your ordinary dim sum place as food items are ordered off of the menu. Our eyes got kinda greedy and we ordered a bunch of stuff from the get go.  It was kind of a wait, maybe because they make it as you order.   Everything was good, but I probably will not order the Chicken Shumai and Beef Short Ribs next time. The shumai was kinda rubbery and the beef ribs DID NOT look like the picture. I was actually dreading it.  My advice is if you are contemplating ordering more, I suggest you order half way through your first order. All in all the experience was good.  Very friendly wait staff.

spYEm8IT2NNedE8upRfdCg.text: This place is a traditional dim sum restaurant. The atmosphere is very quiet but welcoming. The employees speak both Cantonese and Mandarin so if you are from China they would understand you. The price is a bit expensive but since it's a tourist area the price does take a hit. Overall the food is great and the service is very attentive.

Lb7C_YnoqoR5mkZHkv96uw.text: Dropped in for a small taste of dim sum. Me and my 4yr old shared the egg drop soup which she loved. The bbq pork balls were delish! We also had the pork and chicken shu mai as well as ribs... everything was fresh and hot. Will definitely be returning. P.S took some to go :p

BiK7rs0N7m19-lb8immD-A.text: Another spot found on yelp. Like most dim sum place here, it's off the strip. This one was just outside the China town area in a strip mall. What caught me was that they offered dim sum all day long. It's a big restaurant. What differs them from others place is everything is ordered off the menu. It helps with pictures as well. Versus the ladies walking from table to tables with their carts. There's also the counter where you could actually see the dishes before hand and know what your ordering.  We went for a selections of dishes. Classic shu mai, dumpling, pork bun, congee, spare ribs, to the infamous chicken feet. Not my choice as I don't eat them. Portions is ok, some order smaller than others. Some dishes were great, shu mai, pork bun. Others were ok. Overall, service was great and the staff was very helpful with ordering.  Heads up, they add tip your bill before hand. Tip was added to our bill of four people. Then there's a selection below giving options to adding the percentage of tips as well. So if you don't catch it, you'll double tip. We mentioned it to the lady and she told us it's the credit card machine layout. Who knows, just heads up.

qk2xoNhN7RanCGkSvE4kGg.text: Came on a Saturday evening. It wasn't too busy. Customer service was ok. Our food took awhile to come out and we were missing a few items. We ordered a lot of different food such as the shrimp roll noodles, beef roll noodles, Shumai,chicken feet, Chinese broccoli, crispy pork belly, cream cheese wonton, pork buns and a few other items. The crispy pork belly was not worth the money. It was upgraded to a larger size because the server told us the regular serving was very small so with the upgrade it was about $17 and still the plate itself was small :/  overall our bill came out to $205 including the tip for a group of 9. I wanted to try their egg custards but I was so full overall.

zcKoOO6zGgn5CerQgTYbLw.text: This is my go to place for dim sum in Vegas. The staff here is always attentive, which makes for a fast dining experience, and the dim sum is served all day, so you have the pleasure of enjoying fresh made dim sum either breakfast, lunch or dinner.  When you first walk into the restaurant, it's definitely a lot larger inside than it looks from the outside. They have a little over a dozen tables, so you do get seated right away, which is always a plus especially if you're a bit hangry.  When you sit down, the waitress immediately takes your drink order and return promptly to take your order.  I am a dim sum creature of habit, so I usually order the same dim sum: pork and shrimp siu mai, chive cakes, shrimp dumplings, chicken feet, roti and curry, Xiao bao (soup dumplings) and shrimp rice roll! It is always made to order and it is delicious.   The price is great too! I can eat to ultimate fullness and only spend about $12-$14. They also have a Chinese food menu, but I have not had the chance to try it yet as I never make it pass the dim sum.  I highly recommend this place! Til next time Yum Cha!

xwD3rawVhUgbZXycMPdSDQ.text: We chose this place thanks to yelp. It was amazing. The service was great. The food was freshly prepared from the visible kitchen. We saw several multi generation families there enjoying dinner. There was a wide variety of dim sum to chose from. The soups and entrees were outstanding.   I hope to visit them again soon.

qATdMnq6ED-FwIkYMeszEQ.text: Dim sum, is dim sum, and this place was no different. Super empty when we went, with maybe 1 other table that showed up when we were there. Had 2 maybe 3 different carts of steamed dim sum options. Also had a menu of things you could order from the back. Had all of your typical dim sum options like chicken feet, pork buns, turnip cakes, etc. Everything was done well and service was fine. Nothing really stood out in a good or bad way. Would go back!

PaxBQ5dn2gxMIttM-x_Y2A.text: Easily one of the best dim sum I've ever been!!!  Spacious dining hall with round table and booth sitting. xyff_GavKLxYpRjxkueiFQ.text: Decent spot for dim sum in Vegas if you have the cravings. It's nothing fancy, just straight up classic dim sum. While their hot items like siu mai, hai gao and all that are okay, the place excels at the dessert stuff. Get the brown sugar sponge cake and the hot lava custard bun. Both are excellent.

fMEIGeHTIPDPDaH_oVzKMA.text: First time for me at Yum Cha in LV.  The ambience is atypical of most dim sum restaurants in that there's a stainless steel display/warmer counter that greets you as you walk into the dining area (you can see it in some of the photos).  So, nonconventional, right?  BUT, I was VERY pleased and happy with the variety and quality of dim sum available...  For all the dim sum I've eaten throughout my life - and you're talking Hundreds, if not thousands - I've yet to be disappointed.  I LOVE dim sum and Yum Cha Certainly does not disappoint.    The only knock is the price point.  Although it's cheaper than some of the  places here in Honolulu, I just wish it could be a wee bit less expensive because I friggin woof these things down like popcorn.  This time around, I filled up on the har gow, spinach har gow, ha cheung fun, taro wuh tao gou, turnip lo bahk gou and my absolute fav, fuhng jaau or "phoenix claws" (what we used to call it as kids), a.k.a. chicken feet.  Growing up, Baachan would tell us the cartilage contained collagen and protein which was good for our skin and complexion.  There maybe some truth to that...  In any event, you won't be disappointed with Yum Cha... I guarantee it!..

jh5st9GteWbw02IVqS3wYg.text: Of all the different types of Chinese cuisine, dim sum is among one of the most well-known, though its origins are highly disputed. Some believe that a past emperor of China, frustrated at his inability to try all of the delicious food his chefs created, convinced his chefs to create many small dishes he could try without getting too full too quickly. Others believe that dim sum came about through a general in the Eastern Jin dynasty who would send buns and snacks to his front-line soldiers as a way of expressing his gratitude. The most likely origin is associated with teahouses along the Silk Road that hosted weary travelers and served tea and snacks; this practice of serving tea, "yum cha", is where this restaurant derives its name from.  As you might expect, Yum Cha prides itself on serving all manner of delicious Chinese dishes, though it's most well-known for dim sum. I came in on the 4th of July, when most places would be closed -- craving dim sum, I eventually made my way here after having to leave Chinatown and its crowded restaurants.  I was not disappointed -- Yum Cha has some of the best dim sum in town, and even better than some of the dim sum at my usual haunts in Chinatown! The staff were very friendly and attentive, regularly asking how I was doing and refilling my water even before I asked! Needless to say, this helped them get high marks in my book.  As for the food, I ordered a lot of items just so I could try a little bit of everything, like that Chinese emperor of old, and I was not disappointed. Everything was flavorful and delicious, and very distinct in how they tasted! Standouts included the spicy pig's ear salad -- which was very addicting and my first proper foray into pig's ears; the xiao long bao soup dumplings, which were warm and melted in my mouth; the shrimp and pork shumai, which I use to judge a dim sum place and were juicy and flavorful; and the baked lava custard buns, which were sweet, savory, and ridiculously messy to eat in a good way! All of the photos I have attached show the full range of menu items that I ate.  After my meal, I was quite satisfied and happy -- one of the meaning of "dim sum" translates to "touch one's heart", and indeed, I was quite impressed and pleased with how delicious everything was, cementing Yum Cha as my go-to destination for dim sum here in town. Of course, there's only so much I can convey in this review how amazing this place is -- why not find out for yourself? Yum Cha is a good place to introduce yourself to dim sum, and who knows? Perhaps like the Chinese of old, you'll have your heart charmed by their delicious dishes.

n5me3l2GgqcgAziVl1a8LA.text: Driving out of Vegas, we made a quick stop for dim sum.  The restaurant has many tables and there are a few carts, but the selection seemed a bit limited.  Here's my quick rundown:  Shumai - very standard. Tripe - tender in slightly seasoned broth.  very standard Yum Choy - chopped greens were cooked well and loaded with stalk and leaves.  Very good. Pork ribs - cooked with chopped pumpkin.  Greasy & blah.  Not good. Beef ribs - loaded with black pepper and also greasy but good flavor. Tofu skin with pork mixture -  chewy and very tasteful sauce.  It was very good.  Sesame balls - crunchy, chewy, and sweet bean filling was perfect.  Very good!  The service was quick and it only took about half hour to finish our meal. Very affordable.

My favorite is the fried shrimp wontons, glazed chicken feet, bbq pork with taro and much more. Every time I come here, it's usually not very busy but the place is huge when you walk in. She even makes delicious suggestions that we should try on their menu. Do not hesitate to come here.

T-mWyqDnzFIK1aU2zr52xA.text: We arrived right when they opened so there were plenty of seating. The tables filled up quick, probably because it's Easter Sunday. The fried calamari was too salty for my liking. The portions were decent. The dim sum here was decent compared to other dim sum joints in Vegas. The restaurant is big and clean. The staff is friendly & attentive, some of the staff didn't speak English but we were able to point to the menu to get our orders in. They had dim lighting, a few tv's & a counter where you can order togo. Great place to take the family for dim sum, especially if they're out of town.
