IH8yixoJHGQYGs4vXcNvjQ.text: I've been wanting to have dim sum in Vegas, but it seemed there wasn't a unanimous favorite on Yelp. Yum Cha seemed to be the best of the options so my mom and I tried it out on a Saturday night. When you walk in, it resembles a cafeteria. We were seated right away and ordered water and hot tea (no alcohol here). There weren't any carts operating, we just ordered from a server.   They have a dim sum menu and "regular" Chinese food menu, though we only ordered the dim sum. We ordered the Mushroom Mai, Xiaolongbao, Lotus Leaf Pork Sticky Rice, Veggie and Potato Curry Puff, and the Beef Rice Noodle. They were out of the Beef Rice Noodle so we ordered the Chive Dumpling instead. The server sort of laughed at us after we ordered, and maintained a somewhat sarcastic tone the whole time, but I think... he was trying to be funny? I have no idea. I thought he was trying to imply we ordered a lot of food but at the end of the meal I didn't think it was too excessive.   All of the dishes we got were huge, even if there were only 2-3 pieces per. These are definitely not bite sized. The Mushroom Mai felt like a meatball/fishball and I think it's important to note that even if a dish is called "mushroom mai" or "chive dumpling", these are not vegetable dishes. We realized at the end of our meal that 3/5 of the dishes we ordered were made with pork and shrimp and the sticky rice also had pork. I wish we would have been able to switch it up a bit and we should have ordered a few vegetarian dishes. The curry puff was one of my favorites, and I really liked the texture of the sticky rice. The skin of the xiaolongbao was really good and I'm disappointed I didn't get to try the rice noodles. Overall I think our selections were a little too similar. Even with that mistake I didn't think the flavors were that great overall. It's hard to distinguish much flavor when you have a pressed ball of pork and shrimp that falls out of your dumpling. I think I'll be trying some other dim sum places before trying Yum Cha again, if I ever do. I will say that the meal was crazy cheap. $23 bill for a good amount of food for two people.

BiucifS2fTb1CJLFaemhtw.text: Another dim sum place just like the rest. The place is huge so a great choice for big groups. When we got there only one cart was going around and we had to order other stuff we wanted with a waiter, which is strange for me. Isn't dim sum known for the carts being pushed around?  Food was average, same items and same taste as all the other places, did not see anything that would bring me here specifically! Although their food did seem to be fresh, crispy food came out pipping hot and crispy as it can be, hot food came out looking fresh unlike some other places where it looks dry as if it was re-heated from the day before.

-5dTW8wJ5-LeBp9wfzWV5A.text: My friends and I always go to the Rio to get our Dim Sum fix and it has been usually a hit or miss. I'm so glad I found Yum Cha that serves Dim Sum pretty much the whole day.   We were greeted by the hostess immediately when we entered and seated immediately for our group of 11 with no problem. We were given menus, water and tea all around. Looking around the establishment is clean and well maintained. There are TV's all around displaying different channels and a large TV displaying Asian seafood show all on mute so it wouldn't be disruptive.  Food:  We ordered ALOT of food. Our server was great. She remembered everything we ordered except for 1 dish without writing anything down... at all and we ordered a minimum of 20 dishes.. impressive.   My party and I ordered the typical dishes you get at most Dim Sum spots (see pictures/video) Everything was pretty much delicious and really had no complaints about any thing except for the jellyfish (usually my favorite). The Jellyfish was prepared very differently than i'm used to with it being a dry style compared to it being served with a sesame oil type base. I can probably speak for the rest of my party that most of the dishes were pretty good since we didn't leave much left over (jellyfish and a little piece of taro).   The only dish that didn't come out was the porridge. But, by the time we were done with our meal we didn't even want it because it was so full. As we got the bill and asked if they charged us for the porridge they said no and they didn't.   End food review  The establishment was very clean, the staff were friendly and attentive. Just a nice Dim Sum restaurant near the strip.

WeWyveltyYlEp0FTq6I-sw.text: The best $ we spent on food while visiting Las Vegas. We ordered about 10 different dim sum dishes, each delicious. Our favorites were the steamed and baked pork buns. Very friendly and attentive staff too.

rBk65_7iMSHRW855MvrOyw.text: Good customer service!  Came in around 8pm and the no cart dim sum is more fresh and freshly cooked! Late night craving dim sum? You found the place! Also great menu of vegan food!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L1DevMHemTPAKzIo2AA-JA.text: I write this because I cannot stand the unethical ways this place conducts its business.  They "force" you to write a favorable review on Yelp before they will give you a good discount for the meal.  So I KNOW I cannot rely on the reviews I see on Yelp for this establishment.  My own experience here has been extremely mediocre quality of dim sum, bordering on really questioning how people can give such high praises for their food! However, we do experience a slightly better quality more recently, but I still believe in second, third and fourth chances, unfortunately, and I still have to avoid going there as much as possible.    The positive things I can say about this place are: 1.  Nice setting, relatively empty, probably for the same reasons I gave above for my own experience. 2.  Nice enough service, for a dim sum joint anyway. 3,  Easy parking and access.  Negatives(which for me are the most important factors: 1,  Quality of food is at most 2 stars, on a very generous day for me. 2.  Prices do not in any way reflect the food provided.  I would much prefer Ping Pang Pong over here even in pricing! 3.  I just can't handle the unethical business practice this place exercises.  I would like to propose that Yelp makes all reviewers an optional check box in their reviews denoting that they may be receiving any financial gains for posting their reviews.  Since the owner/manager sits/stands there while he awaits your posting, you know he will see if you are posting a negative review, and by simply posting most of the review that he's looking at, and then at the end be able to check off that box can give the reviewer the comfort of some redemption of his/her soul while posting his/her "positive" review.  Meanwhile, let buyers beware.

nY8cywJKqp5vcXB97ZEysA.text: The service was fantastic here. Top choices were the taro, chicken feet and sesame ball. Fresh!

Jc33hvT8nGp1g1Rzs60akg.text: as soon as we walked in, the service to be seated was a bit slow. The food was good, some dishes tasted a bit different but perhaps it's how they made it. $3 for unsweetened iced tea. Vegetables were good. I don't feel the need to return.

ki4yWc4ipiJUFQnD1q_0Jw.text: First time here. Went to another place near Henderson only to find out they no longer serve dim sum so we decided to drive over. We are from cities with a big Chinatown and have high expectations for yum cha. This place was great. First the place is spacious, bright, clean, and great service. Secondly the food was terrific. We ordered shu mai, har gao, lotus leaf sticky rice, gai lan chow mein Cantonese style, red bean sesame buns, mango pudding, and char su chun fun. Everything was perfect.

SiqnHyCBP6EDG6nPEleunQ.text: Good food, I had mostly no idea what most of it was. The General Tso was less spicy than I like, and little fatty, but still OK.

mlpk4Cw3f8OBH7TBNpxCFw.text: The only dim sum in town that serves after 3 pm. And their food is excellent. If you come after 2:30 the carts won't be out, but you can order straight off the menu and they will cook your order fresh. LA needs a spot like this!

jrkPKA-aZ8kXcMchxzElhg.text: Came here with my boyfriend and thought it was a good spot for some great dimsum . The place is huge and their selection is awesome . The food was tasty as well and it didn't take long for them to bring their carts around to us or take our orders from the menu . The only thing I didn't really appreciate about this place was how long it took for us to get seated , get checked for more water/napkins and get our check after we were done . I understood that there were tons of people , but we were literally waiting in line to pay instead of them coming to get the check from us . And the workers don't speak English that well , so it'll be hard to understand them sometimes.

purwM0sDla0-9zmn2V2qNQ.text: This place was ok. Nothing to be excited about. Don't bother ordering the beef tendon noodle. Better noodles at 168 market food court for 1/2 the price.  Ordered off the steam cart and food was luke warm and few cold dishes.

Q02aTBJ8NCfEFi2KMOpu3Q.text: Was in Vegas for my anniversary weekend when I came across this dim sum place. Came here for lunch before we left to go back home and we were not disappointed. I compare all my dim sum experiences to the dim sum back in NYC where I am from. The dim sum here is legit. Not only was the food good but the prices were decent and not ridiculous like San Diego dim sum prices. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. My husband and I felt like we had every staff member there taking care of us lol. There are ladies pushing carts and you can order off a menu as well. The decor is meh but the food, price, and customer service was on point! I will definitely be back.

Fe5Xiuf6C7bF2e6I3FcSxA.text: We love dim sum and thought we would give Yum Cha a try. We go to Vegas about 3 times a year and since my heritage is Chinese/American its a must when we roll into town. Unfortunately the food at Sum Cha didn't quite hold up to our standards. It ended up being on the inconsistent side. How so? There was a disconnect with the servers and the cooks when it came to ordering separately from the Dim Sum carts. One cart server that we ordered from seemed annoyed at having to leave her cart to order the items from the 2nd kitchen and quickly told us it was backed up. The food was super hot and fresh as it came off the carts but when the 2 items from the kitchen bar section arrived, one arrived cold in the middle and the other was delivered well after we were done with our meal and before we asked for the check. Overall we felt that the food from the carts was the best (even though it was average-mediocre) and surmised that the kitchen may be experiencing its own separate issues.  Not sure we will be back to Yum Cha as there are a couple of other Dim Sum places we like to go to like Ping Pang Pong!

oFHJqBX_SPCebA80yEAagg.text: Food here was pretty good in comparison with San Francisco. Im from San Francisco and there are a lot of good places but also a lot of horrible dim sums. I would say that this place is on the good list and hence the 4 star review. Food tasted the way it should, great service, fast and clean facility.  Definitely will come back!

c0fb8Jb689KfzYybVmFQKQ.text: Not bad...dim sum was awesome as it can be. Chowmein though is not your typical chowmein noodle; it was more like small flat rice noodles--not yellow. What stood out was shrimp balls: huge!! We went after 3 pm and it was not busy at all!!! Waited a bit for servers to come around to answer questions, but overall not bad at all. Would probably go back if wanting dim sum.

-AU6lzJn9irzsErB-jScsA.text: Dim Sum at NIGHT.  Reasonably priced, made to order (carts before 2:30 pm) pretty yummy.  Clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.

MaHDMHerc_xJ0so-dvDYPQ.text: Fresh off the plane from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, I had found this gem while researching where to eat in Vegas!  Needless to say, what a great start to the trip!  The owner clearly takes great pride in his immaculate establishment and the attention he gives visitors.  He kindly guided our journey and sought out some items for us solely based off of photos.  We even got brave and tried chicken feet!!  The custard buns are to die for!  The prices are great too!  Seek this place out...you won't be sorry!! It's the kind of food that you think of once you are home again and long for it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!  What more can I say?!?!

ou1uKPlNmWN3vWJqbcR1cg.text: This place is on the pricey side, and many of the dishes are obviously the microwavable version you can buy as the Asian super markets.

_azH1CNDQRREucfVrvsu1Q.text: Like most of the reviews say the staff here especially the management is over-the-top focused on giving you the best customer service experience you can encounter at any restaurant including five star restaurants. They've only been open a few months so the usual issues are still being worked out a little bit to get everything right. But there's no dim sum restaurant in Nevada that has more potential than this one especially with the great location super clean quality dining areas and extensive menu selections both with dim sum and Menu Entree Choices. Be sure to go up to the Steam Table Line where fresh Specialties are offered as well Call ahead and ask for "Elaine" or her Husband to get professional proactive experience. Servers even wear clear masks for extra hygiene quality! Can handle big groups easily with call ahead. Seats 200+

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hgv7Hl6YVo5F4S23VLb-Lg.text: This place was amazing! The service was great and everyone was so nice. Also since they speak Cantonese here, it feels a little like home.

ETGJKBGNrrOP_fPgx2537w.text: This was our first dim sum dinner in Las Vegas....it was absolutely fantastic!  We're originally from the Bay Area and this place rivals some of the best Chinese restaurants there!  Everything was fresh and flavorful!  The prices are reasonable and the service was A1.  We highly recommend this place!

YuJyddkHgwFNpjGmWn3hUg.text: The dim sum is good, service is fast and not chaotic  (like most other dim sum places,) but most importantly...its clean.

Yh9xPMvf7TPo6Dc_k7HTPA.text: Me and my friends has been coming here lately. After watching a movie in Orleans, we come here for great food. The staff are very friendly. Food is amazing. Resto is clean. I would rather go here than other dim sum place.

o2ToYWkjF-tlIsQwLxOLKQ.text: The dim sum was amazing, came here for the hot pot but since it's the summer time they aren't serving it. The server told us they only had one order of hot pot this whole summer. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant can accommodate large parties.  Their sesame balls are a must-try!!! They got them just right. 5/5

fSkuH845jq6wf5pKBfgnEQ.text: Decided on dim sum and tried this place. Very quiet, food is good. Interior is very spacious not your typical Chinese restaurant. Room to walk around. Not a large selection of dim sum steam cart comes around but baked or fried plates are on display but have to ask for items.

l49FIXrAj1tW--m9L7xVTw.text: This place is outside of the Strip in Vegas!  Their Dum Sum is not as good as their reviews.  Not many choices to choose from.  Their Fried Taro is big!  Others have 3 pieces, they only have 2.  The sad part is its mostly Taros and not much meat inside and not much flavor to it. A Dim Sum located inside Rio is much better!

FL4nyPI2F5iB5h_bf8mUnQ.text: Loved the atmosphere and decor concerned about the concept. We came here for dim sum for lunch and they only had two carts that had the exact same items in both carts of about 10 items. So disappointed because the place was pretty cool. The employees could not understand English nor help us understand what to do. We ended up going up to the food bar to ask and finally management started to help. I think they could use some training in customer relations. The food was tasty but a little pricey.

ZkzOu4MHFgvt_LLG39uSuQ.text: Came here on a Saturday at noon. Food wasn't very good. The food didnt seem so fresh. The worst part was they had already ran out of the Tofu with ginger! Why oh why?! I may give it another go though. Hopefully it will be better the second time around.

Bh2kttV-3pmglRanG5uN6w.text: The food is good, but the Dim Sum selection was pretty limited (though it is a weekday). There are a lot of other menu or displayed cook to order items to choose from to supplement the Dim Sum.  Dim Sum items I tried: Siu mai - these were ok, run of the mill siu mai. Bean curd - I don't usually like these, but this was good. Sesame balls - quite good, had two orders. Pork ribs - these were good, they have bones though. Beef ball - these were ok, I'm not a fan of the seasoning used in these.  Non-Dim Sum: Chive dumplings - delicious, but you better like chives... they really border on too much. Chinese Broccoli - delicious, a bit of a small serving for $6.50. Beef noodle soup - delicious, loved the soup, my roommate thought it was very expensive for Chinese ($11.50)... but there was a good amount of beef and veggies and the broth was delicious and it was big enough to share.

87OnSqZGcHwBqj0mRQDMwQ.text: Good service, awesome dim sum hours (till 10:30), and you can't beat the price!  There were a few minor disappointments such as the lack of adequate red bean paste in the fried sesame balls, and over battered calamari, but the sweet and sour soup was on point!

5cO7FyRqPHErSu40a4tGfA.text: One word... YUMMY!  this is by far the best dim sum place in vegas. The food taste fresh, great customer service, and reasonable price. The calamari and garlic fried rice with chicken is by far the best I have tasted. There's lots of choices and they don't harass you to get more of this or that. I would totally come again.

33V7cQ-k0k2a4Nj53eH0qg.text: If you like Chinese cuisine come to Yum Cha!! Clean, fast service, authentic Chinese food!! -Joscelyn:)

6PJJFraBJu0sJ_JnZ6QLxQ.text: Some of the best dim sum ever, reminds me of china town in San Fran. Family owned, very reasonably priced. Delicious custard dessert bun.

olI19C3uGd978rZ_jPgqCA.text: My family and I came here late on a Saturday night as we were in the mood for dim sum.  It was a little cold that night so we started out with soup. Some of the best soup I have tasted. Then we moved on to the dim sum. They have a large menu of all types of dim sum. Later in the evening we were informed that they do not use the carts as it is a little slower and they want the food to be fresh. The food was delicious! We tried about 5 or 6 different types of dim sum before calling it quits. The staff was incredibly nice and informative.  The customer service here is top notch and so is the food. If you want some good dim sum, you must try Yum Cha!

CW_KLjC6Qoy63N6SKK2ICQ.text: The best dim sum I have found thus far in Vegas!! The staff are very friendly as well, which is a bonus, as opposed to other popular dim sum places here, that offer rude service, and crappy food. Out of all the ones of been to, this one is still my fav go to.

VhVw9SGrAvr1ji709VRnJg.text: Their food are not fresh! Rice porridge is a disaster. Staff are nice, this is a plus!  I think it's ok for dim sum, but not for their main course!

VZGzTjTU8lArJXMyMchXQQ.text: If your looking for dim sum in the Las Vegas area this place is the absolute bomb! they even have this tofu dessert with ginger syrup; called tofu-far its like eating a cloud9

Y3uJ5DeKFkCWN-Vc9F8kMQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Umami heaven. The barbecue pork buns were fluffy clouds filled with unctuous pork; the chicken buns were also a huge favorite. All the steamed dumplings were succulent and fresh. The sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf was another favorite -- springy and flavorful. We've already been twice in a week and will be returning again the next time we're in the area. Service was outstanding: our water glasses and tea was constantly replenished, and we were asked if we wanted refills even after the check. When we ordered off the menu, our dishes appeared so quickly it felt like magic. Lovely atmosphere, cozy and casual. A must-visit if you love dim sum.

RMsKyhag9IunH4ShuOH5Qw.text: Great Dim Sum. Everything is fresh and was cooked to order. Staff was friendly as well. Will comeback for sure!

ZWBpLiCnzu71lFC6tbwdzQ.text: Hands down the best place for dim sum in Las Vegas Off Strip and they serve dim sum all day long.    The restaurant is clean, prices are reasonable and they offer a good variety of dim sum.

iuRA_OoCx-8Uu3g2K5fw1A.text: Great food . Atmosphere is wonderful for kids. Just about one of the cleanest dim sum places I've been to.

I7sux83QfRiYc3fXCg06KQ.text: Yum! Sorry no pics too busy eating. If you like dim sum, you must try this spot. Clean and the host is very nice. The water doesn't taste hard which is always a plus.

jpBy1AEEy8015Qkel-23uw.text: Friendly. Fresh. Clean. Items not on dim sum cart were cooked to order. Flavorful and satisfying. I would definitely come back again.

n80ZnwHBExzz_agmfpocIA.text: Had my dim sum cravings satisfied coming here!  Probably the best choi-sum I ever had!  Very fresh and well steamed!  The sticky rice and beef tendon was really good also!  I'd be back.  :)

x5W8wF1LhVzcO2DByZXWhA.text: Yum cha got C from the district recently.please confirm. Business is so so.monday was little bit busy.food is below OK.

RhjOJBxNxMi4A5WdtBVFWA.text: Great place and very friendly staff. Loved that the dim sum was available in push cart and also cooked fresh in kitchen. I loved how the kitchen was an open kitchen so you could see how they cooked the food! Yummy food. Favorite there was the noodle soup! Just like the comfort food in HK cafes.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1L5Mx5XAO1qVhb3zmT71OA.text: Love the decor with all birds cage. It looks clean. The service is great and friendly. The food is great. Especially try their taro cake. Love it! Must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wqRHIdyL9gfvwwhuee7ppw.text: Not authentic Cantonese dim sum, don't be fooled by all the yelp reviews. Only good thing is service is pretty good.

S4LS-Buqr0M8yd5OG1fV8Q.text: The cleanest dimsum and Chinese restaurant I've ever been to! The food is great and the staff are accommodating and always have a smile on their face. The owner was very attentive and took the time to get to know the customers.  You don't get this kind of service at any other similar establishment.  This will be my go to place for Dim sum and they got my recommendation!

hls9keEzas_QWPi5b4b3zg.text: Great dim sum place in Las Vegas! Definitely my go to now for dim sum.   The owner, Sam and the rest of his staff is very friendly and attentive to details. We never ran out of water or tea and they kept our table clear of empty dishes.   The restaurant is very clean which is always a plus! There are too many places that have great food but dirty dining areas. Yum Cha has amazing food and very clean. There's a lot of seating and they can accommodate larger parties.  Now for the food, this is hands down best dim sum I've had here in Las Vegas! Some of our favorites were the pork and shrimp shumai, shrimp dumpling, sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves, ang roti canai. Their yum cha fried rice was also very good and flavorful.  We had the custard buns for dessert and those were simply amazing. A definite must for those with a sweet tooth!   Visit this place, you will not regret it! We will be back!

yRhP_enxl9ffUChtSInpTg.text: Came here last Saturday evening to satisfy our dim sum cravings. Wasn't disappointed .... Dim sum menu was varied with choice selections being delicious. Wait staff was courteous and pretty attentive, atmosphere conducive to family talk, minimalist decor, great value for their menu, & parking easily accessible. Overall, our experience was wonderful, looking forwards to having our family monthly dim sum gatherings here.

zkV_jcgFtSCDjA_aquVoig.text: First time dining here. Really a friendly staff. Very helpful. The steam dim sum served of the cart is hot and fresh. The fried dim sum or soup is ordered from the server or at the counter. I like that because it's fresh and hot instead sitting on a cart and getting cold. They would constantly check on us and make recommendations on their specialties. Overall a enjoyable experience. Has plenty of parking. Will be making this restaurant a regular dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9kmHqoNnM7tuzi-6Qao8g.text: This place is great! Went labor day weekend at 8pm and was surprisingly not busy. All of the dim sum was on point and we thoroughly enjoyed the 15 different dishes we ordered lol. And their soup dumplings were so tasty!!! And way cheaper than din tai fung.

5yjv9gn90KlEBM_q5nBuCA.text: All day dim sum? Sign me up! This place was excellent! We tried a lot of things and everything was great. We ordered seconds of the soup dumplings. Shrimp and pork shumai was also a favorite of mine. Was shocked they weren't more crowded but we went early (5pm).

V_9oZAMG4Lbj6LBrfvMpOw.text: I had the pleasure of eating there yesterday. Food was fantastic. I ordered tripe with radishes,chicken feet , eggplant tofu and potato and vegetable empanada type crusty patty  It was all delicious. Staff was courteous and food was quick. I will definitely return.

Bfj-e3PIuFRT4bykUrakuA.text: Just went there with my family the day after Christmas. The quality of food was so-so but  the price is high. A bowl for chicken congee costs over $8 and it didn't taste any chicken.Most outrageous is that they charge 18% tips even though the service was horrible. The manager said it's a common practice for all Vegas restaurants during holiday season. But I told him it's not True because another restaurant we went didn't have this rule. We paid them the tips anyway but for sure won't go back anymore!

4ybzrBk8rR2I0v-z392cZg.text: First time here and I will gladly give this place 5 stars!! The service is very good in comparison to the dim sum restaurants I've been to in china town! It is very clean, GREAT ventilation (trust me.. some restaurants in Vegas... I can see what I'm breathing in)attentive service from ALL servers, food is decently priced, and food is tasty! I'd recommend this to anybody lookin for some dim sum

VJSfU04LqfehJDZh7o9ksg.text: First time in Vegas and was hungry for some dim sum and checked this place out for the 1st time. Food is authentic and doesn't cost much. Great service and the dim sums are freshly made. You don't have to wait very long to get seats. The was also attentive. The reason it lost a star is the selection of dim sum is a lot less in variety compared to other dim sum places. But still good all in all.

9F8l8xzmIJCzi4l_z0qY_w.text: Great service. Everything we tried was hot and tasty. They have the carts go around with the steamed items and you order the items that won't be good walking around in the carts from any of the servers walking around being extremely attentive. As a Caucasian only table, the only one there at the time, they asked if we needed more help or forks. The crispy pork belly and crispy eggplant were delicious. I could have had 3 portions of the eggplant if everything else wasn't so good. I try the sesame red bean balls wherever I go and they were the best I've had in a while. Will definitely be going there again.   The reason I gave it a 4, which I could give it a 4.5, is the soup dumplings were not as good as other places I've had in this city.  Really glad we found this place, now we don't have to go to Ping Pang Pongs.

FVwg3cNbphMz-rHXPhx9Sg.text: Ok dim sum. I would not go out of my way to come back for the food. But the service was really good.

qI0C_ZwKQbD8RpQt8ucn5A.text: Ate here today. They got my order wrong instead of changing it they just said we will charge u the small order which they did. Price is above on the quantity they serve. If u are over 4 poeple be ready to pay an 18% tip. Food is to salty. I wont be back here and wont recommend  to others. Just go to ping pang pong if u want the same price with more food quantity.

oYo7_TSC99GnbklJP84rkQ.text: The menu is fairly limited, but I'm so used to the variety of the wonderful dim sum restaurants in Monterey Park and Alhambra, so I guess I'm pretty spoiled.  The food quality at Yum Cha is good, but I found some items were not very hot, but I was one of first customers after the restaurant opened on a Saturday morning.   I suggest arriving after 11:30 am to give the kitchen enough time to heat things up.  The restaurant is clean and the service is good.  The pork and shrimp shui mai didn't taste like L.A.'s, but it was passable.  I think the best item I had was the baked cha shu bao.  It was stuffed full of delicious cha shu in a perfect sauce, and the bread was baked to a sticky sweet golden brown.  It's worth another trip, but I'm not going in too early next time.

Z1mH5Mjv-6VXe5NJk7MDgg.text: I think it's just OK. I definitely feel the cleanliness level of the restaurant could be improved. But the good thing is that it's definitely affordable for anyone on a budget!

6nR3wPdv_0R2fOieQ0fBsQ.text: Food was actually pretty darn good. I thought it was going to be a tourist trap but I enjoyed almost every dish. The egg yolk pineapple bun yummmmm.

IckpKXQHpoiC7tUgAvINvg.text: Came in at 8:30 with a party of 5. The place was fairly empty with only one other party in the restaurant. The wait staff was a little too attentative with the lady pushing menu items on us a bit too aggressively and constantly rearranging things on our table.   The food was only a little decent as well. Many of the things we ordered ended up not being available which was surprising that they were out of items already. Overall, decent experience. You get what you pay for but I most likely will not be returning.

FnX0in2ON8l1VSNjHmPiBw.text: Our only DIM SPOT..best Veggie and Potato Curry Puff!! Always welcoming, friendly, clean, and great selection.  Back again and always happy with the pleasant service and tasty variety of dim sum items.

IvIn-V3rVqXt-LRIdHqBew.text: Very good and reasonably priced. They have large round tables, so you can bring a crowd. Clean and spacious.

YPt2VyogpDSQS1xYLCMRkQ.text: This is excellent Dim Sum! I like that after lunch 1pm they stop running the carts and cook everything fresh. It's takes a little longer but the wait is well worth it! If you want the carts go at lunch time 11-1. The staff is very friendly and will offer helpful suggestions. We have eaten at some of the best Dim Sum Restaurants in Los Angeles and San Francisco, Yum Cha is one of the best we have ever eaten!

-J7IbJkNnRKr75olCI3sxw.text: Everything we had for dim sum was delicious! The chow mien was seasoned perfectly. The best was getting the warm custard buns at the end where the custard oozed out as you break it open. Yum!!! Service was great too! Super nice staff and owner. I would definitely come here again the next time I visit!

J16U_XogmCjOQP4QV7TdKQ.text: Great portion sizes for the price! The dim sum was delicious and exceeded my expectations. Definitely a must if you are craving dim sum!

eHEg1HDOwoa_OD0PH3P7sA.text: They had some delicious dinner sums. I love that you could pick what you want. The only thing I was not happy about was their soup. I felt like I didn't have enough broth and too much noodles. But overall, I was pretty happy with the food. You have to order their pork bun for sure!

ytmoNCjmTxJeKvMN8s5B-w.text: Came here last night Friday and was quite surprised at 6PM that a good 80% of the restaurant was empty.  I know not the main dinner rush hour but still...  This is a sit down style dim sum although the rolling carts are only until 2:30PM unlike two others in town but exactly like 1 place on the westside that is full day non cart rollout.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with the menu items and even some of the unadvertised off menu items such as Chinese broccoli and black tea.  The menu is American broccoli.  The prices are about average although different costs for week and weekend meals.    This works for families and even individuals looking for a good place to eat where you can bring a large group or a quiet intimate date with a loved one.

eet4PPytzuq6UezYGjMxpA.text: Awesome dim sum! Food is great quality for a good price! Ordered about 20 plates of dim sum and everything was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the dun tarts as they were the freshest and best I've ever had.

qi0zvf3I3oshm9woGvqlUA.text: By far best place for egg custard. Great place for dim sum and the prices are reasonable. You have to try the baked lava custard bun. Crisp from the outside and moist and gooey in the inside. I say it's the Chinese version of lava cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KOLjw4i3PHbA7JUMFTUuxw.text: Great dim sum but I recommend to dine at opening time because choices are made limited! Rice cake!!!

gPCWYhwmkZZ4VIsz0P79KQ.text: A bit pricey for the quality of food. We got takeout here one night on our trip, and while it came out pretty fast, people working there were somewhat snippy with my husband who went to go pick up the food. Whatever, it's a busy week with the holidays so can't imagine people working there are thrilled to be doing this, but besides this point, I thought the food wasn't all that impressive for $10 a bowl of noodles. We got the curry fish ball soup with flat rice noodles (good, but $10 is a little bit overkill for about 6 fish balls and pretty much just red curry soup), and wonton noodle soup (again, about $10 for around 5-6 dumplings with a pretty basic broth and some bok choy). In a part of town where you can get decent quality ramen for less than $10, this was kind of overkill. We also got the century egg / pork congee which was around $5 but pretty small for the price. Overall, a bit of a ripoff but it got the job done.

-NFnaZ77kNbKIsy7_15a0Q.text: We looked up this place on Yelp, and it had the best reviews for any Dim Sum in Vegas.  The restaurant is bright and clean, and all the food was really fresh and hot.  I don't know all the names of things but we had really good puffy meat dumplings, sticky rice, shrimp and veggie dumplings, beef balls, and there were so many more choices.  The carts came around very quickly and always had a good selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a few of the Dim Sum

HKPzAxuyA69DBwaOdSxBhg.text: I personally like the Cantonese dim sum, and this satisfied all my expectations. They don't offer the cart for dinner, but instead, you can order directly and they served it very fast. The baked lava custard buns and steamed lava custard buns were awesome! Trust me, you should give it a try even though they looked super big. Across the states, I believe their custard buns were above 95 percentile. Don't be scared by the huge size of the baked lava buns, and don't lose interest in the boring appearance of the steamed buns, they were really really amazing!  The shrimps dumplings across all kinds were okay, I guess you can just pick the ones based on the stuffings that you like.  The rice noodles were super disappointing. At least the ones that we tried on that day were not fresh, the stuffing, either shrimp or beef, were super small. It was one of the few that I could confidently say that I don't like at all, even though I'm a rice noodle person. It seems that even if you finish your meal for 30 minutes, they won't even rush you for the check if it's off peak hours. However, we were kinda busy and could wait anymore and went to the bar for our bill...

U-BYs0fu7vgE4foGsn_NVg.text: A nice spot for some traditional dim sum. Good selection, plates are well proportioned and atmosphere is good. A little old school looking but it's not too bad and the service is pretty good too.

tvuheUQLO-43rXa1z_JeJA.text: I finally had a chance to come in and try Yum Cha and i was very impressed, food was delicious and the chicken and pork buns were not soggy at all, they were just fluffy and good,  very friendly staff and i had a chance to have a chat with one of the owners, very delightful man. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends. I have tried Dim sum all over vegas and this is the best i have had in a long time.

nvyHwEommWtuh-SVQeXmFA.text: I feel really horrible to write such a bad review but I rely on yelp for honest reviews so here goes...  I don't think I will ever come back to this place. I came at 5pm on a weekday, so maybe this is why? I felt that everything I ordered was not fresh. The dimsum was regular tasting (I ordered shrimp dumplings, pork and shrimp siomai, mushroom Mai). I also ordered the beef and tendon brisket which was very very bland. I was already feeling kind of grossed out but when my steamed pork buns came, that's when I decided I was officially disgusted. The pork buns looked like it was very very old and steamed to death. It was so soggy and mushy that I could not even take it out of the basket. The pork inside looked like baby food. It reminded me of bread dipped in hot water.   Sorry, I'm going back to Orchids. Yum cha did not hv sticky tables like Orchids but at least I won't feel that I ate old food.

p462F70hjjcdq-HTo7CqCA.text: Yum Cha has the friendliest workers for an Asian restaurant. They are always making sure we are taken care of and are very polite when they speak to us. They offer both dim sum and meals. It doesn't take long at all to get out food and I have not been disappointed yet with it. If you go you have to try their baked lava custard bun, it's the perfect texture with a sweet and savory filling. So far my favorite dim sum place.

pbHRRhU-ZFbjoDUKOCw4jw.text: Excellent Dim-Sum ! I tried a lot of Dim-Sum places, this is the best in Las Vegas, better than Rio or other Dim-Sum in different hotels that I tried.

bKDg8JY4EC3fGNLvPBj_qw.text: When restaurants advertise a certain service or product, consumers will expect them to deliver. Yum Cha is advertised as an all day dim sum; however, this place did not fully live up to that. Many of the items were not available upon request and we were, instead, forcefully advised to try alternatives. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing bad about giving suggestions, just don't be pushy and annoying about it.   There are definitely better dim sum options in town in comparison. We tried this place out because friends suggested it. They raved about the quality and price. We, on the other hand, did not have the same quality experience they had. Orchids Garden will be our go-to spot for quality dim sum the next time we need our cravings fulfilled!

f8DKpQ59NNpi0ir22Btq7Q.text: This place is super clean and the food is really goos. I highly recommend this to everyone that wants to try Chinese style dim sum. There is always service with a smile and the atmosphere is super friendly. I would definitely come back for some more food!

_dB3EFOTYKuVtzzpzwwp2w.text: Here for a visit in Las Vegas. Dropped by to eat lunch. Excellent service. New restaurant. Clean. Good taste. Hope to keep the same standard. Highly recommend.

arUhSXJlkxIDrMAKdP4bNA.text: This Place Is So Bomb I Love It Will Always Come Back I Bring Family With Me All The Time and The Love it

4w4w4Cb-yFSyCYAU5x4gEQ.text: Well i havent been there but after researching I cant understand how there are so many good reviews. On August 12, 2016 they got 39 demerits from the Nevada Health District inspectors for being dirty. I highly recommend using the NHD website and checking their grade before going. You can also see demerits on previous inspections to check their overall behavior and maintenance of the establishment. Ughhh. Shame on this establishment. 39 demerits is just plain gross.

jiuZayuCU3CvYDV9ERmzAg.text: This is the best dim sum I've had in Vegas, and the service is really good for a Chinese restaurant. I also love how they have Roti Canai.

opmff0nPyTS6MojB7YuPCw.text: First timers!!! Heard good things so we decided to come down. Very cool place , not exclusively , they also serve dinner items and have a semi buffet style counter for other foods not on the carts. Food was great! Chomped through some chix feet (that I haven't had in 6 years) that were bomb. The lotus leaf steamed sticky rice is a must. The host took us up to the counter and explained all the food options then gave us some complimentary dessert to try! Warm tofu with ginger syrup was delish! We will definitely be back!

12AA0WHWG8UyseG7HSBeoQ.text: Food was good. I'd have to say the flavor of the food is better than other dim sums here in las vegas. The prices are unbeatable. Service was good. Nice environment. Spacious and we'll designed.

lzkgyb56ggB87AEIr_1P5g.text: Brand new and yummy! Dim sum can be picked out at the counter like Hong Kong so it stays warm. Orange chicken uses real oranges. Best chow main!

iUpRSHI7L3-wu61ysWTRog.text: Great dim sum! Yum yum! We had great service and they were very friendly. Pretty close to the strip, and reasonable prices, especially for the quantity of food.

6_orPBfM_7dX0HDXEyWbmw.text: Went here today with friends from out of town. Food and service were excellent. Best dim sum I've had in Las Vegas. Favorites were pretty much everything we ate: Salt and pepper shrimp, shaomai, cha shao bao, and much more. Was hard to stop ourselves... Reasonable price for everything we ordered.

tZRjYV0qrAlPRueHHmHbvg.text: This restaurant is fantastic! As a vegetarian I find it difficult to find options when eating out. They have a great selection of tofu dishes and when they noticed I was looking at the vegetable section of the menu they made personal recommendations and offered to add some extra veggies. Extremely personal and so friendly. I love having this restaurant in the neighborhood. Highly recommended!

yQHdEjR5P7-QBZ5a0K7Exw.text: Stumbled upon this Chinese restaurant while here on vacation. While the phrase "Yum Cha" means drink tea, this restaurant is more than just a brunch place. Out of curiosity the family stopped for dinner. Wow, we were impressed with the dinner menu selection and the absolute authenticity of the dishes. This is not the 'americanized' stuff that is altered for the American pallet. Great food. You can always tell a good Chinese restaurant when you see a lot of Asians eating there. Will come here again the next time in town.

i99AaSR32gvb5EsvrXygzw.text: Great food. Excellent friendly service.  We will definitely go back. large menu and large portions. Stewed short ribs, chow fun, ginger fried rice, steamed dumplings and salt and pepper calamari.  All were great.

RPPF6IgSfMNK35XWsfmhWA.text: Stylish and enjoyable. Dimsum choice is plenty and most important for me 'hot' and tasty. This is a surprise. Service is good. Price is reasonable and easy to reach. I presume it's first of its kind in Vegas. A long steam table 20' long with over 15 choices of dim sum. A must go. Will come again.

JALxSe1mnMUpGG2ESSP8Lw.text: Interesting set up.  There is a long steam table on the right as you walk in.  There are a variety of noodles, fried pastries, and curry dishes.  They only had a limited choice of tea.  The manager said its because they are still getting their supplies in.  The fried egg noodle dish didn't look too promising, but turn out to be quite delicious.  The turnip cake was a disappointment.  Hardly any turnip, therefore no turnip flavor.  The shu mai was very good, though it was made with ground pork, not chopped pork.  The har gow skin was outstanding.  Thin, good chew, very good.  Unfortunately, the shrimp inside was not the freshest, with a strong fishy taste. Pan cake for the roti canai was light and crispy, and the chicken curry sauce was spot on.  We were dipping everything in the sauce.  The curry fish balls and the curry spare ribs were just ok.  I would skip the stuffed bitter melon next time.  Only thing I taste was the bitterness of the melon, not the stuffing.  The pan fried noodle with beef and tomato was very good.  Now to the best part, all that food and only $35.

mdb4GDp_YQsZa1VnaImzSQ.text: We were really in the mood for Dim Sum for dinner. Yum Cha was well rated and we were not dissapoointed. The food was delicious and the customer service was fantastic. Everything came out fresh. I was a big fan of their Xiaolongbao  and the fried pork ball. Highly reccommend!

FcWDW3yYjv7UehoKGSrQbA.text: Nothing stands out as far as dimsum in this place!  Noisy and unorganized, service is just plain disappointment!  Waited for a Calamari for 35min after repeated  inquiry from inattentive servers!  This Chinese restaurant is the 3rd leasee in 5 yrs in the same building!

4teXUKHPGdZOStN__aV7sA.text: I love this place. I'm always craving dim sum in the middle of the day, which is bad because dim sum carts are usually out only during prime lunch and dinner times. Yum Cha is great because even though they put away the carts during mid day you are able to go to the counter and order what you want. I also get wonderful customer service here! They are all so friendly and helpful giving suggestions about all the options to choose from. It is also cheaper Monday through Fridays, which is a plus. I will be coming back again for the great service.

d0K9Arudcfzv_W0fITSD8w.text: Very good dim sum and Chinese food... Must go if in Vegas! The food (dim sum and Chinese) is absolutely wonderful and the service is amazing with friendly waitstaff and the staff is awesome when helping you decide what you would like. We were visiting Las Vegas from Arizona (but transplants from the Bay Area in CA) and my family and I were missing the dim sum places that seemed abundant in the Bay; Yum Cha filled that void! Having just recently opened Yum Cha is ready to take over Vegas. I highly recommend stopping by to dig in on some Bao, pearl noodle, or order yourself some Shu Mai... A must visit when in Vegas!

XLT37LnyVOq0w7mOTMC9Ew.text: We enjoyed our dining experience here! We had just gotten to Vegas after a long drive and my husband was in the mood for dim sum at night! I looked at yelp and we found this restaurant right away since we were staying at the Orleans.   Food quality and customer service is top notch. The owners treated us like family. The prices are extremely reasonable. We liked our experience. We are definitely coming back!

fqWpfXy0BrFOZ0ImHSKzHQ.text: Best dim sum in Vegas.  Dumplings are always hot and fresh.  Service is always excellent.  And the place is cleaner than most.

9BfuIniUfGH9_kQPr58QUw.text: This is the worst dim sum in Vegas. Don't go. I read all those good reviews and decided to skip my all time favorite Chang's restaurant and give it a try. Waste my $$$$ and time!

bm3AF1MEBF9EnkPXyr6uXA.text: I like that this place is easier to get to from the SW area. The service is excellent. The staff is very attentive and willing to explain the dishes.

PTn0X9kGgepmEcGXqb0ABg.text: Selection was great, customer service was good besides a very minor language barrier, and dim sum service was prompt, hot, and fresh. Overall I will definitely be returning with friends and family. Recommend the chive, BBQ pork buns, and red bean bun for sure.

kkC5sH6BP_blndyPmcFSQw.text: I would recommend this place to all Dim Sum Lovers, foods is pretty tasty compares to places in Los Angles.  It is rare to find good DimSum in Vegas, but this place is awesome. Price is very decent , love everything in here. Eggs custard is sooo good, chicken feet is very soft and juicy. Hmmm can't wait to come here again for the next trip to Nevada.

sqLAgaTR2AHv5iQ-vm2OVQ.text: So good! Excellent food excellent service! Owner was very nice. Came for my birthday breakfast! Very clean bathroom!

43ybMF_qiNIXZIdOWArVbQ.text: We booked a hotel near by and was on the way to Pahrump when we noticed Yum Cha. We decided to stop by and have breakfast there after we check out of our hotel. The morning before heading out we parked exactly at opening time and it seems that there was quite a few families already seated so perhaps they open earlier than their sign (states 10:30 am), also was very pleased that they were open at all considering it was NYE, but hey it IS Vegas and we all know Vegas is the city that never sleeps. We were seated quickly, the dim sum carts came pretty quickly and the food was decently priced. A little more costly than I am used to, but we come from San Diego. The food tasted good, but there were 3 reasons why I decided to rate this establishment 3 stars. I would like to point out their servers are exceptional at how quickly they sweep away the empty plates and used napkins. We did wait on one dish for quite some time, with no one ever checking in and our table asking 2 or 3 times, we felt like we were forgotten. We stayed an additional 10 minutes or so after we had already finished our meal despite putting the order in early to midway through our meal. When we did get the egg tarts, it didn't seem like it was cooked thoroughly and tasted mushy (something even my 8 year old son noted) we are far from being snobs, but it was just very noticeable. When we were ready to pay our bill we walked to the register and waited there for at least another 10 minutes. When you're just standing there awkwardly and literally the only people there, 10 minutes is very long time, lol. It's not that they didn't see us or know we were ready, they just took care of the other tables instead. There were two people at the front desk handling the payments but halfway acknowledged us with our card and bill in hand and kinda just ignored us and made a small gesture to continue waiting while they took care of people that were still eating at their tables. It didn't make sense because we waited for our server to collect our card, but after awhile we decided to just go to the front. Only for the two people in front to be getting all the receipts out for people who were STILL eating and having us wait for an additional 10+ minutes. Doesn't it make more sense to take a quick pause to let us pay and then continue, as we are in front of you waiting and the other guests are still eating? Again, good food. Decent prices, Open parking lot, good servers. But they should have better service when it comes to following up and paying the bill.

r8lyOOlz8kYWfxN45ISW_w.text: My daughter found this place on Yelp...took a chance...we are extremely satisfied with everything - service and the food were both great!! Sam and the rest of the staff were very friendly and efficient. The place is clean...we will definitely be back for more!!! We found a better place for dim sum!!

a4dnlhwrFPxZpeWatJZpGQ.text: Loved this place. Great food and excellent service. I would definitely recommend. Har gao and shumai even though these are rather common dim sum staples. The sweet bun is scrumptious with oozing custard

AcilxHNpr07Ycq2t773gpg.text: The prices are super reasonable. The food is cooked to order and the Dim Sum is delicious.  The folks are friendly. It is definitely worth the trip via Uber for this meal.

GPdQ3OcGggyxJ31B4agHTA.text: Loved this restaurant. Seemed very authentic. Food was flavorful and hot. Service was excellent. Sam was very attentive and informative about dishes. I live in Anthem and thisb is my NEW DIM SUM RESTSURANT. Dim Sum is served all day. Try it. I am sure it will become your new Dim Sum restaurant.  ENJOY!!!!

rWaDUEA4hveoQoLfoQY3Hw.text: Their dim sum was tasty and 1/2 the price of Rios. It 8s clean and the staff is very attentive.  Their bbq puffs were the best I've ever had!  There is plenty of free parking.

QBcP_GVd_S_3pCkHR45P5w.text: My first time here and I was not disappointed! We ordered salted fish and chicken fried rice, crispy pork belly, salt and pepper calamari and their dimsum. The food is authentic and great service. We'll definitely come back and recommend this place.

IW6fzXQFcjRyUY0Hz5ls9A.text: Last minute drive to our favorite Dim Sum Spot. We brought our son here before he heads off to college. Always great service! Food is always freshly cooked. Some of our dishes tonight.. shrimp dumpling, shumai, calamari,crispy eggplant, chives dumpling, coconut bun just to name a few. If your craving Dim Sum anytime of the day Yum Cha is the place to go!

Vid94tBNWmEAi65XuDrduw.text: Fast service, decent pricing. Parking is very easy and it's close to the strip. They serve on heated carts so as soon as you sit down you can get your dishes. In addition the staff was very friendly. I'll make sure to stop by again the next time I'm in town.

Pago1yB2cN2EAYhFyYKaTA.text: 6 stars rating! ! Every time I go to Vegas, this is a MUST stop. Food is GREAT, service is EXCELLENT!  Each trip to Vegas, HAS to eat there.  Good Dim Sum, VERY good Asian food.  Highly recommended.

a-uswoZtdbpzOiKSgTOFQw.text: A bit hectic but they have great customer service and their food is pretty good :) it's really clean in here as well and it tends to get pretty busy.

dy2iYC_1h3zTthES0u29HQ.text: Very horrible customer service!! The man at the counter was very rude and we got up and decided to leave. Food was very unappetizing and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!!!

GL9SQT-EAlchGgVTvTb3pQ.text: Terrible.  Had to wait a long time just to have a cart go by.  Everything was out.  Never had this kind of experience at a dim sum house.

KhhF81DcxT_f_xlpsK0rcA.text: Fresh food, good quality and seasoned well. Their food are not too salty at all like other Chinese restaurant. They are friendly as well. Will come back here.

KH7lFru7W3VMm9fkshqIzw.text: They are so nice and really do care about taking care of their guests. Wonderful customer service. I wasn't the biggest fan on the food but it wasn't bad either.

uVL9mzdrtcvPXpTrmnUG6Q.text: Odd this place wasnt crazy busy on a Saturday at 11am, but don't let that fool you. Everything was made fresh and delicious. We tried a variety of steamed shrimp dumplings, jin dui/fried sesame balls with red bean, shrimp with eggplant, chinese broccoli, and steamed buns with red bean which I personally recommend. Restaurant was open, nicely decorated, and had both friendly and attentive staff. We'll def be coming back!

5sjas7lpuJMhGtpukh7BYQ.text: Worth the price. It's my first time seeing such setting of a restaurant in Las Vegas. It is very clean and waiters are all helpful. Food is fresh and good price. Dim sum serves all day along with hot pot and food from menu. Would definitely come back, good location, easy to find.

9zCke9DmXIUNosltt6UPaQ.text: They have a great menu, ranging from tried and True Chinese food to dim sum. Had their crispy fish which was on point. Service could have been more responsive as we came during early dinner when the restaurant was not busy, but the food was worth it.

MuFtIb0FsEeS6n6KqKWU9A.text: Mmmm Mmmm good! We went during dinner hours and it's just so nice to be able to get dim sum at all hours of the day good prices and attentive staff. Now my wife just needs to tech me Cantonese so I can come on my own.

_9AAlHvZMf0ECKvq5R4-VA.text: I'm in town visiting and was looking for some Chinese food. Well this place is pretty good. Food was prepared just to my liking. Perfect amount of sauce on the General Tso chicken and FRESH! The fried rice was cooked different than what I'm use to, but still good. I'd definitely do business with them again next time I visit.

tqA_EnDDKRGvwMwVRcjrQQ.text: Dim sum was awesome ...... Better yet service is very good .... And attentive which is hard to come by now a days .... Will recommend and come back again

LRTvqbD1SsRPZKx_2l7PSA.text: Yum Cha Dim Sum restaurant is now my go to spot. The dim sum foods are excellent, and the service is very good. Foods came out hot and fresh. Location is easy to get to verses having to go to China town. Prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend Yum Cha to experience Chinese brunch.

Y3s6lO9pCGwErQ4qpMyFTw.text: This place is really great! Neat and clean restaurant. The atmosphere is very relaxed. The dim sum is also very delicious. Very fast service and I appreciate the option to make a dim sum order at the counter in addition to picking out entrees from the cart. Lots of TVs in the restaurant for viewing. Fast service, would definitely come here again!

1mZKfArE6jZY__2fO4n5ww.text: Second time here for late dinner and food are always excellent.  We love the roti the first time but for some reason this second visit is more tastier!  We only come here for dimsum and it's great that they serve it all day.  This time we came with our son and we ordered a lot.  We're surprised that Elaine still remembered us and she and her team always give excellent service.  Food are delicious, service excellent, and the place is very clean compared to other Chinese restaurant. Our favorites are roti, shrimp ball, taro dumpling, BBQ Pork Puff Pastry, so we always have these whenever we come over.  This is now our GO TO DIM SUM place.

r_iavVAtxoqDT6RTTyjHeQ.text: I will be kind and offer this place a 1 star.   The wait staff is friendly and eager to please. But the food is not good at all.   My wife and I visited this place yesterday and ordered   1. Hai Gow -- ( shrimp dumpling ). Only bits and pieces of shrimp with a lot of pork grease. The dumpling skin is sticky. Chef needs to work on improving the skin.  2. Shrimp Cheung Fan --  ( Shrimp rolled in large fat noodle ).  Shrimp is very small. The Cheung Fan is too thick. Has no taste.   3. Chicken Feet -- For the one, the chef has to re-learn how to flavor the dish. Tasteless!!  4. Rice in lotus leaf -- again, totally tasteless. In the rice, there is only minced pork and a piece of Chinese sausage. The chef needs to visit other dim sum places and re-learn his trade.  5. Tofu with fish meat -- again, tasteless.  We stopped ordering when 5 out of 5 are failures.   Awful place if you are interested in good food.

GgEKAE87Q92iwgQa_dtCYQ.text: Great place altogether! The host greeted us as soon as we walked in the door and immediately was friendly with us getting us laughing and recommending food. We ended up getting the chow mein, general tso chicken, and sweet and sour pork and even were given egg tarts on the house. Amazing service from everyone there and great prices.

_YisZch70THT3gmrG7TwOw.text: This place is literally perfect. I've tried several dim sum while in LA but this is way better. Every time I go to Vegas I go this place.

fQRjx9X0gr_GiiyGUsIM3A.text: Don't believe the 1-star reviews!! They were disgruntled people who tried to eat here on Christmas day: THE BUSIEST DIM SUM DAY OF THE YEAR!! Of course it took forever...they were over-run! Every local was trying to eat there because it's so good.  We had brunch there yesterday and it was amazing!! We hadn't even settled into our booth and were already had several piping hot delectable items in front of us off the cart! Shrimp dumplings, spicy beef, tender tendon, chicken dumplings, fried shrimp/crab claws, curried fish balls, hot mustard and chili oil!! A bounty of Dim Sum Delights!! Plus they offer a wide variety of a la carte items like beef stew and noodles. The service was friendly, quick and intense! Our waitress gave us the low-down on the house specialties and made good recommendations. We ate until we could barely stand up to leave! The place is huge and can accommodate large groups. The prices are good. I plan to visit every time I am in Vegas. It's only a short Uber off the strip and totally worth it. Yum Cha is my new Vegas Fav for Dim Sum!!

FNJONU_G0d2zwCuAO8lg3w.text: I really wanted to be blown away by this place. But I found it to be average for a dim sum spot in Vegas. Vegas has some of the best food from all around the world but for some reason no one in Vegas can get dim sum right. I was raised in LA eating some really good dim sum so when I moved to Vegas a few years back I made it my personal mission to find good dim sum. I moved back to LA after a year so sadly I never succeeded in that mission but I kept an eye on the Vegas dim sum scene. That's why when this place started popping up in my Instagram feed from some of my Vegas Instagram foodie friends I got excited. I cross checked yelp, finding out that it had a 4 and a half star rating so I knew I had to check it out next time I was in town. This next time happened to be on Christmas Day. It was both cool and not cool that it was open but it's a Chinese restaurant. Chinese restaurants never close.   Now don't get me wrong. It's not horrible. No place I've tried in Vegas is really super bad. Every one is just ....ok. This place didn't really set the bar any higher. Maybe I'm just a little dim sum spoiled I don't know. I just don't find that it lives up to the standard I'm used to.  We had quite a few dishes I'm not going to name them all but I'll talk about a few. The pork and shrimp siu Mai was cool. Its probably one of the tastier dishes. The shrimp rice noodle fell a little flat for me. I mean literally the rice noodle was thinner than usual. But then again that's my favorite dim sum dish so maybe I expect more. And the shrimp. I don't know why but every dim sum restaurant in Vegas uses small shrimp. Maybe more cost effective but I prefer the larger more succulent shrimp used in restaurants back home.   The service was lacking as well which hurt my rating. They said I had just missed the rush so some of the things I ordered were not ready so it would take a little longer. So it took us a lot longer to finish than usual. And one of the dishes almost never came. After all the food had come out and we finished eating i asked about it. They said they were still making it. Give it 5 more minutes. After 10 minutes I asked again and one guy said they were still defrosting it. That kind of turned me off. Like I know it might not be made on the spot. Maybe it has to be heated up but frozen and then defrosted and then reheated just didn't sound too appetizing to me. So after another 5 minutes which in total is almost an hour after we initially ordered I asked to cancel it. They said yah it's still not ready we can cancel it. The server went to go cancel it and get the check but then someone else brought it out before the check came back. So we just took it to go. That was I would guess the worst dish of the day.   Like I said this place is ok. I think I just had my hopes set a lot higher. So I guess ..... the mission continues.

NruoNcBzhFgk-hkKuQVB2A.text: This place has changed hands a few times. We finally made it here today after reading a few reviews. A bit disappointed in the beginning as we waited a while to get service for a restaurant that is not busy. I believe he was the manager that had to tell the cart lady to come to our table. There's two carts of dim sum that goes around, but without a system. The 2nd cart barely made it to our table, we had to wave to her.  There's also a counter that has food displayed and you can also order from there. I hope they would tell you the process as you would guess what's it for, we had to ask.   Food in general was not bad, but I had better. I like the ambience and it's clean. In the end service was good.

MZbyUbYRVzuimES78yr4nw.text: Bug dim sum fan here and this spot is definitely worth a try.  I normally go to Chang's when I get my dim sum jones but wanted to give this one a try when I saw it from across the street at the International Market.  Good selection and I like that you can order additional items from the provided menus.  Outstanding char siu bao - perfectly sweet and savory.  Only complaint - and it is VERY minor - they could have had one additional cart of goods moving around during lunch time.  When I went yesterday, they only had two.    In the end, what really matters is the taste and quality of the food and this place is has both!

f3zoOF47y0yKFtPdEOoK5Q.text: Good food and selection.  I like that dim sum is served all day.  Service could be better.

7XLhefBLjoM14a6K4dLV3g.text: It was good dumplings were good wanton soup was good. Wife had orange chicken and pot stickers. Nice to have by the house I will definitely go back.

lu8i1uV_k8pKhf1AD1akyw.text: This place is super cool and nice. I haven't been to a nicer dim sum, and the employees are spectacular. You will get your order pretty quickly. Also, a nice tip is that you can go in at 10:00 even though they officially open at 10:30, but when going at 10:30 all the food items will be available for you to eat. One of my favorite items was the egg tarts. The crust is so fluffy and the custard in the middle was superb and creamy. The place looks very clean and not old and beat up. My Sunday morning is now complete--really good food along with fantastic staff.

ePzFMrdz1YfyEbZ1CQc-zw.text: This is second time I ate here.  The first time was ok. This time was worse . The second I asked for a fork, I never saw another come to my table. If you think I'm going back , you have another thing coming . You het better service at McDonald's!

mznSK-2C9EK593PgMDiGpg.text: Mediocre dim sum. Food is prepared fine just lacking flavor.   There are better places to eat.

HAGU8efYcV23G48NwEMMBg.text: FOOD IS GREAT. Seriously, I come here for their dim sum and I absolutely love it. Prices aren't bad either. $2 and some change per servings during the week, and $3 and some change on weekends and holidays. Not bad.  However, service is kind of all over the place.  Everyone is nice for the most part. They have the ladies walking around with the dim sum carts and if they have what you want, you're golden. However, if you want to order something that's not on the carts and you speak English only, there is a communication barrier more than half the time. One lady just nodded as said she'd get my order and 20 minutes later, never came back or acknowledge me and my family. I had to ask another women who understood and watched her walk straight behind the counter, grab the item I asked for, and come straight back with it! I'm guessing the other woman didn't understand me at all or forgot about us.   Anyway, I've only been here twice so far. The first time we had a gentlemen coming to check on us regularly who spoke English and it was great! For that, 4 stars.  The second visit was with my family visiting us from California and I was so sad they had to be there to witness the lack of customer service. For that, 1 star.  I definitely will be back for the dim sum, so hopefully I can have a better updated review then.

SiglQOI9TkwxdPENWP6aow.text: Foods were all good!!! Amazing Chinese cuisines!

5sX8sHJ5fBTRi3ai36LD-g.text: I went here to try out a new Dim Sum place. The location used to be a Chinese buffet that must have failed, so my expectations were not very high.  I was surprised by the food and the service. Especially the service. The carts came around often. You can order directly. The waiter was very attentive. Will definitely be back next time we crave some Dim Sum.

jVwEV-oXevfvxoNvc-cR-A.text: What can I say. The service was exceptional and very detailed oriented. By far one of the best dim sum restaurant outside of the strip that serves legit dim sum. My fiance and I were very impressed. The server interacted with us not just about food but making small talk which we like. We came around 8:00pm, so eating there didn't feel like a restaurant but more like as if you you were at home eating comfortably. We will come back.    FOOD WISE: you need to try the Shrimp and Pork Shumai, Shrimp Dumpling, Fried Shrimp Wanton, CHIVES DUMPLING (the best) and all the bake goods!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef special along with red bean sesame balls and baked pork bun!

aRCYXRpEpCaTJML_JmhOtQ.text: I have to say, their shrimp dumplings and sesame balls are the best I've tried in Las Vegas. Must order!! The dip for Indian pancake is very unique, mix curry flavor with potatoes. So does the beef noodle soup, not just how tender the beef are, but the taste of soup is yummy! The service is pretty good if you want to view it as dim sum restaurant level, lol. The price is average, we definitely will be back, especially they told us the dim sum is available whole day.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the curry dip

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very unique fish tofu

kHNsf6xUT1Rla7P4QSa65w.text: Boyfriend had dim sum cravings so we decided to try out a different place other than Orchid Garden since their service there is a bit slow. To Yum Cha we go, location is great and the food? Well, excellent!   We ordered Shrimp & Pork shumai, Pork Bun, Crab claw with shrimp, Chicken Fried Rice, Wonton Soup, Chicken feet, Beef tendon and Beef spare ribs.. And also their Xiaolongbao is a must-try, boyfriend and I loved it.   The staff here works efficiently, and I like how friendly they all are esp. Elaine. Price is affordable too. We'll definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumm.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their Beef tendon, Spare Ribs and the oh-so-good Xiaolongbao.

VeRgE13gYazLonHNo0xHxw.text: Just OK. To be fair, I went late on a Sunday (2p). Selection was limited and a bit cold even though it still came from a steam cart. Flavor and service was fine but the food was nothing special except for the Crispy Pork Belly which was very good. Still, there's much better around town. A little pricier than I expected as well.

SZEswyix8aGmFdQlPo1EIw.text: So good!  Dim sums are always good here. We've tried lots of places and we aleays  come back to this place.  Good service - really like it here.

mM6vWOp-KjmQk4SIvAScaQ.text: Wanted some good old fashion dim sum while in Vegas with my crew and found this gem off the strip. Its a 15 minute drive from the the strip but it opens after 10:30 so dont both going early morning. The service is friendly and prompt. The food is above average Chinese dim sum. At least better than the one we have in New York City. price is $4 to $6 per dish but well worth it for the quality. Highly recommended if you crave for dim sum. It opens late!

gvMbOgPZccyDnxNdJMVNBw.text: Very clean, friendly service staff. Some items were blank like spinach stuff with shrimp. Shrimp noodle noodle and shrimp Hai how. Spare  ribs I has flavor Shu mai.  Fried fish ball tasty. Shrimp egg plant good.  Not a lot of selection like orchid garden.  My opinion only.

zgCrQ_HEANLo2d_RaKNCgA.text: Food here is good, but service sucks!! Waited 10 minutes for someone to come and take our drink order after seating. Table next to us waited 5 minutes to get a side of mayo, they were not happy. The guy said first and last time here....don't blame them. Been done eating now for about 15 minutes while I'm writing this review and no one has come by...would like to get the check and leave.

ojGMZozT0b-kpSayPgvRbg.text: No thank you.  The customer service was great. The food was obviously poor quality, water logged, too dry or too hard in some dishes which were not supposed to be. Everything had a strange aftertaste .  Only 2 or 3 pieces in each dish you order. Not worth it.

tUcIYXDhs8nrIpExxDb6HA.text: Really good food and price is very reasonable. Didn't try but two dim sun dish the pork rolls and something else I can't remember the name for it. But all in this is a great restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kOBzD_OoGTWYQ_m03gwU5A.text: I brought the "Fun Vegas Foodies" and "Sushi and More" meetup group here today.  As usual,  the staff was very attentive to our needs.  All of the dim sum was on point.  We especially liked to "lai wong bao", custard buns and the sieu mai, pork dumplings.  The restaurant also served us some Malaysian roti canai for free.  We ate so many dishes it is hard to encapsulate everything.  I shall post a bunch of pictures.
