Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T9TNMoXhJKvYIBm_HcGiWQ.text: Nothing special. Service was good, but dishes ordered from the kitchen took to long to arrive. They were not that busy.

svlr_A6-RRd01skwUWZAag.text: Made another trip to Vegas and had to check out some more of their local Dim Sum. People raved about Yum Cha so I had to check it out for myself.    The staff was friendly which is always nice. To be fair I showed up there on a Thursday at 2:30pm which means this may have had some bearing on what was on offer. It was okay. I was going to snap a photo of what I ordered but it just didn't taste as bad as it looked. So that didn't seem fair. I ordered shrimp with black ,  spare ribs, shu mai and shrimp with chive.  Nothing was bad but the shu mai was old like it had been sitting for a while.  Listen this spot is clearly a favorite with the locals. It's large, clean and there's a great market across the street. Here's the take away. Visit Yum Cha on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday. I truly believe that their rush hours are different. I'm curious enough to visit on my next trip. So far K & J is the best in Vegas by my experience. I ate there at 3 on a Monday and it was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NkjfMQcMPYm89AyrIXokYw.text: Horrible food on a Saturday  night.  Wait staff are also your cooks! Do not go. Ratings  are False.

sHDuABlCr6_L82ll7rH5BA.text: I am so blown away by my experience here, so here I am. I am pleasantly shocked and surprised with the extrodinary customer service and attentiveness of the staff here. During our visit, 5 different staff came to our table to check up on us. The lady who took our order gave us recommendations and the food was SO GOOD. The food here is made to order and there's also dim sum carts around so you can start eating while waiting for the rest of your order.  Must: Curry noodles with egg noodle (you can pick your noodle type), dim sum (radish cake), roti canai, Choy sum, their new item fried pumpkin.  I highly recommend this spot. Definitely worth checking out.  I had my fair share of frequenting Chinese restaurants, and if you have as well, you'd know they are not known for good customer service. It's all about good food. This place has both. Gem!!

efdksTajXY1yEgroq9VK8A.text: Pinapple bun leaked out and was watery. The pork ribs stunk, and being from Monterey Park this dim sum sucked bad. I would give it a zero if I could

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow.. Pumpkin in ribs? Gross. Smells like an Asian marketplace .
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck ... Watery bun.

sDUAWzBjQaBDyo4Y1rBu6w.text: It is an excellent place for dim sum. We recommend roasted buns, caramelized with honey and crispy shrimp wontons. Their shu mei, chicken feet, & steamed dumplings were just normal. But we don't recommend their pig ear salad, which was a bit salty. One thing that bothers us was they charged us $1 per person for hot tea.

o-9rTAtIEnkbftuy_KosfQ.text: Although I wouldn't say Chicago has the best dim sum, this tea house in Las Vegas ranks comparable to what I would expect in Chicago's Chinatown restaurants for dim sum.  They bring carts around the table for you to pick the small plates you want and if you don't see what you want after a few carts go by, the wait staff is helpful in getting you your particular choices.  The owner of the restaurant was noted at the time I was dining and helped out as much as he could given that the restaurant was very busy. We had a wait to get a table, but it wasn't more than 5-10 minutes when I arrived around 12 noon on a Sunday.  I had the traditional shrimp dumplings, pork shui mai, turnip cake, shrimp with rice noodle wrap and all were very good. I will definitely come back to Yum Cha the next time I am in Vegas.

SjXn2imQy3aV9ONqklm3ag.text: Sadly, Vegas isn't known for the best Chinese food and that includes dim sum. However, Yum Cha will suffice as adequate to satisfy your dim sum craving. It doesn't have the large dining rooms that I have been accustomed to in California, but there isn't much of a wait here either. Like traditional dim sum spots, you can order some larger plates off the menu while you peruse the selection from the carts being pushed around.  There are a few dim sum dishes that I thought were decent enough to come back for and others that I would avoid. I enjoyed the siu mai and the glutinous rice dumplings (filled with pork). The shrimp noodle rolls were also really good. However, the shrimp dumplings and soup dumplings were poorly made and quickly fell apart. In fact, xiao long baos were so dry that there was no soup inside. Of the large plates, we tried the beef chow fun, which was well received.   The prices are decent and the service was pretty fast after we were seated. Prices are about 50 cents cheaper if you go on a weekday versus the weekend.

YUQVqSt35Q7Tz7LkNdbJ5A.text: Uhhh overrated. That is all. For $3.58, you get such a small portion whereas if you go to another place you get more on your plate. Maybe I'm a spoiled Bay Area girl where dim sum is readily available and delicious that this place is nothing compared to it.   First off, the place isn't very inviting. It seems like a cafeteria in a way. Very big space, but it just feels cold. I mean it's cool they have this bird cage design going on when you look up, but other than that nothing.   I only ordered dim sum dishes so I can't say anything about entree dishes. But it's cool they warm up the dishes for you when you order dim sum plates so the food is hot when it comes out. The sad thing is the portions are so small! Three small pieces of shrimp dumpling (har gow), shu mai, etc., you would have to order multiple plates to feel full! Nothing spectacular about the traditional dim sum plates either. Like I said mediocre at best. Har gow is har gow. You just get the taste in your mouth, but it prob won't hit your dim sum crave. The baked bbq pork bun came out with two decent sized buns. The gloss was too sticky and their was so little filling vs bun. Sad.   Winner of this whole experience is the lava custard pineapple bun. This is the closest thing I have found! It's a bigger puff almost muffin looking, but the runny oozy custard is totally on point. Probably the only reason I would go back to this place is just for this dish.   Overall disappointed. Three stars because the food is okay, the service was good, price a little too high. But I'll be back just for those custard lava buns. If anyone knows where else to try, let me know!

_TUXnNe-PI3yObBeUN-eIw.text: We had a great late night meal here.  Dim sum was fresh and very tasty.  Good selection, fast service and delicious options made for a very satisfying experience.  We particularly enjoyed the shrimp and spinach dumplings and the veggie stir fried noodles.

5cCWuwCst8vZCJvHS_O2Bg.text: Not sure if this is real dim sum.. But I guess it'll do if you are craving it while in Vegas.   Upon entering, I was surprised at the amount of asians that were there since its kinda located in the outskirts of the strip and not even in Chinatown area.  Based on the amount of people there, I was thinking that it must be good... Sadly, I was fooled because the hargow was kinda soggy and the same with the xiu mai. Maybe I'm just a little picky because I'm from California.. But this was not legit dim sum in my opinion. I also had a few other Steam dishes but none that were memorable.  We also ordered a few of their fried dishes like the shrimp egg rolls and 2 orders of the shrimp balls. It's nice because they seem to make it fresh to order, but when I received my shrimp ball, I noticed that the paste inside was undercooked. When I pointed it out to one of the servers, they immediately took it back .. Which was nice until they tried to charge us for 2 orders when they only gave us 1. I do appreciate that the waiter was nice enough to remove 1 of the orders when I pointed it out, but I can tell he was annoyed.   Anyways.. the food here is decent enough if you're really hungry but not up to my standards to what dim sum should taste like.

b6SLCTCWZ69FDZzzTWt38Q.text: Great dim sum! Fresh and plentiful. The wonton soup is so good! The condiments were awesome. Had a great light Sunday lunch. Fast service and great prices!  Will be back.....soon!

nP0Ogt5akXER8IeBYeieFg.text: This restaurant was recommended to me by a friend when I asked her for yummy dim sum. Not only was the dim sum out of this world but they also serve Malaysian food. The roti with curry is yum , lava custard dessert is yum and this curry soup with fresh noodles was also yum. I wish we could have come back . Definitely will be making another trip here when I return to Vegas.   The staff is very friendly. Our waitress was very proud and passionate about the food that they serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the lava custard before we broke in to the gooey yummy insides
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum. Everything was delicious. You can&#39;t go wrong with any of their dim sum.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry soup with fresh noodles. So delicious .

b4dFA2_tyKQQYblkQdpUKg.text: Came back to satisfy my craving for dim sum. The restaurant was clean as new and comfortable to dine in as usual. I also enjoyed how aunty Elaine recommended their specialities and no doubt they were good.   Would definitely revisit them in weeks time to satisfy my craving for char siu bun and egg custard pastry! Overall, great ambience and definitely a good place to experience south East Asia cuisine!

LCg_0Mb0WZ6BTUEkg4Mgig.text: My BF and I were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in and our order was promptly taken. We ordered -  Pork siu mai Hargow Pork spare ribs Shrimp in bell pepper Mushroom mai Veggie noodles Chinese broccoli Fried shrimp wonton Xiolongbao  The noodles and Chinese broccoli were perfect, not greasy or too salty. The siumai, mushroom mai, hargow, shrimp in bell pepper, and shrimp wonton were piping hot when they got to our table and had good flavor.   But, the xiolongbao was only ok. Didn't have much soup inside and were lukewarm when brought out to us. Also didn't have very much flavor to it.   Aside from that, everything else was yummy and the service was really good. Attentive, friendly servers. Will definitely be back again.

CNq0EN1mQk3SOVBtOSg8Eg.text: The food is okay, but be careful when checking out.  The person calculating the bill added a few more circles (demarking orders) on our bill, so that it added up to $20+ more than what it was supposed to be.  We called them out on this and they didn't argue about reducing our bill.    I highly suggest taking a picture of the circles prior to submitting for calculation then doing the math again yourself.  Don't trust them!  Dishonest businesses like this should be shut down.

7vQEuJXhGQ6tK4XhAxGV4g.text: It was my husband and my first time trying dim sum and the server was so helpful with showing us the menu and explaining what the items were. She suggested a lot of things on the menu and we loved everything we tried! We will definitely be back to try different things on the menu as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9VFyBacIKO8C1U9beQh_uQ.text: This was my first Dim Sum experience. It was good. It didn't change my life, but it was a fun authentic experience. The dumplings (all shapes and sizes) are the definite highlight. It is worth a try to go and judge for yourself.

yaJlE9h-Hf5MseGPdtlz_A.text: I've come here twice in the last two weeks and still have their baked egg custard buns and salt and pepper tofu on my mind! I haven't been up for dim sum lately, since my shellfish allergy makes all the good stuff hard to enjoy. I had read about Yum Cha on Yelp though and was eager to check it out. My husband was an immediate fan of their curry items and I really enjoyed their BBQ pork buns (extra sticky and meaty!). Our servers took care of us and explained their process to us  - during lunch/busier times they do the carts, but dinner and no so busy times you can order off the menu. Everyone was very helpful and eager to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. There has been a lot of turnover in this area, so I hope to see Yum Cha succeed in 2017. Seriously, get the custard buns!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salt and pepper tofu
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside the delicious bbq pork bun
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bbq pork bun

Mpes9m7bR0KeEUEZA_1OxQ.text: Best Dim Sum in Vegas! The service is also very good, our waiter gave us some delicious recommendations and the overall place is very clean and pretty :) can't wait until they deliver!

fVRLLgbfukfNMOCpHkuY9g.text: This is my first time at dim Sum and I was a little intimidate, but it was a great experience! Food and service was incredible and they were very helpful. I highly recommend this place and I will be looking forward to bringing my family here!

4QAQKBAzAno7v9pBLwVZsA.text: Take our  was not good and was to expensive for the amount of  food that was given. Don't think I will try to eat inside either.

BFd2CpdX8DaBDzERYzaV3g.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place since ping pang pong had disappointed us recently. This place has a pretty nice size dining area for seating. The service is very good, all of the people working were attentive and smiling. The dim sum was hot and tastes pretty good over all. I liked the spareribs with the pumpkin and the turnip cake. Pricing was the best part, 2 people stuffing themselves only paid 20 total! That's a good bang for the buck. We will definitely return for more.

7yfdVlmL7SMh37fIUXEG-g.text: Pure mierda. Service decor everything. Used to be somewhat good, but now is terrible. Food is subpar in terms of preparation and execution. Service subpar even by fob standards. Will not be tipping. Probably going to be a while before I come back.

FQl3beeHMQPAI_XSAZJKng.text: Service is good.  Food is ok if you order dim sum and not a la carte. We ordered a beef noodle soup and the broth was way too sweet to our taste.  They put way too much msg in the soup and I felt sick afterwards.

onYXWYHY5RHAueZLSfJXjA.text: The staff here are attentive and not pushy. Good communication. Lots of choices. Steamed dim sum on carts and hot dim sum from the stalls. Looks newly opened, super clean. Yummy.

-YA5tNg-vYx4ISsD0yteaQ.text: We randomly found this spot when we were craving some dim sum. We were ecstatic to find out that they serve dim sum all day, which is not typical. We arrived around 3pm and by that time they don't have a cart that goes around with the dim sum. Instead they have a steam table with the food items and whatever else you want off the menu. They had the usuals which were all delicious and I have to say their rice porridge and beef noodle soup were SO good and didn't need additional seasoning, which is rare for me when it comes to rice porridge. We will definitely come back next time we're in town. So good and affordable!

rEZPhQdf8trdbfMevlvIKA.text: Don't waste your money!  A couple of chicken claws and some other nasty shit for $20 - disgusting and a rip-off!

UXCitqJ226sbOGyP37V0sg.text: Love this place! The best dimsum place in vegas! If you want affordable dimsum/chinese food go to yum cha, the pork buns are amazing

D_hLytIWH1qfMnSSshWsCw.text: This place is a hidden treasure. Came here for the first time a couple weeks ago and just fell in love. The staff is friendly and helpful. Very knowledgeable in the food and always offer to try new things.

BtLshdP89Lac_wtQmQnd2w.text: Finally a really good dim sum place in Las Vegas. I'm super picky when it comes to dim sum because my family used to own a dim sum restaurant in Cali.  Very kind service and I like the variety!

45nzzm7Qmm6K7elHW84waA.text: Love this place! The service rocks!!!! And the food is super fresh! Would very much recommend this place.

vjcz8IjFwLaagJK5VTKQPA.text: "Yum" is the word when it comes to dim sum cravings and Chinese cuisine. Yum Cha's restaurant staff is courteous and attentive. Every dish that comes out of the kitchen has picture perfect presentation which compels you to start eating with your eyes and you will taste the passion of experienced cuisine chefs in every bite! Yum Cha deserves to be on everyone's hot-list of places to eat and is definitely among our top destinations as foodies when in Las Vegas.

v-VkWTamHHFYcAbomgLXyg.text: So bad!!!never come back again! We wait the food  almost 1 hour , the food is ok. We just order a noodle soup:(

i6r6BAmDzZ2No-RY8qI3jQ.text: Pretty good variety. Nice to see a new dim sum place. Very good rice wrapped in lotus leafs. Awesome tofu wraps. No pokestops in the parking lot but the food makes up for it.

o5FJmWju5bxmkqfqsgE4IA.text: By far the best dim sum in town !!! Very clean. Not oily like most places. Owner is very friendly. Food is amazing !!!! Highly recommend this place

PCKNY0SAfT9csGdEAxUzcQ.text: The dim sum here is one of the best I've had. Fresh selections and most items are made to order. I especially loved the pork ribs and calamari. They have great service! The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Definitely coming back to try their dinner.

bznrm6iRNOp9myLfw4QPZQ.text: Been here 4 times in 9 days. We love it. CLEAN!! Good people and great food. Dont forget "Golden Sand" for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M81_hbYAddtplC7Yu2X8LA.text: Hard to believe that good dim sum is hard to find in Vegas when there is so much other good Asian food.  Dishes were hit or miss.  Mini spare ribs were good as well as the chicken feet. Long rice noodle rolls (not sure what you calls these in english) were not good nor were the egg custards.  Chow fun was OK.  Shrimp dumplings were passable. Turnip cakes were pretty good.  Overall, was OK but not a homerun.

OLWJVDcwkpDcAn0RV0k9YQ.text: Best dim sum place in Las Vegas.We have coming here for 3 times in 4 days. I would recommend anyone coming to LV to take a try of this place! The price here are fairly cheaper as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

nOwik2cRlL7VqZ5HgEyxZg.text: Great food, takes awhile for certain things to come around so you're just kinda sitting there forever with nothing to eat.

d6BXtBgNr1vxEjgem9u12Q.text: First time dining at Yum Cha.  Friendly and fast service.  My favorites were baked bbq pork buns and mushroom and pork shumai. Bright and spacious place.  Definitely will return when I want dim sum.

YWB6KDB0iyqYZpBjqPcRrw.text: I really love this place. It's one of the best dim sum place in town. They have the carts only on lunch time. A lot of people eat here everyday but there's no wait coz people come and go. If your going to eat here make sure your ready to try a little bit of everything ;)

p04_wvXPvYDkbgavdZhMpw.text: Amazing service and delicious food. It's also a plus that they are open with dim sum so late! Would come back and enjoy again.

xufknBsvi90LlBWkoguB7g.text: This Yum Cha was the best thing on a cold and rainy Las Vegas day.  I decided to take my mother and grandma here after reading the reviews & seeing it on someone's YouTube vlog. It was definitely the best decision I've made all day. The wonton soup & xiaolongbao were heavenly. Also, the shrimp shumai and dumplings were super tasty. I will definitely come back again whenever I come to Vegas next.

-_QO55jwY5wOHqWlhOR_CA.text: I went here today with my mom since she's looking for a good dim sum place to eat with some of her friends that enjoy dim sum and good tea. We only tried a few dishes and were really disappointed with what we had so left after a quick snack.  We had the following dishes:   ha gow - the filling was bland but the worst part was the wrapper. The wrapper was mushy and very sticky   shrimp cheung fun - the cheung fun was a bit thick and tough, nothing like the ones I've had back in San Francisco and LA areas   noh mai gai - rice was undercooked, bland as bland can be. This is usually my favorite dish so I've eaten it a lot   feng zhao - it was cooked alright (maybe a little too soft) but very bland   fried pork belly - over fried so it was dry, stale seasoning   tea - not very good. it was hot enough but even after steeping there wasn't much flavor at all even at the end of the meal  The service wasn't bad with lots of servers for a half full restaurant. They were quick, attentive, and friendly. As a sidenote, they really should get toilets/urinals that self flush. I took a look, washed my hands, and left the restroom without using it.

B_HYPpxGeM17v_sNKEiACg.text: I love the shrimp rice noodle,the sanmai is so soft l like it too , and the price is good,but I don't like the pork rib ,

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love shrimp rice noodle

cAnsw9anvirESooYc6fKZQ.text: My family ate here (our son's girlfriends' first Dim Sum experience).  We were disappointed in the size of the shrimp balls and the food did not taste fresh.  I think the girlfriend was totally turned off by Dim Sum so this probably wasn't the best place to start her with.  My husband said both the fried Hom Sui Gok and Jin Duy tasted like they were fried in stale oil.  I was disappointed in the food quality, but the service was very good and the servers were attentive.

2ueQG8tIYI6MVUMOS68qZQ.text: If you want not so great dim sum this is the place to go. Its not terrible but not great, especially coming from LA. If you want something quick here is the place. Service was not too bad they are pretty quick with it. The restaurant itself is large. Only wish they would have more selection of dim sum. Maybe may not come back here, but we will see.

J4vHRtWVoAHFw2seiokNZQ.text: Service was very strange here, we sat down ordered a ton of stuff, they came all separate and took very long for each one to arrive so we would eat everything , then the next dish arrives in like 15 min increments , and we had to keep asking for our order because they forgot 80 percent of it. Whatever did arrive was part cold .and not so good, the shrimp look funn was disintegrating as we picked it up with our chopsticks , no texture or bounce at all. The only saving grace of our meal with their laksa that was good. Everything else, was cold, and lacking in flavor and texture . Service was almost non existent in the sense that everything took forever. The price was pretty cheap tho but I guess u get what u paid for. For a party of four our bill was only $60. We still never got our damn shu Mai by the way which we asked for 3 times from the time we sat down to 10min before to deciding to give up and go.

aMWjikg9G0mXdeAkZzio4w.text: Not that good, don't order any Singapore rice noodle or any noodle plates from their kitchen, salty and oily. We had tried this place for a few times but disappointed every time.

zHvKp4rTUPlNRgxUrM_6qw.text: Great new Discovery! I came with my fam last Saturday evening and we surely enjoyed this one. The good ones that we'll come back for before we try their other items in the menu are: shumai, tripe and chicken feet; those feet are 2 star better than Orchid Gardens. (These dimsum items taste fresh, clean and flavorful). Also the crispy, delicious, and not greasy S.and P. pork chops as well as their Surprisingly "what?, a chowmein can be this good"... Sam our waiter was  very nice and attentive. Oh the hot tea here is good too.

OmR0gwzomwUk6p3RqMfoaw.text: I am not sure why this restaurant got a good review on Yelp. The restaurant looks like a cheap food court and little bit dirty.    Service is very bad. For dim sum, you need to know Chinese to get fast orders since people in the restaurant don't speak much English. The atmosphere in the restaurant looks like a flea market with customers running around to get their orders.   Foods are not great either. I got a bad smelling food from dim sum. Not sure it was my bad luck or they reuse the food from previous days.   Anyway, it was a total disappointing based on Yelp reviews. You get my idea

aVVm88V7obtMT4YDrRB59w.text: Came in today at 8:30pm and the place was empty with only a party of 2 . We sat down an immediately the waitress was attentive which to me was good , but then she was a little to attentive pushing items we didnt want and trying to make us order fast , i understand its empty and your probably bored so you want to do something but she was a little to clingy . I heard about this place from a co worker of mine and she says she likes it and its fairly cheap. Im  Chinese so i was not impressed. The food was decent but not good and when we tried to order some dishes they said they were out. For a place that says open til 1030 with all day dimsum they sure were out of alot of items . All in all i dont recommend this place and much rather go back to changs or orchad garden for my dimsum ! My family and i will most definitely not be returning !

NvE_xziRWT-MTzenuGPRlg.text: From the Bay Area and first dim sum place we came to out here. Taste like home! Very good, highly recommend!!

R8xPMxEGuD7dIY2VHSrARw.text: Not only was the selection limited and the food wasn't that great, but the owner tried to tack on an extra $30 to our bill. He tried adding double on a few things we ordered and knew exactly what he was doing. I called him out on it and he deleted it. Be careful if you ever eat here. Check your bill!!! These people will try to rob you blind!

WTALdM2_kwMn6rw4JPRo7g.text: Seriously my favorite din sum place in town. Huge with lots of parking so you never really have wait for anything. Service is very friendly. They have pretty much any dim sum you are looking for so definitely the place to go if you are craving something that you can't find else where. Give it a try!

RfrndwZGAEkjv6Lz3Me_0w.text: My mom and I enjoy Dim Sum and we stopped by for lunch. The spot was new to us and we wanted to try a new place. It was great! The staff was friendly and helpful, the restaurant was nice, the food was great, and the prices were a bargain! We can't wait to come back and bring some friends.

Dh9N3jHdGr63NHnZ7gMMfQ.text: I cannot even begin to describe how wonderful our dinner was tonight.  I really wish I would've worn my stretchy pants!  The 2 of us ordered 7 items, and we are absolutely stuffed.   My favorites have to be the pig ear, choy sum & crispy pork belly.  (I was shocked that my American husband enjoyed the flavor of the pig ear so much, but he devoured it!) I wish we were staying in town longer so we could come back and enjoy some of the other items on the menu.   A few honorable mentions: beef balls, pork & shrimp shumai & one of the best steamed bbq pork buns I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SWG_GDX8-9te06Kcv3XObQ.text: As dim sum goes, this restaurant is the best in Vegas.  Service is excellent and the food is really tasty.  You can order from the carts or from the menu.  Ordering from the menu was a lot quicker than I thought.  If you're from LA and love dim sum around the San Gabriel Valley, I would definitely recommend this place if you want the same quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tried to take photos of the food, but I kept eating it too fast.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trust me, it was good.

VaQFACZMl6Q1iDzBXEZMEA.text: I've driven by Yum Cha probably a hundred times, but never really knew what the restaurant was besides being Chinese. Walking in, I was surprised to see the place was large and spacious - and also basically empty. We ordered a variety of Dim Sum dishes and they were generally okay, with nothing being bad but also nothing standing out. Food here is pretty cheap and service was just fine considering there was no one else there. Still, the food wasn't exactly of the highest quality or freshness, so I can't give it a higher rating.

D9qVpbz4dhiha7OaWPN_fg.text: Service was awful! The guy that waited on us was annoyed from the second that we walked in. He had a really bad attitude and wasn't helpful. The food was ok. Some tasted like it was leftovers from the day before. Wouldn't go back.

wuW7apkB7nm9j5x3-4Fylw.text: If you're up for some tasty dim sum while in Las Vegas, you need to make it out to Yum Cha.  Mom and dad were in a dim sum mood and with help of trusty Yelp, we found this little gem. The har gow was so flavorful and loved the taro puff. All the items were nice and hot.  They push some of the items around on a cart but for those that want more, you are able to order them so they come out nice and fresh. Although this isn't in 'Chinatown proper', Yum Cha is worth the trip when you are craving solid dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tableful of dim sum goodness
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Puffy taro puffs....my fav

1fFdrBWUcbVGWzuV8ssNuw.text: It's alright.  Not enough shrimp selections, food takes long to come out, and when they do they run out of the things we wanted. But at least the workers speak English and nice.

lcLA6ilhrKMI1u6A11Skmg.text: WOW!! This is a True treasure. We are visiting from Reno for a school related event for my daughter. We were hoping to find a good dim sum place. We hit the jackpot!! With her rehearsal schedule we couldn't make it to any dim sum places during the normal service hours....and Yim Cha serves dim sum ALL DAY. Order from a menu and it's made right then and there. It's close enough to LV Blvd to be an easy choice for anyone staying to play. It's far enough away to make it ideal for those wanting to avoid the crowds.   Onto the dim sum. We are only two, so our ordering was limited. The baked baos are HUGE, as in one could almost be a meal huge. And they were fresh and hot as was everything. Siu mai are so packed with flavor we took two orders to go for breakfast! Har gao was perfectly steamed and full of shrimp. The wrapper was properly chewy and tender. Chive dumplings are huge and so tasty and came out piping hot and crispy on the sides from the pan fry. Our craving has been sated until we return.   The menu has me wanting to try so many more things. This is perfect for bigger groups as you can order a wide variety and try it all. Service is attentive and very friendly. You'll leave with a smile, a happy tummy, and wanting to return.  Editing to add he prices are very good here! A lot of good food for little cash!

tOmHyna0nzzbKCHL6gBEAA.text: Do not go here for dim sum, especially if you've had good dim sum in LA.   We had a large party of over 12 people so the long wait was expected. But once they led us to our tables, they still weren't clean all the way so they frantically wiped whatever parts of the table that we weren't already sitting at and then they didn't even wipe the center rotating tray. We also didn't have any sauces at our table so we had to grab them off of another empty table.  A server came to take our drink orders and we ordered half hot tea and half iced water. She only brought out the tea.   The cart servers weren't any better - they totally ignored us even when we stood up or raised our arms to get their attention. If it was busy, it's understandable for them to not notice us, but it was definitely not busy.   Once we did get our dishes, legit everything was overcooked. The shrimp dumplings stuck to the paper on the bottom because they were so mushy and fell apart when we tried to pick them up. The shrimp rice roll was too mushy it just fell apart in my mouth, I didn't even have to chew it. And the bun baos were so mushy, when I picked it up, the top felt like mud and it stuck onto my finger.  Not coming back, do not go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overcooked, mushy bun bao

cg2qsKk5mS4YBTbBEad-Vw.text: My family and I love this place. They don't have people Pushing around dimsum carts all day long but you still get the same experience since you get a menu filled with the cart items and just order from there. Everything ice tried here so far tastes great and the staff are very friendly. It's a nice change of scenery compared to all of the other dimsum places around town. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone needing a dimsum fix.

TYf589soHyHRx2ebMoKa1w.text: Funny, I coulda sworn I did a review of Yum Cha when we tried them out 2-3 years ago. Like the fact that it's kind of in a "random" location in a strip mall, NOT on/near Spring Mountain/Chinatown. We went in around late lunch time so it was nice and quiet - maybe 4 other parties in a quite spacious restaurant. Don't remember the specifics but I'm sure I got my "usual," i.e., shrimp rice noodle, the glutinous rice wrapped in lotus leaf, har gow, shumai, and I believe they were fine. Not awesome, not bad. Like a solid B. The one thing that does stick out is that their pork & chives dumplings (hockey puck sized, perfectly fried crispy on the outside thin dough skin containing a filling of the perfect ratio of chives/spices to pork) are OUTSTANDING. I believe it was Yum Cha that started me on a pork & chives dumpling kick - ordered them from 4-5 different other places and nope, Yum Cha's rocks. Husband also very much enjoyed their chicken chow fun.   We haven't had the chance to go back, as the location is kind of off-the-beaten-path for us, but looking forward to the next visit, as this, and Ping Pang Pong, are the only 2 decent dim sum places in Vegas (IMHO) where they nail most (but not all) of their dishes. We've also tried Hong Kong Garden and Dim Sum Cafe in Summerlin, where some of their stuff was OK, other stuff was.. mehhhhh. Still on the hunt for the perfect dim sum place comparable to the "big hitters" in San Gabriel Valley.

Tzs9maLrwYMq1XmxrK2vLQ.text: One of the best I've tried. They have a lot of selections and not just dim sum. It's a Big restaurant and very open. Friendly staff

5LbK3stclN1jNfzjNXSVPA.text: Good service, good employee & good owner!!  Dim sum is delicious. I can't stop to eating.

xi2Bxgj5ZCa4-2OmMzy77w.text: This place is cool- it get packed around 11 ish  dim sum is cool  not many carts but its okay for vegas  it all day  so cant complaing  fed 6 people around 106 bucks they include tip for large tables

oOZWCIna9XofsDt915-giA.text: Mediocre at best. We were not impressed for the price they charge for their dim sums. Will not be back here again.

yDkxkMRzaFAbA347yO2n0Q.text: Great place for Dim Sum and Chinese food.  Instead of having a cart rolling around, you just order what you want as you want it.  Always hot and fresh!  The staff is very friendly and helpful and there is plenty of room especially if you have a larger group.  Every time we go we try something new and never disappointed.  Plenty of parking and easy to get to.  Food here is excellent!

SYzP55qbmCs3xOeYxGjRZA.text: We were craving Chinese food and this place had really good reviews on Yelp. I didn't think the food was good at all. Everything was SO salty! Even my kids complained that it was too salty. The place is in the middle of no where. Would not recommend.

u3kvLW7VGSED9uf5H2Z38w.text: I'm reluctant to write this review as I don't want to let the secret out but I feel I must. This place has excellent fresh dim sum and an even more delicious egg custard dessert bun. We went on a Sunday afternoon and there was no wait at all! Food was fresh and made to order upon request. Highly recommended.

V0QB_zj3EHx93RBVbDQzvQ.text: A new but old spot! Same resto different owner. Across from International Market! A cool dim sum place, friendly staff and the Hot Jasmine tea was bomb! Food was good and decor of birds cages above was a sight to see!  I give this place 5 stars because the servers Always came over and made sure we were good on water and always Asked if we were "okay" will be back! What a way to spend our Good friday dinner 3.30.18

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YJDNHKpaKEtZPqEE2p7jYg.text: Yeaaahhhh....noooope. While I'm sure Vegas may have far better dim sum options... This one certainly isn't it.  The pros are simple... They were very friendly and seemed attentive. (This would later prove entirely inaccurate). There were literally only two other tables (of 3, and 2 pp) in the entire cafeteria sized space when I arrived(3 more 2pp parties came later after my first plates did) Apparently the cart option for traditional service had ended at 2pm.... So the only dim sum ordering process was via menu.  I ordered the shrimp and pork chive dumpling, fried shrimp wonton, Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce, and veggie egg noodle. When asked what I wanted to drink, I asked for hot tea. Remember how I mentioned the place was sparsely populated...? Right? So, youd think Id hv no issue actually getting my food and service after sitting down. Well, you'd be wrong. I did get all of my order relatively quickly except for one dumpling, but I never got a single refill or offer for any additional fluids, never got a single plate cleared even though multiple servers walked by, saw my empty plates, only to bypass mine and p/up from other tables. My broccoli was the standout...but, I mean who can mess up steamed broccoli? LOL. My egg noodle was far from fresh and congealed in a hunk, it was clear that had been sitting for a while. I still thought it could be salvaged, so I asked him to reheat it. They zapped it in the microwave, I thought that wld fix it, but it was evident, since it wasn't already fresh to begin with, this was a vain effort. My shrimp wontons were okay, they were fried a little softer than I like, but not bad. The pan-seared shrimp and pork dumpling didn't come for a full 17 minutes after the rest of my food. Mind you, everything was ordered at the same time. I literally saw them making 3 pan-seared orders for OTHER tables who came in after me, all of whom were Asian... But every instance of my asking about my own order, was constantly met with, it's coming it's coming. Well it took a long-ass while to come... And then by the time it got there, at least it was hot, but it was as blandly gentrified Chinese as everything else. I don't expect some of the basic things I ordered to have too much punch in favor, but I at least expect stuff to not taste like it was pre-packaged, pre-made, possibly frozen, and merely thawed and then reheated. Nothing seemed fresh aside from my broccoli. While  the pan-seared dump was made fresh, I kno bcuz I watched her, when she finally made them... everything was just BLAAAAND. For the price, I definitely expected better than prepackaged, reheated dim sum. But I'm pretty sure this is exactly what I had. I feel after tax was 24 bucks. Not crazy expensive, but not as cheap as I typically find Dim Sum that is far better, elsewhere in the country.  Plus, for the record, it'd be awesome, as a non-asian individual, to go to an Asian establishment, and recieve the same attentiveness as their Asian patrons.... Not just secondary or tertiary, if and when they happen to have excess time to cater to you after catering to them first. Smdh. I have yet to find a place that actually adheres to this. So I guess it's too much to hope for. But still a fat greedy girl can dream. LOL  I was disappointed... and my search for good dim sum in Vegas continues. Hopefully I'll find something before I head back home to the East Coast.

kEudKGXCmejzcnN_8_xniQ.text: My husband and I dropped in at Yum Cha for brunch. The service was fast and friendly and it's nice since there are Cantonese and Mandarin speaking staff. The food was pretty good tasting although one of our dishes was lukewarm/cold. The prices were also quite reasonable, especially compared to grabbing food on the strip.

4cAkkPyqCfTAkgrxjURhog.text: Normally, I wouldn't go to a dim sum place called Yum Cha to Yum Cha. I went because of the rating. Don't bother...  it offers very mediocre dim sum. The chicken feet is on the sweet side. The Cha sui bao dough is chewy and floury taste. The spare rib is okay. The ma 9 Go is okay but not traditional. J5KAQ7mFghGZTzwkB6YEbg.text: Nice  big clean place, however food was just fair to us.  Too much breading on much of the food, pork buns that should be filled with glistening juicy pork were dry and the bun extremely too much bread!  BBQ Pork in puff pastry should be buttery, delicate and flakey these are heavy thick and dry   Sui Mai was good just cold second order ensured hot was much better.

fx43sA93wwtlrOfZbBw6Cg.text: I dont understand how this place got such a high rating. The portion is small and some of the food weren't even great or just mediocre.   Shrimp rice noodle- the shrimp is tiny!! Also taste liked old, frozen, and dry. It has the same texture as dried shrimps that have been rehydrated.  It was awful.   Soup dumpling - very cleaply made. The meat once again taste cheap and very crumbly. The meat didn't bind together. I took one bite and I was done. Couldn't force myself to finish the rest.   Shrimp egg roll- once again the shrimp is very dry and  old tasting. Couldn't finish that either. (Yall see a trend here right, dont get anything with shrimp.)  Chicken feet- was over cooked. Yes the meat fell off the bone but the bone also fell apart too. So you'll get little tiny shard of bones when eating it.   Shumai - the only thing that was okay.

-v-cIs653zxcXC93nFeUow.text: Tried this place tonight, since it got good ratings. A slow Thursday night, we were seated right away. Hubby and I loved what we ordered! Wor Won Ton soup for 2, the red bean sesame balls, the soup balls...all so delicious!   The restaurant is located in a strip mall, away from the casinos. This is a cool party bonus!!  The prices are very good, and when we come back to Vegas, we will come back.

ZBjBmAjSfuB9x9ynMBEHOA.text: I didnt care for the food here. The food either too salty or not salty enough.  Its kind of waste the money to eat in here. Plus the people works here seem pushy and expect you tip atless 20%.    I wonder why a restuand here has such of high good review and stars.

8xDIuZRCOBPnNohXepy4LA.text: Although quite easy to see when passing by on the street, this restaurant didn't have an exterior that pulled my interest or make me remember to try it.  It might be the name or the lack of advertising on the outside.  Over time, possibly 2-3 years after seeing the restaurant, we decided to give it a try.  Thankfully through Yelp, I was able to see photos of the food and get a feel for the overall restaurant.  I didn't know that it was a dim sum restaurant but also serves dim sum all throughout the day.  The inside is quite spacious with high ceilings (and a number of bird cages hanging throughout).  I wouldn't consider myself a dim sum snob because it doesn't take much for me to enjoy dim sum.  It's not a weekly thing but when I do have dim sum I tend to enjoy the experience.  At the times that I would go to YumCha, they don't have the many people pushing the carts around offering the various dim sum choices.  They might do that earlier in the morning.  The food that I have tried is great and they have a very expansive offering from traditional choices like shao long bao to more fast food style choices like general tso chicken.  I really enjoyed the chow mein here, I thought it tasted great.  I recommend the hot tea which you can share and they keep refilling it with more.  If you ever crave dim sum later than midday than I would definitely go here.

rGfG3nOSfn9hIEHYJGVBdA.text: Hmmmmm I had high hopes for this place and it was a total let down and here's why...  The chicken feet had a very unique and not appetizing smell to it. Don't get me wrong, I would love to crush chicken feet wherever I go but I could tell at 11 am on a Friday that it was leftovers from the previous day.  As for the pork shumai, I normally like my things well seasoned and on the salty side but the shumai had an off day. It was a little over season to the point in which it ruined the flavor of the dish.   Lastly, I wasn't feeling the the sticky rice. The leaves used for it steeped into the sticky rice to the point in which the dish tasted bitter. I couldn't get over the taste and called it quits after that bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. =[

0my57x7y4q_6Y0glecN3xw.text: Yum Cha was absolutely straight fire. We we're staying on the strip and wanted to get away on a Friday afternoon for lunch so we gave this place a try. There Dim Sum was amazing and for the price it was very reasonable.

0GY8upr-BD6FvwHyxShjoA.text: Went to Yum Cha for dinner on a Saturday as a party of 5; our party ordered off of the dim sum and regular entree menu. Everything we ordered off of the dim sum menu was really good! I'm a sucker for the BBQ pork bao and look forward to going again just for that! We all tried chicken feet for the first time and it had good flavor, although the process isn't for me. I didn't enjoy the bones/tendons, personally. Other people in our group ordered chow mein and beef with broccoli and said it was good.   Only negative is that service wasn't great. They took a long time to come to our table and take our order and since we weren't sure how much food we would want to eat, we asked to waitress to come back after we started the first round of dim sum but they didn't come back until everyone else in our party was done with their entrees... Also, the food didn't come out together; the timing worked out that we received our dim sum choices before the entrees came out (problematic for children who are understandably impatient when hungry) and then we weren't able to get more dim sum until well after their entrees came out.  I want to go back for lunch service to see if the service itself is better when they're busier and have the roaming carts; I'm not sure if it was an off night or if it's always slow. I've heard before that non-Asian diners can receive less attention, but that seems like a racist stereotype based off of singular experiences without going back to see if service is different or better at another day/time. For all we know they were short staffed, so I'd like to give them another chance!  The food was good and they kept our drinks refilled, so it's worth another shot! I'll update my review after our next visit- dim sum is definitely at least 4 stars.

Pm6hwmTXmJGTZ_7N6OoIiQ.text: In everyone's life some rain must fall...  I don't know what the circumstances were that those that gave less than 4 stars were, beyond what they wrote but I've lived in Vegas since 12/01 and I've found my favorite place to get pizza and sushi but, until today, I've been desperately looking for my go to Dim Sum spot. You know that spot you're proud to take visiting friends and family? Well Yum Cha is that go to Dim Sum place.   You walk in and it's spacious. Plenty of room to not have people to in your bubble while dining but not so spaced out to look like they need more tables; a perfect balance.   As soon as we sat down, hell, as soon as we approached our table, a cart was standing by to serve us. You're all, "A CART?!?! No! The food will be old and cold!" But alas I say, you can order what you like from a server and have it made and served piping hot fresh. Like take a minute before you take a bite or you will burn your mouth, "hot and fresh".    Here's what we ordered, all freshly made a la cart, but not the Dim Sum cart...  Shrimp Dumplings  Steamed BBQ pork buns Shrimp rice noodles  Shrimp stuffed eggplant  Chinese Broccoli  Xiao Long Bao - soup dumplings  Shrimp & Pork Chive Dumplings  Shiitake Sticky Rice Mai Salt & Pepper Calimari Egg Tart    Pot of Hot Tea and two very good iced teas $66 with tax and 18% gratuity.   The staff was super friendly and helpful and open to our requests for freshly made platters, more napkins, fresh plates and more hot sauce.   Located street side just south of Tropicana and Decatur on the west side of Decatur.   My search is over. Yum Cha is my destination spot for the best Dim Sum in Vegas.   Support you local small local businesses, especially when they are this good.   Well done Yum Cha!

GDZkIBZbuePyLnUpLByGRg.text: Unfortunately Las Vegas doesn't have any great Chinese restaurant and especially Dim Sum. However, Yum Cha is my favorite. They Dim Sum is simple but good. Nothing innovative but consistent. Not as good as the ones in San Francisco and New York, but very acceptable.

38fz_uCsMdbPLnfpXYOiYw.text: Not a bad place for dim sum. There aren't many places around vegas for dim sum that I know of.  I know this place is new overall from what it used to be. I heard it used to be a buffet style and under old management.  First time trying it last night and it wasn't bad. Prices are pretty decent too. We had the pork and shrimp shumai, pork buns were delicious, Chinese broccoli, chicken feet. I also really liked the seafood dumpling soup. But my all time favorite was the lava cake bun! It was extremely delicious!  Service was ok, I guess understandable because there was only 3 of them. I saw them bussing serving running food and in the back kitchen too! So they were pretty busy.
