k8yzCCPqpqW5ZQ1SHIAJNg.text: DIM SUM 12/7  Yu-go and I have been dining here for nearly three years and have basically tried nearly all of their vast selection of both traditional and vegetarian dim sum and many of their entrees especially during dinner. I'm particularly partial to their Malaysian dishes where the wonderfully gregarious and most hospitable Sam and Elaine are orginally from.  Of course weekends are much busier serving dim sum from their push carts. Lots of large tables to accommodate larger groups. The spacious restaurant allows for comfortable seating and conversations to remain relatively private. Table service is always with a smile and with very frequent visits. English, Mandarin, Cantonese and Bahasa are spoken here.  The many bamboo bird cages suspended from the ceiling and the numerous flat screens showing food preperations and travel in South East Asia definitely lends to an enhanced appetite.  There is a tendency to order ones favorite dim sum dish from the cart.  Nothing wrong with that. But, look through their pictured dim sum menu for vegetarian dishes. They are astonishly tasty and good for you.  Consistency of excellence and friendly service is what Sam's and Elaine's Yum Cha is all about. Did I mention that dim sum is avaliable all day and every day of the week. No more having to get up early on your dayoff to beat the crowds for fresh made dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ipoh Hor fun for the first time. Yum, yum!!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Chow Mai Fun is terrific !
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum is the order of the day !

br90dxRnsJhZ9bFRMiDKzw.text: I cannot believe how many times I've been to Vegas and this was my FIRST time here.   Came in on a Sunday post Fri/Saturday shenanigans. The usual, check out is at 11, my friends and I are all dead from going out and being belligerent and at this time there are only two things that sounds good  1. My bed 2. Comfort foods ...so the search for dim sum pre-holiday weekend traffic on the drive back home begins. Yum Cha came up and I b-lined it to the restaurant, about a mile behind the Palms.  We were greeted with a smile, sat right away, and were served har gow before I could even let them know I wanted water. AMAZING! I was so excited, it was two of my friends first time having True dim sum and they were so taken back by how fast the service was. I love love love the authenticity of this place. And *everyone* was so sweet. Service was impeccable, and we kept letting them know. I think servers should always be praised when they're going above and beyond and let me tell you, I probably could've asked for Mcdonalds and they would have brought it to me in a steamer haha! Even one of the servers mentioned that he loved the management, I appreciate that so much! Food service is hard as it is, it's good to know employees are happy where they are.   But seriously, some of the best dim sum I've had in a long looooong time. I grew up in the Bay Area, so I'm used to real china town goods. This place completely brought me back. Please go here, pleaaaaaaaaaase.  I wish I took pictures of my food but I was so busy stuffing my face I wasn't even thinking of anything else. 5 stars alll around!

6tL1Scy3PS3u7h7E8OsuCA.text: Was not expecting such great customer service here, but wow I was totally blown away by how attentive the staff were, especially for a dim sum place! First off, the food was great and there was a pretty vast menu of various items to choose from. They serve dim sum all day which is quite unique, and the food was great! I always tend to get hot tea when doing dim sum, and usually it tastes either very watered down or just like straight up hot water, and was also not expecting how good their tea was either!  My friends and I were seated promptly and were never neglected throughout the entire service, which was quite impressive as we had a fairly big party. Overall very satisfied and would definitely come back, the staff was so friendly and helpful!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut pudding
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various types of dim sum

qF4y-LpgJleHy3qBL7n2DQ.text: After trying a few other 'top rated' dim sum places in Vegas, my husband and I have deemed Yum Cha as our favorite - nothing compares. Food is always fresh and delicious; service is attentive and friendly; price is reasonable. We'll be coming back again and again!

llKFFl8HZoER14T4ck3gpg.text: The staff here is super friendly, which is unusual for a dim sum place. They try their best to bring everything you asked for as soon as possible.   I enjoyed having dim sum here! It also seems like they have a ton of vegetarian options with imitation meat options.   Will be back here for dim sum!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butterfly pea sticky rice

7Nr-UAHFZOl0CH2UIXPoxA.text: Decent dim sum and cleaner than most of other places in Chinatown.  Good customer service!!!  I would come back and try other dishes.

mDZrQPpcGz6opHVjcgPfWQ.text: One of my favorite asian food to eat is Dim Sum! When I walked in this place I saw that it had a large dining room and a partial open kitchen with a display of their desserts and some of their menu items including their Peking duck. Their ceilings were adorned with copper looking bird cages  they also had interesting signs as soon as you walk in the door and even at the restroom area to even inside the restroom. Their menu had a variety of dim sum to Chinese food. So we ordered Pan Fried Chive/Shrimp Dumpling, Mushroom Shumai, Shrimp Shumai, Salt & Pepper Fried Crispy Shrimp, Veggie Egg Noodle, Sugar Cane Shrimp, Fried Shrimp Wonton, and Steam Pork Ribs w/Taro| For dessert: Soft Grated Coconut Mochi| Golden Sand Lava Custard Bun| Coconut Bun.  You order your dim sum from their menu and they serve it ALL DAY. They don't have servers they go around in carts.  Oh so Yummy! Everything from food to service was 5 ! Every dim sum restaurant I've been to before the service is never that great. The wait staff here is so attentive and very friendly and always there if you need anything. A must go to place again

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut bun
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ko_CsunMDnmbxyfaQkwQwg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Shrimp dumpling here is delicious and the service is good.

rvd9rIUk2W2KzJmn4tEO8Q.text: This place is AWESOME !! Moving from LA it was hard for me to find a good spot since I've been going to the same ones all my life. BUT. Thankfully that has changed. The service here is so good! All the servers help out so someone's always checking on you ! Great prices of course ! Dim sum is always good priced. I personally don't eat meat so shrimp items are also generally sold out all the time but YUM CHA had everything I ordered! Soooo good we ordered more to go. Love this place ! Will be coming back here (:!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SWnOwfdKm0bh0irZeNTzPg.text: We have been back here a few times since my first review. The food has been great and fresh every time!  The service is outstanding! They are very caring and attentive. Thank you Elaine, Sam and Chong!

2_Wv3vJrtmu3Vbqu2CYylQ.text: I need to start this review by saying how impressed I was with the entire staff.  The service we received was EXCELLENT!!!  I have never had such excellent service in a Chinese restaurant in my life!!!  The staff was very helpful with our orders, patient, and attentive to our needs.    Dim sum for 2.  Got shumai, 2 kinds of chive dumplings, har gow x2, fishcake stuffed tofu x2, crab claws, and sesame bun.  I would say the food here is good.  Not great, not bad, but definitely good.  Would I come here again?  Yes I would.  Would I recommend this place?  Yes I would.  The reviews I read lead me to believe that there were tons of items up front in the display.  I was a little let down that they didn't have all the items I was hoping for.  The carts that come around are pretty standard for any dim sum restaurant in town.  The shumai were  good, they were my favorite item.  I judge every dim sum place by their shumai and I was not disappointed.  I'd like to go back with more people so I can try more items.

PkwypPqP6Wakg9cw88OYcw.text: Found this place by accident!  This place is amazing dimsum,soups and etc.. Street food in Asia .food are all to die for And they have a variety of place to choose from.. Staff are very attentive and you get your money's  Worth. If you are a tourist and looking for good authentic dimsum and chinese food ...this is the place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DuMPycXTkjBol4irxH19tQ.text: I got mislead by all these people giving 5 stars for a freebie dim sum dish. The place is ok. Service much better than the one that went out of business in its place. It's not any better than Orchid Garden. My favorite place remains the one in Gold Coast....favorite among the ones available in LV. None of them are that great. If they have good food then the service sucks. If they have good service then the food sucks. I am not sure why one of the popular ones from LA have not opened shop here.  We ordered quite a bit of the usual stuff and the price came out to be less than $30 for 2. I am perplexed by why they make you go to the counter for regular items like chive dumplings and egg custard tarts. Those are regular fare. The items on the heated trays should be for take outs or maybe specialized items but no one wants to get out of their seat to get some items while some are wheeled around in the cart. It's seems counter intuitive to me. They do come by with trays selling fried items that normally are not good sellers though.  I think management needs to rearrange the way they set things up. Manager was nice and pointed things out to us but I will probably not be back. There's really nothing to make me want to come back. I wish them luck though. I am not the type to yelpitute myself for a free item. I am annoyed I fell into the trap and went because I thought all those stars meant a good one opened up. Too good to be True.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular fare of dimsum items.

FcgNWx8XQgBiOI9T35thJA.text: The service was good and there was not a wait when we went at 12:30pm. the duck was very greasy and a bit boney.  The chicken feet was a little smelly. I prefer ping pang pong over Yum Cha.

RVpm5ttWvn5st2K-TyZcww.text: I have tried Yum Cha for the first time and I am hooked. Yum Cha is my new favorite dim sum restaurant and will likely be my favorite for quite some time. I posted a photo of our first round of orders, but the food was so good I couldn't stop to take pics of rounds two or three or even the Roti and Curry. When it comes to the Roti and Curry get your own. We thought we could share one and it almost destroyed our relationship.   There are so many things that immediately set Yum Cha apart from all the other restaurants in this category. Most noticeably is the walk up counter. Not only can you choose from cart options, but you can also choose from other options at the display. Another major difference for me is the friendly service. Everyone is smiling. Not a common thing I see at most restaurants in this genre. Come experience Yum Cha for yourself. I know I will be returning real soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j7YXCaP96YWjO7r55qwR-w.text: Excellent food and the service was wonderful. Very big place - looks buffet but it is very personalized service. Since it was our first time they explained everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well as you can see the food was excellent- all gone

OChn1tgPdPjG6-a5K49ZCA.text: The food was delicious here. However there is a bit of a language barrier depending on what server you get. The employees working and pushing the cart stok in Chinese to us when we ask questions that was really difficult for for us to communicate. There is a lot of picture pointing going on. However once you finally do get past that barrier the food is very delicious however a little bit slow. The prices for the food are reasonable and it fills you up pretty quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kp1sfIr2TYI6aa41siyvhQ.text: I'm a HK girl from San Francisco that's super picky about her authentic Cantonese dim sum.  This place is the real deal.  No frills, authentic fresh dim sum.  Usually authentic places sacrifice service. Not here.  The service was great.  The staff came by often to see if we needed to order anything else.  Take the 10 minute drive from the strip to come here.  It's worth it!!!!

S0Ai8IGlkMwJOiBvQxIm9g.text: Disappointed. Pictures look good but reviews are overrated.  Can get better dim sum at other places in town.

C2Zamrszq_Il1SSk3CnIZw.text: This was great. I was hungover and hungry and it tasted amazing. It was fast kind and the owner even brought out an extra desert she had. Thank you

rKiBqYqHJBEIl56RjfgEVA.text: "I think I have an abusive relationship with Dim Sum." These were my boyfriends words after we experienced the superb service at Yum Cha.   We were instantly greeted with smiles and an explanation of  how everything worked. They even had a selection of hot teas we could choose from: oolong, jasmine, and another one I didn't quite catch the name of.   Normally service is terrible but here, it's different. During our dining experience three different people asked if we needed anything, kept our waters filled, and no attitude was given.   The setup of this dim sum establishment was a lot different than anything I've seen either. Carts still came around with the steamed goodies but their fried items were set up along a cafeteria window. They displayed the items along the window and then they bring it over to your table.  Overall, the quality of food was good. Not the best but good. I think as soon as they start picking up customers and pump out fresh dim sum the quality will get better. Otherwise, I'd come back because the staff is attentive and friendly, there's no 20 minute wait, and it satisfied my dim sum craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The goodies

t6VxPPyLOegLbQtmZNZ4sg.text: What an excellent meal we had at Yum Cha!! We were visiting Las Vegas and looking for something off the strip that was unique and authentic. The Yelp reviews seemed great and the website too, so we figured, "let's check it out!".  We arrived and the place had an inviting vibe with many tables and a great looking dim sum menu. I love the carts full of delicious food, the different choices and flavors. A few carts came by with more and more great choices! We started with shrimp rice dumplings, chicken and pork shu mai, tons of sweet pork dishes. All so good!!! The tea was also excellent, went so well with our meal.   The service was pleasant and the manager was so friendly! He treated us to a delicious pork bun and took us through a tour of the food that is in the buffet-style area. I am excited to go back to Vegas and try that Malaysian dish!! My boyfriend loved the place too, it's a great spot, I totally recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our favorite of the pork buns, yummm!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp dumplings, pork and chicken shu mai, pork buns - all of them so good!!

hm3IlnEoRg1MYVS9avPXBw.text: I was really craving dim sum tonight and initially planned on going to the Rio or Chinatown but I noticed that Yum Cha had really good reviews so I decided to give them a chance. We were seated immediately (boyfriend, son, and I) and they all seem like genuine people. Compared to most dim sum places, the service was great and the food was prepared fresh. You can actually watch then prepare your food for you. Freshly steamed, freshly cooked, and in a timely fashion. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try. It's ALL DAY DIM SUM at such a reasonable price and extremely tasty! I'll definitely be coming back whenever I crave for more dim sum!

VCr-mlmtNp9Fpi_8oc5K1Q.text: I usually go to other places for dim sum and usually people that serve us are very rude but this place everyone is just soooo nice! Everyone is smiling and helping us out. They dont give us that mean look just like every Chinese place I go to. Always refilling our waters and I this place is surprisingly clean!   Must try the roti with curry and calamari :)  Oh and their water doesnt taste like tap lol

eFUd0ID9taE7NZUpOVnesA.text: I was happy that they accommodated me a few minutes before opening time. Dimsum is ok. Not a lot of selection. They also Didn't know how to make simple Thai tea. I was kinda disappointed.

rTpjbWQCmfUQhIEw5KiUjA.text: I've been wanting to try Yum Cha for some time, and I'm so happy I did!  SOOO much dim sum to try, the stand out was the beef ball. Super smooth, and the addition of worchestishire sauce was perfect.   Staff very kind and attentive, they were genuinely happy for me to try their food. They have every right to be proud, they are excellent.  No need for Chinatown for dim sum, ever again!

ANmgA3qIWY_if2kqPVKzOA.text: Great authentic dim sum. Many items are made to order so they come out hot and fresh. Only the most popular are on the cart. Order your custard buns and crab claws early!

bQuIIdnIddxoMCEC5OOXHw.text: With their name and such positive reviews and high ratings you would think this would be the best yum cha in Vegas....yeah it doesn't work that way on the Monday after thanksgiving with people sparsely seated. Best customer service but a lot of their baked goods like BBQ pork bun, coconut bun, baked egg yolk bun at the counter were old and just kind of reheated and a little dried out/ chewy. They ran out of steamed egg yolk buns and no longer have that egg yolk cake pictured in yelp, and didn't make several dishes that they normally would like white fungus they have on their slide show and other items I asked for. All of the steamed items from cart were gold and unappetizing, the cheung fun was ice cold and noodles hard. This is probably one of my worst dim sum experiences but I am from San Francisco....This meal was all a waste of calories and we should have stopped ordering instead of having hope. Sorry but 1 bad experience prob won't bring me back here despite the really nice helpful people that work here.

8-annl_VGd2dZHGZqwzj1w.text: My family and I were out in Vegas last month and I was craving dim sum, this place definitely hit the spot for us! It's about 5 to 10 mins off the strip, worth the distance though. The staff were friendly and the owner was very sweet. He came to check on us several times and we had a great conversation with him. The food was amazing! They have some people with carts walking around the restaurant, and the rest was made right in front of you where a row of steamers and staff were. It came out quickly, was flavorful, and fairly priced. If you're looking for a good dim sum spot in Vegas, this is the place to go.  I plan to stop here every time we are in Vegas for a great breakfast, vs an overpriced waffle on the strip.

HZ31PPxbv0_06G4snbFK6w.text: This is now where I can get my dimsum fix and the compli tea is really good too.. yum yum all around

xMiQk57Si7CEzrG49gorrA.text: I just ate here and this is probably the worst dim sum I have eaten to date. Food tastes like it has been sitting out and then reheated to be sold. There is no quality here and no one really pays attention to the food they are actually serving. I had to send two dishes back because it was spoiled. And that was 2/5 dishes we got. So disappointed and I wouldn't ever come back here when I am in Vegas.

0hptxnzvgBvCTSUSbgfkPQ.text: Best dim sum place in town.  This place has great food, great service and a lot of options to choose from.  Staff is friendly and conversational as well.

YUz6M9ESGS8C8ExMFsdEgQ.text: These are the best dumplings I've had hands down. They beat the pants  off what I ate in San Fran in China town. There was more mandarin being spoken inside than there was English. I would come back here without hesitation.

sk9P5xYIGDkBi2HJayoDCQ.text: Not as good as I expected. Slow service, don't have many selections of foods. Foods were not as goods compare to other places. Taking too long to order. Will not come back again.

VJ5bXcWXO3oYkJQhAhsDUw.text: Over rated... The green shirt guys are interesting... less PR and more actual work. Asked for a simple shrimp fried rice it took 5 employees to figure it out... Seriously!  I can speak a little Cantonese and Mandarin. Then had to order dim sum from the counter it seems they don't have carts on the floor until 5pm. So I ordered from the counter then the food disappeared for about 10 minutes Hahaha WOW. below average dim sum. Then I had to hunt down the spice tray not on the tables. Install some fans and get rid of the empty bird cages.. Seriously!  Tip of the day - 168 market has better DIM SUM and better service. No return visit.  P.S. The shrimp fried rice is how they made it to 2 stars pretty good.

SccB2sJbNCK6bsZhssdKIg.text: My first visit here and I absolutely loved it! I've had Dim Sum elsewhere, I don't know how to order Dim Sum as other Dim Sum restaurants have carts that come around and you choose the ones you want. I  am very happy that they had a menu that tells you what type of Dim Sum you are ordering. Makes it very easy! You guys have to try the dessert Dim Sum. Its filled with Custard and its so delicious!! Yum Cha I'll be back!

l8wuCET7WKZ2rEvkP3_uew.text: This was my first time to have dim sum and it was great! The service is amazing, everyone is super nice.

ELHRKGOxptHVpi-CHJnkrA.text: It's not my fave dim sum place in Las Vegas but I do like how it's served all day compared to the usual 2pm. They don't have as much variety and if you go later in the day the food isn't as fresh or hot . Overall, it's just ok but not bad .

pPjBKs9yoplTl8LAnwA7rg.text: Have been there 2 weeks ago and dim sum was great with quality service.  The price is reasonable.  The environment isn't the transitional one but we all enjoyed the dinner.  Definitely will come back soon.

EAuFMf_2aTM3aY-qbrBFlQ.text: Good food, clean and fast service. Owner is really nice greeted and checked on us couple times. Happy to find a new dimsum spot!!

k5T6qyho05elL_XJl3BcIg.text: I got a restaurant.com gift card on the same day that I went to the restaurant. The owner said they don't take the gift card from restaurant.com. He said he discontinued it in July. However, when I called the restaurant.com customer service, they said the restaurant is active and nobody noticed them that he wanted to be off the list. I am not sure who is right or wrong. I only come here just because of the coupon. The food was not good. But they were hot. So if you use the coupon, make sure you ask the owner before you start ordering. The staffs were nice and helpful. But that's all about it.

Aa1hPXXe8NsUdZA2aSRJ_g.text: We are locals and visited Ym Cha for the first time. Excellent!!! Amazingly fresh dim sum!!  Delicious!  This will be the only place that we will go for dim sum in the future!!!!

q7qVw6klwPhIqPmr6Dtilg.text: yum cha is a game changer. from food quality to service, let me tell you why..  I absolutely love har gow and shu mai. when I was a little duckling, I would get dim sum with my mom and they were our signature go-to choices. yum cha has the freshest selection of dim sum I've ever seen. the walk up hot bar is great because you can ask for what you want, they make it there for you and even deliver it to your table!  I'm a Chinese/Vietnamese descendant and I know how difficult it is to cross language barriers and we have our own way of doing things amongst other cultures. the effort that the staff and owners put in to communicate and communicate well with you is a huge plus. they check up on you to make sure everything is okay, and even make great suggestions. this is something I wholeheartedly appreciated and make the experience better.   egg custard desserts won me ten fold. reasonable prices and superb quality. get some.

DzXia5e6zfM_E3NVTWb4MA.text: I love to come here! It's always great service. The foods were delicious and fresh. The restaurant is clean. Recommend mango pudding

VraNuBShBQNOsYCEKWZ61A.text: When we travel, Dim Sum is something we are always on the hunt for. Yum Cha is some of the best we have ever come across. When we were in Vegas a few weeks ago, we found this place on our first day in town, and we're so thankful we did. We went 4 more times throughout the week. If you venture off the strip, which you absolutely should, this place is a gem. The dim sum is fresh and tasty. The staff was super helpful, especially Elaine. Since we went 5 times, we made our way through their entire dim sum menu; our favorites were the Pork & Shrimp Shumai, Shrimp Dumplings, and the Chive Dumplings. The most unexpected and delicious item was the Radish Cake. Elaine told us most Americans really don't like it, but we absolutely loved it. It was super affordable, the prices couldn't be better. Can't wait to go back next year when we're back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ovUYs7w3SdwcLLTcVV3pdg.text: Yelp reviews totally threw me off about this place. Service was decent. However: -Bathroom smelled and the urinal was right next to the sink with no separator. -Food was bland. -Organization was chaotic. -There were flys flying around our table. -As we were walking out, we saw the big "C" from the health department hanging on the wall...  Wouldn't recommend.

3sLOFjRuOYEZ3lNLYZcihQ.text: I didnt expect this dim sum place to be really good. The staff were friendly, good food and fast service. Their pricing is reasonable as well. I love their pork bun and shrimp hakaw! The place is pretty clean as well. And they go to your table once you're seated so you can choose from the dim sum menu. And then when you request one server something, they're very polite and acknowledge you. I've never had this good service in a dim sum place so i was really surprised. I love it. I am definitely coming back to this place with more people!

ZAkooJJCvk_so536Xeefrw.text: The worse dim sum place we had in life. Food is cold and no taste. Order stir fry noodle and it's like steam noodle with grill onion on it. My little nephew had xiao long bao and it's like something from supermarket frozen food. Food smell like leftover food.   We definitely don't enjoy the food here. I don't think we are so picky about dim sum but this is bad.

jvK48AQdb7qJeC9jbFL_3g.text: First time here and everything was great and service was great ! My husband and I love dim sum ! Glad we found this place ! Yummy dim sim

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying new items ... but so far very yummy!

ncc4MZboWzb9aHfSJP48pg.text: I was thinking they wouldn't have a good variety of dim sum and they did. Good service, cute interior. From Tueday to Friday some of the more popular dim sum is discounted.

9ofpOWiLkjEatUz4hEt1rw.text: Really liked their custard buns!!!! Both steamed and baked were so good! Also one of the best dim sum places out there! Staffs were friendly, the manager will recognize you if you come back for the 2nd time!

J5xIcnCEfaBp757XkpBrOg.text: Food was bad. Not sure why others rank this restaurant so high. Don't waste your money there. It is expensive and food is really bad.

HfDq_0SQkvIhDFS0oN4CPQ.text: My husband was craving salted fish fried rice and it was delicious!  Dim sum was good. Very fast & friendly service. Kung pao chicken was perfect. We came for lunch.

KbqXgTbJMHgJgybK2R2fxg.text: Very nice people. Good food. Coconut bun for dessert. Yum Cha!  I am a first-timer to Dim Sum but Becky said it was very authentic. I will take her word for it; all I know is that it tasted good & fresh.   A little bit off of the "beaten path" but still close to the I15 and many of the hotels / casinos west of the Strip.   Well done, Yum Cha. Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LloyC4OXJsdzw-awhpWJsA.text: The food is great. The service could be a little better, but the staff is friendly and nice. Great food to eat after a night of clubbing in vegas.

0Erv_TYkeu41QDQeF7L0jQ.text: Absolutely delicious.  After reading all the good reviews, I had to see it for myself.  So many choices, and fresh!  All the fried dishes were made after we ordered, not sitting around on the cart getting cold. The service was exceptional. They were very attentive and polite. We didn't feel rushed at all. It's so unlike a typical Chinese restaurant. We will definitely be back, bringing some relatives to try our new dim sum spot.

vSV4vgOUnotkmSFcAa4YNA.text: If you like to eat hargow (shrimp dumpling) or shumai, do not come here. Not very efficient dim sum carts. First they take forever to reload their food then they always take the same route. So during my visit, all dimsum carts always started from the other end of the restaurant always leaving me with same unpopular few options. Never saw shrimp dumplings nor shumai until I was full with unwanted food.  Asked what I wanted many times for 30 minutes, but noone really cared. They will simply ignore if you are not getting what you want. Becareful where you seat if you are planning to come here.

sqdmMUiCDsEzS_tTvonvHA.text: Simply amazing! Me and my wife ate for like 4 people and almost finished every last bite!  What I like about this restaurant is how fresh everything tastes. Servers come to you with a cart full of various piping hot items like steamed pork, buns, beef tendons, chicken feet, dim sum, fish balls, and more. What I listed is what me and my wife got lol. Plus the fish ball noodles soup, roasted duck, and sweet red bean buns for dessert.   I thought the price was insanely cheap too. I thought the cashier employee ready 87 bucks, which sounded right, but it was actually just 47$!   Speaking of employees by the way, the servers were all very nice, offered suggestions, and were nice enough to give us half a duck when we asked as opposed to the whole thing which I think they usually serve.   STOP BY AND YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED :D

mAeVyyWTq4aHjDK0_Bp8wA.text: A good Cantonese operated Restaurant. Food is good and not expensive. A good place to go dinning in Vegas.

lA0vifObgy0l39TB-bYjcg.text: Wow what can you say? This hidden jewel had the best food I've ever had from a dim sum place( (located in Vegas) Our favorites were probably the fried eggplant and pork buns but the dumplings were a close second. Also the atmosphere was cheery with the staff being extremely nice and talkative. We talked to both the owner and other people working there and thought they were all very pleasurable. Overall this was a perfect place for any meal, and we went around breakfast. This will definitely become our Las Vegas dim sum Hang out and it should be yours to!

ZfBOaW1ZrljWqYrkur1u8Q.text: We really enjoyed our first dim sum restaurant! Food was great, we tried a variety of dishes and the service and pricing was perfect! Will go back again for sure!

Ta49E_cXmjs6FpMt70dwlg.text: Here for the4th of July! Nice variety and quality on par with other nearby places. I enjoyed the usual shu mai and my friend really enjoyed 2 tripe dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6YTKIkb4JUfiZlENhImpJQ.text: Came to yum cha cuz of all the good reviews.. 4.5/5 stars on yelp on a dim sum place?! Gotta try it!! Yum cha is located on Decatur x Tropicana, it is right across from international market.  The menu for dim sum is really small compare to all of the other dim sum places, and they have it by groups. It doesn't have a lot of what I usually ordered, and on the day that we were there, they don't even have the BBQ pastries bun, they told us they don't have it today. So I've tried the har gao, siu mai, spare ribs,  the sticky rice with lotus leaves along with a few other dim sum, and honestly, I am not impressed. The taste is alright, I've definitely had better elsewhere, but the lack of dishes is really upsetting, I still felt the crave for dim sum after eating here. And they don't have egg tarts! (Maybe it's cuz it's weekday?)  On their menu, they have a bunch of random stuffs too, like roti with curry and etc, and u can also go up to the counter to get the food too. While they do have good services, I come to dim sum place for dim sum, so expand your menu!! Seriously, there was a lot of dishes that you can add!!  Oh another disappointment was that they have messed up on the har gao. It was over cooked and the wrap wasn't made right. And I wanted to try their xiao long bao and they didn't have it :(  However, they do have chicken bao here and it's rarely seen in most dim sum place. And they are also supposed to have streamed cake but I didn't see it in the cart?  The price is cheaper on weekdays/non-holidays so it's a better deal to go on Monday-Friday but they might have less items on the cart(?).

_jZqSILVMBrz0R4kg6LFqA.text: It's a Chinese restaurant so the customer service is average at best. If you go in with that mindset, then you'll enjoy this place. Top notch dim sum at $3/order. That's a steal!!

ZYBqwPHwfgg67OBA6A4ouQ.text: My first time here and I'm so glad I yelped this place their dim sum is so so good! I will defiantly come back when I come back in town! :)

Kh-vT9W5vAeLkILcQnbmDg.text: Was looking for a great dim sum place and this place hit the spot. Really great dim sum and menu food. Some things need a little additional seasoning but just use the chili paste provided. Restaurant is clean and service is fast. Could be a little more friendly but it's good enough

QAYS8GrX8bzGuFEuouGbAg.text: The Yum Cha restaurant is incredible! My boyfriend and I eat here very often and we get amazing service and the food is delicious with great quality! The Dim sum is one of the best in town!!! The restaurant is very clean and spacious! I highly recommend this place(=

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice with beef, chicken and shrimp

Ra5FE0KLAEUwASlX9and-g.text: My skepticism was high as we decided to try dim sum on a whim with a silly name like Yum Cha.  Upon arrival, I was slightly disappointed that the place looks like a food court with a hot food counter, tiled floors, and barren tables and chairs.  However, the food was surprisingly good!  The servers were all helpful and quick.  When we asked for something and they ran out of it, the cart lady jotted it down, and actually brought a new batch over to us several minutes later.  I was impressed that she remembered!  The owner or manager was also friendly.  She's one who rolls up her sleeves and hustles.  She came by a couple of times to check on us, and even asked if we liked the pan fried chive dumplings that we ordered.  We said yes, and she said good, because she fried them a few minutes ago herself.  It's not gourmet dim sum, but everything was authentic and done well.

JvI7C-1qpKdx2tslhNrD7w.text: Offering dim sum all day long is their niche, so it's convenient if you have a craving for it past normal lunch hours.  As far as flavor is concerned...it's not as good the San Gabriel Valley restaurants in Los Angeles, but it's good.

wDInqZG0vg3REcXt-x7CdQ.text: They do things a bit differently here in Las Vegas compared to New York Chinatown but I have to say the food quality is just as good as some of the good places in NY.   the nice thing about here is the location. It's away from the  Strip but easy to get to by car and they have parking.

I6o1ABu-jRefHVVrynTdLw.text: Authentic dim sum place. They have carts and everything. Hot tea is good. The food is delicious! Service is as good as any authentic Chinese place (this means it's average, lol). The staff are friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XXGmdrQDmj5-G2IchAP5RQ.text: Delicious, food was tasty, staff was nice food was hot and better than I expected. Was in Vegas for work and wanted to try this out with a coworker. He had never had dim sum and loved it here as well. I would recommend yum cha to anyone visiting Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying some amazing dim sum

l6C0Q87hFgo8ZTalr2snVA.text: I came here on a Sunday around 11:30 AM. There was an hour wait. After being seated, nobody came around for approximately 10-15 minutes. I waved down one of the ladies pushing the cart, and she said if I needed somebody to wait on us I must wave my arms and call out loudly. Fine. I did as I was instructed, and alas I got to order my dim sum feast. All the items came out quickly and piping hot. But how did this place with such slow, lousy service with steep prices earn my five stars? The dim sum was incredible! Everything tasted heavenly, and the variety of dishes they offer is unmatched. I have tasted many good attempts of classic dim sum dishes before, and Yum Cha's versions were extremely comparable or even better. A couple of new items I tried were the shiitake dumplings and crispy eggplant. The crispy eggplant's batter was an absolute delight, sweet from honey, and the texture was crunchy (but not hard). My family ordered over ten dim sum dishes, and I can't begin to emphasize the deliciousness. My favorites were the lava custard bun, steam sausage bun and crispy eggplant. Next time, I will try to find an optimal time to visit and avoid the crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu 7/7
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu 6/7
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu 5/7

1pgp7_dDewq2Ic7LBt6AXg.text: This almost seems a bit ridiculous, but I always get nervous about highly-rated Yelp dim sum places because I find that those rated lower tend to be more authentic. Despite my previous experiences, I decided to give this place a try. I honestly wasn't impressed.  I'm Cantonese and have tried dim sum from all different sorts of places. Personally, I find that I can really speak to the culture, authenticity, and taste of what dim sum should be. This place was not it. Yes, the restaurant is clean and the service is good, but it was so Americanized.   The dim sum was expensive. The taste of the dim sum itself was subpar. Some of the foods were old and dry and the flavor itself was lacking compared to other places I've tried. They only had 1 cart being pushed around. The remainder of the foods were by order, but came out cold and unimpressive. Nice people overall, but if you're truly looking for authentic tasting dim sum, I would not opt for this place.

rcrBWoIq6EPQ2OOxoQqWCw.text: Great service. Busser is on point after we finished each plate. Servers came to check up on us pretty often. Dim sum was good for the price we paid. Super affordable and before we left we got thanked from 4 different staff members. Coming back for sure next time im craving dim sum in vegas.

diduDxEU_jU5S48wUKIkWQ.text: We went to Yum Cha for the first time a few days ago. It wasn't busy (we ate really early around 5-ish) so we were abke to avoid the dinner crowd. The restaurant is nice and clean. The restrooms are clean as well.   The food is great and for a good price! We spent about $48 for 3 people (8 or so dim sum dishes + Wonton soup). They have two menus: one for dim sum and one for other dishes (like chow mein or fried rice). Because we were early we were able to get our food fairly quickly and didn't have to wait long. We had dim sum and a wonton soup and after a few dishes we were really full.   It was our first time there and definitely not our last. It's also a nice change to go to a dim sum restaurant and just order rather than wait for the carts to come around and hopefully get the right one.

uOX1JBRZzBlhTjCldhPuXw.text: We came by after a trade show and before heading to the airport. Items were reasonably priced, maybe slightly on the high side, but you can't complain when you are getting dim sum at 7 at night. The restaurant was practically empty so we were seated right away.  We got your standard fare, shumai,har gow, char siu bao, custard, etc. the dishes were all good, not great, but definitely better than the dim sum place I once visited in Indianapolis (but that's a whole different story and review).  You order and they bring the dishes to you and the waiter left us a menu in case we wanted to order more.  I'd come here again if I was in Vegas and wanted dim sum at night. It was definitely less than if we had stayed on the strip and went to an Asian fusion restaurant in a casino.

za0QCpq9IXVD6SDwamV7eQ.text: It's pretty basic dim sum with just an a-ok for quality of food. Was craving some dim sum and they did have the carts stocked and running but there were only two carts and they both had the same stuff. There was only our table and two other tables at the time. The congee we ordered barely had any pork in it. Soup dumplings were more dry than soupy. The pork and shrimp dim sum and other varieties of steamed goodies we had was not the worst but didn't live up to the hype. The chicken feet looked old but my friend still ate it. Would I recommend this place? Only if you're in desperate need but there are so many good places to eat in Vegas I honestly probably won't go back.  The ladies were nice there but please make soup dumplings actual SOUP dumplings!

8A8e9dCtNHjfB8LraSpkIQ.text: Great place! Food is very tasty. Portions are big for Dim Sum. Everything is delicious. The owner is super nice and cool. The decor is cute with all the birdcages hanging from the ceiling. Next month they will have a lot more options for vegetarians.    I def recommend this place!

mm5XQlfWg9i1rUwLCLkFsA.text: Had lunch with my friend here on a Saturday noon. Many round tables and booths. We ordered many dim sum, and some green veggie and congee. The baked lava custard bun was really huge, and liked the flowing lava inside it. The Chou-sum was steamed and served with oyster sauce, and tasted fresh and light. The egg and pork congee was good too, with sliced green onions on top of it.

Omg... i will neverrr go back...

YsoqsIBObQ1ys_m1yw5Jrw.text: We have passed this place 100 times if I have done it once. We shop at the International Market across the street so today I felt like dim sum and we stopped in! YEAH US! Let me start by saying we filled our bellies to the brim and were in and out in about 35 minutes! The dim sum is super fresh and almost too hot to eat (that's a good thing!) but everything we ordered was delicious. We loved that everything is made with such care. The dim sum is super light and delicately made and not too salty!  Everything had a great texture and flavor! Not any flavor over powered anything.  We tried the following and as I said loved it all! My only negative is there was not really any "spicy sauce". The chili sauce they had was pretty bland. We ordered the following the chicken shumai, shrimp and spinach steamed dumpling, the shrimp (almost a ravioli) something in a light broth. The sweet chicken wrapped in tofu was yummy! A beef something from the cart and a sticky shiitake mushroom rice. I think I got it all. Just get what strikes you as I said everything really was great! Service was fast, friendly and helpful and they clean while you are sitting there! So two thumbs up and they do take out!! Yippie we will be back!

nhCkf0DiGT-7wFimuZgISg.text: Oh Lordy this dim sum was amazing!  They were so helpful in helping us make choices.  My favorite was the pork bbq steamed buns.  Will definitely be back.

PdYSuz8avucADHpm2PRnBQ.text: If you are looking for an all day affordable dimsum. This is the place to go. They can be very busy on the weekend. By it's fine, mornings are usually the best time to try fresh yummy dimsum.

PjOBhhYy1qKEzdlVcBnXiw.text: Come here now and then for Dim Sum. Went here this past Saturday afternoon around 12:30.   Food was fresh, place was clean, and servers were refreshingly nice and attentive. Empty plates were constantly removed and servers and wait staff kept checking in. Manager even stopped by once.   Kitchen and prep area can be seen from the dining area, so I do like how everything is visible. When you ordered things aside from the cart selection, you see them get your food and deliver to the table.  There is quite a bit of seating in the restaurant. I can't remember one time where I've had to wait to be seated. Prices are reasonable. Food is decent and fresh. Quick service all in all.

rTiYq4mctAmbT-il2T3eyg.text: This place was next to our hotel Tahiti so we decided to give a try. We tried it and were very happy. The food was good. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed the BBQ steamed bun. The beef balls, and beef short ribs were also satisfying.  For $50 bucks my boyfriend and I ate there and we even took so back to our suite.  We did over eat but it was delicious.  The service was okay...  5 stars for the yummy food.

EDzt5xvBI-_GXHeeWBQZ0w.text: Vegas isn't renowned for it's Chinese food, this is True but Yum Cha provides an "A-OK" experience if you have a craving.  The menu is large and the pricing is reasonable.  It's clear they use some frozen, boxed items but they seem to get good quality ones.  Solid standard dim sum fare.  Some of the saucing is a bit sweet for my liking (chicken feet and shrimp rice noodle) but still good.  The sweet drinks (iced teas) are quite sweet as well.  The service is good.  Really quick and efficient.  The dining room is large and really clean.

O4kbbShAoFktAZsJKejC0A.text: Came here early afternoon hoping for some decent dim sum. Place is deserted, total 3 tables including us.  Service - decent, above average for a Chinese restaurant   Food quality- not too bad  but not close to the over 1k 4 stars rating   Portion -small, in other words, over priced  It was a big disappointment and confusion. We can't figure out how it can be rated 4 stars by so many.   Not a place that we will visit again whenever we come to LV

izTrtbAxE7ohO--HvZqroQ.text: When in Vegas, you win some, you lose some, and you dim sum!   Our party of 12 walked in at 1PM on a Sunday and got seated right away at a round table with lazy susan in the center. The place was spacious and very ideal with the dim sum carts going around. It only took 5 minutes to get food on our table as most of the stuff we wanted were all in the carts and the ladies pushing them were on top of it. Siu mai, about 10 orders of 4 were what we consumed the most. We also got chicken feet, spare ribs, har gaw, breaded fried shrimp, sticky rice, beef tendon, and those heavenly fried mochi balls stuffed with pork. Special orders were made such as yang chow fried rice, shrimp wrapped in white rice noodle, turnip cake, taro cake, and sweet tofu with ginger of course. Everything I so pleasantly partook in, sans chicken feet as I don't eat that.   You might find yourself lost in translation here so when in doubt, ask for the male server who speaks english or he might have been the manager, not sure. Really patient guy with all of our additional orders and following them up. We had to cancel our 2nd order of the breaded fried shrimp as that took forever to come out. It was so good though - bummer. There was also some confusion with the itemized bill but that same guy cleared it out for us.  Bottomline, would I come back here if craving dim sum in Vegas? Absolutely!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fUqZREqt5z3CPa_c63yumg.text: I am seriously dumbfounded at how this place scored 4 stars with over 1,000 reviews. Simply dumbfounded.  The place and parking lot were completely empty when we walked in. There was one table.  PRICE- $$$$. The items on their ABCD list are almost double the price of other dim sum restaurants. The chicken feet (odd color, see photo) were $4.50! A small 4 piece shumai runs up to $3.75. There is no shrimp in the shumai.   TASTE- mediocre. The items are basic. The food isn't nasty or anything but it is incredibly basic. The flavors are there. When I saw the price I thought the food would be fantastic, but was disappointed.   PORTION- SMALL. Very small! My party ordered the beef tendon when I went to the restroom and when I came back I thought it was half eaten. It was untouched.   SERVICE- decent.   OVERALL- This place caters to tourists. The servers ask if you are from out of town and then have nothing to say when you say you are from here. Do not come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet that aren&#39;t even red.. small portion, $4.50 somehow.

ruQRE2VGVyLBAzYocAnYsA.text: You know you're really Chinese when you're on vacay and you go searching for a Dim Sum Restaurant in the city you're visiting.  Enuf "You're's" in one sentence???  So why?  Out of comfort?  Curiosity?  Wanting to compare against home Dim Sum?  Looking for something unique?  Want to escape the strip?  Yep, all of the above.  Yum Cha, no relation to the Singapore "Yum Cha", is located in a strip mall on the outskirts of Las Vegas Chinatown.  Plenty of parking in the lot and plenty of tables in this large restaurant.  The four of us walked in before noon on a Friday and we were quickly seated.  Quick thoughts - Not crowded, no rush, not much ambiance, multiple TVs showing Chinese and American food shows, bird cages hung from the ceiling to simulate pet bird markets in Asia, long, open, kitchen along one side of the building opposite the windows, tables spread out, a little run down...  English, Cantonese, and Mandarin spoken here, thus there won't be any problems ordering.  We ordered: - Braised Chicken Feet (good) - Beef Noodle Roll (good, rolls were tight) - Sui Mai (ok) - Chive and Shrimp Dumpling (ok) - Mushroom Dumpling (good, although skin broke) - Salt and Pepper Squid (very good) - Fried Egg Plant with Lemon Sauce (pass on this veggie lemon chicken unless you want overly battered egg plant with a sweet lemon sauce) - Runny Egg Yolk Lava Bun (really, really runny - it will gush out if you don't suck some of the egg yolk out first) - Green Tea Mochi with a Coconut Filling (Coconut was too moist with not enough texture and taste, prefer drier)  Service was good and if you look around, wait staff will come over and ask if you need something.  Not your typical look away and ignore you Chinese restaurant.  Interesting restroom signs...check it out.  Overall - decent Dim Sum but as an out of towner, I'll likely try another place before coming back....Liked the Runny Egg Yolk Lava Bun and Salt and Pepper Squid.  Pass on the Lemony Fried Egg Plant.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Mochi with a Coconut Filling - Filling did not have enough of a dry texture, was gooey.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More Potty Instructions - guess they get a lot of Chinese from China who are not used to Western toilets...
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting Potty Instructions

DE9ph048_bu3KJE-Nv4u7A.text: Upon arriving in Las Vegas, my husband was craving for some dim sum.  I found a place that served dim sum all day and we decided to try it out.  It did not disappoint.  This is not the best dim sum, but it is definitely average.  Since they do serve dim sum all day, don't expect a bunch of carts going around.  You are able to order anything you'd like to have and they will bring it out from the kitchen.  The dish that stood out most to me was the chicken feet.  I especially enjoyed the flavor of the seasoning and the dish was cooked perfectly.  It was tender and delicious.  Service was great and if we're in the area wanting to eat dim sum, we will come back.

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GgEp1w1osLWZJbKrS9YkYg.text: YUM Yum Cha!  Everyplace we go, anytime we go, we are looking for a great Chinatown and great dim sum.   I checked yelp and decided on Yum Cha. The prices were right and the reviews top notch.    Yum Cha did not disappoint.  We order our standards - shu mai, sticky rice, soup dumplings, tripe, chicken feet and baked pork buns.  Everything was excellent!  No really - excellent! The food was hot, flavorful and plentiful.   The food always seems to look alike in every dim sum place.  Yet it's the preparation and cooking that separates the True artists from the imposters.  Yum Cha is in a strip mall but once you are inside it's a combination of old world Chinese restaurant with a modern open kitchen.   You put yourself on the line when you open the kimono and cook in front of people.     The space was clean, airy and had high ceilings with bamboo bird cages hanging above.   Prices were very competitive.  We had 6 dishes, tea and soda for $33, with a $5 tip included.  I wish we lived closer to Las Vegas just for this place.  Try it.  It may not have old people like me pushing carts around the floor but the food is the star -  they serve it fast and fresh!

GmV5PMnaBIoB8B9vltarEQ.text: Super friendly and efficient staff. Found this joint on Yelp and decided to give it a try. Staff super friendly and fast. Made suggestions to accommodate our party's dietary restrictions. Everything came out quick. Whole fried fish (flounder) was cooked to a tasty crisp. Stuffed eggplant with shrimp super hot and fresh. Stuffed shrimp atop a slice of bell pepper was okay. Fried pork belly had a thin crispy crunch on the outside and not overly seasoned. Steamed custard was super yummy. Best eaten warm. Manager also recommended the mango grapefruit drink. Super refreshing!

IJtFpoHoC-d0WNvkv_a8uw.text: We went here based on a recommendation and it was so worth it! The food is fresh and delicious. The service staff is attentive and very polite.   I highly recommend this place!

FUTSz2oxE5dWMrONmpPsGw.text: After an exhausting 3 days at EDC, my group was craving dim sum. I came across this place due to all the good, numerous reviews!  We came at around 3pm on a weekday and this place was almost empty! At one point we were the only customers. I was really surprised, given the reviews on Yelp.   Nonetheless, this restaurant exceeded my dim sum expectations. We ordered 18 dishes off the dim sum menu and they brought out our food within 10 minutes of ordering! My favorite items off the menu were the baked BBQ pork bun, fried shrimp ball,  and spinach shrimp dumplings. Everything we ordered was honestly really good. I wasn't really a fan of the curry rice noodle.   Overall, the service, food quality, and affordable prices give this place 5 stars! I definitely plan to come back when I go to Vegas next year.

gpCUDludv9JD_CtkYYB54w.text: I've never walked into a restaurant that I could say NOTHING good about! The menu is misleading (shrimp and pork Shu Mai has no shrimp in it), the prices are ridiculously high for a local restaurant, starts at $3.68 for small dish, $4.38 for medium and go up from there, usually you find these prices on the strip in the 5 star hotel. The food tasted very basic. The place is empty, I can't believe they have over a thousand reviews with an average of 4 stars. Buyers beware!

uQXqkGhNR9ZzDf3vlXpDXA.text: The price is reasonable compare to all the restaurants in the hotels. However the food is average, some dim sum items are too salty and greasy.

ln_eLk8lGH_wDMF5AFAsOg.text: I was thinking a dim sum place close to the strip would be good to offer their selection daily, but they did not.  We came on a Thursday morning, and they had barely anything in their carts and when we asked for specific items they said they put in a order for it.  We were there for 30-40 minutes eating a chatting, the food was okay, the skin on the shrimp ha gao was thicker than i'm used to.  I would probably go again just so I can see how they are on the weekend, and maybe a fresher selection of dim sum.

aEUOzu7e2u4PmN1xTQ4cKA.text: This place was pretty good! It's different from your usual dimsum because they only have carts of the steam items and you have to order the rest from the server. We went at almost 11am and got sat right away. The only thing the servers were slow to take our order. I have to wave down someone twice but one of the guys who helped us in the orange shirt was really nice. Defiantly recommend and will come again next time I'm in town !

vpL6cFroQ0xwr2woROt3jQ.text: Visiting from Los Angeles came up on this great place. I can say this is good as the Dim Sum I have in downtown Chinatown.

K6ZNkxZAxdAf5lcjpaOndw.text: First time here...and now my GO TO DIM SUM / CHINESE FOOD spot in Vegas!   Clean dining area, clean facilities, and and overall great atmosphere.  VERY DELICIOUS with VERY GOOD PRICES!   Sam the owner and the entire staff were very welcoming and provided great friendly service as well.   Definitely will be a frequent returning customer!

2wi1tuylEBD-Rbroq8yfFQ.text: Not a fancy place , but the food and service was good . We came right when they opened so the food was fresh . 30 min later the place was packed . Full of Asians so you know it's good .

8b9G8Wil9_dnhbeVG7oGpQ.text: So. Good.    Honestly one of the best dim sum places here in Las Vegas. Yum Cha has the freshest dim sum in my opinion and the restaurant itself is very clean. Service is great with all servers and the owner himself being really attentive to all customers. The food is AMAZING and very flavorful. If the item you're looking for isn't in any of the carts, they order it readily for you with no ifs, ands, or buts.   Best of all...THEY SERVE DIM SUM ALL DAY. They stop bringing carts around at a certain time, but you can order all dim sum items straight from the kitchen which ensures the freshness.  10/10 would recommend this place! Go check it out :)

h_3q_LZOoiu_lZNtAnSCRA.text: We loved Yum Cha so much we had to go again. We had some of our favorites again; shumai, shrimp dumpling, meatball and steamed pork buns. We also tried some new items like the fried pork ball and the baked lava custard bun.  The manager recognized us from a few days ago and is extremely friendly. He thanked us for coming again and remembered we were from New York and wished us a safe trip home. You must get off the strip and try this delicious dim sum!

4WO-fDrn7MdLrscVCsEJPw.text: Terrible taste and bad service! It's not worth to visit. Maybe worth to visit only one time to take a photo

WHASdvvMlkNdneUuGT6JPA.text: Stop your search! Just go here right away.   Amazing delicious options, all the greatest dim sum hits.   The service was very attentive and equally as impressive as the wonderful food.   Do yourself a favor and get there for impressive food and service.   I am so glad I found this off the strip gem!

_9N9LWwun1qt24GIGIS_Vg.text: We came here based on other reviewers on yelp.  This is less than sub par quality food.  Nothing stands out.  The service is worst.  No one says anything.  I came up to pay for the bill and the host does not say one word.  What a terrible experience.  I don't recommend it to anyone.  Too bad there isn't a zero star rating.

42I-XquvCfNVczi71qJCrQ.text: Big place. We were the only ones in the restaurant. Good service. They were very nice and attentive. Good food!  The only disappointment was that they didn't have pineapple buns. Lol

Q4fw533KDXg3bRrPuQLjxw.text: Excellent food coupled with very nice people. One of the best places I've ever eaten in Vegas and I've eaten Bacchanal, buffett at Wynn and other buffett pkaces and this thing tops my list. Would recommend and come back again if I ever visit Vegas again.

nPLdffFZGvE39k5jo9nS8w.text: Very Authentic Cantonese Dish ! Totally love it ! Cant believe out of no where got something that authentic !  5 stars for yun cha , i will come again next year sema !

HxWKWL3HQfjk87uHL5PXNQ.text: Great experience! Very friendly and helpful staff. They have very delicious Dim Sum all day! I love the Dim Sum I tried and I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to my friends.  P.S. They have chargers so it's great if you want to eat while playing your phone. !,,!

xyis9TbuE5QohSFbhqnGRA.text: In the middle of a quick vacation with the parents in Vegas when we decided to try out Yum Cha. Really enjoyed this place, I recommend eating here wholeheartedly.   Nice open environment mixed with pleasing aesthetics.   Despite coming in to eat around late-noon, we were still able to order dim sum. Food came hot and tasted great!   Staff was very friendly, they did not hesitate to offer recommendations on what was most popular, or simply their personal favorites.

-8dq-W6PCWMUtx6BOSmIoA.text: Unbelievable food... everything was so FRESH...  We were nervous because we caught them on a slow night, but that worry was erased.  Never had bok chok taste so good- steamed with some sort of garlic.  Dim sum was great.  Made to order shumai took a bit to make but well worth the wait.  Best black pepper sauce I've ever had.  Super-friendly gentleman made us feel right at home.  Very highly recommend!

L5zOuMxWLl0uPPSE4DsSnw.text: Service is great, but a couple of dim sum dishes were bland. The lady working there could tell we didn't like a few things and asked what was wrong. I would still come back here though and just not order some of the things, such as cheung fun and curry balls. I loved the radish cakes!

wH7paItXh0KxChtfoFfliA.text: Most of the food here is very good, especially the dim sum. The shrimp dumplings were absolutely delicious, and the meatballs were good, but the wonton soup noodle was a bit off. The soup was too sweet although the wontons were okay. The staff is welcoming and kind. If we could, we'd probably come here again!

Hyb7s98aZnrzgB_6Yc7u8g.text: It's hard finding a place you can get your whole family to on time. Today we came here for lunch my family and family from out of town. We were seated right away and we were starving from waiting for everyone to be ready to get ready. Immediately the carts came around and we were already starting to eat. It was amazing. We ordered some other things from the kitchen and then afterwards we looked at the counter items. It was a fun neat experience. Very delicious food.

We tried almost everything on the menu but my favorite ones were the chicken feet, pineapple bun with egg custard, egg custard steamed buns, fried wontons, sweet soft tofu dessert, beef tribe and soup dumpling. Overall my whole family was happy with the service and food!

ueKILK3Lwym6RNL5XFNaIw.text: The worst service I've ever experienced at any restaurant.  Ever. r7Bny-06fXbL076wQsRMWw.text: It is decent, if you are very hungry :/ The selection of dim sum is limited however the quality for the most part is good. I loved the spinach dumplings and my friend enjoyed the shu mai (traditional pork). The service is impeccable :)

YcB39uJeEwBBAL87F8jo-w.text: Nothing special. Typical taste for dim sum. Carts are very limited in options. Service was challenging, borderline horrible since none of the waitresses knew what we actually ordered. One and done type place. Left feeling having waisted not just money but time...

GuF2TFlvquhg2oRAoKGXPw.text: I have to admit, I decided to check out this place solely based on the yelp reviews. We were on our way to another dim sum spot but the reviews intrigued me.   The place is pretty big and spacious. On top of how large the restaurant is it is extremely clean. We were greeted right away and seated quickly. Everyone was friendly and on top of things as far as cleaning off dirty dishes, refilling our water, etc. That's also a very big difference from other places.   The food was all fresh, hot and quite tasty. I really like how they have the open counter for you to pick from as well. Definitely stands out from other dim sum places. We will be back for sure!

fN6lK90nMVkI-D9B90U_0w.text: Neighbor suggested this place.  Why only 4 stars?  A little pricey than what I'm used to.  Other than that, nice, clean, and organized kitchen.  Friendly staff. And the owner Sam took some time to come to each table to talk to you. My daughter and I enjoyed each dish that we ordered. There were some dishes I haven't seen on at other dim sum restaurants that were also good.  My daughter was pretty quiet during the meal so I know she enjoyed it also.  Come down and try it out.

PN_WVLlDRFH1zwnhyDIj6w.text: LV is not the place to visit for DimSum but see the sign!  Nice selection of dishes but a bit on the oily side. Fine wise staff. Decor uninspiring but not disagreeable.

5ucm7WJ6aeeGExuin-nB9g.text: I'm disappointed.  Maybe because I've been spoiled by the dim sum in San Francisco and the Arcadia area but...I can't believe this got as high of ratings as it did.  I walked in with a friend recently and was very disappointed in terms of selection and flavor.  We were limited in terms of what was coming out of the kitchen and flavor was muted.  I mean this place satisfied my cravings, but do I really want to ingest this amount of calories for this satisfying only a baseline of dim sum?    Nothing really stood out other than the fried pork buns and the egg tart.  Everything else, I could live without.

uxwAxrXgFwnwIvBfPaTUVQ.text: I really like Yum Cha. We got there about 7:05pm and there didn't seem to be any cars in the parking lot. We walked in and there was 3 tables that were occupied. We waited about 30 seconds and a waiter came to greet us. He asked if we wanted a table or a booth. We said a booth. After he sat us.down at a booth the waiter asked if we had ever been here before. We said no. He explained to us that we can order dim sum and Chinese food. We order dim sum. There was a little wait but we didn't mind. It seemed like everything was made fresh to order. I really liked it! This is going to be our new go to restaurant for dim sum.

wPkGTtwgSayWnb1fEziXeA.text: Really cool that they serve dim sum as long as they are open.  Overall, the food was fine, but the service was great.

S1mea6UV9aU1--tkZQlOIA.text: We ate there last Sat and all the dim sum we ordered were not good at all. The siomai and harkao were old and dry and the pork spare ribs was spoiled.

zKTgMVQwLPPHKdvGEsprhw.text: Great service and delicious food! Our favorites were the chive dumplings, radish cake, and baked bbq pork buns! It was really nice getting dim sum a la carte for a late dinner.

ZnqkKPWkqX9hLDVs4k6i2Q.text: Was excited to check out a new Dim Sum place since the Yelp reviews were the highest for this place in all of LV, and there wasn't even a 4 star rating for one in the past two yrs. Believe me I pay attention since my favorite place is at best 3-3.5.   Well let's just say I don't think they deserve the 4 star rating.   Let's start with the positives. Newer dining room. Fast friendly service. Reasonable selection of items.   Negatives:  Cleanliness - asked for a knife to cut my pork buns and it was dirty  Food - most food was rather flavorless including shrimp dumplings, shu mai, shrimp chow fun, shrimp mushroom dumplings, lotus leaf pork steamed rice, and fried shrimp roll. Salt and pepper calamari, Chinese broccoli, and baked barbecue pork bun were ok. The steamed beef meatballs were not good.   Not all of the dim sum items were not pushed on the carts and some had to be ordered off the menu so the dim sum experience was not the best.

RgW-BqCsmzJr4u1WXK4Lvg.text: Really disappointed visit. Came at noon and was seated right away  Service: we were served right away and food comes to your table in less than a minute!   Food: absolutely nooooooo!!! The shrimp rice noodle was cold and flavorless. Everything else was just ok. Lastly we ordered curry fish ball, and the inside is freaking frozen!!! I told the lady that the inside was frozen and she just walked away....told a second server that the center of the fish ball is still frozen and he prob didn't understand so he called another server and this time we finally have a response. There was no apology what so ever, he just said:"oh..I'll cancel your order" and that was it -_-   The only thing that's keeping me from giving this place a one star was the fast service. And also, the tea tasted like charcoal at the end, it was weird (we ordered the oolong) Will no come back again

pftiD4SZefW5Z9xtRfH48g.text: Our favorite place for dim sum. We're from Oklahoma and every time we visit family in Vegas, we come here and order AT LEAST 10 orders/plates of the ha cheung fun (shrimp noodle rolls) and 2 beef cheung fun with EXTRA SAUCE. Everything is great, but the cheung fun is our absolute favorites! The owner is also great, she remembers us when we come! Definitely one of the best places for dim sum, available all day long.

Cheaper then most dim sum, so I guess u get what u pay for!  It's a good thing I only bought around 7 items to go and tried it out at . OxZJdUlnuj0vtYGQRVzwtQ.text: I would recommend getting dim sum before 2:30! It's the proper time to each it anyway.   We came after 2:30 and it was very dead. You can only order dim sum at the counter and they heat it up for you.   The dim sum was only okay. The ha gow felt old and was already sticking to the bottom of the tin. The tripe looked so old that it was even white. The only one that tasted really good was the shumai and that one was the last to come out and it was piping hot!   We also ordered crispy pork belly, fried calamari, and salted fish fried rice.   The crispy pork belly was not pork belly. It was just pork dipped into batter and then deep fried. Not good at all. The fried calamari was good! The salted fish was good but def not worth $13 for basic fried rice.   Service was slow on our water since you already know American Chinese food is salty AF. Other than that, they were nice!

1EVzWqCzHIrvu7Xjie-zbg.text: Came here at noon on a Sunday afternoon and there was no wait! The dining space here is very spacious. You will feel so comfortable eating here without the yapping in the background that you normally get at any popular dim sum spot. The cute dim sum ladies push the dim sum carts around rather frequently. They usually push the same popular dishes around so if you're looking to taste other items, you should place an order. The ladies wear protective mouth visors to prevent spitting on your food, so two thumbs up for that! If you look up to the ceiling as you dine there are empty bird cages as decor--this really reminded me of the grandpas in Chinatown that play Chinese chess back in the day. Speaking Chinese here is a plus! Clean bathrooms! Attentive servers! Definitely coming back!

ncXIT5J4yLuL_jRfFRN3vQ.text: Stopped by here for the first time the other day. Why is there a weird smell to this place? I tried a couple of the dim sum dishes and they were very bland. I feel bad giving this place two stars because the waiters were so nice.   Maybe I will come back and try other dishes.

J17eW9UXVenoTOBpLlsP3Q.text: I am not a big fan of Cantonese dim sum, but this place surprised me. There is a bit of a wait, but definitely worth it. The quality of dim sum was far above average and service was unheard of at a dim sum restaurant. Our server came by and explained everything to us, all the fried stuff is made to order, so don't expect them to be in the carts. The price is decent, quite decent if you compare to California prices. Overall, a great place to spend a few hours while you are in Vegas. Sip on some tea and have a few har gows.

UP81KUZ4nvzYyPSSbdwfbw.text: Love coming here for breakfast. Food is very tasty and staff very friendly and quick.

Ui0fWzqZpQdbbF-iyTjItA.text: Little cuts of taro are buried under the short ribs that soaks up all the meat juices!  They serve oyster sauce separate from the Chinese broccoli.  Dipping is always better!  Most of the fried stuff is freshly made and not sitting under a heat lamp.  Veg and curry puff has smaller cuts of potatoes letting is soak up curry.  Owner is Malaysian so some South East Asian influence.  Kue ku is amazing!

6nYaXZF78DJDT8z_N5vH2w.text: The food was very good.  Everything came out quick which was awesome because we were on a time crunch.  I would highly recommend this place!  The owner was very nice.  The fried shrimp ball is a must try!

ymYlGiUzFfZSWcB7sOJqgA.text: Did not like!!! Chicken wings were browned on the outside but wasn't done on the inside. Eggplant was to done dried out not fresh. Eggdrop soup just nasty I've had much better. And shrimp fried rice was more like shrimp with sticky rice. Just my opinion, but to each their own

ZZcFo3gP9bdeK4gwR1xL9Q.text: Can't believe this place got 4 stars?  Food was not good, seems like mostly from frozen.  The restaurant decor was very old and not current at all.

368viAoZBmUpbjB0IucniA.text: It was okay. We arrived in Vegas around 8:30pm and since this place was near our hotel and stays open until 10:30, we thought we'd try. We walked in and the place was empty with one party of 6 almost done. The man counting receipts welcomed us in, so we took a chance. A little odd because we were going to be the only ones there, but we were hungry. Drink orders of hot tea and water were taken right away. However, I had to ask at one point and so did the hubs, and total time took 15 mins. Not a good start. The nice lady mgr took our chopsticks since 3 out of 4 of us don't use them and replaced them with forks - she was nice. The place stated "dim sum all day" but doesn't mean carts, so you order from the menu and then wait staff brings your food in spurts. I don't like this idea, but could be different earlier in the day. A few more small parties came in, but our food was okay. We have had 10 times better food than here, but we are always cordial and to try places. We will not be comimg here again unfortunately. Maybe our own fault to come later in the night, but we still had an hour and a half before they closed. Idk...

JHo8suTecdp3vCw4_vgk8A.text: Taking over the space of the short-lived Fortune Seafood Restaurant, Yum Cha is a welcome addition to the dim sum/yum cha options we have here in Vegas.  Yum Cha is about six months old and notably, quite clean. Other diners appreciated the better customer service and lack of pushiness here.  Although we did experience a little pushiness, but after my firm no, the dim sum lady kept on moving.  They have your standard dim sum pushed in carts along with a hot foods counter with made-to-order items.  Those who appreciate extra crispy freshly made radish or taro cakes will understand why this is important.  (Back in the day and at a few random dim sum places outside of Vegas, they still pan-fry the radish and taro cakes table-side, which means it comes out hot and fresh!)  Because Yum Cha offers this hot foods counter, it will come out piping hot!  You can go along the counter and let them know what you want or ask the server to bring it to you too.  We also received an order of Chives Dumplings freshly off the pan this way.  On our last two visits, we got:  * Shrimp and Pork Shumai * Shrimp Dumpling * Beef Ball * Chives Dumpling (Shrimp & Pork) - It comes out so hot from the pan, so watch it! * Steamed Pork Ribs * Chicken Feet * Spinach & Shrimp Dumpling * Beef Tripe * Beef Rice Roll * Beef Spare Ribs - We normally get the Steamed Pork Ribs but when the dim sum lady suggested this one, it was a big win!  The Little Guy loved it a lot! * Radish Cake - Request it extra crispy! * Beef Tendon - The dim sum ladies have this one in their cart versus the Beef Entrails, Tripe & Radish dish needs to be ordered from the counter. * Beef Entrails, Tripe & Radish * Sweet Rice Cake - I rarely see this dish in Vegas, especially at a dim sum restaurant.  The owner came around on both visits to check up on us multiple times.  He makes sure you are aware of the additional foods at the hot counter.  There are a few service issues that could use some improvement.  For example, I turned the lid on my teapot indicating it needed to be refilled. Unfortunately, no one came to refill it until I asked a server directly.  When I mentioned this to someone in upper management, they told me their star server was out that day.  On our second visit, I think this star server was working because I never had to ask for my teapot to be refilled this time.  However, all employees should recognize when a teapot needs to be refilled.  There are just some servers that are more efficient than others.  There was one server on our first visit who seemed like she hated being there.  It was a pain to ask her for anything since it looked like it was an inconvenience.  On our second visit, there was a discrepancy on our bill as we were charged for an something we didn't order.  Once we brought it to their attention, they looked over it and fixed it.  They did apologize for the mistake and mentioned it was probably a good idea to look over our bill when it's so busy.    I do appreciate that they only charge tea for the Husband and myself.  At other dim sum restaurants, they'll charge tea for the children as well which can add up.  Prices are split into different categories which are marked on your bill as A,B,C, and D.  Dim Sum: Monday through Friday $2.88; Saturday, Sunday and Public Holidays $3.28 Delicious Dim Sum: $3.98 Chef Specialties: $4.98 House Specialties: $5.98  Overall, Yum Cha has become our choice for dim sum in Las Vegas.  I hope they expand their menu to include more elusive items and old favorites as they become more popular.    We also enjoy the ongoing feed of YouTube videos showing food from all over the world on the large screens.  Not only does it make us nostalgic, but I think we eat more as well.

EHwvMIKDmNL40M6ycKzAYA.text: It's more like 4.5 stars actually. 5 stars definitely for customer service. First time here tonight and the experience was well above average. Food quality is very good. This place is CLEAN.. than most chinese dimsum restaurants. My wife and I ended up finding a new dimsum place after seeing the now-closed Orchids Garden featured in dirty dining.  Yum Cha did not disappoint. Best rice cake in town! The place wasn't packed when we came in so food came fast. They have a dimsum menu and a regular a la carte menu. Our first time here is definitely not gonna be the last.
