p69Ixoa74BNyc142tHmlDQ.text: There aren't too many options for dim sum in Vegas, but this place satisfies a dim sum craving. Before coming here I read the yelp reviews, and so many people said that this place was friendly. And they were totally right, the service was warm and welcoming. Jack and I came by for dinner, so no carts were being pushed around. We just ordered the things we wanted and they brought it over. The dim sum was good. The fried egg plant was pretty delicious, I hadn't had anything like it before. And they had fried pork bun which is one of my fav dim sum dishes. Good dim sum, clean restaurant, friendly people, inexpensive - they do a great job :)

V4Jp1DUh3xsX5mT3IspdkA.text: Dim sum here is excellent. Fresh and you don't need to hunt down the dim sum cart. The shrimp har gow, pork shumai, string beans, and pork spare ribs were tasty and better than some found in SoCal. Their signature custard bun is really good (but very rich)! The service here is also excellent and very friendly. A great spot for your dim sum fix in Vegas!

9b2ozh4dQe187m568YL2dA.text: Great place for dim sum! I tried their new dessert today- mochi with peanuts! So good

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi wth peanuts inside

S15dGwTx5ugg3bI8tFptKw.text: Visited a few days ago after I read review of good food. To my surprise the place was completely empty when we sat down at 1040am in the morning. So we chose a booth, big mistake. A few minutes in, my friend notice something crawling on top of the booth behind me! A small cockroach. That spoiled my appetite completely and gave me yucky feeling. The staff removed the crawling insect with a towel. We moved to another table where we won't have to worry about things we cannot see.  Besides the uninvited free companion, the har gor was good, but the rest of the dim sum  was really so so at best, but pricer than most dim sum places in Vegas with similar or better food. The lotus leaf wrap was not tasty at all and rank near the bottom of the ones we tried (the ones at PPP and Rio's KJ is much tastier). The beef rib was stiff and not tasty, I stopped at one piece.  The staff is ok (even though no one offer me discount after the cockroach was captured, there was no apology), the food I can find similar for less elsewhere in Vegas. Uninvited companion at the booth is simply unacceptable, I still got this creepy feeling of that thing crawling on me since it was only a few inches behind me. Safe to say, I have no intention to ever go back. I would go to Chang's just a few blocks away with similar food but less pricey during weekdays, or go to Hong Kong Garden or Orchid garden. Incidentally, they charge for tea at Yum Cha whereas the other three does not.

mTN4h93yCfKQhCPP1jDWWg.text: We discovered this restaurant in our last trip to Vegas last fall and came here again. They are as good as ever. They have good options for dim sum. My favorites were siu mai, bean curd roll and taro cake. On top of that the service is good not just with our server but with every staff we came in contact with which is so rare. Definitely will be back for more.

ykAhFZK-dKZvk0PwKAPHuw.text: Been looking for a new dim sum go-to place in Vegas for a while, after my previous place went out of business. And I think this is it! Really a cut above all the other places I've tried. Also service is extremely friendly! Atmosphere is a bit more like a mall food court than a formal restaurant the upside to that is there are big TVs all around the room so you can get them to turn on the game if you're there for lunch on a Saturday or Sunday...  Recommend beef tendon and stuffed tofu skin

uXWv2UQmRv2NiaDTDo6orA.text: Super friendly staff, greeted us right away. It's Sat 1230pm, seated us right away. Gave us water and even kids cup and kids utensils without prompting from us. That shows the staff pays attention. Tables were cleaned promptly and frequently offered for more dim sum plates.  On to the food, I'm normally not picky so probably won't get a good opinion on it.  Usual dim sum items were up to par on the taste. I had to order from the menu as some items weren't in the carts. All were not too bad.  There's also some other items at the bar area and boba I believe.  I'd return as the location has plenty of parking and close to my house.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum dishes

7Ejuac4P3zC4EJhFdnHRRQ.text: Went back again this year when we were in town and it was still awesome. Our server was SO funny and very helpful in helping us choose what we would like. The Manager was there again too and she is such a wealth of information and very sweet and attentive. Tried some different items and all were fantastic. Love this place!

g788sqKPXqEdFZLQNU04Dg.text: I unexpectedly came across this place leaving the Orleans casino. I wanted something small and tasty and this place was right across the street basically. I got some bbq pork buns and some egg tarts. They were both Really good. I'll definitely be coming back soon. Also the restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly, so it's a win/win in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq Pork Bun
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Tart

U_9Ji_ckYSNGKRmc2IwecQ.text: Came here with my family on Christmas Day for Dim sum. We arrived at 10:30 and the place was half filled. The place got busier and service became slower. The food was good, and my favorite was the pineapple bun. The bun was filled with yellow liquid and oozes out when you bite it. The environment was really nice and clean. The servers either spoke Cantonese or mandarin, some knew English. They were also friendly. Besides the dim sum carts that they push around, you can also walk up to the counter to order what you want.  Overall giving four stars because service was slow when it got busier. We ordered some foods but the food never came. Some of the dishes were cold when they arrived to us. I would recommend this place, because it's a nice place for dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg tart (wasn&#39;t as good)
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside pineapple bun 菠蘿包

ZW7dCJBvR3kJyOY8McGvmg.text: Was not good at all. I was expecting a 4 star as it should be according to the yelp review but only got an OK meal. We were the first couple of customers walked in for dim sum in the morning, whoever couple of the dishes were already soggy, they didn't taste fresh at all.

wt826L8mn_En_R1QsV-VLg.text: Great food! Shrimp dumplings and Kung Pao Chicken was delicious. The service was fast and they were very friendly.

c8OQSBBwv6bA5ng80FprOQ.text: This place was so awesome! I love Dim sum and this place was a great authentic american version of that. The atmosphere was very welcoming, the hostess, waiter, manager everyone was friendly. The only thing they should improve on is their entrance, looks dated and not a lot going on. Food was on point, cart lady very friendly, i would love to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jmvOlhOccMZAyaTjOS4JhA.text: First time the place was clean enough the dimsum carts on a Thursday were only 2 going around.  When our check arrived it was for the other table.  Came back twice to get our correct amount. Food was not bad. Just ok

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QWq8MiePQSFWzkU0AjLktA.text: Good selection of dim sum. Flavors did not "pop" though. I was a bit disappointed with the lack of seasoning. Food arrived hot. Service was great.

WpJFA_FznuXNxE4FMyKS1w.text: I absolutely love this place! You can get dim sum for dinner!!! After craving dim sum for quite sometime I decided to try this place out, and I am not disappointed at all. The set up for dim sum was not the usual cart going around; the servers bring you what you pick on their menu. The menu had pictures for all the food and it was so easy to read! I really enjoyed how they set up their menu and the food was delicious. I really want to go back soon.

Z4Z9EvMLHnXWSHHCuDyyug.text: Was there around 7:00pm on a Thursday. The place was pretty empty, which was not a good sign. I ordered a number of dim sum dishes, and a HK style chowmein. Most of the dishes did not have a good texture. The hagow wrapper was thick and chewy, but the filling fell apart. The turnip cake was mushy, The shumei and wrapped bamboo were very tough. The beef mixed was mostly tripe, no other organs, and the taste was bland. The HK styple chowmein was a dark sauce, which is not authentic, and tasted so so.  All in all, it was a pretty disappointing meal. I will not return...

E2FJbFLkix4tiNRYdIj9Nw.text: It's nearby The Orleans Hotel and it's a local spot. I ate here twice during my 4 day stay, because it was tasty, fast, low-key, and good pricing. I didn't overeat and we shared several dishes, because of the dim sum style. We were told by the managers that it's busy during lunch and weekend dim sum time. I recommend the chicken feet.

UcTDjvX0_zdMVNroAToZpg.text: 3.5 stars!  The service here is great!! Everyone is so nice! And the portions are more generous than other Chinese/Dim Sum spots I've been to. And the restaurant is very clean.  The reason it gets 3 stars is that maybe I'm just used to LA/OC's dim sum where it's a little more authentic and greasy lol! I felt as though the flavors here were somewhat lacking. The congee had no taste and I was expecting a lot more from my favorite: har gow. I was also disappointed that I didn't see honey walnut shrimp on the menu. :(  I like that dim sum is served all day and not only in the mornings like most places. Excellent service, but I miss the saltiness and greasiness of the places I'm used to! Lol

4-wb6pxUPAUmo66nhWucbg.text: Good selection and pleasant atmosphere.  I've done both in house dining and take out and both were good.  Among the better Chineese choices in Las Vegas.

t2BsQ8wwGKhggEtKIqvi6w.text: Great service and hot food fast!  Delicious!  I will definitely be back for the crispy eggplant.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The red bean sesame ball is thick and chewy with a crispy outer shell!  The stir fry has gai lan with white fish and lots of ginger.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Crispy Eggplant is delicious!! I will return again for this dish!  The salt &amp; pepper calamari is spot on.

8CuaR09tcOFPUtB_vETVoA.text: This place is clean, modern, and delicious. You have to try their baked lava bun, it's sooo good! At first the carts kinda had the same items, but when the owner came to check in on us, we told him the items we were looking for and he brought it out for us! The staff speaks English and they constantly refilled our water cups. So their service is really great overall. I also liked how their food wasn't as greasy as some other places in Chinatown. Another great thing was they had a menu with pictures of their dim sum items so you knew what to look for.

TuvaNt7hBZy-8DkSHmM3zw.text: Just spotted this place and stopped by to have dinner. All staff was kind and friendly. Dim sum was fresh. Tea was delicious. One of the servers brought over some rock sugar for tea. So good.  Great Service. Will definitely come back.

HMcjL5YGeb9x_v3Vy1iy_Q.text: Really good Malaysian food... I enjoyed so much!!!! Highly recommended... When  in Las Vegas we always stop here to eat there... Roti canai just unbelievable.... Ohhhhh....

kh9lLsIKyI6B4vMAr9lFnw.text: Dim sum in Vegas has been hit or miss for me.  Yum Cha was very good.  Better than most of the others in Vegas.  Our food tasted "fresh". We've been to others where the food tasted as if it had been sitting out a long time.  Good selection too for the price.  We (two of us) were stuffed for twenty dollars and still had leftovers.   We really liked the pork buns and shu mai. The staff really wasn't "friendly".  They were efficient and attentive.

eLfIAE5KQeCeUO9580Uj1Q.text: food was good and the prices were reasonable. however, each dish we ordered took around 25 minutes EACH to come out. We ordered shu mai, shrimp dumpling, and beef ball. they came out separately but it took so long for each to come in

XoBOYXjLphlkr1DwZobkuw.text: I can see why Yum Cha has more 5 Star rating than negative, we went there mainly based from review of other diners, so here's my 5 cents worth... Came here on a Monday noon, as expected, they're not too busy, and was able to find sitting and order food right away. Food I'd give it an A, which I consider good, not exceptional but good. Service, like I said they're not too busy, but we got exceptional service and attention, so I'll give it an A+. I believe the owner himself attended to us and explain how their ordering system work, got everything we wanted in a timely manner. Price, another A+, since we came on a week day, the price is reduced, yes to that! Parking, none issue to us so another A+. I think they do need more honest customer to help them promote, since they are relative new and away from China town, the only way they get exposure is through Yelp. Over all, we're very satisfied and will come back again the next time we come to Las Vegas.

fPe-n6snk9hwU8NK_qdL2Q.text: Good service ... food is affordable (dim sum ) It's far from where we live but it's worth a drive Place is clean.  Manager approached us and ask where we from thinking maybe we're from out of town when he found out that we are Local ask us how we found his restaurant I told him from yelp and it took us 30 minutes get here, he gave us free custard dessert as a token of appreciation. I'm not a fan of noisy places and crowded restaurant, this place is defensively recommended for people who just want to enjoy their food...

H1GxVl18TCjwMix2gvpv_w.text: So delicious! Excited to find this gem in Vegas. The owner was super kind and friendly. Lucky we didn't order too much or we wouldn't have stopped eating it and they would have had to roll us out.

-B9DizPGM8S-OxoU8Ky6-g.text: I'm surprised at the reviews this place got.  It's the primary reason we decided to try this place out.  But, from the get go we had a bad feeling about this place.    First, the pros:  clean, spacious and has a very relaxing atmosphere, not to crowded  Then, Cons: took a little while before someone greeted us and took us to our table.  Then the server was confused about our drink order.  One coke and 2 hot teas.  Pretty simple.   We ordered our dim sum which then took nearly 10 minutes to come out.  But not all at the same time.  Pork spare ribs came as we finished eating everything else.    Aside from the chicken feet (My fiance's favorite) everything else tasted old.  The look fun noodles looked grey and the edges were hard, the fried taro tasted like it was made in really old oil, the spare ribs was to chewy and tasted like it was marinating in a bowl of garlic for a week and the hot tea was warm.   Finally, I always find it interesting when we are close to leaving/finishing multiple employees come over to see if we need anything.  A simple and unassuming gesture, but can be perceived as a way to rush you out.

rqa25emVi1QCzdMVpZn9Vw.text: I like this place , first time for me to eat and it looks clean and organized..I would certainly come back and try some more of the menus.

WRXEAUIfE1mpgpMmH5EUtQ.text: Great dim sum in Vegas. The restaurant was very clean and everyone working there were very nice and attentive. The carts had good variety and you could order as well. They have soup dumplings too! We'll definitely be coming back.

SyGAx4CCpUt4Zp6V2tZH_A.text: It was okay and the price is decent . Most of the dumplings tasted store bought but I could be wrong.   Anyway not bad, no amazing either

SibkbMNyUyEY5BiZ4Bqf_w.text: B  I'm from NYC and Dim Sum is one of the staple foods in the city and in the burbs.  I wanted to like this place because family recommended it but let me say this and I am being as honest as Pinochio's nose. 1) the food is not fresh.  It's steamed but not made in house.   2) The place is clean. 3) The food is not fresh.  It's been premade other than the soup. 4) The place is in a dope location. 5) The food is not fresh but edible and if your taste for dim sum is not there yet then this place is "GOOD" at best.    I would not come back unless I was being nice to someone.  Even the soup dumpling was "MEH" I usually don't want to be mean about my ratings but I have to be honest for you folks out there who wants a real honest opinion.  So visit this place - don't knock any place until you tried it.  UNLESS I GAVE IT A "BW" rating.  Food is not fresh Restrooms are CLEAN Tables CLEAN and HUGE Table wait time none.  Restaurant is empty. (1130am) Take out wait time is QUICK Customer service is GREAT - people do not speak English well so you have to really speak like you're talking to a 6yr old.  The manager is nice though.  Ambiance friendly and wide. Kitchen SUPER CLEAN and YOU CAN SEE THE FOOD in a buffet style glass area.  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uS5bcH3LTDraLF7z25MQ5w.text: Hands down, the best dim sum spot in Las Vegas. I challenge anyone to find a cleaner, better value, better tasting dim sum restaurant than this one. If you are here during peak dim sum / lunch hours they push the carts around. They don't put the carts all day but you can get dim sum anytime and it's all fresh made to order. Be a little patient - it's all made to order and well worth the wait.  They have a huge menu - more than the average dim sum joint. Save some room, try different things. If you're not sure, just ask. Very nice people. They also have a regular entree menu if you're not in the mood for dim sum. I'm tempted to try their noodles but I was told the portions are huge and I'm always in the mood for dim sum.  One thing that really stood out for me was the curry dishes - the fish ball one and the roti one - both were flavorful and delicious. The one with the roti is Malaysian style, made in house. Amazing.

EPj165bJI_NDpFJpM181Gw.text: I went here for dim sum on a holiday and the line was long! I came by around 10am and there was already a long list of about 15 people ahead of me. After waiting for about 45 minutes, I realized that it's a lot harder to get a table for 2 people. It's much easier to get a table for 4. The guy at the counter kept calling parties of 4 or more but skipped most of the party of 2 even if they signed in before. He eventually would call in the parties of 2.  Write your name large and keep checking it as your name may be skipped when things get too busy. My name got skipped twice and I had to point it out to the guy at the counter that he skipped me. He finally got a table in the end.  The service from the staff was rapid. They brought the food out immediately. The quality is great. They have many options to choose from in the cart. They also have a menu if you want to order something different than the dim sum carts.  The price is decent. The cleanliness of the place and the restroom is acceptable.   Keep in mind that I visited the place on X-mas day so it maybe was busier than usual.

J8dBrM1DmE-mdOZqAkaSjg.text: I was very stoked to try dim sum in Vegas, but Yum Cha kind of left me unsatisfied. I do come from Los Angeles, where we are infamous for our dim sum in the San Gabriel Valley. So I know to not have my expectations too high.  The main reason I had to give Yum Cha 3 stars (instead of 4 stars) boiled down to the bill, that kinda left me with a bad taste in my mouth (on top of the subpar tea and dim sum).  I went a day before Thanksgiving (Wednesday, November 22), but they had charged at the 'Holiday' rate. It's about 60 cents more per plate. We had initially found this place through my mom's Chinese newspaper, that had advertise $2.85 per dish. When we got there, the regular prices were $2.95 and the Holiday prices were $3.58. The staff confirmed to me that the Holiday price was enforced for the whole week. (I was reviewing Yelp menu prices, because it's been a while since my experience. It appears they were raising the prices every year). If they were upfront with their prices, I think I wouldn't be as annoyed, but that 'shady' business kinda throws me off.  Overall, the service is good. It's casual but the staff is very attentive to your needs. The food and tea isn't good. Like, if you're drunk and hungry, it would be fine, but who would drive that far from the strip to get dim sum --idk, it is open super late.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front page menu
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Real carts

Daic_vIEoUKq2upRa6zpsw.text: Ahhhhhhhhh. Why do I live so far???   I grew up in SGV and have eaten dim sum my entire life. I. Know. Dim. Sum.   I saw the reviews and HAD to stop by to get the Pineapple Buns because they were calling my name. . These babies were so orgasmically good. Once opening the baos the sweet yolk came gushing out.. it was just simply so satisfying.   I walked in and went to the counter and ended up order 5 things..... so unnecessary but SOOOL NECESSARY. We were driving back to Los Angeles and definitely needed snacks... even though we literally just ate at Shane's Artisan Noodles.   Their Pork Buns  2 per order. HUGE Buns... stuffed with pork. Freaking delicious.   The football looking fried crystal dumplings  was good. I wanted more stuffing but still good.   I also got crispy pork pastries. These are savory and just right.   The service was friendly, quick, and efficient. I wish I lived here so I can eat this daily. Bad for my waistline and wallet but so good for my soul

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wP47nm8jfbnSIFzP-fvoIg.text: After deciding where to eat for my last meal in Vegas, I decided to check this place out. Expecting good expectations with after reading recent reviews and after my visit I was 100% satisfied with the food, service, and experience! The food was really flavorful and not oily at all. Really nice/friendly staff too. This place is a for sure visit whenever I come out to Vegas for now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highly recommended
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy eggplant so good

oWpXr1yq9QV4tePn1Umzxw.text: Din Tai Fung quality at a much less price.  Good parking in a strip mall with a lot of tables for immediate seating.  The carts are plentiful so you can sit and start summing before you get your chopsticks from the waiter. A definite must have on any trip to Vegas.

jOrdYfnJFT0vkkuzU8X0Qw.text: Best dim sum place ever. However they are always out of something ! If it's not the egg tarts it's something else and it's kinda annoying. But other then that really good place to eat

ehBpbD-P6b-cmrWUgbc8mg.text: For the high reviews I was expecting better out of this place.   Food 2/5  The basics were decent but nothing was done to the point where I was actually impressed. What really pushed me down to two stars for this place was the veggie dish we got which was suppose to be boiled gailan but it was ridiculously oily to the point where it was barely edible. In addition, their special bun with salted egg was so doughy and raw towards the bottom it just wasn't that great.   Service 4/5  The service here was pretty fast and everyone was very accommodating to what we needed.   Overall we spent around $70 for four people. I think since this place does all day dim sum, it's good if you're craving some har gow at night, but if you're looking for a Sunday morning dim sum place I think there are better places to go.

4dIvyF9DVY0r6vNOl63ROg.text: Always good!   Good food plus good staff is always a good experience.   It's a must for me to eat here whenever I'm in Las Vegas!!!

vD2Ljh70wui6UnlAqGfF-w.text: My husband and I dropped in for a late lunch and loved everything we ordered. I'm veggie but he eats everything, and we were both really happy. We got mostly dim sum: he loved the shrimp dumplings, and the imitation pork buns were fantastic!   The location is a bit off the beaten track, outside of Chinatown and off the Strip, but absolutely worth the short drive! The entire staff is really friendly and attentive, and everything came out perfect and very quickly. Very casual place, not a lot of frills but bright, clean and above all delicious!

MAq0iXLLGjaD2f_lWlGHeQ.text: I honestly regret making a shorter trip to get dim sum. I should have drove the extra couple miles to China Town.  upon arrival, we arrive to a nearly empty restaurant. Immediately greeted and seated. A few mins later a young lady took our meal. We wait nearly 15 mins for our minimal order. She only ordered us 1 soimai when I said. We tried their "crispy pork belly" and it was horrible. It was very salty and it seemed more of leftover meat. A server checked on us and we told them how salty the pork was but she didn't seem to care. Yes, they kept it on the tab even when we didn't eat it. My Som wanted more steamed rice so we ordered. 5 mins has come and gone and no rice. The server again asked if everything was ok and if we needed anything else. Told her we told the young lady 5 mins ago we needed rice but just forget it as my son was almost done. Very disappointed with the quality of food and service. My family and I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy pork belly - disgusting
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy shrimp ball

LVPM6msVZ1gxF0c0VvAQKA.text: So happy we experienced Yum Cha. Dim sum is delicious and the selection is large. Portions are generous and the staff is super friendly. Open ambiance and family friendly. My fav here were the eggplant with shrimp stuffing. My son (a dim sum aficionado) insists on a return visit soon.

-JFIFugX8Gj4rrCmpCidWQ.text: Amazing service - great recommendations and the staff were all really friendly and accomdating Food - pretty good food. I got the tofu and veg Curry noodle soup (one of their recommendations) and it was rly good! Some dishes were a bit salty though

XFHB9W06DZCrm14q5JSceQ.text: Cute, made to order Dim Sum Spot. Easy to access parking and off the strip/215 freeway.  Staff is VERY Friendly and super nice. Everyone speaks English very well if you have questions about the menu. They serve dim sum all day until closing as well as a full Chinese menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9rgcI3iVn2M4oGmmjgWBTQ.text: We went here for some dim sum it was nothing special. I wish they had more dim sum carts option. I guess I'm comparing it to the best one I had in china town San Francisco. We technically had everything in the menu that they had to offer for dim sum. The service was slow for the place not being busy. I believe we should had gotten exception customer service.  They do have funny signs in their he bathroom which is unique.

CNraMClf_4K3l133e4i6pA.text: The food is sooo good! The dim sum menu is amazing  And the sesame chicken was very delicious  Try it out

ME8-fAOfB-qbqk52M5hUwA.text: Yum Dam Cha, Sik Koh Baw  What did I get Some of everything! Dim Sum plates. I got the Shu Mai, Chicken Feet, Beef Tripe, Cow Tendons, Pork Ribs, Tofu Curd Rolls. Everything was as expected but the beef tripe was a bit tasteless for me, needs a bit more spices please! Also got a plate of stir fried veggies with garlic, also would be great if they stir fried the garlic and not just top it off with garlic (no to garlic breath)  Environment Very big restaurant, lots of space. The ladies come around with the carts of Dim Sum and you can pick and chose. You could also see all the bakery items near one side of the wall. Typical space, nothing special. OH! The bathroom signs are hilarious.....  Niceness of staff Um... nothing special. They weren't rude nor were they super friendly. I think with language barrier it is a bit difficult. Mostly they just want to serve you food and move on...  Dollar Small plates... about $4 a pop! Gets pricey once you start adding up! I was with another person and the bill was about $40, I wouldn't say I was full  Yes? With so many chinese restaurants in Vegas, I definitely would try elsewhere. Nothing stood out for me to definitely want to come back.   #WendyTakesVegas #WendyWanders

U_HfkaYSN_hJMI2g-ZbPlw.text: We decided to try this place after reading Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. The food was fresh and hot, prices were good, and the staff welcoming, helpful, and friendly. We especially loved the Mushroom Mai. We will return on our next trip to Vegas.

TrCMCCXqtz0svEtzbk-g_Q.text: Food is just average, service is very limited.  The pushcart ladies are quick to come around and ask if want anything, but the waitstaff does not come around often, not even to take away empty plates.

TnlDb6E5WrYcbjZZuGWXNw.text: This is my second time eating here at Yum Cha and it has been awesome. The food is great with the dim sum being made as you order. I love eating the shumai and the fried pork rice but I would recommend trying everything since they are all great. I tried the curry fish ball soup today and the curry is home made with a nice little kick to the taste. What makes this place even better is the service each server provides. They are very friendly and would talk to you like you have been there all the time. They are attentive to what you want and would recommend the best food that they have. I will definitely let my friends and family know about this place as they are really good. The price is also great with the dim sum being only 2.98 per order on Tuesday through Friday.

LWH53tKozBtqld1nWehhFg.text: Had chicken feet, char shu rice rolls and sticky rice dumplings. Unfortunately I could taste the ingredients weren't fresh. Days old meat taste :(

23wMOGMnfw9e3XUkNuLuZA.text: Good food.. the 1st time wasn't that great. Fried rice tasted bland and nothing special but I still get food from there. It's close and customer service is always good.

hzJ0-2LpwnGV5hKynM5ZkQ.text: Forget about Spring Mountain Road. Why is this is my new go-to spot for dim sum in Vegas?  1) the freshly prepared dishes and open kitchen, 2) spotless dining area and floors, 3) super friendly staff, and 4) an owner  who genuinely wants to please customers and took the time to explain the hot food bar and carts. We ordered baby bok choy, har gow, shumai, spare ribs, taro balls, sticky rice, and baked char siu bao. The dim sum itself was hot, full of flavor, and not too greasy. We'll definitely be returning next time we're in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s easy to make selections from the super friendly servers pushing carts or behind the hot food bar.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Playful decor in this bright and clean space.

ndr6Nfava4bx0QBqflKEMg.text: Food was delicious and came out super piping hot! Super friendly service, waitress and owners came by several times to check on us. Their food is unique, Malaysian and Chinese influences.

IqKFdWKzrpGyqrTSwS9bYg.text: Decided to stop in here for a late dinner based on yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint!  Very clean and bright with amazing servers.  The baked lava custard was out of this world, and the chicken shu mei was the best I've ever had.  Everything was super fresh and piping hot. Will definitely be back.

NIlRQt3VmpLjhcKNQny07A.text: Took my mom here for lunch. Love their food! I recommend anyone that wants to come here for a good lunch or dinner. Price is good. Service is awesome as well!

ADgnvQCETPfwR0eEga5soQ.text: Great food , clean place, fast service , reasonable price !! Awesome place to try if you stay in Vegas !! Must try : coconut jelly after meal it's AMAZING !!!

QnWDJARiR37vj3CM45eITQ.text: Delicious dim sum! I think this place is more busy during lunch, we went here for dinner but is was great! It's a new place in town, clean and typical open Chinese setup with large tables and a buffet area for the lunch. We ordered several dim sum dishes to try out for dinner and we're full when we left. All the dim sum was made to order, authentic and fresh. I'm only on town for a while but thinking about going back here.

O5agD-GeDcksdBGVWwFXzQ.text: I always go here for lunch since it is close to my office. The servers are always friendly and attentive. Someone is constantly checking if you need something. Food is delicious. I super like their siomai, beef tendon, mongolian beef lunch special and custard bun. Those custard buns are so heavenly you have to stop yourself from eating more. Quality of food here is better than Orchid Garden. I would highly recommend this place!

UF9UEqDHTaRKwRMV4B6TQw.text: Not bad, clean but no ambiance at all, very cafeteria looking. I asked the lady why they didn't have a Dim Sum Cart roaming around and she said they couldn't afford hire extra people to do it, it was 5:30 pm dinner hour and very little people there..., so, we had to order the dim sum off the menu instead. Everything tastes fresh and good. It nothing special. Boring place, no ambiance, pretty good dim sum (we have had better), clean and nice people. Not a place to entertain guests from out of tow because he lack of ambiance and no dim sum cart. To sum it up: I would maybe go back out I wouldn't crave them.

177Micb2bkJFozWq5TsPow.text: Not really my cup of tea (Dimsum) but this place is very good. The Soups are spectacular and I am not much of a soup guy. The GF loved fried eggplant (or whatever it was) I did not like the looks of it. place sort of reminded of the dinner at the palace in the Temple Of Doom movie, but not eyeballs in my soup which was fortunate. No too sure of the prices here either not expensive, not cheap.

EOB8QUjoli-aYDjZ50aNYg.text: Good food. Mediocre service. Room is huge with only 1-2 people pushing carts. One lady pushing a cart does not seem enthusiastic doing her job. She just walked right passed us. We had to flag her down, actually her co worker had to flag her down for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a1LfyM5cdAaHPthLQw14kA.text: For dim sum in Vegas I was impressed.  It is most definitely close to the best that I have had here.  Usually, I would drive to LA and avoid Vegas dim sum...but now I know of a place that I like the quality if food in Vegas.  The service was so so, but the food was tasty!  I'll come back to eat!

OF519TZ4twt6uqdtAdBrSw.text: Native Nevadan- grew up on Dim Sum in the Bay Area and in S California. Our family have distinctive tastes and very particular to food being fresh. After eating all of the dim sum places all around Las Vegas, our all around was Ping Pang Pong, Hong Kong Garden, and Changs. My husband is a creature of habit and does not like to venture out what he considers as his staples. After persuading him to try what 521 other yelpers have reviewed, I am taking the time out to write a review because we agree. The atmosphere was bright and lively. The open kitchen where some dim sum dishes are made fresh to order gave me peace for cleanliness, the dim sum taste was surprisingly very good. There wasn't one bad item and I would say all around superior as a whole than the other dim sum restaurants in town. Xiaolong Bao was probably the main item I would stay was standard. The friendly customer service is the push to move Yum Cha to our now go to place. Give it a try, this place will start to get very packed.  Must order: Shrimp and Spinach steamed dumpling Pan fried shrimp and chive dumpling

4SaeQdyPfN2tTHHOiBzhJg.text: To be honest, I'm pretty surprised how this place got really good ratings. After seeing so many great reviews, my family and I wanted to try this place out. Since we went late night for dinner, there was no cart service since they end it at 2:30 pm so we ordered from their dim sum menu instead. Service started out great by our server taking our drink & food orders. They were very friendly and attentive. Everything was made fresh to order which was definitely a big plus. But everything came to our table extremely slow.... one dish at a time. At one point, we had to ask our server where and when our other food orders were coming cuz we were just sitting there..... waiting for the rest of our food to come out. We also ordered the wonton soup to split and had to ask three diff servers for bowls & spoons. Somehow, the lady who was suppose to bring it, got distracted because we saw her grab it in the back but then walked off doing something else. My boyfriend repeatedly tried getting our server's attention until the girl (who we initially asked) finally brought it to us. In addition, we ordered baked BBQ buns, which we had to ask our server where it was. He misunderstood us and thought we said custard buns. He went to the back to check on it and later told us that they ran out and asked if we wanted steamed ones instead. We were pretty disappointed but our server made it up by giving us a free dessert.   Overall, the service was inconsistent at times even with the restaurant not being busy. I can definitely say that it's not worth coming back to for dim sum especially because nothing really stood out to be amazing. There's a lot of other places in LV that have better dim sum.

sTdY4lquQS1ZorVQtwOtSA.text: Best Chinese food outside of NYC and San Francisco...Clean dinning room and restrooms... Great service...

EQ42znL5qaQXmzrvZfXbTQ.text: Found Yum Cha on Yelp. We eat best dim sum in Atlanta and Seattle. Yum Cha must be best in Las Vegas because we loved it. Yum Cha has carts with all our favorite dim sum dishes.

AWCPAES1R3X5U_lLyiyxrA.text: Amazing food and even more amazing service. Been a fan of another dim sum place up north and thought I couldn't find a better place, but I've been proven wrong. They have unique dim sum offerings and the taste is savory. Had the pork ball (fried Mochi with meat inside), salted egg custard bun, salt n pepper shrimp, shu mai, crunchy shrimp ball and beef tendon.   Owners really care about earning your business and make necessary effort to make sure you leave with a good overall experience. Will definitely go back.

nBnU02b6A9YW50qRP28SRw.text: Sometimes you crave a food and are disappointed when you finally get it. This was not one of those times. Perfectly sized to have a little bit of a lot of things. I was very pleased with the food and service. Superb!

iByE_0ggy45ZObOfxmvbxg.text: Dim Sum and then some!  This is a find if you like dim sum. The Proprietors are from Malaysia and they know their dim sum. Carts came fast and were laden with many selections. We ordered additional items that we did not see on the cart and they were equally delicious. Xialongbao, crispy eggplant, steamed pork buns all were delicious. Shu mai and shrimp dumplings were re-ordered multiple times. Next time I need to save room for dessert. Custard buns looked delicious. Only thing I would not reorder were the beef balls. They were not bad just not as tasty as other offerings in our opinion. The rest was YUM!

K0pwmcT81ON2FGiX4MPXKQ.text: This restaurant has everything you need in a dim sum restaurant, friendly staff, delicious food, and comfortable atmosphere. The only place that has lava custard buns. A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gsNs7IZVZ2oRAiFxb2W_qg.text: I've been stopping at this quick dimsum eatery for a few years now,  every time I go to vegas. They don't disappoint.  It isn't fancy but the food is good!!

Ae2G0X_sap4Rv0NaqiEryA.text: Yum cha was great! The selection of dim sum was fantastic and all of the dishes were reasonably priced. The wait staff were super friendly and made the overall experience a joy

s7u0MqoKdj2V4dL4ZORXNA.text: We have been trying to find a good dimsum place since we moved here last year. Today we finally got to check out this place. We came in the afternoon so it wasn't busy. Food carts came right away before we could even sit down so that was nice. We always eat the same dimsum dishes so it's easy for us to compare. The food tastes fresh and it's not too greasy. Compared to the one place on Eastern in Henderson, this place is much better. The service is very good as well. We'll definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet buns
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava flowing from the middle!

A7AcmggVlh7rOXcBR1WzIg.text: The food if it ever arrives is good. Maybe because they are new, they don't have their act together. For dinner they don't use the carts. I will come back maybe for lunch. We'll see.

S3wNQpU5ODQT9HHnZA9Ghg.text: Very friendly staff, manager was happy to see us even though (or maybe because) it was our first visit. Had very good char siu bao. Happy to make dishes to order.

ayGTaT9FAufKLvu54DLcGQ.text: They serve Dim Sum in carts until 2:30 but until closing via memo ordering. My sister and I went there at about 7 pm to get some Dim Sum and every thing was excellent including great service. We will be returning as this was excellent value and service.   My sister and returned today and the Dim Sum and service was excellent again. We will return for dinner over the weekend.

XSqLjKeHTJnx28_8djWHdA.text: Wow! It was really good, and probably my favorite meal of this trip. It definitely compares well to places I've been in San Francisco bay area. It's authentic, and served hot. The dim sum is served all day, a rarity in most restaurants. They have the dim sum on carts until 2 pm. Afterwards, you have to go to the counter and to pick from the cases. I liked that they weren't very high pressure or no attention while we were there. My friends and I got to sit back and enjoy our food and catch up. If I'm ever in Vegas again and craving dim sum, I would go here. Also, the price was very reasonable. For three people, we spent less than  $40.

G4weJsuNuXKeGR-Joh0J-g.text: Wow i was skeptical about this place because the dim sum joint in this build ing before had a rude ass bitch with no customer service talking to us like we stupid!!!  But OMG!!!  This place is comparable to my usual Ping Pang Pongs And Orchid Gardens!!! Absolute redemption from the previous joint. This place is legit as a mofo!!!

GphQI-IR6jT8wE1FUVrQkA.text: This is one of the better places for Dim Sum in LV. They serve it all day, as well. The food is great. I haven't tried their regular entrees, yet. Until I do, I'll keep this review at 4 stars. They have a lot of diversity in choice of foods. The price is a plus, as well. The service is fine. When dining dim-sum style, there's not much "interaction" between server and diner. Hence, why I'll wait until I try their main menu.

tFn5gh2HD4uHWVodVvByvg.text: I came here on October 2016 and I gotta say it sucked. The food here lacks in portion sizes and quality. The calamari we ordered had way too many breading and not enough meat. The dim sum stuff was average and the decor was unpleasing. The bill turned out to be $80, in which we could've went to Ping Pang Pong at Gold Coast and had better food and portions, and probably spent a little less.

pnoXpreH5LpLViSaAUTcZA.text: Clean facilities. Nice customer service. Food wasn't consistent. We would order a dish and it would be delicious- the next round, it would be completely bland. Still a good value for the money spent. We'll give it another try.

5Sw6m2YfTGxGJISbXhEdUw.text: Pretty good. Good late night dim sum place. Good price and good quality. They have certain item that other places don't have.

zOqv9fezkOnc2ci26QjuJw.text: We went to Yum Cha 3 times in one week. We enjoyed every thing we tried!   The service was good & the staff are good at making recommendations. The chrysanthemum tea was an excellent choice for non-caffeine tea.

A5MVIz3U61kbOwxfSu4vAQ.text: OK dim sum, I have had a lot better and a couple worse in town. The service was really good though. I will update my review if I go back as I kind of went at an odd time and that may have impacted the food.

sG3UbvLDD5WfuRXvWKFGRA.text: When I arrived there was a full bus unloading and entering Yum Cha, I considered leaving due to the size of the crowd but I'm glad I didn't.  I was VERY impressed with Yum Cha's handling a large group as well as separate diners and a solo (myself).  The carts focused on the large group yet there were plenty of staff regularly checking with me and having my orders filled by the kitchen.  Very impressed with the service!!!  I usually avoid fried items, i.e. Salt & Pepper Calamari or Shirmp, as it can be cold and soggy sitting on a cart for a while - but Yum Cha will prepared these items to order so it's warm and crunchy!  Prices were good, food was good (but a tad bland).  5 stars for outstanding cordial & attentive service, -1 for a bit lacking in flavor = 4 stars.

PqWG3XrpWA5fte4EjQdrXw.text: the best dim sum I've had! we came late at night so we didn't get the push cart experience but they had the menu which described what was in everything. worked out perfect as this is one of the first times my kids have had dim sum. the regular entrees were just as good to. everything was freshly cooked.    their customer service was great.  they weren't pushy like other dim sum places where they get upset when you don't order more.  the waitress was very helpful and great on suggestions for food to try, she even gave us a free dim sum to try.  i forget the name of it but it was delicious.   if on i lived closer to the restaurant, im interested to know how the atmosphere is like during the day

2rqWgeUwpw1bYaYaYrHXew.text: Went here for lunch with my family. Nothing but great service. I highly recommend the sesame balls if you're planning on getting dessert.

aQSGXDiqAW1AjVVZEoJ5jg.text: This is now my favorite dim sum place srsly the best in Las Vegas, the dumplings and shumai are so juicy! I also loved their roti bread with curry on the side, very unique option if you are into trying new things (: To top it off, their service is excellent, every worker made sure that we were content with our meal and stay.

3HkEjQR8dt6DvhDpz-T9yg.text: I must say the service was really good. The price for the food was reasonable and it was good. I'm coming back next time I'm in vegas.

0d_ovuhNmBtGt2_hkQtnJA.text: Very fresh and good food. Very clean compared to other Asian restaurants, and good customer service. You won't be disappointed at all with this choice of restaurant.

RL_ZCzPaaa7h2bVtf61hTQ.text: If you are looking for the best dim sum in Vegas. Come to yum cha! The food is great. I'm so full and happy!

ivtdBFfAzGmC1jdwQq1jfA.text: I don't usually give reviews often but this place is awesome! If you're vegan or vegetarian there are few options for you! They make a really good vegetable and tofu hot pot. The name sounds plain and boring but it is really flavorful!

9Gb9Au5HlkgHdgPsPE2psA.text: I love this place. Authentic Dim Sum, great service, clean, and Elaine always makes sure her regulars are taken care of . So ask for Elaine and tell her Nikki sent you!

wZlLXRa1CZ8DZt0RraSepA.text: Loved how clean and shiny the place was.  Great food and great service.  We will be back.

NODJbfa1GAgBI7B7ehwx3Q.text: Really good service. The tables were getting cleaned so fast, water glasses were getting filled and tea was always hot. Dim sum was really good, we wished we had known about ordering at the kitchen counter.  Otherwise great experience would highly recommend going there.

2z8muDOpwj5d7o07b97CVg.text: Clean, convenient, friendly greeting. Great dim sum. Get egg tarts hot out of the oven. Savory items all delicious. Carts vs. steam table confusing. All in all, truly the best dim sum in Las Vegas, and we have tried them all!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kj-cdrhBmhE4ytXjcflLbw.text: Definitely recommended! Family friendly and a great value, dishes are super fresh, delicious, dining room is bright and cheery, and the staff is ready and willing to help.  Owner came over to talk to us because we clearly weren't local. He was just as welcoming as his staff, who not only recommended some great selections, they sat down at another table and ate the same items they were selling to us, which was great to see. When we travel I make a point of hitting local spots and Yum Cha is a winner for us. Took my two dim sum eating kids and they downed the baked bao, polo egg buns, and fried rice, but the coconut rolls are just spectacular and they have a number of more exotic dishes as well. Loved the malaysian pancake and curry sauce. Solid add to the local scene, Yum Cha beats the pants off Orchid Gardens for straight ahead dim sum. Get off the strip, already, and see what the local food scene is about--it's places like Yum Cha that make it worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise from top, polo egg bun, salt and pepper shrimp, sesame red bean ball, and baked bao from Yum Cha. All terrific!

hrJXArlJPhO_nAey0ywxLQ.text: Super solid dim sum. The Shu Mai and Spinach Shrimp dumplings were exceptional! Their chrysanthemum tea was also above average. And great service, too. Clearly a place that cares about food.

MM8GWv3sGfvYom9ROpqwcQ.text: My second time at Yum Cha was disappointing. I visited for dinner--around 8:00, and ordered the veggie noodle, chicken Shumai, shrimp dumpling, and xiaolongbao. None of this was great: the Shumai had many bones in it and the xiaolongbao had no soup in it at all. Additionally, the black vinegar that is supposed to accompany the xiaolongbao was diluted with water, which was a downer all together. The shrimp dumplings and noodles were both dry. The whole visit was surprising, because the first time I visited was incredible. Skipping out next time.

HAO28W1iW6GZeKR4aL1bWA.text: I arrived LV for vacation n had my first chinese dinner at Yum Cha. I was recommended and so gave it a try. Clean n cosy environment. Salty fish chicken rice, fish ball were delicious. Fillet wz corn sauce n Malaysian fat rice noodles were also nicely done. Last but not least dessert mango pudding n coconut pudding gave a lovely sweet ending to my dinner...

K079aS0f1pl8e7amHJD_iQ.text: Wonderful cuisine. Tried the various dim sum. The siu mai, shrimp won ton, and the chive and shrimp dumplings were wonderful. Also ordered a whole duck it was very good.  The fu jook rolls were the favorite.  Staff was courteous and efficient. Overall a excellent dining experience.

cu3NkV_E3peeX3qOHMBjwA.text: It's my first time here and food taste better than I expected. Curry noodle taste very good. They don't have a liquor license yet. Very quite and nice. It's relaxing and slow at night.

xMSDOjzewLF7fHKo1YLYRw.text: Found this place through Yelp and although this restaurant only opened less than 3 weeks ago, the owner was very friendly and the food was well displayed.  Coming from New York, the set up for dim sum was unorthodox because the waiters don't serve you the food from little carts; instead, they display the food behind the glass so that the customer can see all the possible options. Which is better in my opinion. There are no labels above the dim sum dishes so if one is unfamiliar with the Chinese dishes displayed, the owner takes time to explain which is the most delicious or popular depending on your preference- or all the dishes if you're curious. For the adventurous diners, she will push you to try something new! The prices for each dish are inexpensive. There are many wonderful entrees as well if you are not feeling in a Dim Sum mood. I would recommend the meat wrapped in bean curd skin, pork and shrimp Shumai, steamed sweet pork bun, fried sweet pork bun, and sesame red bean balls. Everything was full of flavor. Please try it! My friend and I will definitely dine here again in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shumai and flat rice noodle with pork with various hot sauces

LYflLQgIDMWlhzbAZJW03w.text: I don't know it's because I'm not Chinese but it took 15mins to get a cart and that's only because I had to walk up to someone and asked them how do I get a cart to my table and place an order. All the stuff we wanted they said "it's cooking". We asked 3 servers for two small bowls of rice. After we finally got our food, we waited for another cart......get this.....they passed up our table and went to the one behind me, TWICE!!!!! They only had 2 carts. VERY CRAPPY SERVICE!!!!

NW0acEWwPJvn3s5Lk7E_0w.text: One of the best places in Vegas to get great tasting dim sum. I would order everything on the menu if I could!

GmiEgklj314sLz6Vcje5HQ.text: Nice clean place. Very friendly staff and had both cart service and pick your own from the counter. Very convenient if it's packed and you can't wait for your favorite dish.   Food was tasty, and exactly what I always want from my dim sum. Highly recommended.

3lqe-yC85vHpJdLBNp4cpA.text: Came here on a busy weekend to try their dim sum as Changs stopped serving some of our favorites like custard buns. Once seated it was virtually impossible to get anyones attention and most of the carts stuck to the outside tables. Only one would ever venture into the tables on the inside and they had the less popular dishes. We managed to try one order of har gow which was good but nothing else. After waiting for a half hour trying to get served we gave up. We managed to get the attention of a busboy and asked for our check which took an additional 20 minutes. We left hungry and unsatisfied.

7rSwBeoF-eQ3gM1C4EnJkA.text: Always looking for a good dim sum place... I think my son had 6 pc of har gao (shrimp balls) to himself! The jasmine hot tea is delicious. We also liked the shu mai, hot & sour soup l, egg drop soup and egg custards. Not too busy, clean & friendly people. My 3 yr old was treated so well!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg tarts! My son &amp; I love these here. I&#39;m not usually crazy for them, but these are just the right sweetness and the crust is crispy!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special items on the buffet line incl. congee, veggies with oyster sauce, rice cakes...This buffet is in addition to the circulating carts.

fnzNPc0FsGoO7fd2NKclww.text: This place probably has to be the best dim sum I had in Vegas. From the moment I walked in to leaving all the staff has been so nice. Once we sat down water was given and less then a minute food was pushed in a cart to our table. The staffs always made sure to refill our water and always had food coming when we were about to be done with the dish. They also recommend a lot of delicious dish to try. we got them all and the taste was amazing.

CseKdoswOFjAgG_zKC00Wg.text: Not even 1 star! Very bad customer service with the lady server we had today. Ate with the whole family and multiple times I have to call for their service she never checked on us the whole time we were there, because they were too busy cleaning and doing other things. I would understand if they have other customers but just us and the other family were inside the restaurant! The restaurant was empty but she never did gave us that service we were expecting! Then she expected us to leave a tip! As we walked out the restaurant she went up to us and ask why we didn't leave her a tip unbelievable!!!!

HYbUFqrT5MM-cTlI-hhn5w.text: I come here at least twice a week because I'm obsessed with their steamed BBQ pork buns and steamed lava custard buns.

UJj5TNWcyNOiRn8Y4aKU9Q.text: Yum Cha is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here for a year and love trying new things every time. The service is great and staff is extremely friendly. Yao is my favorite. I Highly recommend it!

pfK7-PA-saU9tuVYwFSDTQ.text: This is my new place to go for dim sum.  The restaurant itself is very clean, not greasy like every other dim sum restaurant in town.  They have an open kitchen area where they prep food and feature dishes of the day.  Among the usual dim sum dishes, they have awesome custard steam buns. The buns has yellow yolks with just the right amount of custard and sweetness . If you've ever had the steam custard serve at restaurant in Hong Kong, these are the same!!!  Easy access and plenty of parking  Will surely return.

OsHyzzToa-wwoJL5oVaINA.text: Decided to try this place out since we wanting to eat some dim sum while we were visiting vegas and plus they serve dim sum all day. We ordered chicken feet(which I didn't eat but my girlfriend did - she said it was good), shaomai, crispy pork belly, radish cake, deep fried pork dumpling, and egg tart. The shaomai was just ok, not that great. The crispy pork belly and raddish cake were good. The deep fried pork dumpling and egg tart were pretty good. Overall I thought the food was ok. Not the best dim sum but not the worst. I enjoyed the dim sum restaurant inside the Rio Hotel more than here. I give this place 3.5 stars.

DnSqui5yUdBvQzHVw8L26Q.text: Yum Cha is the best dim sum in town. The only place my fiance and I will go to! The crispy eggplant and sweet and sour chicken rolls are bomb. Must try. Service is always great. People there are sweet. Rock on

1rVd4Wun-W9Qc4T0zZp7Xw.text: Visiting from out of town and we stumbled upon this place after a long weekend of gambling and drinking. Dimsum was great and the service was fantastic, will come back when I return to Vegas!

qFc5rzH-UuSt4_sKwIWoxQ.text: Here is my verdict. Overpriced. Food=GROSS  Total disappointment. FOOD-GROSS  Don't mind the price for good food. Never again here. Food-GROSS  Came here after yelping.  4stars yelpers- epic fail. Food-GROSS

E2AFmzuEajojdxdh8vjf6A.text: They need to learn how serve customer better. We order chicken fried rice and they dont even provide us a bowl and spoon how are we suppose to eat with flat plate and chop stick or with my fingers? They are very cheap on napkins too. One piece for each person. Every time i have to flag down the employee for things. Not convenience dim sum restaurant. Dont bother coming here if you think this is professional Chinese dim sum restaurant because they don't know how to serve customers. Plus the chicken on our fat noodles was raw. Like ewwww. And some shrimps was not fresh. This is my first time here from all the good reviews I read on Yelp I expected this place to be good haha turns out it's totally opposite. My family would not be coming here again. We agree the food and service here is below average. Plus the noodles was very salty and charge us pan fried noodle price which was not even pan fried.

ksEtbnG0HvX6OQZzPc6EsQ.text: Great place off the strip! Whole steam fish was the best! Dim sum also serves at night!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wsjIYsDzr0oWkfO_LOQkYA.text: Super cheap dim sum place but the quality was just soso. We ordered those regular dim sum like shrimp dumpling, sui Mai, mini Shanghai dumplings, curry fish balls, beef balls and lava bread. 25 dollars for two is not a bad deal but please don't have a high expectation for the taste. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fgnvwnWog2ZMyXrPW-TfkQ.text: Yum Cha is a new dim sum restaurant across from International Marketplace. I came across Yum Cha on Yelp in the Hot & New category. So I decided to try it out with my dim sum-crazed friend, who had introduced me to every other decent dim sum restaurant in Las Vegas.   Upon walking in, it was pretty late in the afternoon and the dim sum carts had ended at 2pm. After a few minutes of waiting (and they weren't busy at all), we were seated and chose our selection of dim sum from the glass display.   Our orders: Three orders of har gow Three orders of cheung fun One order of Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce Total price: $29  The FOOD took some time to come out, but came hot and good sized portions. The shrimp in our dishes were plentiful and filled us up. The SERVICE from the woman serving us was very nice and went out of her way to offer extra toppings for our dim sum and kept our waters filled. Overall, I think Yum Cha is one of the better restaurants that have filled this space which seems to have a history with high turnover.   At the end of our meal, the woman (maybe owner?) gave us a description of each dessert and I almost laughed because it felt like home when your mom makes you eat a lot of food. But in a good way. So, welcoming space and hopefully next time we'll come in to try the regular entrees for dinner.

xqxCGPy2p43N44gOm_b2Lw.text: Yum Cha is an All-Day dim sum restaurant. The service was good, with friendly and attentive staff. We ordered various dim sum items like steamed meatballs,  shrimp dumplings, steamed pork hash and pork spareribs. The food was good, if not a little bland on some of the dishes. Overall it was a good experience.

7jGoxdbSwN26TcArvYd-gQ.text: I haven't had dim sum in a couple years. Dim sum is the only reason that will get me to wake up early.  Yum cha has a diverse menu. I was able to eat chicken feet, tendon, and tripe. If you stick to the steamed menu it's pretty waist line friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nv6DtjNdzOBVLUvG581Ntg.text: Great restaurant.  Have had some Chinese food in Las Vegas and none were all that satisfying.  This restaurant however, is both tasty and reasonably priced.  It's also very clean!!!  Went there for lunch on a Tuesday, during Thanksgiving week.  Not too crowded so service was fast.  The dim sum was very good.  Best I've ever had in Las Vegas BY FAR.  It's comparable to what you might find in Monterey Park (that's a pretty tall order).  Only regret is not discovering this place sooner.  Parking is ample, the service is great, English is spoken and understood (Cantonese too, for those who wish to speak Cantonese).  Unsure how verse they are in Mandarin (I don't speak it myself).  The design is pretty unique in that they have bird cages (with fake birds of course) hanging from the ceiling.  The tables were clean and the chairs new.  They also have a food bar where you can get things which aren't pushed around in heated carts.  And of course, they have a full menu of items you can order.  If you want something not quite on the menu, they will try to customize your order, when possible.  Will definitely come back in the future.  Las Vegas is a common destination so we'll be back very soon!

e2i9ANLHH0mj14haHw6Z9A.text: Haven't been for Dim Sum in a while and before heading out the the usual Orchid ran a quick check on Yelp and found Ym Cha. Really glad I did. We did arrive right at opening and every Item we had tasted so fresh and well above any we have had in Las Vegas. Haven't had this good of Dim Sum since last in San Francisco.  They have carts going around with the usual items and you can go up to the counter to order others. I do recommend doing that right away. One of the best things we had was the chive dumplings ordered at the counter. You don't have to wait they will bring you what you order.   Service was great place was clean and food the best.

UxOfJulpNuXdSxqOvvQEfg.text: I don't usually bother with dim sum in Vegas but other options were even more crowded due to the holiday. Line stretched out the door (and there was an equally long line to pay) but so many people gave up that even though there were 20(!) parties ahead of us, it only took us ~30 minutes to be seated. Someone tried to steal our table but the hostess thankfully blocked them.  Doesn't compare to the dim sum I've had in Hong Kong, NY, or LA. Probably on par with what I've had in San Francisco and San Diego. They have a chaotic, inefficient system, not like the well-oiled machines I'm used to for dim sum. Between carts and going up to order at the kitchen, in 20 minutes we had only managed to get 3 dishes. Took 3 people to get our tea.  Guk faa cha: only $1/person for chrysanthemum tea! I like how they give you the rock sugar on the side, though we didn't use it. They were slow to refill our teapot, with lukewarm, not hot, water.  Cart items were mushy from sitting around, which was surprising considering how busy it was. The cart ladies would often pass us by in the corner where we were sitting.  Ha cheong fun: wrapper is a bit mushy. Shrimp on the small side. The 2nd round hadn't been sitting as long as the 1st so was marginally better, but still too squishy for my taste. 3 to an order.  Pork & chive dumpling: though they smelled good, they were bland, greasy, and the filling was hard. I felt like a dog gnawing on a rubber ball. There was supposedly shrimp in this but I didn't see or taste any. 3 to an order.  Bat tong go: sliced too thin so the edges were dried out and crunchy. Also small - I should not be able to shove an entire slice in my mouth. A touch too oily. Just the right amount of sweetness though. Comes 4 to an order but they're relatively small pieces compared to what I'm used to.  Ha gao: these we managed to get right after they were made. Instead of a shrimp ball there were 2 whole shrimp inside each one, though the shrimp they used were again on the small side. Even so, this was the third best thing we had. Getting it fresh made all the difference between this and the ha cheong. 4 to an order.  Malaysian roti: the best thing we had. Even the roti by itself was so delicious it almost was a shame to cover up the flavor with curry, even though the curry was also super-delicious. Comes with a little ramekin of delicious curry (which had some chickpeas and a few small chunks of potatoes in it). There's a serious bottleneck producing them as they're made fresh to order, there's only one pan to make them in, and only one fits in the pan at a time. Got 2, though we could have eaten a pile of them. Menu says it's vegan. Worth coming back for.  Xiao long bao (soup dumplings): the flavor was good and not sweet but there was no soup inside and the bottoms of the wraps were soggy. Despite their flaws, these were slightly better than the XLB Fat Dumpling (which I also like but don't love). Comes 3 to an order and are on the slightly small side for XLB.  Daan tat (egg custard): ordered this at the kitchen. They said they would bring it to our table but didn't ask where our table was. Half an hour later we still had none and could not find anyone who knew what was going on with them. Finally they arrived hot out of the oven nearly 45 minutes later. They were delicious (mostly because they were just made). I haven't had fresh hot daan tat in a long time so this was a nice treat. The second best thing we ate here. Comes 2 to an order and are the normal size kind, not the minis.  Steamed sponge cake: not what I was expecting. Tasted like sweet cornbread but with some almond cookie notes. Not bad but not what I wanted. They are not consistent with the size of the slice they give you, but they give you a huge hunk at least the size of your face.  Mushroom mai (shrimp and pork-stuffed mushrooms): they said they were out when we tried to order it but it came by on a cart later so we grabbed one. The shrimp and pork ball had the same problem as the chive dumpling filling in that I did not taste any shrimp, but these were less rubbery and had better flavor. 3 to an order.  They were out of veggie and potato curry puffs and pan-fried potstickers.  We did not get any of the noodle dishes, though it's of note that they give you your choice of wide or narrow rice noodles or thin egg noodles (I prefer wheat noodles to rice or egg noodles though).  Due to reaching our sweets threshold, we didn't try to get our other sweet favorites like dau saa bao (red bean buns), red bean sesame balls, mango pudding, tofu faa (sweet silken tofu), or golden lava custard buns.  The tables, chairs, and cafeteria area are not very posh but the dozens of wooden bird cages hanging from the ceiling are cute, and the floor tiles and booths look fairly new.  12 items cost $50 before tip.  They lose points for inefficiency, the lukewarm tea, hot items that got cold, and the chive dumplings, but the rest was good enough to make up for it.

CpXrDddNPufpZXWMjPdgvg.text: Ordered Curry Fish Ball Noodle Soup (w/ flat rice noodle), Beef Tendons and Pork & Veggi Roll.   It took a while for them to serve the food, but the flavor and taste were great.  The noodle soup is a local Malaysian dish with a unique spiciness and steaming hot. The other two side dishes were transitional Cantonese dim sum selection.   Yummy and I was sweaty after finishing all of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Fish Ball Noodle Soup

GEXa42Ol9h9BmrRFRIpUUw.text: Visiting from Denver. Have experienced dim sum in various states (as well as throughout Asia). Yum Cha is the best! Certainly the best in Las Vegas.  It is convenient to drive to. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The dim sum cart handlers promptly visited our table as soon as we sit down and thereafter again and again. We always order an assortment of pork, shrimp, beef and rice items. DELICIOUS...always delicious! Prices are very fair and competitive. Every time we visit Las Vegas, we visit Yum Cha. Do you want to experience fantastic dim sum any time of the day? Yum Cha is highly  recommended!

ODnsWdrCRxQb_eE3it2WKg.text: I give this place a solid 2.5 stars -  So In my opinion (just an average Joe opinion) I can't really judge dim sum super harshly but here's my reasoning for 2 1/2 stars even though yelp MADE me only give 2 stars.  We got there and this place only had one other customer. Not a great sign for Dim Sum on a Sat at 11AM. it's a big place. Lots of space and light and it looked promising.  This place was more of a order and we'll make it, or they had it made but you can tell its been sitting out a bit.   The owner and his wife seemed attentive and very nice. That's why i am giving them 2 1/2 stars. A 1 star can hurt a business and i'll never do that unless it was purposely a crappy experience.  The food was just ok.... Nothing special. I have since had dim sum like 10 times since this experience 3 this past month and honestly Yum Cha just did not cut it for me.  I waited a bit to write this review. Saw it in my drafts and thought what the hell -  There were some standard things missing. The food was just ok.  I honestly love going to vegas and I love Dim Sum - don't think i'll be back to this place though. Oh and It's expensive. I ended up dropping 80 bucks and I hated it. Go at your own risk.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MxGsxajFB26ADiiYsvbKCA.text: This place has a very distinct smell that you only get when you go to an authentic dim sum restaurant. It is not pleasant (propane). But you get used to it and are fine with it, because the food is amazing! The staff is all very friendly and customer service oriented. The prices are very reasonable compared to dim sum in the California area. I always try and stop in while I am in Vegas!

QG6kj2RBawYe-fTlFyNyBg.text: I lived in San Francisco and there's largest Chinese community in the US but I like this this place more than any dimsum restaurant in SF. Every time I come to Las Vegas, I always come to YumCha because they did really great job. Great services ,  The server mention that sweet bun really hot and  Take care really good.  good dim sum , and I recommend this is really awesome place if you love dim sum.

L-Lvl1trYnYBQNzOaZCqUw.text: Amazing service and super kind staff! Definitely worth the short trip off the strip for this treasure! Everything is well priced (~$3-$4) snd super fresh and tasty. Fed and filled 6 hungry people for around $60 total--such a relief from the other overpriced and bland food on the strip. My favorites were the shumai, soup dumplings, and fried shrimp balls! If I'm ever in Vegas again, I definitely will be back!

aP0TXWP6Zbaeemm83JC15Q.text: Highly rated but the food was disappointing.  Most of the food looked good but  the hargow slimy. Beef roll was very bland . I did like the noodle . Ham sui gok was oily but the meat was bland.  We did like the barbeque pork buns
