UYxBcT60aRi0prYRLTgZ5w.text: This was my first time dining at a dim sum restaurant and it did not disappoint! Everything I ordered was flavorful and delish!!! Our server was sweet and attentive. The prices are extremely reasonable considering how good the food is. I definitely recommend this restaurant - quite large inside and I didn't feel rushed even though we stuck around for a while after we paid our check. I'll be recommending this restaurant to friends and I will definitely return!

YvBRopjuNhbvOyc5fvU2BA.text: Excellent menu options, fresh and hot, great service! Wonderful place outside the hustle of Spring Valley Rd/Chinatown for a relaxing meal. Will definitely be back!

-wUeiNOxZUL3owMFiRPqpQ.text: Great Dim Sum. Fried pork balls and Xiao Long Bao were my favorites. Great food after a late night out on the strip.

XH6gbuQOF1xZOSlvtalBEw.text: I was super excited to try this place out. It was once a Chinese buffet before it closed its doors. Someone had posted a Roti picture on Yelp and I wanted some! Haha! As soon as I came in, it was a huge dining area and I was greeted by super friendly staff. This place specializes in southeast and southern China with a hint of Malaysian flair.  There were several carts going around the dining area and food selections available on the counter and an a la carte menu as well.The food inside the showcase and behind the counter all looked good! Forget the food cart! Haha! The bulk of my order came from the counter. You choose your food and tell them what you like. They have a partial open kitchen where they heat up your food on a skillet prior to arriving on your table.   What stood out to me were pan fried chive dumplings, lotus leaf sticky rice, fish balls, and of course the Malaysian style Roti were all delicious! The fish balls were one of best I've had and they were larger than normal. Whatever sauce used on those fishballs really paired well with it. The Roti was delicious, but prefer mine thinner. I was told that they make the curry dipping sauce from scratch and that some restaurants use curry powder. As usual, Roti and curry together was a great combination. I wish they have a sweet version of this Roti (bring on the condensed milk and sugar please)! I was so disappointed I did not order a single noodle! This ain't me! I was too full! Haha!   This is a sure return for me as the food were all done right and tasted great if not better than some of the competitors out here. They have many options to choose from that's a must try for me. It's also great for a huge group and lots of room to socialize. I stopped going to a couple of places that served dim sum in Vegas because the quality of food just went downhill as well as their service. If I can give "my other dim sum" place a 4 star? This is definitely a 5 star! What pushed it was the visibility of their partial open kitchen. It's located on Decatur and Tropicana. It's the plaza across International Market and next to Sushi 21.             Yum Cha, you've earned my 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bwt9gFMyk62lTvjIUu7bZg.text: Hey there! Ok ... so we have been to many dim sum restaurants here , Hawaii and San Francisco and so far this one is my favorite! The food was hot , the service was excellent, the staff were very friendly and the restaurant... so clean !!! I also loved the fact that you could see the kitchen and know the food is prepared to order ! Everything we ordered was delicious my favorite was the baked custard bun (yummm...) ! We will be back soon !      Thank you Yum Cha !

3Y8JIcYll4E7VJUlhdK_QQ.text: My family used to go for dim sum at the Orchid Garden for years and now that my sisters and I are growing up, we don't go as often and we order to eat at home.   It's either a hit or miss for me. One day I come, they have egg tarts and the next time I come, they don't. I absolutely love egg tarts so why would I come if they're not going to have it? If they know that the egg tarts run out quickly, they need to prepare more. Anyways, my family went on Tuesday to celebrate my sister's graduation and this time, they did not have crab claws with shrimp. I mean I guess.   What I would recommend:  -Steamed and baked BBQ pork bun -Fried pork balls -Egg tarts (when it is actually available) -Chicken shumai -Shrimp dumplings -Congee -BBQ pork puff pastry  -Shrimp balls -Red bean sesame balls -Taro cake   I kind of wish that they have pineapple buns on the menu but there are other dim sum places in Vegas as well. You can order by menu and there are carts that go around too.  The staff were nice and  pretty patient every time I visited. I praise them for being exceptionally patient this time with my family being those incredibly demanding/annoying customers.  I also thought that this place would be packed but there is usually one or two families. I have never seen the place filled up. Other than that, the food is good and tastes like what I've had at other dim sum places.

r9xI1q7Z6QpcPvQ1WOnK9Q.text: We checked in yesterday. It was mad busy, but we got our seats pretty fast. We had the standard Sou Mai, har gau, loh mai gai, and Char Siu bao. Best part of all of these were they were all piping hot, soft and very fulfilling. We ordered a lot like a banquet size. And the price was just heavenly. WILL come again!!!

4pEbNob_uOd-VJbSBbc5VA.text: If you're looking for great Dim Sum, go to Yum Cha.  with a wide array of options on the menu, one is sure to find something they will enjoy.

TWzdrjEWqib6KmGJVLh2yw.text: DIM SUM PLACE LOOKS CLEAN  . **2017 Yelp 100 Challenge #6** . The place looks super clean & simple & pretty big. There's none of that stuffy feeling you get when you go into a Chinese restaurant be side of old carpet & all the oils stuck in it smell.   The staff was very attentive at least the lady was super friendly. She kept checking up on us & made sure everything was good.   The food IMHO was not the best. They had items that most other DIM SUM places aren't very tasty but the MAIN squeeze basic items that I usually get were just whatever's. My main concern was the SALT & PEPPER shrimp which they even show on the tv screen slide show Of how it should be but it came out like CRAP.... If the shrimp gets too much coverage from the flour then the shell doesn't crisp up properly enough for you to eat it whole.   CHICKEN STEAMED BUN - HOT & soft  STEAMED RICE CAKE  CHIVE DUMPLING  CHICKEN FEET - perfect  LOTUS LEAF PORK STICKY RICE  FISH. STUFFED TOFU  PORK & VEG ROLL  BEEF BALL  RADISH CAKE - SO disappointed it's like they put too much flour in the mix  2x STEAMED PORK RIB - FREAKEN YUMMY  CHINESE BROCOLLI  BEEF TENDON - DERICIOUS!!! SALT & PEPPER SHRIMP - SO sad.  So I probably won't be coming back here unless the hubby wants some chicken FEET. One because you have no idea which items cost how much. Because I figured which page they are on would indicate the price but the way things were shown on the receipt says otherwise. So unfortunately when I don't trust something I usually won't be going back.

L3cH3tE1TOiVDfZ7UuGjDg.text: This was our second time going to grab Dim Sum, our first time was in Los Angeles and loved it, Yum Cha is a really good place to eat, the staff is friendly, Sam was really great and funny. Definitely going back especially since my girlfriend and I are locals!

yrASJCqjoH1jIpUO8IenAg.text: My whole experience here was very great! We were greeted at the door by the host who promptly sat us and took our drink order. It was the first time being in a dim sum place where you order from a menu vs the carts and the host explained that to us as well. Everything was very delicious - as a family of 3 we ordered the baked pork bun, shrimp and mushroom shumai, chicken feet, braised beef, fried shrimp, Chinese broccoli, and the crab claw. For dessert, we ordered the sweet tofu and we were recommended the baked lava custard, which we ordered as well. Again everything was very good! After eating it all, it didn't leave me feeling heavy since the food wasn't oily. Overall I would highly recommend this place and I'll be going again multiple times.

tZspkJpFdfDn7ZDBE8bm_A.text: This is my new favorite place for Dim Sum. The food is not oily and the tripe are not slimy. This place is clean, come try it for yourself.

lQS8UydZ45FH15U_CVX1dQ.text: my parents and I decided to eat early lunch here. This used to be Fortune Restaurant located opposite International Market on Decatur.  They serves dimsum. The owner said it was the first day of opening and we are the 2nd customers. They only have few items of dimsum ready. The owner said it was their first day so taking a while.   the dim sum was ok. All of the dimsum are $2.88 each which is pretty inexpensive. We had chicken feet, pepper stuff shrimp , pork ribs and shumai.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ryd-eqWcP2o8PHR5tdxOYw.text: Great Food + Great service = Happy tummy. I especially favored the beef short ribs, bbq buns and chicken feet. Try it out.

nFPsEQo3K8W5EosDdK3pSg.text: Found the perfect Dum Sum spot in Vegas!!! FOOD was DELISH (super authentic HK style Din Sum) & CUSTOMER SERVICE was IMPECCABLE!!! Everyone serves w/ a smile on their face! We ordered the Lotus Sticky Rice w/o knowing that it contains shrimp (which one of our friend is allergic to), so we didn't end up touching it after we found out there's shrimp... We didn't bother telling the server as most Chinese places wouldn't care, but Lien (supervisor/manager?) was AWESOME!!! She asked us how everything was tasting & asked if we knew how to eat the Lotus Sticky Rice as we haven't touched it yet, so I told her we ordered it w/o knowing that it contained shrimp, so she was so kind to switch it out for us with something that had the same value... That was such an unexpected surprise that she would be proactive in taking care of us... We were SO APPRECIATIVE!!! We'll definitely come back again... Highly recommend this place!!! Thank you so much for your hospitality again Lien!!! :-)

4p71FC9kLTEwILZTUDXPMA.text: My new favorite place for Dim sum!  The food was wonderful and very fresh, the atmosphere is bright, cheery, clean & modern.  The service was great, and staff were all so friendly and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IOLc4fZNIyxZPaj7a2einQ.text: Good food!! Good host!! Dim sum was good. We went weekday evening. Wasn't crowded. All food we ordered was good. I am from Vancouver and used to really good Asian food. The food did not disappoint me.

3vgt795VXzgy29nJgNlicQ.text: Came here for the first time today and loved it. Food tasted great and fresh, will come here again next time I'm in Vegas

CUXg_smfb3OY4Z5KlrTZtQ.text: Was looking for dim sum and found this new restaurant on Yelp. It's across from the International Marketplace. The food was fresh and at a great price. Before 2 pm, they have the traditional carts going around, and they have a food bar so you can order additional items. The owner greeted us and was very attentive to ensuring that we enjoyed our meal. Overall, it was an enjoyable lunch and I'll probably come back again next time I'm craving dim sum.

o4aWF0IpV8PszaG2YNdROA.text: The food is fresh and tasty.  This is the first time here.  I think it taste better than some of the dim sum places in New York.  The staff is friendly and are attentive to our needs.  Definitely will come back if I'm in the area.

TdpAriSxVNC_f6F0e3SsJA.text: Fantastic. I would definitely eat here again. It's very clean, affordable, the staff is attentive and friendly, and the food is F@$&ing bomb!

nqlhFMFpytDRvXMLUqaMPQ.text: A great restaurant should have delicious food even during off hours of the day. I came in the late afternoon and waited for a couple of minutes before I was seated. The restaurant was practically empty, only a couple people sitting in the booths but was for the most part clean. We waited over 20 minutes to order because we could not get anyone's attention. It's as if they didn't want to talk to you. Everyone was doing their own thing. I finally got the attention of one girl but then she end up forgetting about me a minute later because she sat down at another table and started eating her lunch. At this point, I was ready to leave but I saw such great reviews for this place and drove over 35 minutes to get here so I decided to stick it out hoping the food was good. Again, I was mistaken. We order 7 dishes totaling to about $28 which for dim sum, that's expensive. The dishes didn't even come with your standard 3-4 pieces of food. Some of ours came with 2 pieces! That's $1.50 for each piece, ridiculous! Now the quality of food, totally lacked flavor and you can tell it was microwaved because the inside of the food was cold and mushy. On my way out, I noticed that their fried ducks and chickens were just sitting out on the counter with no heat lamp, don't know how long that has been there. I could not believe that this place is still in business. From the poor customer service to the lukewarm almost cold food, to the steep pricing, I will definitely NOT be coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

--mqcYm--TZ6S2xhYOgUrw.text: This place was recommended to me by a foodie and I have to say I was extremely disappointed.  The quality of the food wasn't any better than an East Ocean.  There were only 2-3 carts with very limited variety with a lot of the popular items not available.  They probably had less than 1/3rd of their dimsum menu on the carts and a lot of those items were in very limited quantity.  And all of this was at 1230p and not that many people in the restaurant!!  The staff tried to help by bringing us requests but even there they overpromise and underdeliver.  10 minutes turns into 20 minutes for 1 plate of food.

hUV5xANKnm1k2m7HXbc58g.text: My family and I are from California and we originally wanted to eat at a buffet, but stumbled upon this place. It isn't the typical dim sum place where the carts are going around, it was like a buffet dim sum! We ordered wanton noodle soup, pork buns, vegetable dumplings, fried tofu and shomai. ALL SO DELICIOUS!!! Sam was surprised to see my brother eat three plates of pork buns, and told him I'm coming back for my birthday so he gave us two complementary desserts!! It was nice of him(: definitely coming back here again, and again. Thanks Sam!!!

WxpqoBCidoUfKvF98BeEmQ.text: You can really find some great dim sum here.  I tried the pork sui mai, lotus wrap, sticky pork bun, and shrimp gao, all very delicious and reasonably priced!  Only disappointment were the custard tarts, although they were good, I just expected it to be a lot sweeter for a dessert.  Service was also great. I will definitely be back!

QunWKqiQ7TlIQrjVgV3aTA.text: Friendly staff, great service, delicious food! Went there for dim sum twice. In the morning there are dim sum carts that go around tables and during late hours orders are taken for dim sum. The fried dim sum dishes are made to order and can be chosen from the menu provided.

q9572mauCBPVTo056AV6iw.text: Very tasty. We came in after 2 and food was great. On Monday-Friday the small dishes are just 2.88

pVuXKm3Mfm5Iu84xnXBEMg.text: This place is great! They have some of the best tasting and freshest dim sum we've ever had. They have a big selection of options too. The owners were friendly and helpful too!

qURNSJ_T8CxglltootvYmg.text: This place has the best customer service of all dimsum restaurants. Crews have a very pleasing personality. Food is great, clean place, I would say this would be my go to dimsum place from now on.

ehg-LXTV77ABg8Y3iPepXg.text: My husband and I are from New York and so we are spoiled with good quality dim sum. Been searching for a while for a good go-to dim sum place since moving to Las Vegas and unfortunately have been to several bad ones... Until Yelp helped us find Yum Cha. Apparently fairly new but solid quality dim sum (up to par with NY, even the in-laws approved). More casual appearing than traditional dim sum restaurants, although they have the typical carts as well as a counter to order from. Food was fresh and did not disappoint. Best baked pork buns I have ever had (and I'm Filipino so I know my buns). Service was better than most, very attentive. Will definitely be back.

qWYHOw96kC-LNfXsrllD7Q.text: The food is great and the service is even better! every suggestion our server made was spot on. She even predicted what soups we would like. We ordered them for each other and ended up switching!

jH4YN_bMG1lnG3XWA1gQXg.text: Good Service! Great food! Reasonable price. It's definitely worthy of try! I like the coconut tart, chicken feet, ribs. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Tart!

GGrufyg56chnn1ciBIUHpg.text: Never had better service at a dimsum place! Great customer service, clean environment and food came quick.  The lady that served us was very informative and attentive to us!

UVi4zoqI9CliSy9CvUd7OQ.text: First meal at Vegas. Four star for the decent food and pleasant service. The price is surprisingly like fast-food price. Very inexpensive for authentic Chinese food. Really happy to see a Chinese restaurant with an elegant and friendly waitress.

oNoMudhcPDC9ni1BbOGiBw.text: I'm from SF where I'm spoiled with great food... This was my first time having dim sum in Vegas. I'm definitely going back soon, the food was delicious and the staff was very nice  The place is new & clean & great for parties

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too many to name, each one was delicious

NMqYKF0Os5NKI6Yf7QjCCg.text: My husband and I try to make it a point to have dim sum everywhere we visit and most places would have good food, but lack in customer service. This place was perfect from point A to point B!  Great service from the moment they sat us down. There were multiple servers who came and check up on us one after another. Even the manager came around. That is 100 stars right there! The food was awesome and on point, time-wise. This was our first stop after we landed in Las Vegas and it was a GREAT start to our vacation. We will be back!!

2q1kUg1TSTP_WfA2PS1rnQ.text: We went there last weekend October 6-9, we got an order of dan tat (egg custard) bolo bao (pineapple bun) and guy me bao (coconut bun) to go. It was real fresh and still warm. I will definitely eat in next time I'm in Vegas..

DAiWmG7EDtvx7oVZ7yfKSA.text: We came into town for the 4th of July weekend and stumbled upon this little gem through the great reviews from Yelp. I'm glad we stopped by. Food was really good and talk about customer service...it was amazing!   CUSTOMER SERVICE: First thing, we ended up getting there about half an hour before closing and they allowed us to eat there without rushing us. Second, they let me go up to the counter and order the dim sum plates that i wanted (cuz i do better visually than through the menu when it comes to that kind of stuff). Third, they kept checking up on us to make sure everything was okay and that we had what we needed and to top off our drinks when low...very attentive.   FOOD: They serve dim sum all day. We tried about 8 different dim sum plates and they were all really good.   We're happy to have found this place and will definitely be back next time we are in town.

onpyntbTYmtZj_QZutwySQ.text: We are a Bay Area family that came here for dim sum, so take this review with a grain of salt--we have high standards. The dim sum was below average. The har how was cold and hard, and the fried shrimp balls were also cold!   The extra star was for the service, that's the only thing that was good here. They also advertised that everything was 3.80, but a few of the items we were charged more. If you're looking for dim sum, try another place.

Rravy0_G8q-vvlZ-OUpkkQ.text: Great food. Service is very quick. We came in on Sunday noon and it's packed but they manage to take care of everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

KLE8YsWQr3VIHv4epvxiIA.text: Definitely a must try!    The restaurant was CLEAN!!  Let's face it, many Asian restaurant are not clean.  The service was attentive and staff was kind, unlike all the other money-hustling dim sum places around Vegas!  The owner was sweet and sociable.  He was very professional!  I like the fact that they have a made-to-order hot bar!  If you want to make sure your salted shrimp is fresh, hot, and crispy and not from the cart, just go up to the hot bar!  They have congee and soups you can order from the bar.  I love their Chinese broccoli; it was made-to-order and was piping hot when it hit the table.  Eat fresh, my friends!

_xTuFcu0XLMVSXGhDpPkCg.text: The best dim sum restaurant I've been to in Vegas.   Restaurant is clean and food is delicious. One thing that stood out from all the other dim sum places is their customer service! We never had to ask for water refills and if we had to ask for something they were happy to help us. There was always someone checking on our table to see if we needed anything or just to see if we were ok.   We tried a little bit of everything and everything was so good!! The salt and pepper shrimp needed more flavor tho. I also noticed that there was no roast duck or BBQ pork. Unless I missed it on their menu.   Don't forget to get the CUSTARD BUNS!! Omg !!  Prices were decent! For 4 adults and 1 kid total bill was only $55

Mg0ZuOwxnL6AKdcyDJjHnA.text: First time here, we had 2 different kind of sticky rice with leaf, we love them! Delicious bbq pork bun, custard bun and Roti with curry..reasonable price and friendly customer service.. Dim Sum is available day and night till 10:30pm!

Gv_bTuyHG-etuedFBXDdiQ.text: I brought some of my coworkers who were here from Chicago.   This place for being a Chinese dim sum place was very clean and very presentable!  The dim sum dishes were all very fresh and you can tell they were just made.  They also have a counter you can walk up to and order something and see them cool it. Definitely a first having a great experience at a Chinese restaurant!   Nicely done!!!

c_OI24ap2jlPytjm79MOCA.text: The food there was very delicious.The service was great. If you get a chance try the Lava custard bun it's really good!

xWAR1JbdzsF8NGO5MBgFow.text: My daughters & I are from Singapore, & missing Dim Sum, we decided to have Brunch here after a week of Christmas fare & before our NYE Spanish dinner tonight. What a great place, great service, & great food. The Prata & Curry were delicious, the Sesame Balls were perfectly soft, balanced in sweetness, & taste, & the Lady Boss, Elaine, from Ipoh, Malaysia, brought us the Salted Egg Custard Buns. They were of melt-in-the-mouth consistency & were so delicious! Yum Cha is my new favorite!

87s5sbJP5l7CyEguCZLS9g.text: Since last week, they've added the gooey egg custard bun! I asked about it last week but they didn't have it. Well they have it now! And its delicious!! I'm used to it being in a golden and crispy bun. Theirs is in a plain white bun. But still good. Its a must try! Not sure what its called in English but in Cantonese its pronounced "lau-sa-bao". Get it!

E-2BsTrhnx6pH3MtP2Nm1Q.text: Been looking for good dim sum like back home in SF and there's not too many places out here up to par. First time at Yum Cha today and it was great. 7_b50OiyZTP-QYIdVWgJhw.text: Best dim sum in town!! They have a special on Tuesday thru Friday $2.98 and Saturday and Sunday is $3.58.. not bad at all. We didn't have to wait that long. The owner Sam was awesome!! Try it.. you will love it.

7RtfZW_PAhF-drMWVG7BUQ.text: Fast, fresh, attentive, delicious! Great spot for tasty dim sum.  Must try sweet ginger tofu soup!

RmDez10P8Fhq-Tf4D_Zk5w.text: 3.5 stars. I'm a huge dim sum person, so whenever I get the chance to try a new place, I go. This place had the best overall reviews, so my friends and I decided to try it. It's not too far from the strip, so take a taxi/uber.   This isn't your regular dim sum restaurant, least not what I'm use to. The restaurant is a little dark inside. There are carts going around, and some other things you can order to be made. The food overall is pretty good. You can easily judge a dim sum place by their chicken feet, shrimp dumpling and sui mai. All 3 here are pretty good. They have almost everything you can get at a dim sum restaurant, so if you're craving it, this is probably one of the better spots in Vegas.  I don't get the dim sum vibe here like I do most places. Maybe it's the lighting, something just feels off. But don't let that stop you, it's just me. I would definitely come back here for dim sum next time I'm in Vegas.

g1jc9cfTjxqDLAVOK0IhLA.text: Good dim sum and good service! A must when you visit Vegas! I came here for the name because their name translate to drink tea/dim sum in Chinese which is funny. It was pretty busy even though I came on a weekday but the staff was efficient and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf, chicken feet, pork rib with black bean sauce, shrimp dumplings, and shrimp rice roll.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum cha! ;)
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef organs.

oZFXvWIDatwds_IMtlFGaQ.text: Meant to take pictures but couldn't stop eating long enough. The service was decent, the prices a little bit higher than standard dim sum which is why the star loss, but over all I really enjoyed this place.   Some of the stuff looked a bit super sized such as the Baked buns were about half a size bigger as well as the shumai. Everything else was standard size but had excellent flavor and the food was brought out very quickly. I would absolutely come back here and pick up a few things to go.   The leftovers were great up to 2 days later (which is how long it took me to get to them).

JuHqcGxS3bKhziHG-yCFKA.text: Large dim sum restaurant with attentive service, good food and atmosphere. Average portions which is good to share the many dishes so you can try a lot.

c7OUpaIpvTlRc-rtflrHVw.text: My first dim sum experience in Las Vegas. I had driven by Yum Cha several times since it is close to my house, but I finally found someone to go try it with (dim sum is hard to eat alone). The restaurant itself is fairly large, and the birdcages hanging from the ceiling are very distinct. The interior was clean, and service was actually friendlier and more attentive than usual for a dim sum place. It was also not too crowded, but also not empty, so a nice balance and no wait before getting seated.  As for the dim sum itself, there is a hybrid system of a few carts that come around and food over at the counter. I haven't really seen this setup before, but anything you order up at the counter will be brought to your table. The food itself was not bad; not the best dim sum I've ever had, but I also haven't had any other dim sum in Las Vegas to compare with Yum Cha.   Prices seemed reasonable; I didn't really pay attention to how much each dish cost, but we were pretty full at the end and the subtotal was about $20 per person for our party of two.   No major complaints. Yum Cha seems like a solid dim sum place, and it's close to my house too.

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1JHKNidI9Qy59iUFg8O-tw.text: Meh.  The XLB was doughy. The shumai had a giant bone in it. My husband almost vomited. I expected much more

90F1_BmYM4NdLfGFhPC0eA.text: My dim sum expectations might be a little high. But this place was seriously a disappointment considering it received the highest yelp ratings.   1. Location - it is in a strip mall as everything is in Vegas. :( However, when in Rome, it is pretty much comparable to other locations  2. THe space is large and as previous reviews it does feel like a cafeteria. There are a bunch of flat screens surrounding the entire venue and there are fake birds in wooden bird cages. Kinda cool.  3. Food and the main reason I gave a 3 stars review.  I had the chicken shui mai, shrimp and beef chang feng, century egg congee, and lau mai gai (chicken wrapped in bamboo leaves).  First it was expensive and I really don't mind paying for more, but that is not what we got. Everything was ok. HOwever, it did not justify the cost. Chang feng fell apart and shrimp was not really fresh. Lau mai gai fell apart as soon as I unwrapped it.   Of course, this was when I took my Chinese mother who liked another place and I wanted to give this a try so she of course has revoked my ability to pick a restaurant forever.  TL,DR - food not worth the cost. Lost relationship with mother.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nothing terrible but not quite worth the cost.

fOENShg2QaASrjZCuNv4yQ.text: Pretty amazing dim sum and the service was top notch here. Very attentive and responsive to all of our requests or needs. Did I mention the food was also pretty great?!

SUAaeKEefDQabnVbmDQoYQ.text: After a long night in Vegas, this restaurant gave everyone some life. We got the chicken feet and it was pretty good. The meat fell right off the bones and the flavor was just right being a little sweet and salty. My favorite was probably the crunchy shrimp balls. The outside is fried to a golden crisp and the inside is filled with juicy shrimp. We also got the congee and it was also good. It was the right amount of saltiness and the century egg really brings all the flavors together. The shumai was only okay though in my opinion. They added dried shrimp on top and that overpowered the dumpling. Otherwise, that would've been really good too. Last, we got the soup dumplings and I was pleasantly surprised. The skin wasn't too thick and the soup inside was flavorful. The prices here are also great based on how big your stomach is. Each ranges from $3-$6 and comes with 2-4 items. Not too shabby...

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QzaY6XirMKNa6W-moy5enA.text: This place is fantastic! Very clean,  amazing service, lovely atmosphere!  I can't wait to go back for some jasmine tea and dim sum!    Try the bbq pork buns, they are so good! We tried a little of what looked good, I can't remember the names of everything,  but everything we had was amazing!  I highly recommend this place!

H4_WUyPQd3eqiOAyKW0o3A.text: Dim sum off the strip, YES! A bit of True Chinese dim sum amongst the buffets. This local place is 15 or so minutes off the strip in a suburban area of business and residences. Yum Cha offers Great service and an easy to read menu of traditional dim sum cuisine. Prices are fair as the food is tasty and in many cases just as I remembered when I was a child growing up in SF. The dim is more than satisfying to the tummy and palate. This is a definite place to go. Enjoy!

jRO1qaV3F4Q9hUTFy3XUIw.text: Yum Cha...is not so yummy. We took a Lyft from the Strip craving good dim sum thinking we would find it here given the other reviews...but nope. The only good thing about this place is that it's the cheapest dim sum I've had. We also appreciate that they don't charge extra for hot tea.  I'll say that the shrimp dumplings, rice wrapped in banana leaf, and baked BBQ pork buns were acceptable, but the calamari was plain and soggy. The other dishes we ordered (chicken feet, fried tofu skin, fried shrimp balls, pork ribs) weren't memorable.  I can see why families would come here for weekend brunch, or why people who work or live in the area come for weekday lunch. It's a large restaurant with lots of seating. I don't think I'll be back though.

The dim sum carts keep coming every 5-10 minutes. We kept ordering shumai, chicken feet, pork ribs, and shrimp dumplings. They also have good egg custard desserts. I recommend this place if you are hoping to get some dim sum for a good price while in Las Vegas.

hR5c4JkWapcV_GZhSidzNg.text: Came here for dimsum and it didn't taste fresh. I was also upset that they auto grat my bill when it was only the 2 of us. Pretty disappointing experience.

cU3y0SPxmDewlZDoZsogBQ.text: Had the chicken feet, spareribs, curry fish balls, and siu mai. The only thing decent was the spareribs. The curry fish balls had no flavor and the curry wasn't silky. Another disappointment for Chinese food

rPBBFKuWRydKabg8jjo1eA.text: We love Dim Sum but have been spoiled by great restaurants in LA and San Francisco. We were visiting in Las Vegas and shopping at International Marketplace and got hungry from looking at all the foods! We saw the Yum Cha Dim Sum nearby and thought we would take a chance. It is a large room with lots of tables and the food carts on one side. The carts started coming by and we saw some of our favorites as well as new items which was fun.   We ordered off carts but the menu has tons of choices too. Their chow neon noodles were good but not a ton of flavor. Favorites were Seafood Rolls, Shrimp Balls, Shrimp & Pork ShuMai, and Won Tons. My husband picked something he thought was BBQ pork but ended to be Beef Tendons! They were surprisingly soft and tasty. The tea is such an important part of the meal and was very good too.  Dim Sum is a favorite of mine because you get to have small tastes of so many items. Going to look at the food carts was interesting and gave ideas of different foods. We had tons of good Dim Sum selections for so little money. We will definitely return!

D3s_P4e539nUMJcefpKU-Q.text: This place is not kinda busy but it's a very warm and quiet restaurant whenever we come. The woman always remember us and give us any desserts to thank. To be honest, Yum Cha is not a best dim sum place in town but I see they are trying. Been trying almost everything and still come back.

Onkv4rqDVVQSLcOqyBMaCw.text: We stayed in the Las Vegas are for a week around the Thanksgiving holiday.  Tried a few Chinese restaurants in the Chinatown area, and they were all pretty bad.  We met up with a local who recommended Yum Cha for dinner.  We ordered from the Dim Sum menu and every dish was amazing.    We ordered family style, where everyone orders a dish and each dish shared by all.  There were about 8 of us, so we ordered plenty of food, and there wasn't a bad dish to be had.  When we were here, it wasn't very crowded, and the owner served our table.  She was quite pleasant and offered a some recommendations which we ordered.  She even brought a dish or two that were comped.    I was surprised to see such poor reviews for the dim sum at this restaurant, but I think I understand; those reviews must be referring to the dim sum lunches, where the carts are wheeled from table to table.   Our experience with the dim sum was quite different.  We ordered them for dinner and they were coming straight from the kitchen and hadn't been sitting on the cart for who knows how long.  If you love Dim Sum, I would highly recommend this place, BUT, maybe (based on reviews), coming during their dim sum lunch offering may not be the best way to enjoy this restaurant.

iExtrOr0g_-cyDcFYCdTUQ.text: One of the better dim sum places in Vegas.  Food is pretty fresh!! Great customer service!!

xOmWaIaD8weze5CIsQxUzg.text: Yum Cha is hands down a winner for dim sum. They have a private parking lot, ample seating, and their service is super fast and attentive. They have carts going around and they're always walking around to make sure you have enough food on the table and picking up your empty plates as you go. Anything steamed, are on the carts, but anything fried, you have to put in an order. You can also order anything else you want from the menu. The prices are solid, the food quality is delicious, and the options are plentiful. You can't go wrong with anything here. It was so good, I forgot to take any pictures of the food or location and dug right into the food.

Rgx7Ot-Rgs4iuTDwujn2Cg.text: I love this place for fresh and tasty Dim Sum. They offer dim sum all day which is an added bonus! Be sure to arrive early to receive the full dim sum cart experience. But don't worry, if you like to sleep in or skip the crowds like myself, they have the dim sum menu available to order from all day, so you can get your fix at any hour. I prefer the dim sum menu over the carts since they make it fresh to order. The service is quick and friendly. You will definitely find a favorite.  They prepare everything well, but here are my favorites!  Char Sui Puff Pastry - BBQ pork puff pastry Shrimp Cheung Fun - Shrimp noodle rolls Shrimp Har Gow - Shrimp dumplings Pork and Shrimp Shumai - Shrimp & pork dumplings Steamed Char Sui Bao - BBQ pork steam bun Baked Char Sui Bao - BBQ pork baked bun Pan Fried Shrimp & Chive dumplings Wu Gok - Deep-Fried Taro Dumpling Puffs Xiao long bao - XLB, soup dumplings Wu Tao Gao - Taro Root Cake Dan Tat - Egg Custard Tart  Be sure to check them out!

UyBM4nlBO_5lB8nQdyabuw.text: Here for dim sum. The food is not fresh and supper salty. We ordered sui mai, ha Cao, chicken feet, spinach shrimp ha Cao, shrimp rice crepes. All the dishes were salty and not fresh at all.   Would not recommend.

xCJ1q50m33E05S6_u0ddIA.text: Dim dim at night!! Yes!!!!!! Food was yummy but why did the waiter put our dim sum on someone else table. It's not like it was busy!! The owners I believe took over! That's when it was amazing!!   The dim sum is cook when you order! Which makes the food hot and tasty! They are super passionate about what the serve. I had order food to go so I could have it back at my hotel. The owner lady strictly instructed me how to reheat it up!! Love it!!! Thank you! It was still so good when I had it the next day!   Third day in Vegas and I'm already craving for it again! Going back before I head back to the OC!

FpDv7nbev2jlT6WhncOTcw.text: Came in for a late dinner after flying into Vegas.   We were not expecting much but wow was the food good! Geeeez. We got some noodle and hot soup dish that I forgot the name and it was soooo comforting and so good.   We ordered some of the dimsum stuff off the menu and enjoyed all of them so much.   Verrrry much want to come back again for that hot soup noodle dish. I'm salivating as I'm remembering the delicious dish T.T

nyBPEMfGyP30zbUFHkDS0w.text: We should have known better coming from San Gabriel Valley (home of some of the best Dim Sum in the Western USA) than to go eat Dim Sum in Las Vegas...   We walked in and the staff were very welcoming and kind to us.   They offer Dim Sum (all day) along with their full dining menu. Please keep in mind this review is ONLY for the DIM SUM.   We ordered Pork ShuMai, Har Gow, chicken feet and Pork ribs... All of these dishes were Dim Sum A at $3.58/each  The Shiu Mai looked like frozen prepackaged although the flavor was not so off. There were tiny little pieces of shrimp.   The proportions of wheat and shrimp in the Har Gow were a bit off, you could taste the dough more than the overall flavor.    The chicken feet were tasty. The sauce was a bit too thick and there were only three as supposed to the five that you normally get in most Dim Sum places.   The worst were the Spared pork ribs. It tasted like old meat, or they used expired oil. Too much fat and not enough meat on the ribs.  I wouldn't come back. Cheers!

Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $3.58 DimSum - 4/28/2017

NFS5Wb1VjwGvtsIBzOy77A.text: We went at opening and have all hands of deck to us. They have a great selection and a lot of the classic selections I grew up with. They have a lot of great recommendations. I especially love that they have Bai Tang Gao! Literally my favorite dessert. And of course the mango pudding was picturesque!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Pudding

HeLw8RJjfXZ_HZorh5fuEA.text: Outside of the Chinese New Year Dim Sum Buffet at Wing Lei, this is my favorite dim sum spot in Las Vegas.  We came with out of town guests, who also enjoyed it as well.  Decor is very plain and simple. The food is solid, unlike most of the other dim sum places in LV, sans the crazy wait times and bad service you'll find at Ping Pang Pong.  It's my ideal choice, with plenty of easy free parking to boot.    We arrived on Easter Sunday at 11:45, as a party of six, and were seated immediately.  Tried getting reservations, but was told by the restaurant that they don't take reservations for seating on weekends or holidays.    All the dim sum was on point, and being a party of six, we tried a good amount of items.  Not spectacular, but certainly up to par.  All dishes came out hot, with the exception of the chicken feet.    My favorite here is the pineapple bun (their version of the ngai wong bau). If you like runny, oozing yolks you'll love these.  But beware, I mean runny!  When you split these buns open, your fingers will be drenched from the orange liquid yolk-like center pouring out...and, you will love it!  The dough of these buns are worth all the carbs. However, note that this is somewhat of an acquired taste.  I once shared my love of these with a friend, and we'll just say it's definitely not something she'd ever order again.  For me, and my traditional Cantonese-food loving friends though, we really loved it!   Keep in mind that the pushcarts stop coming by at around 2pm.  After that, you can order off the menu, but for me, that just isn't as fun as seeing and selecting what you want.   As Hubby always says, "If it's Sunday, it must be Dim Sum Day", and whenever we're in LV on Sundays, we happily often end up here!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come here for these Pineapple Buns!!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IIGMw-PjmuHDXxqty06y8A.text: This place is next to my work and the perfect quick lunch.   There is better dim sum in town but this still does the trick. The short ribs are a little tough, the pork buns are really sweet, and the hargow always breaks. It's not traditional as there is only one cart that delivers the steamed items and the rest you order off of the menu. However, I do appreciate the freshness of the fried items. But I still like to munch here every so often and get a quick bite when I'm on a time crunch.

gHhpM03wQCyCvVMYJZLpMw.text: For dim sum, i really like this place a lot.    For all you dim sum lovers, this place is on par with any of the other excellent dim sum places in Vegas.  The high amount of guests keeps the food coming hot and fresh.  I especially like their cooking section where you could see all the other foods that they have and you can order.  The nice staff come around with carts filled with all sorts of Dim Sum. if you don't know it, just ask them and they will tell you what it is.  If you want something from a Menu, they will order for you.  All items are marked on your order sheet, by dishes ordered and you just get a tally at the end and pay it.  Very easy, very fast and very good.  I won't describe all the types of dim sum, but all I got to say is try the chicken feet.  Really good.

KicoDSlG_XP7o8j1vNb-uw.text: This place is my new go-to in Vegas! Totally worth an Uber drive from the strip. We loved it so much we came back two days in a row. The freshness and flavor is just so amazing! The shrimp shumai, rice, sticky buns, and everything else we tried was just so good!  Also, finish off your meal with a custard bun, you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GF-5fONJ5a3nDO_INveOKw.text: Their dim sum reminds me of the streets of Hong Kong. Very authentic! I loved their salt and pepper pumpkin, on the menu it describes it as "surprisingly good", and while I thought that was funny and a great reason to try them they were my favorite item sampled that night.  They also have the dim sum available all day, so if you get a late night craving (until 10 pm anyways) you can count on them to provide an authentic experience.

V8-QujuWwS7F5pz_Fjk3tA.text: Dim Sum!! I love the weekend service with the carts! Everyone is so friendly and happy to explain what they have to offer. I have been to many Dim Sum places in CA, this has quickly become my favorite in Nevada. We have gone twice in the last 2 weeks! So good!    We have tried  Shrimp Dumpling - Delicious!  Chicken ShuMai - Delicious!  Soup Dumpling - Delicous! Beef Noodle - Delicous!   Let's just say everything we've had has been fresh and Delicous!

XcEiOSVD9f_x9XFJXfuf7A.text: Love love the chinese sausage fried rice and the chef special tendon. Been ordering for take out and they never disappoint with their servings and service. I haven't tried any other dim sum place here in Vegas but what for? This is already the best dim sum place here in Vegas.

OD5l4p9pC6NK5oizla1wTg.text: First time eating here last night. Ate dinner with with friends. Loved the fried rice and broccoli chicken. My friends liked the dim sum choices and taste. Returned for dinner tonight with another friends. I ordered the same as last night; friend got General Tao chicken. Both tasty! Very good service both nights. While we had to get someone's attention to be seated, everyone is bustling around servicing all the seated guests. Don't let the old diner style chairs out you off, this is a very good place to enjoy good food with good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Unqrl9tfsOe4f8oH6ayUjg.text: This is one of the best Dim Sum spots in town. The service is amazing, the staff is all really helpful. Our server was Kara, she definitely recommended us to try a lot of new stuff. Will return soon for the great dim sum.

yA6dyYhKmoy29CJQZeS_WA.text: The foods are authentic and delicious! I am from Hong Kong so I can tell. If you want to try real Dim Sum, you will not regret to choose Yum Cha! ,Yum Cha!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JPqRx71oOkR8sNzXVpjGLA.text: OMG! I've been craving Dim Sum and thisbplace popped up on Yelp! The ratings surpassed my expectations.  We had.... Shrimp Dumplings Shrimp & Pork Shumai Steam Pork Ribs & Taro Beef Tripe Bean Sauce Chicken Feet Fried Shrimp Ball Shrimp Rice Spicy Shrimp + Pork Wanton Veggie Egg Noodle Chinese Broccoli Golden Sand Lava Custard Bun Steam Sandy Lava Bun Red Bean Sesame Ball Stean Sweet Rice Cake  Everything was absolutely delicious! If I had more room in my stomach, I would have more to eat!  A must when if Vegas or if you have a craving doe dim sum!

EqcZ9zYCMPLEZMhh9LAL6g.text: Excellent food and friendly service! We ordered a spread of dim sum and soups. Everything was hot, fresh, and delicious. Staff was attentive and kind. We will definitely be back.

xJ72-u_2dj8aRPNUWiXWGw.text: Deliciousness!!!  1st time having Dim Sum and everything tasted wonderful. I highly recommend the Shrimp & Pork Shumai and the Pork Panfried pot stickers. The bbq pork bun was flavorful but Ive had better ones in LA. I also recommend the sweet& sour seafood nugget, as well as trying the Fried Fish ball w tofu skin. The spicy shrimp & pork wanton was unusual. Not one note thats forsure. It has some sweetness more than spicy. The staff is welcoming and very attentive. The food was hot. All in all if your looking for a lunch spot or a fun dinner this should definitely be a place you check out.

G6yAnzqt0tMbtKK0yhvPBQ.text: I tried to like it but the lack of service and the quality of the dimsum wasn't great. The roast duck was good though. Am I returning to this place? My answer will be no.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lupchong  steamed bun.
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open area where the food is prepared

E-cs-XNureaKB_d8BS5CWg.text: Flew in from CA with 12 others, and since we had parents and in-laws with us, we figured they'd really enjoy a dim sum lunch. The service was excellent, and we were thrilled that they were able to seat our party of 13 immediately. Unfortunately, the dim sum and food didn't live up to the 4-Star rating for any of us. I thought maybe our standards and expectations were just too high being from CA, but congee was super watery, under salted and lacked flavor, and the dim sum was just okay. We ordered a lot and of all the items we ordered, the only thing worth mentioning is the fried pork belly, which was recommended to us by waitstaff. Reminded me of Taiwanese popcorn chicken and was quite good. Would pass on this restaurant next time though.

zJGGC6sREcJ598nxeLjIyQ.text: Great Dim Sum at reasonable prices. You could eat here for a month and try something new and delicious every day! Across the street from the Orleans Casino-give yourself a break from the crappy food there!

RQ9Yya5jYZ-gBvUnasClmA.text: Sui Mai: [10/10]      -Flavorful not too sweet or salty. Meaty. Not greasy. Har Gow: [8/10]      -Good. Skin is soft and ricey. Broke apart quite easily tho. Pork and Veg Roll: [8.5/10]      -Great taste not greasy. Less filling than I'm used to but well done. Loh Bac Goh: [8/10]      -They cook it fresh when you order.       -Crispy outside and melt mush inside.       -Decent lap churng and shrimp. Small sizing. Beef Tripe: [9/10]      -Really good and clean. Good taste. Taro dumpling: [3/10]       -Too much taro not enough of the pork filling.       -Mouth encased with taro. Needs salt.       -The outside crust is too thick I think that's what it is. Beef Rice Roll: [5/10]       -Good flavor. Too little filling. Anorexic amount of beef.  Beef Ball: [3/10]       -Flavor is ok. The texture is less meaty and more like pho beef balls.       -Dense jello? Doesn't feel like you're eating meat.  Baked Pork Buns: [6/10]       -Extremely doughy. Good flavor. Def made in-house and authentic. Diet Coke: [10/10]       -Ice cold and comes with chilled glass. Canned. Service: [10/10]      -Very nice and helpful. Attentive.   The sui mai, beef tripe and pork/veg roll were my favorite dishes. The entire meal ended up being quite expensive around $52 from what I can remember. (I did have 4 or 5 diet cokes*) Best dim sum I've had in Vegas so far but still nothing compared to the delicious dim sum in the Bay Area.   Just posting the review now. I ate here 7/7/19

nOWu1asW6ccTgzyw2JMFWg.text: The dim sum here wasn't that great.  We came here to try the typical siu mai and hargow.  The skin of the hargow was very thin and the siu mai was just average.  It took awhile to get our bill and we were only one of 3 tables there.  I dont think i'll be coming back for dim sum here.

RWzHNyRSo5zwMlJBbVnGog.text: One of the Ordered 5 things and it was enough to satisfy me and my wife.  Our favorites were xia longbao and lava custard bread.  $21 + tip.

5T6KL-7x-Ftxr-FhgAko8w.text: BEWARE! They secretly added a 18% tip to your bill, and they still expected you to tip for a party of 4(check the receipt picture), meanwhile nowhere on the menu or on the wall did they indicated about anything about this 18% tip.  When we questioned about it, both the waiter and the manager (or the owner) acted annoyed and pissed, and they just scratched the "suggested tips" thing out on the receipts like we were idiots.  We asked where on the menu or on the wall did they say about this 18% tip, the boss started his answer with an annoyed look and "you tourists were always like.."...so we were tourists just because we happened to speak Mandarin, and you off the boat scammy chinky ass wasn't?  Of course we warned him about his unethical practice, but he continued acting like we were subhuman ignorant tourists and said "ALL LAS VEGAS RESTAURANTS CHARGE THIS 18% tip durning holiday season", and he refused to let us leave if we tipped below this shady 18% tips in full for their mediocre services. I don't know if they are still practicing this now but on 12/26/2018 they did. If this isn't straight up unethical practice I don't know what this is.  And I'm curious to see if they pulled the same shit  on non-Asians too...

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beware of their shady secret tips. when we questioned them about it, they just scratched the &#34;suggested tips&#34; out in madness lol

K5rHCE1tccYIZMDKYPCcOw.text: Not sure how this place how as many stars as it does. My family came here for dinner. We were a large party of eleven. We had no trouble finding a table to seat all of us as the restaurant is rather large; HOWEVER, their portion sizes were tiny. We paid about $10-$15 per plate and each of us could only get a tiny scoop of each dish. On top of that, the meat dishes we ordered hardly had any meat in it. We felt super jipped on the Mongolian Beef dish. You might as well call it Mongolion Onions because that is all there was in it!  We did get the Hargow dim sum dish, and that was probably all that was actually worth its price.   Overall, I'd say this place is not worth it. Try finding another Chinese place, or make it out to Chinatown where you may find bigger portions.  TL;DR:  - Recommend? No - Service? Decent - Parking? Free and easy

nTdZ4CUBDhttTT1aOCwavw.text: This was my first Dim Sum experience. It's located in Chinatown and seems very authentic, as it was recommended to us by our Chinese friends who dined with us.   You will be seated at a large, round table with a large "lazy Susan" in the middle. You can order individual entrees from the menu, or wait for the waitstaff to walk around with the carts and choose whatever you want to eat. It's basically Chinese tapas, so everything is in small portions with the intention of sharing.   If you aren't all-in on authentic dishes the restaurant does offer tasty "Americanized" options such as delicious deep fried calamari and general tsos chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bird cages represent old Hong Kong culture, where it was typical for patrons to bring pet birds out on the town with them (True story!).
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lazy Susan covered in goodness.

2ZZ-HN_i5HbYXdTc_dloAw.text: Wanted to try a different Dim Sum restaurant when I was in Vegas.   We arrived at about 10:30am and the restaurant was quite empty on a Saturday morning.  There was 1 food cart and it looked like there's an area to select hot foods.  We did order off the menu too.   Overall, the service was okay but the food was mediocre.  The spare ribs lacked flavor. :(   Overall, I don't think I'd ever return here.  The food was just not as good as other places I've been.

rQu4tyXfmMuEjgs3jAyZJw.text: First off, we got there at 9 at night and were kinda hesitant because it was pretty empty. We absolutely love dim sum, and from the reviews we wanted to try this place. We ordered ten things off the menu. And everything tasted absolutely amazing. The food actually came out pretty quickly.  Service was not bad at all. For getting the ten items and hot tea, we spent less than $50. Not bad at all, especially in Vegas. We will definitely be coming back on our next visit.

RCzhi2BtqHbWxoC-Zyvq8A.text: This place is open late which I love! Usually Dim Sum is only avail in the mornings but this place is open late. Service attentive and the food came quickly out once ordered. I enjoyed all the dishes I ordered and plan to return.

ENZU6g890etSjkcicu9iSA.text: I'm a first timer at dim sum and this was a great start. My friend and I went for dinner and it was nice and quiet. The menu had pictures and descriptions of everything- made it very easy to order. I really liked the Shrimp & Chive dumpling- it was a bigger than I expected and very flavorful. I also liked the pork potstickers and the dipping sauce- I would have liked the potstickers a little more crispy, but they were still good. I did not like the chicken in puff pastry- it was kind of sweet from the pasty and I didn't think it balanced well with savory chicken inside. Overall it was a good experience. I really wanted to try the baked custard bun, but it was too late in the evening and no more were being made- kind of disappointing. There's so much I didn't try and I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

grilNBTno52Fij4N2hwNAQ.text: Was craving dim sum and saw Yum Cha had good reviews and wasn't too far from the strip so I decided to check it out. Coming from Orange County, I wasn't expecting the dim sum to be that great over here, but I left pleasantly surprised!  Everything we ordered was delicious and came out quickly. The total for 4 including drinks, tax, and tip was only $60 which is about the same as back home. This place might even be comparable to Seafood Cove #2.  Overall a great spot for dim sum, definitely recommend coming here.

dhBY4NYOU4O1L679XcbEig.text: Less than 10 minutes from the strip, definitely worth the drive. Clean.  Fresh food! We had dim sum and it was good and authentic. Reviews on Yelp led me here, what a great find!  Sweet sticky rice triangles, yum! Ha gow, sui mai, black bean spare ribs, rice/meat wrapped in leaf, and red bean sesame balls were all delicious.   Nice big space, they have their own building off the corner of strip mall. Located by Walgreens, lots of parking.

1l3h0iEiINBH_RZwpwOnfg.text: Everything was good except the chewy ribs. What stood out was the crispy pork belly. I thought it was cheap but it ended up 30usd per person.

e_QvQ4I-TDUlE5_K6KLDrQ.text: Did this satisfy my dim sum craving? Yes. Was it the best dim sum I've ever had? No. I feel like Vegas really doesn't have an A++ option for dim sum so maybe this is the best there is. It's located on the strip of a strip mall across the street from the International Marketplace building. The inside is pretty big with lots of tables spread out. It's also very clean which is always a plus.  My babe and I came on a Saturday around 1-2 pm and were quickly able to get a table. We were kind of sad that they didn't offer carts going around and that we just had to order from the menu. We tried a few different things, but the Shrimp Dumplings and Curry Fish Balls ended up being my favorite. Both of these had good, rich flavor and I would order them again. The others we tried were just average to me.   I would most likely come here again when the craving calls, but I don't think it's a top favorite restaurant at all.

PPqG2_3BgVLYWVJV-DyTBA.text: Favorite Dim Sum restaurant in Vegas. It's about 30 minutes from my house but is well worth the drive!

WeT1ealUhY18Hxbs6kcTYQ.text: Returned to our fav dim sum restaurant Yum Cha.  New menu with added items. A lot of great dishes to choose from. Today we had dim sum, hainaan roasted chicken, salt & pepper pumpkin & curry noodle soup. Everything tasted great, plated beautifully & staff is most attentive.  Thank you & see you soon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry bun

3zvDOQjwbyWkCwECNTpHBA.text: Really good dim sum for Vegas. Coming from OC I have high expectations of dim sum and this place really hit the spot. Good prices too and not too crowded.

qu-TtIslBihqMkysVCJr_A.text: We usually have gone to a different dim sum on S Decatur, but this visit, we wanted something much closer to Desert Paradise, our timeshare condo, so we happened to see the All Day Dim Sum sign in Yum Cha's window, which is at the intersection of S. Decatur and W. Tropicana Aves.  Boy, are we glad we saw that sign! This place is FUN! No crowded, hustle-bustle here, but don't let that make you believe it isn't worthy of your patronage. I think our early bird time frame may have been their less busy time.  Service is friendly, engaged, and competent. We had a table for our family (8), and they handled the varied ordering just fine. We had vegetarian preferences, tip-toe new to dim sum, and experienced dim sum addicts to deal with, and they seemed to understand.   Some dishes were delivered to the wrong individual, but really, dim sum, is meant to be shared--and that only meant that someone who would never have ordered that dish, discovered they liked it. LOL.  We had our favorites, steamed pork buns, on the menu in various forms, and then there were a lot of other new ideas for us.  No one left hungry; no one was disappointed in the fare; no one felt neglected. The tab averaged $11.50 a person before tax and tip, and we had plenty of hot tea as well. We had good food and good fellowship. What more is there?

Xyn491eS7WCxeuqFU---OQ.text: Went to Yum Cha in Las Vegas. Surprised to see the staff to be so friendly in a Chinese Restaurant. The manager keep checking back with us and recommend dishes. Most of them are very good. Did not find one or two of the dim sums were not up to par. A little pricey. Overall I give them high marks. Definitely will go back and definitely recommend them.

uxCTI09twRlVw8teCAgR7g.text: Whenever you're in Las Vegas and craving for dim sum, highly recommend Yum Cha hands down.  In the past, Orchid was our go to place but after trying Yum Cha, it is now our choice for dim sum.  The place is clean, servers are friendly and attentive.  Their dim sum is tasty and not oily.

T33nuQ7o6-xM1PSkZfXrpQ.text: Located at an old low budget Chinese buffet in a busy plaza we visited this place because we were referred to by a mutual friend. We went on a rainy Sunday around around 5pm. Was a bit dead and there were no carts of food anywhere to be seen. Thankfully we were able to order a la carte each dim sum item on the menu anytime. The service was very on point.   We ordered the usual dim sum items such as shu mai, har gow, fried shrimp ball, Chinese bok choy, and shrimp in flat rice noodle. They were all tasty and came hot and steaming as if they were on the usual food cart. But these are made to order rather than batched prior to the usual dim sum hours. Never been to a place that will make your dim sum choices made to order. This was a definite plus.  Afterwards, we were all so full and the lady came up and gave us information on their hot dessert item. Even though we were stuffed the server was sincere about the steamed custard buns. We gave in and had one order of egg custard and two orders of the amazing sweet custard bun (can have it steamed or baked I think). The custard buns were warm and crispy on the outside, but inside was soft and filled with runny, sweet custard. Both great choices to end a well balanced meal.   I would come back again and try the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ball , bok choy, crab balls
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp rice noodle must!
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard bun must try for dessert!

qc8nuQGWHDwkpOIIP-33qQ.text: Get away from the strip for affordable food. Visiting Vegas for a convention. Found Yum Cha on Yelp under local favorites and I am glad I did. The food was great and affordable. Had some of our favorites like radish cake and red bean balls but tried things I have never had before like a durian puff (I am sure it is somebody's favorite and a good example of it but I don't think I like durian). I will come again next time I am in Vegas.

WHC-g7a4C_7lgaSjDgPJYA.text: The service is great and the food is so good! I usually order coconut buns to go to enjoy later!

5M_rJbgvXOqN4Ugc6M7e_g.text: This place has great food and good attentive service!  Everything we ordered was great, all items were clearly made to order and made with care. My favorite was the steamed BBQ pork bun! It was True to what I remember from when I was in China. We will be back!

g9rNpqkF5dkN7nLllWrhLQ.text: After my first visit here with my family, I couldn't wait to write a review about this restaurant! It became my new go-to place when I'm craving for some dim sum :]  The establishment occupies a pretty big space and they are able to accommodate a lot of people. Plenty of tables and chairs throughout. Majority of their kitchen is open as well. You're able to see most of it behind a glass wall. It's a great way for customers to know how their food is being handled and prepared.  Our server, Elaine, was really nice and informative. She told us what menu items are their most popular and recommended a few things, including one of their famous dessert items. But when it comes to dim sum, I don't even need to see the menu. ;] It's one of my fave Asian cuisines, so I have high expectations for it. lol From the shrimp noodle, shumai, salt & pepper calamari, to the veggie noodles and beef tripe, everything was so yummy! Pricing was not too bad either. :]  Unlike most dim sum places, they DON'T serve their dim sum from a steam cart all day. Our server told us that, once lunch is over, they prepare the food as you order. This is to make sure nothing gets left to sit out all day. When it comes to ensuring quality and freshness, you can tell the difference.  The rest of the staff was very attentive and always made sure our drinks were constantly being refilled. Since this restaurant has three owners, their menu has some Malaysian influence too.  Don't pass up on trying this place out! If you love dim sum as much as I do, you won't be disappointed. :]

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7IZeCsnaGqFBzBqrU3mjaQ.text: This was a good new dimsum place! We didn't have to wait and the food was all good. Yay for a non-oily taro puff. Service was excellent as well.   They said they're having some new chicken & vegetarian menu items in October too.

gRjZgfztbCnJ5c6AMXr80g.text: I think is one of the better dim sum cart places here in Vegas. The cart servers are attentive and prompt. The various standard cart selections were freshly steamed and tasted great. Will be coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fM-z6GBodC82plMh3paQpg.text: Good customer service. Lots of variety. Not too oily and not too salty for my taste. Don't forget to grab a custard bun or even the coconut sweet bread!

bScCGuEzvDz2Pm4rYTCZpA.text: Very Yummy ! Definitely  a place to stop by and try out their stuff ! You won't regret it !

g5fnkg_zgDjRUwS6p9cuVw.text: Really good food. 5 of us went to celebrate birthdays on a Sunday afternoon. We were disappointed the carts stop at 2pm. As it was a first visit it would have been nice to see all the dishes.  However after studying the rather vast menu we ordered a selection for 3 of us. Two opted for main dishes, orange chicken and chicken kung pao. Both were happy with their selection.  The dim sum was hot and fresh (the upside of no carts!) The crispy eggplant was outstanding. Salt and pepper shrimp were good but could have had a bit more pepper and a little less red onion. Spinach and shripm was good. Sugarcane shrimp was a nicely fried shrimp ball with a piece of sugar cane...different and the accompanying sauce made the dish. Baby bok choy was a bit salty.  Service was spotty. Our first order came out promptly and properly. A subsequent order was never filled.  Perhaps going earlier in the day would enhance the overall experience. But the food quslity was tops.

B9SMbGBj1KlX9NsqUOtWew.text: Many vegetarian choices of Dim Sum. Best of all is the vegetarian Char Siew Pao. Glad to find another vegetarian friendly joint which has more than enough choices of food. Good and friendly service.

ONRw2rHbCeYT3oJgcMAnqA.text: This is my favorite dim sum restaurant in Vegas!   Everything is freshly made. The food is served steaming. Many dim sum restaurants served their food cold after sitting out for a while. Some of the food is available in the carts that they push around, but I love that they have a larger dim sum menu for you to order off of.   My favorite dish here is their roti with curry. It is absolutely addicting. Sticky rice, shu mai, and custard buns are a must order. I honestly haven't had a bad dish here.  I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roti and curry
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard bun

LA9quA4khB_S0dbnPgPDdg.text: Definitely not the best Dim Sum I've ever had but it wasn't bad either. I went on a weekday so there was no wait at all. I judge dim sum places on how good their Siu Mai are and the place had average tasting Siu Mai. It's on par with those strictly to go Dim Sum places. If you are craving dim sum and don't want to wait a long time for a table. This is the place to hit up.

CRwRixY7rZQ5k4VqHD_Qjw.text: We wavered between giving this place a 3 or 4 star (3.5 would be accurate). We arrived near opening time Saturday morning, and there were few people, which is somewhat surprising for a dim sum place. They we're bringing items around on the cart, and the few items my husband tried were underwhelming (he didn't even like their shrimp and pork shumai). It turns out, you are probably better off ordering things off the menu instead of the cart. We got several more things including their new vegetarian offerings, which appeared to be made to order. The chives dumpling and breaded eggplant were especially good, and the vegetarian shumai was juicy too. My husband also enjoyed the salt and pepper smelt. Staff were very attentive, which is rare for Dim Sum, so all in all it was actually good despite a rough start.

OGXKoHRh7m1CPyfMb3iizg.text: This is the best dim sum in vegas. But i gave it a 3 because there no small bouncy balls vending machines and they did not have shrimp noodle. This is like kung fu panda

wravRRe2z0dzDy834XVtJg.text: Excellent dim sum!  And quite affordable. Everything was made fresh to order. The not sour soup was among the best I've had. The tumyum chicken soup my wife had was the best she's ever had. We got prompt friendly service and the TV screen played food shows to keep us entertained.

FOG-tPO5eMTlgT9TuInDfg.text: This was my first time here at Yum Cha! The dim sum here is very delicious and not oily like other dim sum places. The service here is great! The staff here are so nice and friendly.  Not only is there dim sum there's stuff to order on the line too. Try their Malaysian pancake (Rotti) with curry. It's one of their best sellers.  Their desserts are very yummy as well! The custard bun and coconut bread are so good! My boyfriend loves the coconut bread and was so excited to have me try it.  Come and try! This place is comparable to Orchid's Garden.

Tc6foB6MzZpht8SnmrnXTw.text: My boyfriend and i saw this restaurant driving and was really excited seeing them because we love dim sum! We went in and the staff was really nice to us... The owners were super nice and let us know that it was the 2nd day of being open and if we were looking for something specific let him know and they will make it in the back....  So place looks like a food court but the owners said they do carts too and regular entree meals and hot pot... So lots of option...   I personally like the choices we got... We had spare ribs and calamari... Chow mein dim sum.. Siu mai and chinese broccoli and the congee   We really like the fact it is served all day dimsum so thats a major plus in my book.. Definitely coming back.. Love the people that work here super nice...

H5eImJtmwumitjxr8Td3uw.text: Went again and it was even better. Had the soups, fried eggplant, and the steamed sponge cake  - unbelievably good. The owners are super friendly and want every customer to enjoy their food and stay long. They shared their service philosophy, which is to have each person enjoy the dining experience with a smile and happy belly. We had such a great time.

d4OB5s-h7CRsh1IIyzVGcw.text: YUM-cha was definitely super yum. Driving around looking for a late dinner we went on Yelp to find something yummy. Thank goodness we were able to try out Yum Cha!   Quality food and quality customer service! Everyone was friendly and very attentive. Food was superb, we didn't leave a speck of food on our plates. My personal favorites were the crispy noodles with shrimp and custard bun for dessert! We will definitely be coming back in a few days before we head back on a roadtrip home! Going to grab some for take out too!

ykEWJEenIrIj9HhE7kMrrg.text: i must say this place satisfy my dimsum pallet.. we came in here not knowing what to expect..  Staff: the staff are very friendly and very polite.. the lady cashier help us most of the time and she is super awesome..  Food: food is far better than orchid garden.. although they dont have much variety to choose from, they stick to the basic of dimsum which is a very good thing..   Ambience: very cozy and has more space than a regular dimsum place.. the place is very well lit.. and the place is very clean..  Salted Fish fried rice is now my favorite, they cooked that very well

XYI3x0n89idl519Nw0rhVg.text: The previous restaurants that occupied this space have left a bad impression on many. This is unfortunate because Yum Cha is very good! I've tried both their dim sum and their dinners. Both are amazing!  The staff is extremely helpful!  The owners are always around to help in any way!

77BLBwqmk-zFpEEZJOEN9A.text: Yummy!  Everything we ordered was delicious!  Won ton soup with noodles, Mongolian beef, orange chicken, and Kunpao shrimp.  Also, the service was excellent!

UoLwQBRnyG3sAXBIWv45DA.text: Great restaurant for Chinese food! Found them on yelp and it didn't disappoint. Super friendly servers and owners and awesome prices. Perfect option if you want Chinese and easy access off the strip. Big parking lot.

5Vpop7BtYhaAmkQBPMXQdA.text: !!!!! This place is a (new) hidden gem. I can't say enough good things about this place. Some logistics: the place is pretty big with ample tables and booths and pretty clean. They aren't serving hot pot right now (the manager told me its bc its too hot in Vegas right now) which is why we came but it's okay bc we had a more than satisfactory experience.  Must try: + Sesame ball (I was crying when I finished it) + Salt & pepper shrimp + Shrimp dim sum + Fried tofu + Congee  The servers are very kind and helped us navigate the menu since we aren't that familiar with the menu. Had to take some sesame balls with me to go. I couldn't have enough of it. Will definitely be back! :-)

wfknrHq3qCi-JqroLXal5A.text: Went to this place at 3pm for a late lunch.  We were a bit disappointed that there was nobody walking around with the carts of food but it is understandable because we arrived at an odd time.  The host did say they have people walking around between 11am and 2pm.  We were directed to a counter where all their food is and all we have to do is point at the food we want and they bring it to our table.  The food was surprisingly good considering it was 3pm and not a lot of people were there. Every item that we ordered was full of flavor and did not disappoint at all.  Definitely gonna come back here to try it during normal lunch times.

8fc_IuskLKWDZHOqbWdOHg.text: Clean location.  The food was tasty and from Tuesday to Friday the front page of the menu is on special.  By the time we finished with our first set of orders from the cart there was always someone to take our order if we wanted more items.  A nice Dim Sum location.

QRzBfKjpBJo7Th1QCHtMwg.text: Omg!!!!! Best dim sum ever and so fresh! I hate it when we go to dim sum and ask for a dish and are denied. At Yum Cha, they will make you whatever dish you want that is not already on the carts. The baked pork bun was so pillowy and fresh. I was absolutely shocked that the shumai was so delicious! I can't wait to come back.

J5PCGcEyqiUhvLR3b28ZxA.text: Let me start this mini review by saying that the people that works here are amazing and are very friendly. They are very accommodating and tries their hardest to explain what things are and even tells you what are the average ones and which ones are good . So far my wife enjoyed their porridge and chicken feet . I order the shrimp + pork shumai and the fried pork bun (highly recommended) which I had to order some more for take out . Would come back if we're craving for some dimsum . Stop by and meet these nice people and awesome dimsum . 10 am - 2 pm if you wanna see them walk around with the dimsum on the cart !

Vtz8LWwixGWIFp7RHX3O1g.text: So much better than a typical Las Vegas breakfast/brunch.   Best Dim Sum I've ever had, and great service.   Clean new place.   I have to try Dim Sum in California still though, but Yum Cha is my current favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Semi self serve area. They have carts too.

gGjpr4E0ZutA5SKx7y3eLQ.text: Wow! This place is the best dim sum in town...in any town. My husband and I just drove in from CA and we were starving but had a craving for Chinese, we yelped and everything was closing or closed ( 10:15pm) we found this place and saw ..15 min left till closing and gave it a shot.So glad we did! So, we are avid dim sum waters back home, we have eaten everywhere from LA , OC to SD and this place takes it.Fresh, Fast and the service was phenomenal.They were kind and communicative.I was super shocked because usually other dim sum places they want you in and out ...sadly I expected this since they were almost closing ...but it was the exact opposite.They didn't rush us and in fact they kept asking if we would like more. The food was fresh and tasty and the prices you can't beat, especially is you want to save some cash for the machines lol. Anyhow, so good , so happy !!! Great place and clean.

85FMldWKF4XHvFtlcY7jWA.text: Open for lunch and dinner. Really good dim sum and nice service....has dim sum and non dim sum menu - only been open 5 weeks thus building reviews. Highly recommend and we will be back :). Everything was delicious. Across the street from three pokestops at the park. Also caught some while eating here; so dim sum and a game. Awesome!!!!

kOD6AgKW3ies4e6PMISMRg.text: Excellent service, super clean and good was THE BEST! I highly recommend this Chinese dim sum restaurant. Loved my experience, the owner was super nice. Now I found a place to keep coming to for lunch when I come to this awesome city.
