FkoOxswiTa0mcJ8Ulj63lQ.text: This is the third time me and my friends have eaten here. Food is always good, fresh and yummy.  Elaine the hostess is very nice and accomodating. I would strongly recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends.

70UumLP26Jk8RyoFtmrbyQ.text: Lucky to have found this Dimsum spot! The food was great.l, and I'm from westminster where they have really good dumsum.

HDvIXkOnbH-TAkHTb8xl-w.text: Great food and service. The staffs are very nice and friendly. The quality of food is good compares to other dim sum in Vegas. From someone growing in HK eating dim sum, the taste can match restaurants that what you find from HK.

CM_t6xLW3-c05OUeqtum3w.text: This place is pretty good, came around 5pm and at dim sum, they didn't have the push carts but they made the items fresh.

DFoBHae8NuV-fSio38_4dA.text: Great dim sum place in Vegas, compared to other places. We were seated quickly which was nice. Nice area where you can choose from a variety of stews, buns, and fried foods. They also cook it for you when you order it  so it's hot and fresh. Service isn't bad, staff is pretty friendly. Overall, would recommend if you're craving for dim sum!

h_8np7xJg-QMAquH5MjHrw.text: Not being from the area and deciding to stop in we were pleasantly surprised at how clean and fresh all the dishes tasted. The dim sum was pretty solid and the restaurant was clean. I appreciated the time and effort the servers took to give extra service and do recommendations. With all this said being asian, I sometimes get really bad service at asian restaurants but here they were very hospitable. I also have had dim sum at many places around the country and I have to say that this place ranks high up there. Give them a try you won't regret it.

BoPup40QziLHDkfZaerNjw.text: If you guys craving Dim Sum...i highly recommend YUM CHA on Tropicana and Decatur. Place is one of the cleanest Chinese Restaurant I've eaten at so far. Food are fresh and delicious. And the staff are very friendly and courteous.

SxsHOfetUQGOpxomjHycjg.text: I love this place. Ihave been there 3 times in.the last 2 weeks. They serve dim sum all day. The cart stops at 2:30 but you can still order from the dim sum menu all day. And the dim sum menu has pictures so you actually know what you are ordering. There is also a regular chinese menu which is excellent. We always order too much food and end up taking enough food home for another meal. I think I am going to lunch there tomorrow.

wpeNZaI20IeTgBGbKOSEuQ.text: This was a great place, the food was delicious and the staff was awesome.  The dim sum was very good and very reasonably priced.  The female manager took extra good care of us and checked on us throughout our meal. The shrimp buns were delicious and so were the other dishes we had.

-_a9qdlTUGa5XPLzxy7FzA.text: Love the food.  The owners are super friendly.  I feel good when I eat there, because they put their heart into the business.

E2rPqcOxzF91JBRsVi6MIg.text: First timer here.  Came here from California and I was Craving dim sum.  Tried this place and the pork shomai, combination fried rice, baked and steam pork bun were delicious. Friendly service.  Even got some help picking out s few items.  I will be sure to come back.

8AzNllnVi1aNOp9q08lg6w.text: Service was great! Food was delicious. Will definetly be back! Thank you! Their is nothing to complain about. Good prices, great food nice staff and they make you feel right at home.

My0LBDDlKvVkg9dtKhi8DQ.text: Outstanding service and the cleanliness of the restaurant adds to the experience of enjoyable dining of their dim sum, menu items, and specialized desserts! The dim sum is ALWAYS fresh, never left under a steamer and rolled around in carts for hours. Dim sum can be made to order as well which, personally, makes this restaurant UNIQUE. Restrooms are very sanitary and CLEAN! As a local for the last 25 years, and after trying many dim sum places, the staff here SMILE and are very attentive to customers. I appreciate that level of service:) Check them out....you'll be very happy.

D6AX4dX_mOT_dU7fjLusKg.text: Good dim sum and great service!  My favorites were the Shu Mai, Sesame Balls, and Pork Ribs.  Very nice and clean restaurant.  We came around 2:30pm on a Wednesday on an off hour and the food was still very fresh.

PbkIXq3xLnk3ulGhwvPG0A.text: This was some good Dim Sum! On our way out from Vegas a friend and I were craving dim sum and came across this place. I'm not an expert on dim sum, but I left full and pleased. The BBQ Steamed pork bun is always my favorite. The staff was friendly and quick. I'd keep coming back here in my.trips to Vegas for sure.

Ke0NPLCU3R_RbJYoJGi5_g.text: Food was good, service was awesome. My boys and I had a great time. Definitely recommend. Shu mai was 3.28 each plate not bad a little pricey maybe but food does cost a lot more nowadays and working in the restaurant business we understand. Good service (servers always ask if we need anything or would like to order more) and they actually asked how our day's going which is always nice to hear. Food is also very good- we ate items from the cart dimsum and ordered chicken congee which was also really good. Highly recommended , will definitely come back when we're visiting Vegas.

O0WdDGKjhqWh9ZTNFlFMCA.text: Great dim sum! Clean restaurant, great service, friendly servers. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a great casual meal.

Kj-kZJ0tIZLxonTrWBWK0w.text: Don't understand how this place gets a high enough rating. The food selection was very limited and even then their food was average at best. Plus the service was chaotic and unorderly. Do we put our name on a paper list we couldn't see? Confusing. Also, we got upcharged +$3 for specially ordering something outside of their dim sum cart selections. Expected more from this spot, but only came up to be heavily disappointed.

2KRYHNke8ITcFJ2wfli5bQ.text: So I was here with my family at 10 am. The staff are nice. The food is too salty for me. But it's not too bad. pdePn7m33Mo-J__yY9LJSg.text: Omg this is the best ever. Literally when we get seated then the food just came at the same time. The taste is close to what I got in China. Service is good. Price is good. I will definitely recommend my friends to come and for me I will come again and it's a 5 star review.

4nkTTyS1n9_ci39fdCC2Xw.text: I hadn't had Dim Sum in quite some time and came here to feed my hunger for some shumai and congee. No fear if you're confused as to how dim sum works, for if you can't find what you're looking for in the carts, their are menus with special items you can order.   Ladies made their way around the restaurant with their carts. Breaded and dry dishes are usually kept on a separate cart vs the hot and steamed dishes. I wouldn't call myself a veteran, but I've been around some DS places, so I knew what to zero in on.   Though the food satisfied a part of me, the other wanted a more flavorful variety. The noodle dishes were dry and lacked spice. The only thing that helped me like it was the chili sauce. For almost all the dishes, I used one specific combo of sauces. I add soy sauce with some chili  and swirl around until a good consistency. Absolute fave and the one thing that masked the blandness. Congee, usually is a bit more bland as you add some sauce, but when tasting it, it wasn't hot and lacked any flavor whatsoever. Disappointing.   Not sure If I would give a second chance, but for now, I'll pass.

wODSl9G5XeDkwxWDV0J3sA.text: Great find for dim-sum in Las Vegas.  Clean restaurant, courteous staff and food was good.   Malaysian Chinese.  Owner very interactive with the patrons    Now offering a wide selection of vegan / vegetarian dim-sum options on the menu.  Highly recommended.

wnKUvE9phQilVsNra2WYUA.text: Interesting place. The food is average, IMHO.  The great part is the food is served hot.  Though I've had better versions of almost everything we ordered elsewhere, I wanna say I enjoyed the tripe and shrimp hargow here.   Service was friendly, quick, but there might be a struggle with communication at times.   The prices are at $3.49, $3.99 etc. everything we ordered fell into either of those two categories.

7f38XmfPvD5mPQLztYr9PA.text: My husband and I were visiting from FL and looking for good dim sum. Glad we found this place on Yelp. This is more of a classic style (with carts). There is also the option to order other dim sum from a menu. The owner-manager was kind enough to greet our table and explain their service style. There wasn't a long wait to eat either; we were met with a food cart as soon as we sat down! Good variety and prices, great flavors. The service was exceptional. If I lived in Vegas, I'd be there all the time.

_KAyYK9gaboyIm92WRyFrw.text: This place is a must go for dim sum!  My daughter and I decided to try this place based on her friend's suggestion; and we were pleasantly surprised on how good their dim sum choices were.  It's a little bit expensive than the other dim sum place that we used to go, but the sizes are bigger and the taste of each one that we ordered was way better!  This is not the cart kind of dim sum. You have to order and they'll bring the items to your table fairly quickly.  The service was fast and the servers were very friendly!  Again, if you're looking for a dim sum place in Vegas, this place is a must try!  PS... the restaurant is big and clean too.

QmKxEAegoj64m7VGCsxCFw.text: Food: horrible Yelp fail. People that are giving high Yelp ratings have obviously never eaten proper dim sum in S. Cal or even Cupertino, CA! Dumplings (Hai gow and spinach and shrimp) tasted mushy (frozen), oil on lobo gao tasted old. So gross. We cannot find decent dim sum here! Of the 4 places we have tried so far, this one was the worst. Tea was decent.   Service: surprisingly friendly and helpful which is unexpected (ha ha), but they are low on help which is also clear from the help wanted sign on the door.   Ambiance: clean, but looks like a fast food place.   Location: across from International Market.   Won't be back!!

A4dthTHsdSAAzpdhSKvWDw.text: pretty solid dim sum, really friendly staff.. Update, my boyfriend and I went alone the next day when they had the dim sum karts out.   I added 1 more star to make it 5 because the service was so good ! Everyone has manners. Maybe this place could be our tradition!

NWyiyPagbskB5T761hycFA.text: Should be a 2 1/2. I was really looking forward to trying Dim Sum at Yum Cha. Based on all the yelp reviews I thought this was a sure bet. Unfortunately, it was disappointing.   The employees were all great and deserve 5* for service and hospitality!  As for the Dim Sum on the carts: Shu Mai 1/2* It had no flavor and was simply the worst Shu Mai I have ever eaten.  The Shrimp spinach was a 3* but would have been a 5* if one could pick it up without it falling apart.   Now for the hands down winner: Xiao Long Bao ***** 5 *****. This was made to order and simply the best version I have ever eaten. It was fabulous. I would come here again just for their Xiao Long Bao.  I would suggest NOT ordering from the cart. This kind of ruins part of the over experience for me but when Dim Sum staples (Shu Mai and Shrimp Spinach) we're so poorly executed I will stick to the items made to order.

p_ydMGd9etyEkX5poiTiCA.text: Food is amazing, definitely the best. This will be my new dim sum spot for now on. This restuarant is across the street from international world market. This used to be a Chinese buffet but apparently they closed down and now it's this awesome gem of a restuarant. The food are always served straight from the steam cart or you can go up to their display that you can order from them. All the items we ordered was very authentic, doesn't taste like those cheap knock offs from Chinese buffets.   Walked in on a Thursday dinner around 3pm was a very slow time for them. Was seated real quick by the servers. The staff is very friendly, especially the lady that took our order was very helpful in explaining everything to us as beginners. In my option look no further for other dim sum restaurants besides here they are very cheap prices too. Will come back I definetly love this place.

O1urZYF7WvjhMBF5jq-g8A.text: We had dim sum for lunch here today.  The food was pretty good as we probably had ~10 different kinds of items.  The prices are very reasonable as well.  Just on the food we had, I would have given the restaurant a 3.5.  On the negative side, the choices were fairly limited.  We're used to going to dim sum in Chinese restaurants in Los Angeles, where there seem to be many different "carts" being wheeled around and at least 50 types of items.  Here, there is basically only 3 carts and maybe 20 items total.  The setting is also nothing to write home about.  Set in a strip mall, the restaurant looked dated and has the quality of a cafeteria type setting.

xY3lbnEAQ2NbV2VgU3FdHQ.text: Went here with my friends, I wasn't planning on eating since I wasn't hungry but had a interesting experience.. so to give you some insight I was the only person in our group who wasn't Asian, but I am a lover of Asian food just as much as my friends. When we sat down the wait staff took our drink order and that was all fine and good. But then a woman laid a FORK down next to my plate and only MY plate(I never asked for a damn fork and I don't need one!). Okay to be honest that is NOT cool to just assume that I would need a fork just because of my appearance. To put it in perspective: When someone of Asian decent walks into a Italian joint do the waiters automatically give those customers chopsticks? No. How rude! Just to prove a point I started placing dim sum on my friends plates with chopsticks. I am giving the place two stars because everyone who ate said the food was below average and wouldn't go here again. And the fact that they assumed I needed a fork because Im not Asian really turned me off this place..

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seriously wtf though..

LKwu70nHCzUKWWjzZ2JNNg.text: The staff were very friendly and quick on the service they provided. The restaurant was very clean and open. You don't feel congested like some places you go. The food was freshly steamed in the push carts and delicious! I highly recommend if you are a dim sum lover!

k0dues5s3Ny4lOGncHiVqg.text: What a find! The best dim sum place in Vegas - hands down! We found this place in our search for finding Hong Kong style dim sums on our recent trip to Vegas. This place is just outside the strip but not in Chinatown but I would recommend this over all the restaurants in Chinatown. Also it opens very early while Chinatown is still sleeping - so if you are looking to get some comfort food early in the morning to get rid of that hangover, this is THE place you need to head to. Immediately after you enter, you are served nice hot jasmine tea, free of charge and you continue to get refills as much as you need. Promptly the dim sum cart comes along with their yummy collection of dim sums and they are all sooo cheap!!! My absolute favorites were - The Spare Ribs with the Black Bean sauce, Sticky Rice in Lotus Leaf, BBQ Pork Buns and the Pork Dumplings. We straightaway did 2 rounds of each of these. We all had the Shrimp Dumplings, Chicken Feet, Chive dumplings as well, all were top class! We left the restaurant overfed and greatly satisfied only to return in the evening to get some more. The food was so good that we came for a late night dumpling fest. The staff was very kind. They recognized us from the morning and even though they were almost about to close, they welcomed us in and fed us until we we were ready to burst again.  I recommend it very highly - I will surely visit them every time I am in Vegas for all my breakfasts. Also, the staff was so friendly, I could just go back to give them a visit.

ert3sN8eB3BaS-kca_P8dg.text: This is absolutely one of the worst restaurants my family and I have been to for dim sum! They don't even deserve my one star. I don't understand how this place has 4 1/2 stars with close to 700 reviews! My family waited at the table for 20 min before any server took their food and drink orders. Everything arrived slow.  The plates were hot but the food was terribly cold. We sent plates back and they never came back. The carts never came around our table, we had to get up and ask for it. We continuously waited for entrees for long periods of time.  None of the dishes came with the right serving utensils, like soup bowls or soup spoons. The complimented sauces never came with any of the dishes like traditional dim sum. When the bill arrived, my father put his credit card in the check presenter. When the server came back with the bill, it had no cc and the bill was never charged. I walked up to the front and someone from another table said this wasn't his credit card. And I said thats my father. So they charged the wrong table. I explained how bad the service was the entire time we were there and he said was "sorry holiday weekend" I also said I work in the service industry whether holiday or not service should not be this terrible, the cashier asked if I worked on the strip and I said yes and he said ... "they can afford to make mistakes!" What kind of restaurant gives you that answer! If you're off the strip you should show more excellence in customer service to avoid these comments and mistakes. I've never in my entire like experience such terrible restaurant with customer service and food!

h2xLzV9U8zcot8gqLqVhnA.text: I'm usually skeptical about going to dimsum places other than orchid gardens but this one was a lot close so why not try it. The place is clean, you can dine in or get items on the menu to go. They had a very friendly staff who pretty much catered to our needs and everything. Very affordable as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GeUPpxBTJoR_uAmbrp0Cug.text: Yum Cha was a delicious post pool snack. It really hit the spot! The Taro Dumpling and shrimp stuffed eggplant are on point! We'll be back to try the Roti Canai on Sam's recommendation

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e2i9MlVlliMcJ6BOS8wjAw.text: I finally found my new place for Dim Sum. This place is the place to go for great food, great price and great customer service. The restaurant is clean and I love how open the dining room is. The dim sum is all day. Fresh food, made as ordered. The staff is genuinely friendly... you will feel welcomed. Try this restaurant, you wont regret it.

wslfzrj81h8RtQ7VDJgkgg.text: Our new favorite dim sum place! Very clean establishment, delicious food, and wonderful service. I highly recommend the shrimp balls and our favorite, the baked custard bun!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bkjjSdc7l84eCN2ExWTldQ.text: I remember the place that use to be here it was a dump, but since they have changed into a dim Sum Restaurant it's 100 percent better the food is great, clean and fresh I know a lot of other places in town where I can go to get Dim Sum this is my second time here and I am pretty pleased with them! I love the Lotus Leaf pork sticky rice it's my favorite! But I recommend this place!   Best, K.Kaviar

Rl1fR93fz2GEtl04dk1rYQ.text: A delicious spot to get Dim Sum for dinner. Excellent service. My husband ordered the orange chicken and loved it. We will definitely be back again.

Lw3McMrhMaoM5VlaxnqJTg.text: At first glance, you see the fast food takeout style buffet but the food was very good. They ended up having dim sum carts going around but some items you order at the buffet serving area. Once you order, they will cook your food and bring it to your table.  Some of the flavorful dishes we got was a Malaysian Chinese dishes and it was amazing.  I loved the pancake with curry dipping sauce. It's a must!! Defiantly going to come back again!!

yl9YCPPfOpEEDV5xGAnNBg.text: We have been waiting someone for so long to take our order, food serve fast, but you have to wait again if you ask for bill or to go box. No one will come to you and you have to wave your hand or keep looking at them to make them realize you need someone to help. We end up walking to the counter to pay our bill.

aMNzcNvPjSgJwhh-FS3BXw.text: My family and I were in town for the New Year and it's my job to find a good Chinese restaurant in town. I came across Yum Cha and definitely we were not disappointed. This restaurant definitely rivals the Chinese restaurants In San Gabriel in CA. 5 Stars!! The staff were also very accommodating and friendly.

AbwYlR5LC-lPrJyMXSnurA.text: Service was GREAT - so nice, sweet and timely. I loved their food, some I felt they reheated up and others so fresh. The radish cake was hands down the best I ever had.  Next time I will come not hungover so the food might taste better! Cheers

NYTu3VZqaSLhQyff437-3Q.text: So the food here is pretty good, especially since they are usually making all your food fresh...   The only downside to this is I feel like you're not getting the full dim sum experience... Make sure you order all your food at once because if there's more than five groups in the room with you it takes forever..  But like I said, food is really good. Lots of flavor.

nZn8xBgeG1tofwZTWh_zBw.text: Tried other dim sum spots in Vegas and this now one of my favorites. The food was delicious and the service was amazing. Very friendly staff. You HAVE to try the chive pork and shrimp dumplings!

W6Sh2ChDChITf-QfGrnKDw.text: I came here with another couple for dim sum. Everything looked really good and fresh- not frozen. I didn't eat much since I already had eaten earlier. Just came for the company but from what I can see they didn't have much selection from the push cart for dim sum. If you wanted more of a variety you can order from the menu. You know it's a good place when you see a lot of Chinese people in here. I will have to give this place another try next time.

PMpjx2OXY9HojJiKaSMFsw.text: This place never fails to impress me. Great customer service and great authentic dim sum. I had my usual with tea. This time we ordered won ton soup. It was so delicious. I love that the dim sum is always freshly cooked.

Jw2hGlC9R4TyzTthurtjWQ.text: Chinese Dim Sum can seem like a basic concept and that they should all be similar. Yum Cha had quite a few entrees that most Dim Sum restaurants don't usually offer.   The items that we ordered were all really good and tasty. The quantity per order is a bit smaller compared to the others I have been to. The service needs some improvement as well. I have been to Dim Sum restaurants where you have to shoo them away because they don't stop offering items.  Can also be annoying, but when I want more and they're not coming around is worse.   I would go back next time I'm in Vegas and looking for Dim Sum.

JlYVXadKsv10OECH3XMHHQ.text: DINNER VISIT Sooooooooo friendly. Bent over backwards to be helpful. Super fresh and they make thier own soy sauce ..ARE YOU KIDDING ME !?!?, full menu plus dim sum. Very authentic.  I will be back. Thank you.

pNPGmi7HzhIWSQ8UAKOGtw.text: Highly recommend. They have a wide variety of choice like dim sum, hot pot, and main course food. Servers were very helpful and nice, always have a smile their face. Since it was grand opening, so the environment was very clean. Each booth has their an outlet to charge any phones or computers! The great catch would be the super LOW PRICE for each dim sum! Would come again for sure!

x8HvHr4z8bHHOZZmx2yk6Q.text: Really great new place, & the staff is super friendly!! There wasn't a lot of people there when we went (around 6:30pm on a wed) cuz apparently people aren't aware they cook dim sum till close, AND have a full dinner menu? The dim sum was fresh & delicious though & I'll definitely be going again soon!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various dim sum items, as well as the awesome Malaysian roti bread!!

snxHQJFBfYFBDRaGvhFQmg.text: My uncle recommended this place. Very good dimsum. Finished the meal feeling satisfied. The manager/waitress was also very friendly & lively.

81zvmYlK2cJ_KCAKt_7_VA.text: Have you ever been to a dim sum place and don't actually know how much everything is because they just stamp it on your order sheet? Well this place has a menu of all the dim sum they serve and has the prices too. What makes this place different is that they don't come around in carts, you actually order what you want and they bring it to you fresh  $2.88 on weekdays is the cheapest and biggest selection of dim sum on their menu; 3.28 on weekends and holidays. They also have other selections like soup noodles and appetizers (spring rolls, calamari, fried chicken wings). First time here and it's pretty good!

1uwJP9JkBaPJ1KLeaCFfIA.text: Very nice place, friendly staff, reasonable price and good quality food. Their manager is a very nice friendly person. Their egg tarts are one of the best in Vegas.

bpvPmeYrMUntaZz1DWBD-w.text: Nice and clean place to eat!  We went there for Dim Sum, many selections, good food and very reasonably priced!  It has a contemporary decor, not like any typical Asian Restaurant.  I would definitely go back again to try their beef brisket noodle soup and other delicious dishes!!

VN7N8kVXUl8znUcegDqotg.text: first time eating here. very nice and clean place to have dim sum. food tasted great. service was very welcoming and friendly

ARIUNs_BbacSs9iseBaqaw.text: I don't often give 5 star reviews but this one is well deserved for more than just the food.. it's their PROMPT and polite service. I came by myself for a semi-late lunch adventure on a quiet Thursday, and the place looked slow. Naturally I expected quick service and wow did I get that. Got sat down and had hot tea and water delivered in seconds, followed by a couple push carts containing my go-to dishes like har gow, pork ribs, shrimp rice noodle and beef tripe. All of the staff spoke perfect English to their guests which I appreciate even though I'm Chinese (can't always assume they speak the same language). In addition, the restaurant is never short on TVs airing a variety of food/travel video clips and shows for our wandering eyes. And the open food stall showcasing specialty foods being prepared and cooked for availability is a pretty sweet feature. Overall this is an excellent and reasonably priced choice for dim sum off the busy Las Vegas Strip.

WkspNuH2vFdnSSYusxyGLA.text: Good place, I would recommend for since dim sum. Nothing usual, good or bad. Just, good enough

FuCiN0jlsO6qOlTYDUbnzw.text: I was originally from Taiwan and there are some pretty good yum cha where I lived. But I was pleasantly surprised how good the food tastes here. We ordered 11 dishes of dim sum and two plates of noodles and it was about $65, which is a very decent price for dim sum, not to mention that this was in Las Vegas. There's plenty of seating. Service was quick. The restrooms were clean as well. Located in a plaza with plenty of parking space. Would definitely come again if I were ever in the area!

Wn8Fl0AK7HbETfenxK_mnQ.text: Beyond my expectations! Dim sum was amazing and lots of variety. Servers were very helpful and nice. Chicken feet and egg tarts are a must try. The food is canton style, food was authentic Chinese. Overall the restaurant is clean and organized. Prices were reasonable and I would definitely come again.

OLz1ABAARuajDbmvrLruuw.text: Very good dim sum!! Prices are very reasonable too! I will return. Everything we had was great! Especially the barbecue pork bun, salt and pepper shrimp, and beef short ribs.

AvItidVoEDdwDhvt0K01WA.text: was craving dim sum and saw reviews on Yelp and thought to try it out. the dim sum is yummy as well as the main dishes - all very flavorful. they even have taro cake (you can't taste the sweetness) on the weekends. the staff is very friendly and truly appreciates their customers. very spacious interior. there's lunch special dim sum on the weekdays everything $2.89 except the rice noodle roll (cheung fun). we will be back again to try different things. oh and the coconut bun pastry item is phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of Yum Cha - Las Vegas, NV, United States. taro cake... yummy!! only on weekends (limited quantity)

91t7wSc5gly5w7DCjPwsNg.text: Not worth it.  Service is way too slow, it wasnt even that busy.  Portions were too small.  Also the model they use is made to order, meaning everything you order comes out at unpredictable times and in an unpredictable order.  I wanted to love the place.  Dont come here if you are hungry.

LwBLS61MlAFszI8bHU11sg.text: This place is authentic and does serve real Asian dishes; but, the quality of the food is lacking. My buddy and I lived in Taiwan for a couple years and were excited to try this place, and we both left disappointed. Our search for Taiwan dishes that are as good as the distant island continues.

UXrVK4bBQ9aR4txQqKj7mg.text: This place had quality food! Try the dim sum and the sevice was both exceptional and friendly!

CfT2te5neMNZDpTPpMdPCg.text: Great service! Food is good, not greasy.  Restaurant was clean. Eileen was really knowledgeable about the menu and provided lots of recommendations.

sb81V9sJKpOlXTag5rrRxA.text: What an unexpected surprise! Very good dim sum with excellent flavor and variety! I wanted it all! Service was very prompt and friendly. I will definitely return here another time before I leave and will go back next time I visit Vegas! Yum indeed!

DGhZRRs6-0U2yTpG6ywGrQ.text: Friendly service and food was okay. I was very disappointed in the shrimp noodle rolls, they were not good.
